Job Summary

The Data Center Expert is responsible for the operation, optimization, and continuous improvement of data centers, with a focus on backups, storage, virtualization, and replication systems. This role ensures high availability, security, and scalability of mission-critical infrastructure, driving compliance with industry best practices and organizational requirements.

Key Responsibilities
ï Oversee the daily operation of data centers, ensuring uptime, performance, and reliability of mission-critical infrastructure.
ï Manage enterprise storage solutions, including provisioning, replication, backup, and disaster recovery.
ï Implement and maintain backup and replication systems using industry-leading platforms such as Veeam and Commvault.
ï Operate and optimize virtualization and hyper-converged infrastructure solutions, with a focus on VMware vSAN.
ï Monitor capacity, performance, and availability of data center resources, ensuring proactive scaling and optimization.
ï Lead data center operations for security, power, cooling, cabling, and physical infrastructure.
ï Ensure compliance with best practices for data protection, retention policies, and disaster recovery strategies.
ï Perform root cause analysis and implement corrective/preventive actions for system incidents.
ï Develop and maintain documentation, including runbooks, system diagrams, and operational guidelines.
ï Collaborate with IT security teams to enforce strict controls for access, monitoring, and system protection.
ï Plan and execute system upgrades, migrations, and lifecycle management activities.
ï Provide escalation-level troubleshooting for complex data center, storage, and virtualization issues.
ï Conduct periodic testing of backup and disaster recovery procedures to validate system resilience.
ï Ensure adherence to SLAs and compliance requirements for regulated environments.
ï Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies in storage, backup, virtualization, and data center management.
ï Train and mentor engineers and administrators to strengthen organizational expertise in data center operations.
ï Support audits, capacity planning, and reporting to senior management on data center performance and risks.

Job Requirements
ï Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical Engineering, or related field (Masterís degree preferred).
ï Minimum of 10+ years of experience in data center operations, with at least 5 years at an expert level in storage, backup, and replication.
ï Proven expertise in enterprise storage management, including SAN, NAS, and hyper-converged systems.
ï Strong experience in backup, replication, and disaster recovery with platforms such as Veeam and Commvault.
ï Hands-on expertise with VMware vSAN and virtualization technologies.
ï In-depth understanding of data center infrastructure, including servers, networking, cooling, and power systems.
ï Strong knowledge of ITIL processes and data center operations best practices.
ï Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills for enterprise environments.
ï Proven experience managing large-scale, mission-critical data centers.
ï Strong documentation, communication, and leadership abilities.
ï Ability to work in high-pressure environments with 24/7 operational responsibilities.
ï Aviation experience is preferred.

Required Certifications
ï Dell EMC Proven Professional Certification
ï Veeam and/or Commvault Certification
ï VMware vSAN Certification

Preferred Certifications (a Plus)
ï VMware VCP-DCV (Data Center Virtualization)
ï ITIL Foundation or higher
ï Cisco CCNP Data Center or equivalent
ï Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) certification

job_title: Postdoctoral Researcher?/Research Scientist in Data Science Mineral Exploration
job_description:
Position: Postdoctoral Researcher / Research Scientist in Data Science for Mineral Exploration

Physical Science and Engineering Division

Organisation/Company KAUST Department Physical Science and Engineering Division Research Field Geosciences ª Geology Geosciences ª Other Mathematics ª Statistics Mathematics ª Other Researcher Profile First Stage Researcher (R1) Recognised Researcher (R2) Established Researcher (R3) Positions Postdoc Positions Country Saudi Arabia Final date to receive applications 31 May 2026 - 23:59 (Asia/Riyadh) Type of Contract Temporary Job Status Full-time Hours Per Week 40 Offer Starting Date 1 Jun 2025 Is the job funded through the EU Research Framework Programme?

Not funded by a EU programme Is the Job related to staff position within a Research Infrastructure? No
Offer Description

Professor Max Frenzel is currently recruiting for a 2-year Post-doc position (extendable) to join the new Mineral Exploration and Exploitation Group focus of the position will be on the development of new methods integrating a variety of data types (remote sensing, geology, geophysics, geochemistry) for geological modelling and advanced exploration targeting of mineral deposits. These workflows will then be applied in relevant Saudi Arabian contexts to help discover new ore deposits.

The position will combine techniques from geological modelling, geostatistics, machine learning, and potentially geophysics (inversion) to develop new exploration targeting methods. These will be designed to make the most of the excellent outcrop conditions in Saudi Arabia, which means that a particular focus will be placed on the use of remote sensing data. Other relevant data types are geological maps, geophysical surveys (gravity, electromagnetic, seismic), and soil or stream sediment geochemistry.

In terms of the application to specific regions in Saudi Arabia, the candidate will be free to choose their own case study(s). The willingness to collaborate closely with local exploration companies is expected.

Saudi Arabia is a fast-developing country offering unparalleled opportunities in mineral resources and other geoscience-related fields. In particular, the recent opening of Saudi Arabia for international exploration companies has led to a substantial increase of activity in the mineral exploration sector. Given the great geological potential of Saudi Arabia for different types of mineral deposits, it is probably the country with the most exciting mineral exploration opportunities right now.
ï Excellent coding skills in python, R, or another relevant language are expected, as demonstrated by previously completed projects.
ï Strong candidates will also have a firm background in geostatistics, geospatial modelling, and/or data science.
ï Excellent oral and written communication skills in English are required, as evidenced by a strong publication and conference presentation record.
ï In addition, candidates should hold a driverís licence or be willing to acquire one, and should be willing to undertake fieldwork.
ï Experience in the mineral resource sector is desirable but not essential.
ï Experience in conducting UAV surveys is desirable but not essential.
ï A completed PhD is sufficient for appointment as a postdoctoral researcher. For appointment as a research scientist, additional research experience of at least 2 years is required in the relevant areas highlighted above.
Specific Requirements

English (C1 / IELTS 7.0 equivalent or better)

Level Good

Research Field Physics ª Other Geosciences Engineering ª Geological engineering Years of Research Experience None
Additional Information

The position will include a competitive salary based on the candidateís qualifications and experience; benefits include medical and dental insurance, free housing on the KAUST campus, an annual travel allowance, 30 paid vacation days, and other generous benefits. KAUST is a vibrant and international community, with many opportunities for social, sporting, and learning activities outside of work.

The successful applicant will be associated with the new Mineral Exploration and Exploitation Group group will commence work in August 2025. Its main aim is to contribute to the development of mineral resources in Saudi Arabia by developing innovativeÖ

## Full Description
Overview

Eram Talent is on the lookout for a talented Data Scientist specializing in Digital & AI Projects to join our client's team in Saudi Arabia. This role is perfect for an innovative thinker who is eager to harness data analytics and artificial intelligence to drive impactful business solutions. Responsibilities

Originates and carries out studies to identify potential advanced analytics use cases and applications to existing problems. Resolve complex technical problems, increase revenue, optimize processes, protect the environment, or improve safety using advanced analytics/data science background.

Examines the business problem and identifies the required learning task (e.g. classification, clustering, regression, forecasting Ö etc.).

Selects appropriate Machine Learning algorithms suited for the selected learning task and condition/structure of the data. This includes but is not limited to Decision Trees/Forest, Support Vector Machines, k NN, Neural Network and Deep learning.

Builds and deploys predictive models using algorithms such as linear/logistic/dynamic regression to address the business needs.

The position requires not only technical expertise but also the ability to translate complex findings into understandable recommendations for stakeholders.

The position includes collaborating with cross?functional teams to identify opportunities for AI integration, creating predictive models, and delivering actionable insights that guide strategic decisions.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field with a minimum of 8+ years of work experience.

Expertise in Statistics, Machine Learning, Time Series, Deep Learning, NLP, Foundation Models, Knowledge of Python, API & other machine learning frameworks.

Experience with selecting appropriate machine learning algorithms, building predictive and forecasting models, and solution deployment and maintenance.

Experience with deployment of advanced analytics solutions based on machine learning techniques in upstream and downstream processes.

Knowledge of plant automation systems, standard real time interfaces such as OPC and process historians such as PI.

Experience with identification of new advanced analytics use cases, business value quantification and working with multi-disciplinary teams on delivering analytics solutions.

Awareness of Digital Transformation area and experience with delivering Digitalization initiatives.

job_title: Data Analyst Jobs in Saudi Arabia
job_description:
Saudi Arabia has become one of the most promising destinations for skilled professionals who are looking for strong career opportunities, long-term growth, and the chance to be part of one of the fastest-growing economies in the world. The Kingdom is transforming rapidly through its ambitious Vision 2030, which focuses on technology, data, and innovation. Among the most in-demand roles today are Data Analyst jobs, as organizations across finance, healthcare, energy, retail, and logistics look to harness the power of data to make informed decisions.

This job description highlights the opportunities, responsibilities, work environment, and application details for those aiming to start a career as a Data Analyst in Saudi Arabia.

Company Overview

Our hiring is focused on leading organizations in Saudi Arabiaís tech, energy, and service sectors that are actively looking to expand their data teams. These organizations are located in King Fahd Road, Riyadh, which is one of the busiest business hubs of the Kingdom. Offices here are modern, equipped with high-tech infrastructure, and provide a collaborative atmosphere for employees from all over the world.

The companies are committed to offering opportunities for international candidates by supporting relocation assistance, work permits, and in many cases, visa sponsorship. With Saudi Arabiaís rapid push toward digital transformation, Data Analysts will be at the heart of driving business strategy and innovation.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large data sets to provide actionable insights that help organizations make data-driven decisions. You will play a critical role in building dashboards, preparing reports, identifying patterns, and supporting senior management in strategic planning.

This position requires both technical expertise and strong communication skills. You will be working closely with cross-functional teams including IT, marketing, finance, and operations to ensure that data is accurate, reliable, and transformed into meaningful business insights.

Key Responsibilities
ï Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather data from multiple sources, verify its accuracy, and clean inconsistencies to ensure reliability.
ï Statistical Analysis: Use tools such as Python, R, or SQL to run statistical tests and uncover meaningful trends.
ï Data Visualization: Create clear and interactive dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or Excel to present findings to stakeholders.
ï Business Insights: Translate data patterns into actionable recommendations for different departments.
ï Collaboration: Work with managers, developers, and decision-makers to identify new opportunities for process improvement.
ï Automation: Implement automation scripts to reduce repetitive tasks in data reporting.
ï Reporting: Prepare weekly and monthly reports to update stakeholders on performance metrics.
ï Compliance: Ensure data management processes align with company policies and international data privacy regulations.
ï Problem Solving: Use analytical thinking to identify challenges in workflows and propose data-driven solutions.
ï Learning and Development: Stay updated with the latest tools, frameworks, and industry trends in data analytics.

Skills and Qualifications

To succeed as a Data Analyst in Saudi Arabia, you will need a combination of technical and interpersonal skills:
ï Bachelorís degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, or related field.
ï Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
ï Strong knowledge of data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or QlikView.
ï Solid foundation in statistics, probability, and predictive modeling.
ï Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables and macros.
ï Experience working with large datasets and database systems.
ï Ability to communicate complex data findings in simple language.
ï Strong problem-solving, attention to detail, and critical thinking abilities.
ï Previous experience in business intelligence or analytics roles is highly preferred.

Work Environment

The role is based in King Fahd Road, Riyadh, where companies operate in a professional, multicultural, and modern environment. Employees enjoy collaborative workspaces, advanced tools, and access to continuous training programs. The companies hiring are committed to diversity and welcome professionals from across the globe.

With Saudi Arabiaís growing expatriate community, working here offers a unique experience of cultural richness and professional development. The organizations also provide competitive compensation packages, healthcare, accommodation allowances, and relocation assistance to ensure employees can settle smoothly.

Career Growth

Data Analysts are highly valued in Saudi Arabia, and this role opens doors to career progression in:
ï Senior Data Analyst
ï Business Intelligence Analyst
ï Data Scientist
ï Machine Learning Specialist
ï Analytics Manager

With the government investing heavily in smart cities, digital infrastructure, and artificial intelligence, demand for data professionals will continue to rise.

Salary and Benefits

While exact packages vary depending on company and experience, Data Analysts in Saudi Arabia typically earn:
ï Entry-level: SAR 8,000 ñ SAR 12,000 per month
ï Mid-level: SAR 13,000 ñ SAR 18,000 per month
ï Senior-level: SAR 19,000 ñ SAR 25,000 per month

Additional benefits often include:
ï Housing or accommodation allowance
ï Annual airfare tickets for relocation
ï Comprehensive health insurance
ï Paid annual leave
ï End-of-service benefits
ï Relocation support and work permit sponsorship

Easy Job Titles Available

For candidates seeking opportunities in Saudi Arabiaís data and technology space, here are 10 easy job titles currently available:
ï Data Analyst
ï Junior Data Analyst
ï Business Intelligence Analyst
ï Data Entry Specialist
ï Reporting Analyst
ï Research Analyst
ï Market Data Coordinator
ï Junior SQL Developer
ï Excel Reporting Assistant
ï Operations Data Associate

These positions are suitable for candidates with varying levels of experience, ensuring both fresh graduates and experienced professionals have opportunities to apply.

Why Work in Saudi Arabia?

Saudi Arabia offers a unique balance of professional growth and lifestyle opportunities. From its modern cities like Riyadh and Jeddah to its ambitious Vision 2030 projects, the Kingdom is creating an environment where international talent can thrive.

Employees benefit from:
ï Tax-free income
ï Competitive salaries
ï Modern work environments
ï Strong career advancement
ï Opportunities to be part of large-scale transformation projects

For international professionals, this is a chance to build a rewarding career in one of the most dynamic regions in the world.

How to Apply

If you are ready to take the next step in your career and secure a Data Analyst job in Saudi Arabia, applications are now open. Interested candidates are encouraged to prepare their updated CV, highlighting relevant skills and experiences in data analysis, visualization, and business insights. To apply, please send your application directly to the recruitment team via the official company HR email provided in the job posting. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews, and successful applicants will receive visa sponsorship and relocation support to start their journey in Riyadh.

You'll lead building the AI defense systems that detect fraud, eliminate counterfeit products, and maintain marketplace quality across our platform. In MENA's high-COD environment (75% of transactions), trust is everything. Your models will be the difference between platform growth and reputation damage.

Responsibilities
ï * Build and deploy supervised and unsupervised ML models for policy violation detection, counterfeit detection, and fraud detection.
ï Build and grow the Integrity, Safety & Trust pod, mentor applied data scientists and deliver end-to-end projects with measurable business outcomes.
ï Design feature pipelines that leverage product text, images, seller behavior, and transaction data.
ï Apply NLP models for text classification, entity extraction, and multi-lingual moderation (Arabic + English).
ï Utilize multimodal architectures (CLIP, ViT + BERT) for imageñtext cross-validation.
ï Develop graph-based and anomaly detection models to identify coordinated or suspicious merchant activity.
ï Collaborate with product, legal, and operations teams to define integrity policies and feedback loops.

ï Optimize model precision/recall tradeoffs based on enforcement and user experience goals.
ï Familiarity with graph learning, anomaly detection, and multimodal data pipelines.

As a pioneer remote-first tech company with a product that inspires people globally, we attract a huge number of applicants to our organisation.

We have created a hiring process that is totally unique empowering our business based Hiring Leadership team to lead talent selection.

Our Talent Science team ensures that our processes are effective and that the business is able to make the best decisions to select exceptional talent.
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a team that is changing the way an organisation hires.

Our Talent Science team has a mission to ensure that we follow objective, scientifically rigorous and efficient processes to select the very best new colleagues regardless of location, culture or background.

We work closely with our key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are being made in the right way and that our hiring model supports the selection of world class talent, regardless of location, culture or background.

As a Talent Scientist, you will work closely with these Hiring Leads to drive initiatives, automation and best practice whilst offering an expert viewpoint on talent assessments.

This is not a recruiter position; it's about the science of talent and performance, raising awareness and insights across the business so that they are able to select the best talent available from our global talent pool.
We have a number of mid-senior level openings in our team seeking the following:

Passion and drive to embed scientific approaches that deliver impact on how an organisation selects talent.
Strong behavioural interviewing techniques (competency based and psychometric assessments).
Excellent analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns using SQL, statistical analysis or Python, BI tooling, etc.
An exceptional academic background including a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology based subject.
A high level of personal organisation to work remotely and be effective.

Location:
This is a remote position based in the EMEA region

What your day will look like

As a Talent Scientist you will:

Drive talent analytics to provide our business with real-time insight, partnering with the business to help them move through their hiring processes efficiently.
Conduct in-depth behavioural talent interviews providing considerable insights into motivations and behaviours.

Build key relationships with global stakeholders to ensure we deliver against our hiring agenda, closely monitoring hiring activities, driving results and ensuring that there is consistency in our operational processes.
Drive data driven insights, making sure our decision making process is robust and supportive to inform our decisions.
Consider our employer brand and how our interactions with a candidate impacts their experience.
Review and streamline hiring processes and tools to drive continuous improvement.
Work with external third parties and platforms to ensure we maximise our return on investment.

Bring a passion for diversity and inclusion, ensuring we remove unconscious bias from our hiring process and ensuring our sourcing strategy underpins this.
What we are looking for in you

An exceptional academic background from high school and university, with a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology based subject.
Experience of hiring talent in the technology or consulting industry.
A highly data drive mindset with the ability to create measurable outcomes.

Passionate about how an organisation selects talent using scientific approaches with viewpoint on how to predict and measure hiring outcomes.
Strong analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns using SQL, with Python and/or advanced statistical analysis preferable.
Exposure/appreciation of psychometric assessments, including interpretation.

Experience of conducting behavioural, competency based interviews with the ability to train stakeholders and advise on how to get the best out of an interview.
A high level of personal organisation and self drive to work remotely and be effective.
Willingness to travel to company events 2-4 times a year, for up to two weeks each.

Other Skills You May Bring

Experience in sourcing and headhunting with the ability to teach our senior leadership team how to hunt for industry leaders.
Experience in statistical significance testing and experience in Bayesian inference and/or predictive analytics and ML.

Exposure to the following tools:
LinkedIn Talent Insights, Greenhouse, DISC profiling, Superset.
Psychometric validity and reliability metrics.

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source.

As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis.
We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004.

Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

DESCRIPTION
We are seeking an experienced Data Science Engineer to join our growing Data & Insights team in Casablanca.

In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining scalable data pipelines and architectures, while enabling high-performance analytics and machine learning workflows across the organization.

You will work closely with engineering, product, and AI/ML teams to design and deploy advanced data solutions using the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem.

Your expertise will help unlock the value of our data, driving business insights and supporting strategic decision-making through robust, production-grade data engineering.
This is a key position within our global AI and Data Engineering community, reporting directly to the Engineering Manager.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, build, and maintain robust ETL/ELT data pipelines using Microsoft Fabric tools
Develop scalable data warehouse architecture for analytics and reporting
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Data Science, AI, Product, Engineering)
Ensure data quality, security, and compliance across the data lifecycle
Integrate structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
Leverage Python and open-source libraries to enhance data workflows
Monitor and improve performance of data processing pipelines
Apply best practices in data governance and version control

PROFILE & SKILLS
Must-Have
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric ecosystem: OneLake, Data Factory, Data Warehouse, Synapse
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, and data transformation libraries (e.g. Pandas, PySpark)
Proven experience designing and implementing ETL/ELT pipelines
Solid understanding of data modeling and performance optimization
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
3+ years of experience in a production-grade environment
Fluent in English (written and verbal)
Nice to Have
Familiarity with machine learning workflows and tools (Azure ML, Scikit-learn, MLflow)
Experience with Power BI and data visualization best practices
Exposure to DevOps concepts and tools (CI/CD, Azure DevOps)
Relevant certifications (DP-203, DP-900, or equivalent)
Fluency in French is a plus
Show more Show less

A cutting-edge AI company is seeking a Data Science AI Trainer to design complex data science problems for AI projects. This remote position offers flexible part-time work with competitive pay rates that can go up to $46/hour, depending on your skills. Candidates are required to hold a Master's or PhD degree in a relevant field and have at least 5 years of experience in data science. Proficiency in Python and statistical analysis is essential. Join us to help shape the future of AI and enhance your portfolio.

job_description:
Ultimate Peaks ñ Hiring for a Futuristic Client

We are seeking a Senior Data & AI Solutions Consultant to lead presales and delivery for advanced Data, AI, and Generative AI initiatives. This hybrid role combines client engagement, solution architecture, and end-to-end project delivery across modern data platforms and AI ecosystems.
Key Responsibilities
ï Engage with clients to understand business challenges and translate them into AI, GenAI, ML, and data platform use cases.
ï Design and present end-to-end solution architectures, including data ingestion, processing, modeling, storage, and analytics layers.
ï Prepare technical proposals, SOWs, effort estimates, pricing sheets, and presales documentation for RFPs.
ï Lead and support RFP responses, demos, and PoCs across AI, Generative AI, and data analytics workloads.
ï Oversee project delivery from discovery, architecture, and implementation to testing, deployment, and handover.
ï Collaborate with data engineers, cloud architects, ML engineers, and cross-functional teams to ensure scalable and secure solutions.
ï Utilize cloud data and AI platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) to build data lakes, data warehouses, ETL/ELT pipelines, and real-time data flows.
ï Develop and support Generative AI solutions using LLMs, RAG architectures, vector databases, embeddings, and prompt engineering.
ï Ensure delivery quality, documentation completeness, and adherence to architecture best practices.

Requirements
ï 7ñ12 years of experience in Data & AI solutioning, architecture, and delivery, with strong presales exposure.
ï 2ñ3 years hands-on experience in AI, Machine Learning, LLMs, or Generative AI.
ï Proficiency in Python, SQL, and modern ML/AI frameworks.
ï Proven ability to design and deliver data platforms including data lakes, data warehouses, and ETL/ELT pipelines.
ï Strong experience preparing technical proposals, estimates, and project plans.
ï Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to work across business and technical teams.
ï Demonstrated experience delivering end-to-end AI and data projects, including feature engineering, model development, deployment, and API integration.
ï Experience with cloud ecosystems (AWS/Azure/GCP) and modern data stack technologies.

Description

Job Title

Senior Specialist, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence

Reporting to

Director, Technology CoE

Business Unit/Function

Sustainability, Safety & Innovation

Department

Technology and Innovation

Direct Reports

Budget/Size

-

Grade

M10

Job Family

Technology and Innovation

Sub Family

, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence

Position Type

Regular

Role Profile Number

Job Purpose

Role is to support the Principal Engineer in driving the implementation of technology use cases, vendor discussions, and in-house AI-ML applications on internal use cases. You will utilize your expertise in data science and artificial intelligence to contribute to the development and deployment of innovative solutions across the organization.

Key Accountabilities

Collaborate with the Principal Engineer to identify and evaluate AI-ML use cases for enhancing process efficiency and reducing reliance on conventional technologies.

Assist in developing and implementing novel data science and AI applications, including AI-advisory modelling, ML algorithms, and AI-based ESG and safety dashboards.

Conduct technical research to explore potential AI-ML applications and stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in the field.

Contribute to the development of testing and validation protocols to ensure successful implementation of new technologies.

Collaborate with the Principal Engineer to establish best practices, standards, policies, and procedures for the adoption of novel AI and data science applications.

Stay updated with industry best practices and advancements in data science and artificial intelligence, and share knowledge with the team.

Minimum Qualifications, Experience and Competencies

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer engineering, IT Engineering, Software Engineering, or a related field?

Minimum Experience:

5+ years of experience in data science and AI-ML technologies, with a focus on driving innovation and efficiency improvements in the extractive industry.

Ma'aden High-Performance Competencies:

Teamwork

Integrity

Care

Ownership

Accountability

Communication

Continuous improvement

Achievement Drive

Decisiveness and judgement

Impact and influence

Commercial Acumen

Strategic Visioning

Skills:

Problem solving capability.

Fast learner, adaptable to change to work in an agile environment.

Demonstrated skills in mastering new knowledge and its applications.

Demonstrated ability to see underlying concepts and patterns in complex situations and their application to business decisions.

Work well in a cross-functional, strongly matrixed environment.

Critical thinking capabilities, analytical skills, action orientation

Excellent prioritization skills

About AgodaAt Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.Today, we are part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you're ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.Get to Know Our TeamThe Data department , based in Bangkok , oversees all of Agoda's data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company's culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityPlease note -The role will be based in Bangkok.We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world's largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.In This Role, You'll Get toDesign, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness.Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation.Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality.Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a differenceWhat You'll Need To Succeed4+ years hands-on data science experience.Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks.Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala.Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team.Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.It's Great if You HavePhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systemsHands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/HadoopExperience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTAWe welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #malta #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #doha #alrayyan #riyadh #jeddah #mecca #medina #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #hcmc #hanoi #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #newdelhi #bangalore #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #jerusalem #mumbai #bengalulu #hyderabad #pune # #IT #4Discover More About Working At AgodaAgoda Careers Facebook LinkedIn YouTube Equal Opportunity EmployerAt Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.DisclaimerWe do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency's representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

job_description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst with at least one year of experience to join our growing Data & AI team at Tarmeez Capital.

In this role, you will work closely with product, business, and data stakeholders to analyze data, build dashboards, and generate insights that directly influence decision-making.

Youíll be responsible for transforming raw data into clear metrics, reports, and narratives, helping teams understand performance, identify opportunities, and measure impact across the organization.

Key Responsibilities
ï Analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
ï Build and maintain dashboards and reports for business, product, and leadership teams.
ï Partner with product and business stakeholders to define KPIs, metrics, and success criteria.
ï Write efficient and reliable SQL queries to extract and transform data from data warehouses.
ï Perform ad-hoc analysis to support product launches, experiments, and operational decisions.
ï Validate data accuracy and collaborate with data engineers to improve data quality and reliability.
ï Translate analytical findings into clear, concise insights for non-technical audiences.
ï Support experimentation and performance analysis (e.g., funnels, cohorts, conversions).

Requirements
ï Saudi National
ï Bachelorís degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
ï 1+ year of experience in a data analyst, business analyst, or analytics-focused role.
ï Strong proficiency in SQL for data analysis and reporting.
ï Experience working with data visualization tools such as Metabase, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
ï Solid understanding of metrics, KPIs, and analytical best practices.
ï Comfortable working with large datasets and multiple data sources.
ï Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.
ï Ability to communicate insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Skills
ï Experience working with a data warehouse (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
ï Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (pandas, numpy).
ï Familiarity with A/B testing, funnel analysis, or cohort analysis.
ï Experience in fintech, finance, or investment-related analytics.
ï Understanding of data modeling concepts and analytics engineering workflows (dbt is a plus).

Exceptions

All of the above can be ignored if you can demonstrate a proven record of exceptional work, through a GitHub portfolio, research, or deployed projects.

Responsibilities:Conduct merchant-side analysis for the food delivery business, supporting frontline teams in business comprehension, marketing campaigns, product experience, merchant research, and strategy formulation to enhance overall operational efficiency. Identify business needs and establish key metric systems for various scenarios including business performance analysis, operational monitoring, and team management. Build and maintain data dashboards, develop data products, and improve data accessibility and usability for both frontline and supporting teams. Develop a deep understanding of the business, utilize data analysis tools and methods to uncover insights behind data, generate business observations, identify opportunities, address key business questions, and drive business optimization and iteration. Perform in-depth thematic analysis on specific business issues, providing professional insights and data-driven input to support company operational decisions, product direction, and business strategies. Collaborate closely with frontline, operations, product, algorithm, and technical teams to drive the implementation of strategies and take ownership of business outcomes. Requirements:Bachelorís degree or above, preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related fields.3+ years of relevant experience in business analysis, data analysis, or similar roles. Prior experience in leading internet companies or consulting firms is preferred. Proficiency in SQL, with experience in Python and BI tools. Strong logical thinking skills, ability to structure and deconstruct problems, with independent and critical thinking habits. Solid command of common data analysis tools and strong foundational knowledge in mathematical statistics. Proven track record of driving business iteration and optimization through data analysis and delivering tangible results. High sense of responsibility, excellent communication and problem-solving skills, and strong team collaboration and project management abilities. Highlights:Opportunity to work in a startup-like environment, participating in early-stage business planning and key project implementation. Preference will be given to candidates with industry research experience in food delivery or FMCG (Fast-Moving Consumer Goods).

job_description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!

At Parsons, you can imagine a career where you thrive, work with exceptional people, and be yourself. Guided by our leadership vision of valuing people, embracing agility, and fostering growth, we cultivate an innovative culture that empowers you to achieve your full potential. Unleash your talent and redefine what's possible.

Job Description:

Parsons is looking for an amazingly talentedSenior Data Analyst (Financial Data & Automation Analyst ) to join our team! In this role you will get to automate reporting, analyze AR and unbilled data, and deliver real-time insights.

Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels no matter the race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability or genetic information.

We truly invest and care about our employee's wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest-APPLY TODAY!

Overview

We are seeking a Marketing Analyst to join our team and drive data-driven insights that optimize marketing performance. This role will focus on tracking KPIs, analyzing campaign effectiveness, managing HubSpot automations, scouting PandaDoc, and conducting quality assurance (QA) testing. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, data-savvy, and skilled in marketing analytics tools.
Payrate

Payrate : $7-$8 / Hour Full- Time ( 40 Hours a week)
Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Performance Tracking
ï Collect and analyze data from marketing campaigns across multiple channels (paid media, organic, social, email, etc.).
ï Track key marketing KPIs, including:
ï Own full-funnel performance tracking across Marketing, SDR, VAPI, and Direct channels
ï Manage budget, spend, management fees, ROAS, and CAC for cost-efficient growth
ï Track lead volume, qualification rates, CPL, and cost per qualified lead
ï Analyze demo performance and conversion rates (booked, completed, show-up, no-shows) across all channels
ï Monitor pipeline health, lead quality, and disqualification reasons throughout the funnel
ï Report on revenue impact, including projected vs. actual clients, services sold, MRR, and average deal size
ï Create custom dashboards using Looker Studio, HubSpot and Google Sheets for directors.

Marketing Operations & HubSpot Management
ï Manage HubSpot workflows, sequences, and automation to improve lead generation and nurturing.
ï Create and optimize HubSpot forms for data capture and conversion tracking.
ï Implement UTM parameters and HubSpot shortcodes to track campaign performance.
ï Ensure data integrity and monitor CRM performance for marketing and sales alignment.

PandaDoc Scouting & Integration
ï Research and scout PandaDoc features for marketing and sales information.
ï Identify opportunities for contract management.

Quality Assurance (QA)
ï Conduct QA testing for marketing automation and integrations.
ï Identify and troubleshoot bugs, workflow issues, and system errors.

Work with developers and product teams to ensure marketing tools function as intended.

For a brief introduction, it is a full-time remote position conducted during office hours of Pacific Time. We offer a competitive salary package that is amenable to negotiations, retirement plan, PTOs, and more.

job_title: Data Analyst - Telemetry & Operations - APAC (On-site) - Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
job_description:
Decima International is a professional services company, providing project management and controls services to clients in the United States and the Middle East. Our mission is to become the premier professional services provider across all industry sectors we are engaged in. To accomplish this, Decima Internationalís founders established a simple yet powerful formula:

Approach each client engagement as a partnership, create an environment that attracts the most talented professionals and allows them to flourish, and regulate growth to maintain excellence in our service standards.

Decima International is a professional services company, providing project management and controls services to clients in the United States and the Middle East. Our mission is to become the premier professional services provider across all industry sectors we are engaged in. To accomplish this, Decima Internationalís founders established a simple yet powerful formula:
Approach each client engagement as a partnership, create an environment that attracts the most talented professionals and allows them to flourish, and regulate growth to maintain excellence in our service standards.

We are looking for a driven and capable Data Analyst ñ Telemetry & Operations (Critical Infrastructure | Data Center Operations) to support our clients by analyzing operational and telemetry data across critical infrastructure environments, enabling informed decision-making and improved operational performance.

You will play an integral role in analyzing real-time and historical operational data, validating telemetry signals, supporting incident investigations, and producing clear, evidence-based insights that assist clients, vendors, and project teams in managing risk, performance, and reliability.

We are looking to bring in dedicated individuals with strong analytical skills and a passion for operational data who thrive in fast-paced, incident-driven environments. We will help you grow, pursue, and fulfill what inspires you so we can make big impacts on the world together.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Telemetry & Incident Data Analysis
Operational Data Analysis:
ï Analyze real-time telemetry alerts and operational datasets to validate incidents, identify anomalies, and assess operational impact.
ï Differentiate true events from false positives, duplicate alerts, and known recurring conditions.
ï Correlate trends, timestamps, logs, and event data to support severity assessment and operational decision-making.
ï Prepare clear, data-backed incident summaries to support client and stakeholder response activities.

Operational Support & Vendor Coordination
Incident & Stakeholder Support:
ï Provide analytical context and data-driven insights to clients and external vendors during incident investigations.
ï Track remediation actions, response timelines, and outcomes using structured operational data.
ï Support escalation and prioritization decisions through evidence-based analysis.
Communicate findings clearly and concisely to operations, service management, and project stakeholders.

Data Quality, Trends & Insights
Performance & Trend Analysis:
ï Identify recurring incident patterns, systemic operational risks, and vendor performance trends.
ï Highlight gaps in telemetry coverage, data quality, alert logic, or monitoring effectiveness.
ï Recommend opportunities for alert tuning, automation, and improved monitoring or reporting practices.
ï Support continuous improvement initiatives by surfacing actionable insights from operational data.

Documentation & Continuous Improvement
Reporting & Knowledge Management:
ï Maintain accurate, auditable records of analyses, incidents, and findings in approved client and company tools.
ï Contribute analytical insights to improve runbooks, alert definitions, and operational standards.
ï Support initiatives aimed at reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) and minimizing repeat incidents.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required Qualifications:
ï Bachelorís degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical, Computer, Network), Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related technical field.
ï 10+ years of experience in a data analyst, operations analyst, or telemetry/monitoring-focused role.
ï Hands-on experience working with time-series data, logs, alerts, or event-driven datasets.
ï Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret noisy, incomplete, or real-time data.
ï Excellent documentation, written, and verbal communication skills.
ï Ability to operate independently in fast-paced, incident-driven environments.
ï Comfort working across vendors and cross-functional technical teams.

Preferred Qualifications:
ï Experience supporting data centers, infrastructure operations, NOC/SOC environments, or other critical systems.
ï Familiarity with incident management, problem management, or operational analytics practices.
ï Exposure to telemetry, observability, or monitoring platforms.
ï Understanding of root cause analysis concepts and service management frameworks (e.g., ITIL).

Position Details:
ï Primary Location (Office-based): Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
ï Position: Data Analyst ñ Telemetry & Operations (APAC)
ï Position Classification: Salary-based full-time hours

PRODUCTIVITY TOOLS:
ï Microsoft Office
ï Microsoft 365

Decima International is an Equal Opportunity Employer who is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law.

At Decima International, we offer a competitive salary package, including paid time off and performance-based bonuses. We also provide excellent medical, vision and dental insurance for our employees.

Job Description ñ Data Analyst Job Summary

The Data Analyst will play a critical role in enabling Tarshidís business units to make data-driven decisions. In the short term, this role will focus on collecting, cleaning, consolidating, and analyzing data from multiple systems to provide reliable reporting and insights. In the medium to long term, the Data Analyst will actively contribute to the design, testing, and adoption of Tarshidís Data Lake and Business Intelligence platforms, enabling advanced analytics and AI-driven insights across the organization.
Key Responsibilities Immediate (PreñData Lake)

- Gather, validate, and consolidate data from multiple siloed systems and manual sources.

- Develop recurring and ad-hoc reports for Finance, Strategy, Shared Services, and Operations.

- Build dashboards and visualizations (Excel, Power BI) to track KPIs such as project progress, financial performance, and energy savings.

- Highlight trends, anomalies, and risks to support timely decision-making.
Transition (During Data Lake Implementation)

- Support IT/Digital Transformation in defining data requirements, integration points, and reporting needs.

- Map existing manual reports to future automated dashboards.

- Identify data gaps, inconsistencies, and recommend data quality rules.

- Participate in testing and validation of migrated datasets and dashboards.
Future (PostñData Lake)

- Leverage centralized data to deliver predictive and prescriptive analytics.

- Enable AI/ML use cases (e.g., IoT smart meters, energy savings forecasting, operational optimization).

- Create scalable, automated dashboards for business self-service reporting.

- Partner with business stakeholders to translate strategic questions into data-driven insights.
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

- Deliver recurring standard reports within agreed timelines (e.g., weekly, monthly).

- Respond to ad-hoc data requests within 2ñ3 business days, depending on complexity.

- Ensure accuracy levels of at least 95% in reports and dashboards delivered.

- Support incident resolution related to reporting/data accuracy within 1 business day.

- Participate in governance meetings and provide updates as per the DT/IT governance cadence.

Tech for People Unlocks the Future

At Devoteam, we believe that technology, combined with strong human values, can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People is shaping the future, creating a positive impact on individuals and the world around us.

With over 25 years of passion for technology and a presence in 18+ countries across EMEA and beyond, we are committed to leveraging innovation, expertise, and human-centric values to make a difference.

Devoteam Culture & Values:

True innovation is born from a powerful culture, fused with meaningful values.

Culture:

Fair and courageous Everyone is treated fairly ñ this fuels bravery. At Devoteam, we always make fair decisions. We listen and are willing to be challenged, taking courageous decisions as a result. We help our employees to progress at every step and congratulate those who deserve it. Ambition and results Ambition is nurtured at every step ñ this drives results. We are ambitious entrepreneurs with a taste for performance, growth and celebrating success. Commitments are always kept as we seek to achieve profitable growth to create value and employment. We aim to bring as much value as possible to our clients, at every touchpoint. Learning and innovating Curiosity and learning are at our core ñ this stimulates innovation. At Devoteam, we are curious. We learn and embrace innovation constantly to meet challenges and build partnerships of excellence. Caring and sharing A caring attitude is infused into our culture ñ this encourages sharing. We believe in the power of teams, we promote support and collaboration. At Devoteam, we care about our teams and want to work in a positive, productive environment. We support the development of talent and careers,

knowing that success is the result of collaboration. Alone, we go faster, but together, we go further.

Because alone, we go faster ñ but together, we go further.

Values:

Respect Frankness Passion

Business Unit:

Data & Intelligence

Level:

Senior to Managerial -level

To know more about us, please visit: www.devoteam.com

Job Description

A Business Data Analyst translates business requirements into data-driven insights, serving as the bridge between data experts and business stakeholders. They apply analytical skills, domain knowledge, and business acumen to interpret complex data sets and produce actionable recommendations that directly impact strategic and operational business decisions. At this level, analysts independently manage analytical projects, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and clearly communicate insights to management and stakeholders, influencing strategic initiatives and driving tangible business outcomes.

Technical and Analytical Capabilities:

Advanced Excel Skills: Pivot tables, advanced formulas, scenario modeling. Proficiency with Data Querying: SQL for data retrieval and manipulation. Data Visualization: Tableau, Power BI, Looker to develop interactive dashboards. Analytical Programming: Familiarity with Python or R for exploratory analysis. Understanding of Data Warehousing: Experience with relational databases and data structures for efficient data extraction and interpretation. Statistical Methods: Capability to perform descriptive analytics, correlation, and regression analysis to interpret business performance.

Business-Oriented Capabilities:

Business Acumen: Deep understanding of organizational processes, strategies, and KPIs to interpret data in relevant business contexts. Requirement Elicitation: Ability to gather, clarify, and refine business stakeholder needs and convert them into analytical tasks. Strategic Thinking: Align data analysis with business objectives, proactively identifying opportunities and recommending improvements.

Communication and Soft Skills:

Strong Communication: Clearly explain analytical findings in straightforward business language, tailored to different stakeholders (including executives). Data Storytelling: Ability to craft compelling narratives from data to highlight actionable insights. Stakeholder Management: Comfortably interacting across departments, from technical teams to senior business executives.

Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Proactively identify issues and approach business challenges analytically, offering practical solutions.

Project and Task Management:

Project Leadership: Independently manage end-to-end analytical projects from requirement gathering to delivering insights. Time Management: Efficiently prioritize multiple concurrent tasks or projects to meet deadlines and business expectations. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive documentation of analytical methodologies and findings, ensuring transparency and reproducibility.

Qualifications

One core certification (CCBA, CAP, or PMI-PBA) One data visualization certification (Tableau or Power BI) One complementary certification (optional but preferred)

Additional Information

Level: Mid-senior Level

Business Unit: Data Intelegince

job_description:
Description

Position Data Analyst

Department Institutional Planning and Research

School Prince Mohammad bin Fahd University

Reports to Director, Institutional Planning and Research

introduction

Prince Mohammad bin Fahd University strives to develop human intelligence, disseminate knowledge and find solutions based on research and scientific studies of problems experienced by societies. Based on its vision and mission in serving the local and international communities, and with the expertise, potential and facilities supporting scientific research and studies, and outreach activities, the University is inviting applications for this position.

General Description

The Data Analyst is responsible for the production of both standard and customized data reports to support decision-making by various campus constituents, including decisions related to student success, program review, planning, and resource allocation. This position will provide support to campus constituents with their data requests and will offer training to those interested in accessing available data on their own. The person in this position will be a key member of the Institutional Effectiveness Committee, and will use their knowledge of institutional data to contribute to strategic planning, recruitment, retention and student success strategies, and the development of institutional policy.

Duties and Responsibilities
ï Create various ad-hoc reports as needed by campus/departmental leadership across the entire campus.
ï Assist campus administrators and the Institutional Effectiveness Council with research, planning, and analysis of institutional and/or comparative data used to support and enhance evidence-based decision-making and policy formation in areas such as strategic planning, resource allocation, enrollment management, institutional effectiveness, and outcomes assessment.
ï Provide interpretation and analysis of statistical reports to campus leadership and other campus groups.
ï Assist with enrollment projections and retention analyses. Use multivariate analysis, regression analysis and other statistical tools in order to interpret data and make predictions.
ï Oversee administration of surveys including NSSE, FSSE, SSI, campus climate, etc.
ï Maintain archival research information essential for retention, graduation, and trend analysis.

Qualifications & Experience (Required)
ï Bachelorís degree with a focus in management information systems, informatics, social science, higher education, or a related field that includes statistical analysis and/or research methodology.
ï Two years of relevant experience with data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, and/or SQL programming.
ï Experience using SQL, Microsoft Access and Excel, relational database or BI reporting tools, data blending tools, or data visualization software.
ï Ability to write queries and manipulate data from various and multiple sources. Ability to create visual and tabular reports with excellent attention to detail. Ability to effectively communicate and exchange information.
ï Ability to use statistical database, spreadsheet, and word-processing computer programs to translate quantitative data into usable information for planning, assessment and other purposes.
ï Strong communication skills as evidenced by ability to develop written reports and to explain and present information to a variety of audiences.
ï Strong interpersonal skills, including ability to maintain effective working partnerships with multiple stakeholders across campus.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (Required)
ï Strong written and verbal communication skills
ï Strong focus on first time quality
ï Desire to grow technical skills and ability to learn new technologies swiftly
ï High attention to detail, self-starter, result driven
ï Ability to work in a cross-functional team
ï Professional, polite, and attentive while also being accurate
ï Always prepared and responsive, willing to meet each challenge directly
ï Teamwork
ï Negotiation and persuasion
ï Problem solving, Leadership
ï Perseverance and motivation
ï Ability to work under pressure, Confidence
ï Managing ambiguity, Resilience
ï Analytical skills, IT skills

Remuneration and Benefits

PMU offers an income tax-free compensation package, commensurate with rank and experience.

How to Apply

Application to this position require a letter of interest, curriculum vita (include a recent photo; state citizenship), unofficial copy of Diploma, as well as the names, addresses, phone numbers and email addresses of at least three professional references who may be contacted, with permission of the candidate, following initial evaluations by the search committee.

Positions advertised on our job website and can be closed at the discretion of the department at any time. This position is open until filled. This employment site is updated on a regular basis. The length of the recruitment and screening process may vary from position to position, depending upon a variety of factors. Should review of your qualifications result in a decision to pursue your candidacy, you will be contacted by phone or email.

Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until positions are filled.
ï Please mention the name of the source/website where you have seen this advertisement
ï Only short listed candidates will be contacted.
ï For submission of applications, log-on to our career site:
https://pmu.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobsearch.ftl

Alternatively, send your application by email to vacancies@pmu.edu.sa in the event of an unsuccessful online application. (Please specify Position Applied for: Ex: ìData Analyst" in the email subject line and please also mention the name of the source/website where you have seen this advertisement)

Disclaimer

PMU reserves the right to alter, amend and add responsibilities to this position in line with the institutional needs. Changes and amendments to this job description shall be within the academic framework and the general employment conditions.

Primary Location: Al-KHOBAR

Job: Analyst

Organization: Global Engagement

Schedule: Regular

Shift: Standard

Job Type: Full-time

Day Job

Job Posting: May 19, 2021, 5:35:46 AM

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions.

As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!

Ideal Candidate
ï Fluent in English
ï Excellent research skills.
ï Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
ï Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Saudi Arabia.
ï Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
ï Must be living in Saudi Arabia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
ï Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
ï Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
ï Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
ï Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
ï All work must be of an independent nature.

Technical requirements to perform the work

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:
ï A logon account unique to you
ï Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
ï Only one member per household may apply

NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

Benefits
ï Work up to 20 hours per week.
ï Earn a competitive rate of pay.
ï Develop your research skills.
ï Avoid the long commute.
ï Work from the comfort of your home office.
ï Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

Apply Online Today!

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Skills

English. Arabic. Attention to Detail. Research Skills.

job_description:
Weíre looking for a Senior Data Analyst (Finance) to lead and elevate all our financial analytics across Salla. The ideal candidate will work closely with Finance, Accounting, FP&A, Data, and Product teams to build accurate, trusted, and audit-ready financial data foundations.

This role requires strong ownership, high precision, and deep understanding of financial systems, revenue pipelines, and data modeling.
ï Act as the main data partner for Finance, collaborating with Technical, Product, Engineering, Data Platform, and Accounting.
ï Own data collection, reconciliation, and validation across ERP, billing systems, data warehouse, and revenue pipelines.
ï Design and maintain financial fact tables, revenue models, cost allocations, and profitability frameworks.
ï Partner with Finance to define revenue recognition rules and cost attribution methodologies.
ï Ensure month-end closing data is complete, consistent, and aligned with Finance & Accounting requirements.
ï Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and automated data pipelines.
ï Conduct deep-dive analyses on revenue, cost trends, merchant behavior, pricing changes, and cash-flow drivers.

Qualifications
ï 4ñ7 years of experience in data analytics, finance analytics, FP&A, or a related quantitative role.
ï Expert-level SQL (able to write optimized, complex queries on large datasets).
ï Strong BI experience (Tableau, Looker, Metabase, or similar).
ï Solid understanding of:
ï Financial statements (P&L, balance sheet, cash flow)
ï Revenue recognition
ï Accounting fundamentals
ï Financial modeling
ï Experience working with ERPs, billing systems, or financial data pipelines.
ï Exceptional attention to detail and rigorous data validation discipline.
ï Strong communication skills with ability to simplify complex financial concepts.

Nice to Have:
ï Experience in ecommerce or fintech data environments.
ï Familiarity with VAT/ZATCA, e-invoicing, or regulatory reporting.
ï Python for automation & analysis.
ï Knowledge of data warehouse modeling (dimensional modeling, SCDs, fact tables).

job_description:
Service Assurance; Reporting & Analysis; Quality & Process Improvement

Applies specialist knowledge in performing and reviewing specific processes and procedures within and across departments, to support achievement of divisional and corporate goals. Participates/leads in the design, development and implementation of processes within area of expertise.

Accuracy & Attention to Detail;Problem Solving Skills;Influencing & Persuasion Skills;Written & Verbal Communication Skills;Interpersonal Skills

Required Technical Skills
ï Advanced Excel skills
ï Data visualization tools (Power BI / Tableau)
ï SQL

Preferred Qualifications
ï Certified in Six Sigma
ï Certified in Business Analytics
ï Any other Certification on Quality Assurance
ï Bachelorís degree in IT, Business Analytics, or any related field

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce in which we enforce fair treatment, and provide growth opportunities for everyone.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, color, national origin, genetics, religion, gender, marital status, pregnancy (including childbirth or a related medical condition), physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 Worldís Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy, or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions, and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970ís. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure, and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in todayís global marketplace.

job_description:
Master-Works is seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will utilize your analytical skills to transform data into actionable insights that drive business performance and foster innovation. Your expertise will be instrumental in helping us to understand our operations, improve processes, and support strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple sources to evaluate business performance and trends.
ï Develop analytical reports and dashboards that present findings to stakeholders effectively.
ï Work alongside various departments to understand their data needs and provide tailored analytical solutions.
ï Perform statistical analyses and build predictive models to forecast future trends.
ï Identify opportunities for process improvements based on data insights.
ï Present findings and recommendations in a clear and compelling manner to non-technical audiences.
ï Ensure data governance and compliance by maintaining data integrity and security.

Requirements
ï Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
ï Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
ï Nationality: Saudi.
ï Expertise in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
ï Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
ï Proficiency in statistical analysis and experience working with large datasets.
ï Effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
ï A collaborative mindset with the ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.

Role Overview:
The Data Analyst will manage and analyze project data, ensuring accurate tracking of design reviews, compliance reports, and performance metrics. This role supports informed decision-making, progress reporting, and ongoing improvements for the Design Studio.

Key Responsibilities:

Requirements:

ï Proficiency with project management data platforms, ideally ACONEX.
ï Strong skills in data visualization and reporting tools.
ï High attention to detail and organizational abilities.
ï Fluency in English is required; Arabic is an advantage.
