At Parsons, you can imagine a career where you thrive, work with exceptional people, and be yourself. Guided by our leadership vision of valuing people, embracing agility, and fostering growth, we cultivate an innovative culture that empowers you to achieve your full potential. Unleash your talent and redefine whatís possible.

Job Description:
Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Senior Data Analyst (Financial Data & Automation Analyst ) to join our team! In this role you will get to automate reporting, analyze AR and unbilled data, and deliver real-time insights.

What You'll Be Doing:
ï Automating & developing real-time dashboards and performance data models (Power BI / Excel)
ï Performing deep dive analysis on AR and unbilled positions
ï Extracting, structuring, and validating large financial datasets
ï Tracking aging, DSO, and collection performance indicators
ï Producing precise insights for leadership reviews and decisions

What Required Skills You'll Bring:
ï Bachelorís degree in Finance or related field
ï With 4 + years of experience
ï Strong financial data analysis capability
ï Advanced Excel proficiency (Power Query, advanced formulas, data models)
ï Power BI development experience (visuals, measures, DAX)
ï Ability to build automated reporting workflows and dashboards
ï Hands on experience cleaning, transforming, and validating large datasets
ï Understanding of AR, unbilled, aging, and DSO metrics
ï Familiarity with ETL logic and structured data handling
ï High accuracy, fast execution, and strong problem solving mindset

Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels no matter the race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability or genetic information.

About UsTamara is the leading fintech platform in Saudi Arabia and the wider GCC region with a mission to help people make their dreams come true by building the most customer-centric financial super-app on earth. The company serves millions of users in the region and partners with leading global and regional brands such as SHEIN, Jarir, noon, IKEA and Amazon, as well as small and medium businesses.Tamara is Saudi Arabia's first fintech unicorn and is backed by Sanabil Investments, a wholly owned company by the Public Investment Fund (PIF), SNB Capital, , amongst others. The company operates from its headquarters in Riyadh, with additional regional and global support offices.We are looking for Data Analyst II to take us to the next stage of growth, supporting functions across the finance department. The successful candidate will have experience developing analytical solutions and assisting with data-driven decision making, while managing stakeholders across a broad range of functions. Tamara is a high growth startup looking to develop key product success metrics and enhancing decision making through data. Your ResponsibilitiesDrive business impact through actionable insights and identifying key opportunities for rapid growthBuild dashboards that provide accurate and actionable insightsWork with the data engineering team on the data enrichment needs of the product teamWork with stakeholders across the business to prioritize projects based on impact and drive deliveryDeveloping a process to identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, empower informed decision making for stakeholdersEnsuring governance and being a steward of good analytical practices throughout the processYour Expertise5+ years of experience in data analyticsBachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or other analytical field. Graduates from other fields with relevant knowledge and experience are welcome to apply.Hands on experience using programming (Python, R) to manipulate large data sets for insightsDemonstrated proficiency in one or more implementations of SQL (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL)Display understanding of your domain of interest - Whether its Finance, Risk, or ProductExperience using Machine Learning tools and techniques in R or Python a plusExperience using one or more data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik)Experience creating data visualizations and dashboards with Apache Superset a bonusExperience in a high-growth startup or unicorn a bonusAll qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

Job Summary

The Senior Data Business Analyst is a senior-level role requiring strong experience in data analysis and business requirements management. The position acts as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams, translating business needs into clear and actionable data requirements that support informed decision-making.

Key Responsibilities
ï Translate business and data needs into technical data requirements.
ï Define, document, and assess Data Use Cases and their business value.
ï Act as a facilitator between stakeholders and data engineering teams.
ï Analyze gaps between available data and required data for decision-making.
ï Contribute to the design and enhancement of data solutions and analytics initiatives.

Required Tools and Technologies
ï Business Analysis Tools (Jira, Confluence)
ï BPMN
ï SQL (Basic level)
ï Tableau or Power BI
ï Data analysis tools

Qualifications
ï Bachelorís degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field from an accredited university.
ï A Masterís degree is considered an added advantage.

Required Skills and Competencies
ï Excellent communication, presentation, and professional reporting skills.
ï Proficiency in English.
ï Strong analytical and logical thinking.
ï Ability to work under pressure and support change management initiatives.
ï Strong collaboration and leadership skills.
ï Professional certifications such as PMP, CDMP, Agile, or Scrum are considered an advantage.
ï Experience in data analysis and artificial intelligence is a plus.

Master-Works is excited to announce an opening for a Data Analyst to join our innovative and collaborative team.
In this position, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing data to help guide strategic decisions and improve business operations.
Your analytical insights will be critical in fostering a data-driven culture within the organization.
Key Responsibilities: Gather and analyze data from a variety of sources to make informed business recommendations.
Design and create comprehensive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and performance indicators.
Partner with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements and deliver impactful data solutions.
Utilize statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and relationships within datasets.
Communicate analysis results and insights to management and other stakeholders in an understandable manner.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing rigorous data validation processes.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and apply them where appropriate.
A Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a Data Analyst role or similar.
Nationality: Saudi.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strong attention to detail.
Experience in statistical analysis and familiarity with data modeling techniques.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical audiences.
A team-oriented individual who thrives in a collaborative environment.

Description

Eram Talent is seeking an analytical and detail-oriented data program analyst to join our team in Saudi Arabia. In this role, you will be instrumental in managing and analyzing data programs to enhance operational efficiency and decision-making processes. As a data program analyst, you will collaborate closely with various teams to translate raw data into meaningful insights, ultimately contributing to the success of our initiatives.

Responsibilities
ï Assist in the design, implementation, and management of data programs aimed at collecting and analyzing vital information.
ï Collect and manage data from various sources, ensuring its accuracy and integrity.
ï Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and program outcomes.
ï Analyze program data to identify trends, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
ï Support stakeholders by providing insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure effective data sharing and communication.
ï Prepare presentations and reports to convey complex data in a clear and actionable manner.
ï Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and program management.

Requirements
ï Bachelor's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field.
ï 3+ years of experience in data analysis or program management.
ï Proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
ï Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and present data effectively.
ï Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
ï Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks.
ï Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
ï Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
ï Fluency in English; proficiency in Arabic is a plus.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Telemetry & Incident Data AnalysisOperational Data Analysis:

Analyze real-time telemetry alerts and operational datasets to validate incidents, identify anomalies, and assess operational impact.
Differentiate true events from false positives, duplicate alerts, and known recurring conditions.
Correlate trends, timestamps, logs, and event data to support severity assessment and operational decision-making.
Prepare clear, data-backed incident summaries to support client and stakeholder response activities.

Operational Support & Vendor CoordinationIncident & Stakeholder Support:

Provide analytical context and data-driven insights to clients and external vendors during incident investigations.
Track remediation actions, response timelines, and outcomes using structured operational data.
Support escalation and prioritization decisions through evidence-based analysis.Communicate findings clearly and concisely to operations, service management, and project stakeholders.

Data Quality, Trends & Insights Performance & Trend Analysis:

Identify recurring incident patterns, systemic operational risks, and vendor performance trends.
Highlight gaps in telemetry coverage, data quality, alert logic, or monitoring effectiveness.
Recommend opportunities for alert tuning, automation, and improved monitoring or reporting practices.
Support continuous improvement initiatives by surfacing actionable insights from operational data.

Documentation & Continuous Improvement Reporting & Knowledge Management:

Maintain accurate, auditable records of analyses, incidents, and findings in approved client and company tools.
Contribute analytical insights to improve runbooks, alert definitions, and operational standards.
Support initiatives aimed at reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) and minimizing repeat incidents.

QUALIFICATIONS
Required Qualifications:

Bachelor s degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical, Computer, Network), Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related technical field.
10+ years of experience in a data analyst, operations analyst, or telemetry/monitoring-focused role.
Hands-on experience working with time-series data, logs, alerts, or event-driven datasets.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret noisy, incomplete, or real-time data.
Excellent documentation, written, and verbal communication skills.
Ability to operate independently in fast-paced, incident-driven environments.
Comfort working across vendors and cross-functional technical teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience supporting data centers, infrastructure operations, NOC/SOC environments, or other critical systems.
Familiarity with incident management, problem management, or operational analytics practices.
Exposure to telemetry, observability, or monitoring platforms.
Understanding of root cause analysis concepts and service management frameworks (e.g., ITIL).

Position Details:

Primary Location (Office-based): Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
Position: Data Analyst Telemetry & Operations (APAC)
Position Classification: Salary-based full-time hours

PRODUCTIVITY TOOLS:

Microsoft Office
Microsoft 365

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce in which we enforce fair treatment, and provide growth opportunities for everyone.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, color, national origin, genetics, religion, gender, marital status, pregnancy (including childbirth or a related medical condition), physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 Worldís Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy, or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions, and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970ís. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure, and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in todayís global marketplace.

Overview

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 20 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The companyís flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby generates over $14 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing Fin Tech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and now has an implied valuation of $4.5 billion.
What you will be doing

Queue Management and Routing Rules
ï Configure internal queues in the CRM for distributing tickets to agents.
ï Analyze and optimize prioritization logic, SLA paths, and fallback routing.
ï Support special scenarios: escalations, VIP cases, language queues, shift-based routing.
ï Perform regular audits of rule correctness and their impact on SLA and workload.

Service Performance Analytics and Monitoring
ï Monitor key metrics: SLA, AHT, backlog, occupancy, shrinkage.
ï Detect anomalies in data and investigate root causes of deviations.
ï Analyze the impact of queue and process changes on service metrics.
ï Prepare regular performance analytics and reports for management.

FTE Requirement Planning
ï Calculate required agent headcount based on forecasts and SLA.
ï Model ìwhat-ifî scenarios: marketing activities, SLA changes, new processes or products.
ï Evaluate schedule effectiveness and recommend optimal resource allocation.

Workload Forecasting
ï Build time series forecasts for incoming tickets, chats, and calls.
ï Identify seasonal patterns, spikes, and holiday effects.
ï Prepare short-term and long-term forecasts (interval, weekly, monthly horizons).
ï Update forecasts considering product changes, marketing activity, and process updates.

Data Work
ï Write SQL queries to retrieve data from the analytics database.
ï Collect data from multiple sources (CRM, BI systems, queue logs).
ï Prepare and clean datasets for forecasting models.
What you will need

Mandatory
ï Experience in one of the following areas:
ï Workforce Management (preferably General / Backoffice Support)
ï routing/queue management in a contact center (routing specialist, queue admin)
ï time series analytics or ML model development
ï Understanding of queueing theory principles: prioritization, waiting time, throughput, SLA, workload balancing.
ï Confident SQL skills (joins, window functions, aggregations).
ï Experience analyzing operational metrics: SLA, AHT, abandon rate, occupancy.
ï Understanding of backlog servicing (non-real-time), multi-skill routing, and blended workloads.
ï Experience analyzing anomalies: data quality control, SLA trail validation, workload spikes.

Preferred
ï Experience configuring queues or task distribution in any CRM/Contact Center system:
Zendesk, Genesys, Avaya, NICE, or internal tools.
ï Experience building ARIMA/Prophet/LSTM or regression-based ML models.
ï Experience working in fintech/e-commerce/support environments with high ticket volumes.
ï Experience using BI systems (Tableau, Power

BI, Looker, or similar).
Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain.

What you can expect
ï We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
ï A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
ï You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
ï Participation in the companyís employee stock options program.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, weíd love to hear from you!
About Tabby

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

Description

The Qiddiya Investment Company is seeking a dynamic and experienced director of data analytics. The director ñ data analytics is a quantitative leader responsible for transforming complex financial and operational data into clear dashboards, insights, and decision-ready intelligence. This high-level role will require a visionary leader who can leverage data to drive strategic decision-making, enhance operational effectiveness, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization. The successful candidate will oversee the development and implementation of advanced analytical frameworks, data governance structures, and reporting mechanisms that align with Qiddiya's strategic objectives.

Key accountabilities

Analytics, dashboards & insights:
ï Design and own executive dashboards covering cost, budgets, workforce plans, and performance KPIs.
ï Translate complex datasets into clear visualizations and actionable insights.
ï Drive data storytelling to highlight trends, risks, and opportunities.

Cash, workforce & budget analytics:
ï Lead cash flow analytics, forecasting, and scenario modeling across projects.
ï Develop workforce plans, productivity analytics, and resource demand models.
ï Analyze budgets, costs, and financial performance to support decision-making.

Quantitative decision support:
ï Act as the go-to expert for quantitative analysis, modeling, and performance measurement.

job_title: Data analyst ñ business & data mapping - gapd - jeddah
job_description:
Job Title: Data Analyst ñ Business & Data Mapping (Teradata FSLDM) | Experience: 10+ Years | Location: Jeddah, Saudi Arabia
About the Company
Our AI service offering is underpinned by cutting?edge technologies and a forward?thinking approach, enabling organisations to turn raw data into actionable insights. By meticulously assessing current business landscapes, we empower organisations to pinpoint inefficiencies, uncover hidden opportunities, and devise strategies that are both scalable and sustainable. Through a seamless integration of AI and analytics, we ensure that every step toward innovation is both measurable and impactful, ultimately fostering a culture of continuous improvement and technological excellence.
Our holistic service offerings in Technology, Consulting, and Security are empowered by cutting?edge AI features designed to drive unparalleled efficiency and innovation.
Role Overview
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst ñ Business & Data Mapping (Teradata FSLDM) to join our clientís team in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. This role is ideal for professionals with strong experience in data analysis, business requirements gathering, and source-to-target data mapping within financial services. You will collaborate with business stakeholders, data architects, and ETL teams to translate banking and financial services requirements into accurate mappings and analytics?ready datasets using Teradata FSLDM. Your work will play a critical role in enabling regulatory reporting, data governance, and enterprise data warehouse initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Engage with business teams to gather, analyse, and document functional requirements for reporting, analytics, and regulatory use cases.
Conduct workshops to understand banking processes and map them to relevant FSLDM subject areas.
Prepare functional specifications, process flows, and business glossaries.
Perform data profiling to assess data quality, completeness, and consistency across source systems.
Identify data gaps and propose remediation strategies.
Analyse FSLDM structures for suitability and alignment with business needs.
Develop comprehensive Source-to-Target Mapping (STTM) documents integrating source systems such as BANCs, LOS, CLOS, MUREX with FSLDM entities.
Define transformation rules, lookup logic, and business rules for ETL development.
Ensure all mappings adhere to governance and regulatory standards.
Leverage FSLDM logical and physical data models to represent business requirements accurately.
Recommend extensions or customizations based on project needs.
Support integration with analytical layers such as FSAS.
Participate in SIT/UAT cycles by validating data outputs against business rules.
Work with development teams for defect analysis, triage, and resolution.
Maintain mapping inventories, data dictionaries, and lineage artifacts.
Follow governance standards for metadata, change management, and version control
Required Skills
5ñ10 years of experience in data/business analysis within Banking or Financial Services.
Exposure to regulatory reporting frameworks (Basel, BCBS 239)
Strong understanding of Teradata FSLDM or similar financial services data models.
Hands?on experience creating STTMs and transformation rules.
Ability to work closely with ETL teams (Informatica, Data Stage, Talend).
Strong SQL proficiency for data extraction, validation, and profiling (Teradata/Oracle).
Proficiency in ERwin or similar data modelling tools.
Working knowledge of Excel, Power Point, Confluence, Jira.
Excellent communication, documentation, analytical thinking, and stakeholder management.

ï Building data solutions for customer segmentation, targeting, churn modelling, lifetime value estimation, forecasting, recommendation systems, and price optimisation

ï Developing clear, effective visualisations to present complex data to stakeholders across multiple departments
ï Reporting insights and recommendations to senior leadership and relevant teams including production, user acquisition, monetisation, and marketing

What we're looking for:

ï Strong applied statistics knowledge including distributions, regression, and statistical testing

ï Advanced SQL skills and a deep understanding of RDBMS concepts with experience handling large datasets
ï Strong programming and scripting skills in languages such as Python, R, Java, Scala, or Perl

PIPECARE Europe is currently looking for UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3].

By providing technology and service focused solutions to the international arena of the oil and gas industry, the PipeCare Group of companies has been helping our customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global focus and international growth, Pipecare is seeking experienced UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3] to support our continued growth.

Selected candidate will be working with our project execution teams to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of in-line inspection results, with focus on our custom-tailored reporting solutions to satisfy our customersí needs. This includes the review of customer requirement specifications, processing of in-line inspection data, the analysis and identification of pipeline features and anomalies within processed data sets, application of industry accepted anomaly assessment criteria, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the final results, and compiling the results of our inspection activities in a concise, comprehensive custom tailored report for our customers.

Industry/sector: Oil & Gas / In Line Inspection services

Qualification: Data Analyst in UT/UTCD technology [Level 3]

Min years of experience: minimum last 15+ years working as UT/UTCD Data Analyst

Other requirements: solution ñ oriented attitude; hands on approach; disciplined; team player; self-motivated

Responsibilities include:
ï * Checking and approving the tool performance during the PTT
ï Checking the data quality of ILI runs
ï UTWM Data Analysis
ï UTCD Data Analysis
ï EMAT Data Analysis
ï Checking and implementing dig verification task at sites and preparing relevant reports
ï Reviewing the software inter phase
ï Reviewing software user manuals
ï Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
ï To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
ï To prepare a specific Run assessment report
ï To identify obstructions in the pipeline; to produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report (if applicable)
ï To produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report
ï To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
ï To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
ï To alert the R&D regarding the software problems
ï To update the documentation
ï To produce updated standard quality procedures
ï To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding the software problems
ï Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role

Qualified Candidates will possess:
ï Minimum 4-year technical or engineering degree from an accredited university (experience in the analysis of in-line inspection data may be considered in lieu of education on case by case basis)
ï Prior certification as ILI PQ LIII Data Analyst in one or more of the following in-line inspection technologies: UTWM, UTCD, EMAT; or the ability to become certified
ï Minimum 15 years of experience in the analysis of in-line inspection data
ï Ability to learn proprietary software platforms; proficiency in Microsoft based applications is a must
ï Proficiency in English, both verbal and written
ï A professional, detail-oriented focus and attention to detail and high quality
ï Ability to communicate effectively to all organizational levels, prepare and make presentations to management and customers on all levels

Job requirements:
ï Ability to work for extended periods of time in a stationary position at computers and workstations
ï Ability to pass vision acuity and color differentiation examinations
ï Business travel may be required for internal training, internal meetings, site visits, and customer meetings [international travel may be required]
ï Ability to work flexible hours based on business and project needs
ï Ability to work either independently or within a team to ensure project success

Physical and Mental Requirements:
ï Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
ï Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells
ï Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively
ï Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively
ï Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
ï Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary

About PIPECARE Group:

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What we do:

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

job_title: Data Analyst Jobs in Saudi Arabia
job_description:
Saudi Arabia has become one of the most promising destinations for skilled professionals who are looking for strong career opportunities, long-term growth, and the chance to be part of one of the fastest-growing economies in the world. The Kingdom is transforming rapidly through its ambitious Vision 2030, which focuses on technology, data, and innovation. Among the most in-demand roles today are Data Analyst jobs, as organizations across finance, healthcare, energy, retail, and logistics look to harness the power of data to make informed decisions.

This job description highlights the opportunities, responsibilities, work environment, and application details for those aiming to start a career as a Data Analyst in Saudi Arabia.

Company Overview

Our hiring is focused on leading organizations in Saudi Arabiaís tech, energy, and service sectors that are actively looking to expand their data teams. These organizations are located in King Fahd Road, Riyadh, which is one of the busiest business hubs of the Kingdom. Offices here are modern, equipped with high-tech infrastructure, and provide a collaborative atmosphere for employees from all over the world.

The companies are committed to offering opportunities for international candidates by supporting relocation assistance, work permits, and in many cases, visa sponsorship. With Saudi Arabiaís rapid push toward digital transformation, Data Analysts will be at the heart of driving business strategy and innovation.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large data sets to provide actionable insights that help organizations make data-driven decisions. You will play a critical role in building dashboards, preparing reports, identifying patterns, and supporting senior management in strategic planning.

This position requires both technical expertise and strong communication skills. You will be working closely with cross-functional teams including IT, marketing, finance, and operations to ensure that data is accurate, reliable, and transformed into meaningful business insights.

Key Responsibilities
ï Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather data from multiple sources, verify its accuracy, and clean inconsistencies to ensure reliability.
ï Statistical Analysis: Use tools such as Python, R, or SQL to run statistical tests and uncover meaningful trends.
ï Data Visualization: Create clear and interactive dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or Excel to present findings to stakeholders.
ï Business Insights: Translate data patterns into actionable recommendations for different departments.
ï Collaboration: Work with managers, developers, and decision-makers to identify new opportunities for process improvement.
ï Automation: Implement automation scripts to reduce repetitive tasks in data reporting.
ï Reporting: Prepare weekly and monthly reports to update stakeholders on performance metrics.
ï Compliance: Ensure data management processes align with company policies and international data privacy regulations.
ï Problem Solving: Use analytical thinking to identify challenges in workflows and propose data-driven solutions.
ï Learning and Development: Stay updated with the latest tools, frameworks, and industry trends in data analytics.

Skills and Qualifications

To succeed as a Data Analyst in Saudi Arabia, you will need a combination of technical and interpersonal skills:
ï Bachelorís degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, or related field.
ï Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
ï Strong knowledge of data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or QlikView.
ï Solid foundation in statistics, probability, and predictive modeling.
ï Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables and macros.
ï Experience working with large datasets and database systems.
ï Ability to communicate complex data findings in simple language.
ï Strong problem-solving, attention to detail, and critical thinking abilities.
ï Previous experience in business intelligence or analytics roles is highly preferred.

Work Environment

The role is based in King Fahd Road, Riyadh, where companies operate in a professional, multicultural, and modern environment. Employees enjoy collaborative workspaces, advanced tools, and access to continuous training programs. The companies hiring are committed to diversity and welcome professionals from across the globe.

With Saudi Arabiaís growing expatriate community, working here offers a unique experience of cultural richness and professional development. The organizations also provide competitive compensation packages, healthcare, accommodation allowances, and relocation assistance to ensure employees can settle smoothly.

Career Growth

Data Analysts are highly valued in Saudi Arabia, and this role opens doors to career progression in:
ï Senior Data Analyst
ï Business Intelligence Analyst
ï Data Scientist
ï Machine Learning Specialist
ï Analytics Manager

With the government investing heavily in smart cities, digital infrastructure, and artificial intelligence, demand for data professionals will continue to rise.

Salary and Benefits

While exact packages vary depending on company and experience, Data Analysts in Saudi Arabia typically earn:
ï Entry-level: SAR 8,000 ñ SAR 12,000 per month
ï Mid-level: SAR 13,000 ñ SAR 18,000 per month
ï Senior-level: SAR 19,000 ñ SAR 25,000 per month

Additional benefits often include:
ï Housing or accommodation allowance
ï Annual airfare tickets for relocation
ï Comprehensive health insurance
ï Paid annual leave
ï End-of-service benefits
ï Relocation support and work permit sponsorship

Easy Job Titles Available

For candidates seeking opportunities in Saudi Arabiaís data and technology space, here are 10 easy job titles currently available:
ï Data Analyst
ï Junior Data Analyst
ï Business Intelligence Analyst
ï Data Entry Specialist
ï Reporting Analyst
ï Research Analyst
ï Market Data Coordinator
ï Junior SQL Developer
ï Excel Reporting Assistant
ï Operations Data Associate

These positions are suitable for candidates with varying levels of experience, ensuring both fresh graduates and experienced professionals have opportunities to apply.

Why Work in Saudi Arabia?

Saudi Arabia offers a unique balance of professional growth and lifestyle opportunities. From its modern cities like Riyadh and Jeddah to its ambitious Vision 2030 projects, the Kingdom is creating an environment where international talent can thrive.

Employees benefit from:
ï Tax-free income
ï Competitive salaries
ï Modern work environments
ï Strong career advancement
ï Opportunities to be part of large-scale transformation projects

For international professionals, this is a chance to build a rewarding career in one of the most dynamic regions in the world.

How to Apply

If you are ready to take the next step in your career and secure a Data Analyst job in Saudi Arabia, applications are now open. Interested candidates are encouraged to prepare their updated CV, highlighting relevant skills and experiences in data analysis, visualization, and business insights. To apply, please send your application directly to the recruitment team via the official company HR email provided in the job posting. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews, and successful applicants will receive visa sponsorship and relocation support to start their journey in Riyadh.

Job Description Summary
The Production Data Analyst ñ ECT supports the production and operations teams by collecting, validating, and analyzing manufacturing data to enable accurate performance tracking and data-driven decision making. This role works closely with the Cell Leader, Manufacturing Engineering, Planning, and Quality teams to monitor labor hours, production progress, and key manufacturing KPIs.

The position is designed for early-career professionals who are interested in manufacturing operations, skid or modular equipment assembly, and shop-floor performance analysis. The role combines hands-on shop-floor exposure with data analysis and reporting, helping ensure alignment between planned and actual execution.

The analyst will maintain Excel-based reports and dashboards, support daily and periodic performance reviews, and contribute to standardization and continuous improvement initiatives. This role provides strong foundational experience for future careers in operations, industrial engineering, manufacturing analytics, or planning.

Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
ï Collect and consolidate production data from timesheets, router files, and shop-floor inputs.
ï Validate accuracy (missing punches, incorrect operation IDs, duration errors) and follow up on corrections.
ï Prepare daily/weekly/monthly KPI reports: utilization, operation attainment, planned vs actual hours, overtime, rework.
ï Build and maintain dashboards using Excel (Pivot Tables, Power Query, slicers/charts).
ï Support standardization of reporting templates and master data (Operation IDs, planned hours).

Required Qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree in industrial, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field from an accredited university.
ï 0 to 1 year of experience with exposure to operations, manufacturing systems, statistics, or data analysis.
ï Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel.

Desired Characteristics
ï Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including:
ï Pivot Tables and Pivot Charts
ï Logical and statistical formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS)
ï Data cleaning, structuring, and validation techniques
ï Basic understanding of manufacturing or operational data, such as labor hours, routings, production tracking, and planned vs actual performance
ï Good verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly present data, trends.
ï Ability to work closely with production, planning, and engineering teams to understand data sources and validate information.
ï Willingness to ask questions, follow up on data gaps, and ensure reporting accuracy.
ï Interest in skid assembly and manufacturing.
ï Basic understanding of mechanical, piping, electrical, or integrated systems.
ï Awareness of manufacturing and assembly processes (workstations, routing, operation steps).
ï Basic knowledge of production KPIs such as labor utilization and planned vs actual hours.
ï Willingness to spend time on the shop floor to understand assembly flow and data sources.
ï Ability to learn and apply Lean and daily management concepts.
ï Strong attention to detail and focus on data accuracy.
ï Interest in developing skills in dashboards and data analysis.
ï Good communication skills and confidence to follow up with teams.
ï Proactive and hands-on learning mindset.
ï *Additional Information*
ï Relocation Assistance Provided:
No

ï Develop and implement analytical models to evaluate business performance.
ï Create comprehensive reports and dashboards that summarize findings and insights for stakeholders.
ï Work closely with teams to determine data needs and provide analytical solutions.
ï Use statistical methods to derive insights and predict future trends.
ï Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data through rigorous validation and quality checks.
ï Communicate analytical results effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Join us at Master-Works and leverage data analytics to make meaningful contributions that enhance our clients' success and drive our business forward.

Requirements
ï Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
ï 2+ years of experience in data analysis or analytics.
ï Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
ï Strong understanding of statistical analysis and experience with data modeling.
ï Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
ï Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to diverse audiences.
ï A detail-oriented professional with a passion for data-driven decision making.

Job Description Summary
The Production Data Analyst ñ ECT supports the production and operations teams by collecting, validating, and analyzing manufacturing data to enable accurate performance tracking and data-driven decision making. This role works closely with the Cell Leader, Manufacturing Engineering, Planning, and Quality teams to monitor labor hours, production progress, and key manufacturing KPIs.

The position is designed for early-career professionals who are interested in manufacturing operations, skid or modular equipment assembly, and shop-floor performance analysis. The role combines hands-on shop-floor exposure with data analysis and reporting, helping ensure alignment between planned and actual execution.

The analyst will maintain Excel-based reports and dashboards, support daily and periodic performance reviews, and contribute to standardization and continuous improvement initiatives. This role provides strong foundational experience for future careers in operations, industrial engineering, manufacturing analytics, or planning.

Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
ï Collect and consolidate production data from timesheets, router files, and shop-floor inputs.
ï Validate accuracy (missing punches, incorrect operation IDs, duration errors) and follow up on corrections.
ï Prepare daily/weekly/monthly KPI reports: utilization, operation attainment, planned vs actual hours, overtime, rework.
ï Build and maintain dashboards using Excel (Pivot Tables, Power Query, slicers/charts).
ï Support standardization of reporting templates and master data (Operation IDs, planned hours).

?
Required Qualifications
ï Bachelorís degree in industrial, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field from an accredited university.
ï 0 to 1 year of experience with exposure to operations, manufacturing systems, statistics, or data analysis.
ï Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel.

Desired Characteristics
ï Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including:
ï Pivot Tables and Pivot Charts
ï Logical and statistical formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS)
ï Data cleaning, structuring, and validation techniques
ï Basic understanding of manufacturing or operational data, such as labor hours, routings, production tracking, and planned vs actual performance
ï Good verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly present data, trends.
ï Ability to work closely with production, planning, and engineering teams to understand data sources and validate information.
ï Willingness to ask questions, follow up on data gaps, and ensure reporting accuracy.
ï Interest in skid assembly and manufacturing.
ï Basic understanding of mechanical, piping, electrical, or integrated systems.
ï Awareness of manufacturing and assembly processes (workstations, routing, operation steps).
ï Basic knowledge of production KPIs such as labor utilization and planned vs actual hours.
ï Willingness to spend time on the shop floor to understand assembly flow and data sources.
ï Ability to learn and apply Lean and daily management concepts.
ï Strong attention to detail and focus on data accuracy.
ï Interest in developing skills in dashboards and data analysis.
ï Good communication skills and confidence to follow up with teams.
ï Proactive and hands-on learning mindset.

Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

After our successful Series D in 2021, we raised another $50M in 2023, doubling our valuation to $12B. Thereís never been a more exciting time to join Deel ó the international payroll and compliance market leader.

Duties

Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
Analyse market data, identify customer behaviour and trends
Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualisations that drive actions and support decision making
Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.

Requirements

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
5+ yearsí experience in product analytics team
Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority

Weíd especially love to speak with you if:

You love data exploration and visualisations
Have experience with snowflake and LookML
You are driven by business impact generated from your insights
You are naturally curious and enjoy challenging the status quo
You are proactive and like to take responsibility in projects, managing requirements and collaborating with a number of different teams across the company
You know when to go deep on a task and when to execute

job_description:
Weíre looking for a Senior Data Analyst (Finance) to lead and elevate all our financial analytics across Salla. The ideal candidate will work closely with Finance, Accounting, FP&A, Data, and Product teams to build accurate, trusted, and audit-ready financial data foundations.

This role requires strong ownership, high precision, and deep understanding of financial systems, revenue pipelines, and data modeling.

Requirements
ï Act as the main data partner for Finance, collaborating with Technical, Product, Engineering, Data Platform, and Accounting.
ï Own data collection, reconciliation, and validation across ERP, billing systems, data warehouse, and revenue pipelines.
ï Design and maintain financial fact tables, revenue models, cost allocations, and profitability frameworks.
ï Partner with Finance to define revenue recognition rules and cost attribution methodologies.
ï Ensure month-end closing data is complete, consistent, and aligned with Finance & Accounting requirements.
ï Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and automated data pipelines.
ï Conduct deep-dive analyses on revenue, cost trends, merchant behavior, pricing changes, and cash-flow drivers.

Qualifications
ï 4ñ7 years of experience in data analytics, finance analytics, FP&A, or a related quantitative role.
ï Expert-level SQL (able to write optimized, complex queries on large datasets).
ï Strong BI experience (Tableau, Looker, Metabase, or similar).
ï Solid understanding of:
ï Financial statements (P&L, balance sheet, cash flow)
ï Revenue recognition
ï Accounting fundamentals
ï Financial modeling
ï Experience working with ERPs, billing systems, or financial data pipelines.
ï Exceptional attention to detail and rigorous data validation discipline.
ï Strong communication skills with ability to simplify complex financial concepts.

Nice to Have:
ï Experience in ecommerce or fintech data environments.
ï Familiarity with VAT/ZATCA, e-invoicing, or regulatory reporting.
ï Python for automation & analysis.
ï Knowledge of data warehouse modeling (dimensional modeling, SCDs, fact tables).

job_description:
Company Description

Tech for People Unlocks the Future

At Devoteam, we believe that technology, combined with strong human values, can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People is shaping the future, creating a positive impact on individuals and the world around us.

With over 25 years of passion for technology and a presence in 18+ countries across EMEA and beyond, we are committed to leveraging innovation, expertise, and human-centric values to make a difference.

Devoteam Culture & Values:

True innovation is born from a powerful culture, fused with meaningful values.

Culture:
ï Fair and courageous
Everyone is treated fairly ñ this fuels bravery. At Devoteam, we always make fair decisions. We listen and are willing to be challenged, taking courageous decisions as a result. We help our employees to progress at every step and congratulate those who deserve it.
ï Ambition and results
Ambition is nurtured at every step ñ this drives results. We are ambitious entrepreneurs with a taste for performance, growth and celebrating success. Commitments are always kept as we seek to achieve profitable growth to create value and employment. We aim to bring as much value as possible to our clients, at every touchpoint.
ï Learning and innovating
Curiosity and learning are at our core ñ this stimulates innovation. At Devoteam, we are curious. We learn and embrace innovation constantly to meet challenges and build partnerships of excellence.
ï Caring and sharing
A caring attitude is infused into our culture ñ this encourages sharing. We believe in the power of teams, we promote support and collaboration.
At Devoteam, we care about our teams and want to work in a positive, productive environment. We support the development of talent and careers,

knowing that success is the result of collaboration. Alone, we go faster, but together, we go further.

Because alone, we go faster ñ but together, we go further.

Values:
ï Respect
ï Frankness
ï Passion

Business Unit:

Data & Intelligence

Level:

Senior to Managerial -level

To know more about us, please visit: www.devoteam.com

Job Description

A Business Data Analyst translates business requirements into data-driven insights, serving as the bridge between data experts and business stakeholders. They apply analytical skills, domain knowledge, and business acumen to interpret complex data sets and produce actionable recommendations that directly impact strategic and operational business decisions. At this level, analysts independently manage analytical projects, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and clearly communicate insights to management and stakeholders, influencing strategic initiatives and driving tangible business outcomes.

Technical and Analytical Capabilities:

- Advanced Excel Skills: Pivot tables, advanced formulas, scenario modeling.
- Proficiency with Data Querying: SQL for data retrieval and manipulation.
- Data Visualization: Tableau, Power BI, Looker to develop interactive dashboards.
- Analytical Programming: Familiarity with Python or R for exploratory analysis.
- Understanding of Data Warehousing: Experience with relational databases and data structures for efficient data extraction and interpretation.
- Statistical Methods: Capability to perform descriptive analytics, correlation, and regression analysis to interpret business performance.

Business-Oriented Capabilities:
-Business Acumen: Deep understanding of organizational processes, strategies, and KPIs to interpret data in relevant business contexts.
-Requirement Elicitation: Ability to gather, clarify, and refine business stakeholder needs and convert them into analytical tasks.
-Strategic Thinking: Align data analysis with business objectives, proactively identifying opportunities and recommending improvements.

Communication and Soft Skills:

-Strong Communication: Clearly explain analytical findings in straightforward business language, tailored to different stakeholders (including executives).
-Data Storytelling: Ability to craft compelling narratives from data to highlight actionable insights.
-Stakeholder Management: Comfortably interacting across departments, from technical teams to senior business executives.
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Proactively identify issues and approach business challenges analytically, offering practical solutions.

Project and Task Management:

-Project Leadership: Independently manage end-to-end analytical projects from requirement gathering to delivering insights.
-Time Management: Efficiently prioritize multiple concurrent tasks or projects to meet deadlines and business expectations.
-Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive documentation of analytical methodologies and findings, ensuring transparency and reproducibility.

Qualifications
ï One core certification (CCBA, CAP, or PMI-PBA)
ï One data visualization certification (Tableau or Power BI)
ï One complementary certification (optional but preferred)

Additional Information

Level: Mid-senior Level

Business Unit: Data Intelegince

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

Job Description:

The Data Analyst ñ Business Intelligence & Reporting will undertake the pivotal role of transforming raw data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. This position demands a keen analytical mind with a strong foundation in data extraction, transformation, and visualization. The ideal candidate will leverage advanced statistical techniques and business intelligence tools to interpret complex datasets and present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, the Data Analyst will drive the development of customized reports and dashboards while ensuring data integrity and alignment with business objectives. Success in this role will require proficiency in data manipulation, a deep understanding of business metrics, and the ability to communicate findings clearly and effectively.

ï Strong ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and analytical outcomes.
ï Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences.
ï Demonstrated problem-solving capabilities and the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
ï Capacity to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.

ï Present data insights and visualization results to management and stakeholders, ensuring clear communication of analytical conclusions.
ï Assist in the development and implementation of data management processes to enhance data quality and availability.
ï Continuously evaluate and refine reporting methodologies to improve efficiency and relevance to the organization's evolving needs.
ï Participate in team meetings to share insights, best practices, and new analytical techniques to foster a culture of data-driven decision-making.
ï Document data processes and methodologies for knowledge sharing and consistency across the reporting team.

Required Skills:
ï Strong analytical skills with the ability to dissect complex datasets into meaningful information.
ï Proficient in SQL with an aptitude for writing and optimizing database queries.
ï Hands-on experience with data visualization tools to create compelling visual representations of data.
ï Basic coding skills in Python or R for statistical analysis and data manipulation.
ï Solid understanding of statistical concepts and their application to real-world business challenges.

About the Institution:
MCTS is a governmental organization mandated to oversee traffic affairs in Saudi Arabia.

It is responsible for developing and monitoring the implementation of strategies and initiatives under the National Transformation Program to enhance traffic safety.

About the Role:
MCTS is seeking a Senior Big Data Analyst to deliver advanced analytics that strengthen decision-making and improve organizational performance.

In this role, you will work with multi-source datasets (including external/governmental entities), enhance data quality, automate repeatable analytics, and develop executive dashboards and reports.

You will translate complex findings into clear, actionable insights for senior leadership while supporting the organization's data-sharing and integration objectives under strong governance, compliance, and security requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and document data from multiple external sources, including government and regulatory entities, ensuring consistent data definitions and traceability.
Clean and improve data quality by building validation rules, identifying anomalies and missing values, and recommending corrective actions.
Design and execute advanced analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, and when needed predictive/prescriptive) using Python or R, applying appropriate statistical methods.
Develop executive dashboards and performance reporting in Power BI and/or Tableau, including KPIs, trends, drill-down capabilities, and interpretation notes.
Deliver data-driven recommendations to support initiatives and projects, clearly communicating expected impact, risks, constraints, and assumptions.

Contribute to improving data flows and integration between entities by identifying gaps and working with technical teams to implement enhancements (current state relies on file-based exchange).
Automate analytics and reporting through reusable scripts and templates to reduce manual effort and improve reliability.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements, including privacy, data classification, and access controls for sensitive data.
Present insights to senior stakeholders in non-technical, executive-ready narratives, including scenarios and limitations of analysis.
Maintain thorough documentation of analytical work, methodologies, business rules, models, and KPI definitions to support auditability and continuity.
Support monthly delivery cycles and reporting commitments while managing multiple parallel requests and outputs.

Key Stakeholders:
Government and regulatory entities and relevant authorities.
Senior leadership and decision-makers.
Data Owners and business representatives.

Qualifications & Experience:
5+ years of hands-on experience in data analytics, big data analytics, and/or business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in Python or R for analysis and statistical modeling, with practical experience using common analytics libraries.
Advanced experience building executive dashboards and KPIs using Power BI and/or Tableau.
Proven experience improving data quality, including validation rules, anomaly detection, and remediation recommendations.
Experience working in multi-entity data environments with data sharing, integration, and governance considerations.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Professional working proficiency in English (written and spoken).
Practical experience using GIS and geospatial analytics tools (e.g., ArcGIS and/or QGIS).
Ability to pass required security screening/background verification.

Preferred:

Training or certifications in Business Intelligence, Applied Statistics/Data Science, Data Governance/Data Management, Data Privacy/Information Security, and stakeholder management/presentation skills.
Experience designing executive-level visual storytelling (UX/storytelling) that highlights key messages and supports decision-making.
Exposure to improving interoperability and integration approaches between organizations.

Skills & Competencies:
Analytical and critical thinking with structured problem-solving.
High attention to detail and accuracy with large, complex datasets.
Executive communication and presentation skills, including translating analytics into clear decisions and recommendations.
Strong time management and prioritization, especially in monthly delivery cycles.

Stakeholder management:
listening, expectation setting, professional negotiation, and converting needs into actionable outputs.
Continuous improvement mindset with a focus on automation and reliability.

Values:
Quality, Initiative, Commitment, Integrity, and Team Spirit.

Work Environment:

The role requires flexibility and the ability to perform effectively under high-pressure conditions to meet targets and national priorities.

Job Benefits:
Annual performance bonus and salary raise.
VIP health insurance coverage that includes dependents and parents.
Education allowance for children.
Individual training and development plans, plus mentorship and coaching programs.
Opportunities for professional certifications and advanced training.
Support to attend workshops, conferences, and seminars.
Clear career growth path with continuous development opportunities.
A values-driven culture built on Quality, Initiative, Integrity, Commitment, and Team Spirit, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.

Description
Job Description ñ Data Analyst Job Summary

The Data Analyst will play a critical role in enabling Tarshid's business units to make data-driven decisions. In the short term, this role will focus on collecting, cleaning, consolidating, and analyzing data from multiple systems to provide reliable reporting and insights. In the medium to long term, the Data Analyst will actively contribute to the design, testing, and adoption of Tarshid's Data Lake and Business Intelligence platforms, enabling advanced analytics and AI-driven insights across the organization.
Key Responsibilities Immediate (PreñData Lake)

- Gather, validate, and consolidate data from multiple siloed systems and manual sources.

- Develop recurring and ad-hoc reports for Finance, Strategy, Shared Services, and Operations.

- Build dashboards and visualizations (Excel, Power BI) to track KPIs such as project progress, financial performance, and energy savings.

- Highlight trends, anomalies, and risks to support timely decision-making.
Transition (During Data Lake Implementation)

- Support IT/Digital Transformation in defining data requirements, integration points, and reporting needs.

- Map existing manual reports to future automated dashboards.

- Identify data gaps, inconsistencies, and recommend data quality rules.

- Participate in testing and validation of migrated datasets and dashboards.
Future (PostñData Lake)

- Leverage centralized data to deliver predictive and prescriptive analytics.

- Enable AI/ML use cases (e.g., IoT smart meters, energy savings forecasting, operational optimization).

- Create scalable, automated dashboards for business self-service reporting.

- Partner with business stakeholders to translate strategic questions into data-driven insights.
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

- Deliver recurring standard reports within agreed timelines (e.g., weekly, monthly).

- Respond to ad-hoc data requests within 2ñ3 business days, depending on complexity.

- Ensure accuracy levels of at least 95% in reports and dashboards delivered.

- Support incident resolution related to reporting/data accuracy within 1 business day.

- Participate in governance meetings and provide updates as per the DT/IT governance cadence.

job_title: Graduate Engineer - ESP Calculations & Machine Learning
job_description:
About Nybl

We are developing an Ai ecosystem that enables businesses, in any industry, to be able to deploy artificially intelligent solutions using both our platform and applications. Our technology allows anyone to build Ai solutions without writing a line of code or needing a degree in Data Science. Our ecosystem is world changing from healthcare to agriculture, education to industry, the applications of our technology are truly limitless.

What You'll Do

We're on the hunt for an enthusiastic Junior Engineer to help with engineering calculations and machine learning algorithms for Electrical Submersible Pumps (ESPs). This position is perfect for someone who has a solid technical foundation in petroleum, electrical, or mechanical engineering, is keen on production optimization, and loves using data science and programming to tackle real-world issues in the energy field.

Responsibilities
ï Gather, organize, and examine ESP field data (production, electrical, and fluid characteristics).
ï Help in creating and verifying ESP performance calculations (head, power, efficiency, pumpability ranges).
ï Apply correlations for fluid characteristics and IPR/VLP models.
ï Assist in designing and testing machine learning models for optimizing ESP and predicting failures.
ï Create and update Python/Excel/MATLAB scripts for engineering and ML processes.
ï Record algorithms, generate reports, and present results for engineering and management teams.
ï Work with senior engineers to incorporate solutions into production monitoring systems.

Qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree in Petroleum Engineering.
ï Fundamental understanding of ESP operation and production systems (academic experience or internships are acceptable).
ï Proficiency in Python (preferred), MATLAB, or VBA for engineering tasks.
ï Knowledge of data analysis, regression, and basic machine learning methods.
ï Analytical approach with a focus on detail and a willingness to learn.

job_title: Senior/Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Bidding (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
job_description:
About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youíre ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Get to Know Our Team

The Engineering department oversees all Agodaís ML and software related requirements. Our goal is to enable and increase Agodaís business through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, ML driven solutions, queue systems and data monitoring tools. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our companyís culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the engineering team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the ML engineering squad, but also the reward. We work across structured and non-structured data at scale. For example, our current ML models process millions of images every day to try and enhance the experience that our users get from our app.

Why Agoda Engineering Team (ML role)?

Our engineering teams are at the intersection of business analytics, ml engineering, data warehousing and software engineering. Our job involves dealing with distributed systems, stream processing, ml modeling and computation at tens of PB Scale. We focus on software engineering related to data replication, storage, centralized computation, and Data APIís. By providing our users with ML products/tools, shared frameworks, and ML services, we enable our company to validate strategic decisions, make smarter choices, and react to the fast-changing world. We are a small but passionate team with people from different nationalities working together on a single goal.

In this Role, you will get to:

Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing ML systems and processes. Build, administer and scale ML processing pipelines. Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Python3, Scala Spark, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc. Should be able to understand internals of ML models such as Light GBM, Random Forest, CNN, Regression models, etc Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality. Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks. We believe in end-to-end ownership; this role will involve taking and building systems that enable us to deliver ML models to production at a scale.

What Youíll need to Succeed:

Bachelorís degree in computer science /information systems/engineering/related field 6+ years of experience in software engineering with a minimum of 4+ years in MLExpert in SQL, Python3, and JVM based programming language ñ ie, Java or Scala Expert in software design/design patterns, functional programming and object-oriented programming. Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience. A strong engineering driven mindset will be required to succeed in this role.

Itís great if you have:

Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems and Big Data architecture and techologies Experience working with Open-source products Experience with Scala development Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies Systems administration skills in Linux

Benefits

Hybrid Working Model WFH Set Up Allowance30 Days of Remote Working from anywhere globally every year Employee discount for accommodation globally Global team of 90+ nationalities40+ offices and 25+ countries Annual CSR / Volunteer Time off Benevity Subscription for employee donations Volunteering opportunities globally Free Headspace subscription Free Odilo & Udemy subscriptions Access to Employee Assistance Program (third party for personal and workplace support) Enhanced Parental Leave Life, TPD & Accident Insurance

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a personís merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.

Disclaimer

We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agencyís representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

ï Optimize and scale ML models for production.

Relevant Experience:

ï At least 5 years of hands-on experience as machine learning engineer or similar role.
ï Familiarity with Python, Java, C++, and R.

Skills Expected:

ï Software Engineering Principles (version control, testing, DevOps).
ï Cloud Computing Platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) (often a plus).
ï Extensive math and computer skills, with a deep understanding of probability, statistics, and algorithms.
ï In-depth knowledge of machine learning frameworks, like Keras or PyTorch.
ï Familiarity with data structures, data modeling, and software architecture.
ï Excellent time management and organizational skills.
