ï Collaborative and innovative work environment

As a pioneer remote-first tech company with a product that inspires people globally, we attract a huge number of applicants to our organisation.

We have created a hiring process that is totally unique empowering our business based Hiring Leadership team to lead talent selection.

Our Talent Science team ensures that our processes are effective and that the business is able to make the best decisions to select exceptional talent.
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a team that is changing the way an organisation hires.

Our Talent Science team has a mission to ensure that we follow objective, scientifically rigorous and efficient processes to select the very best new colleagues regardless of location, culture or background.

We work closely with our key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are being made in the right way and that our hiring model supports the selection of world class talent, regardless of location, culture or background.

As a Talent Scientist, you will work closely with these Hiring Leads to drive initiatives, automation and best practice whilst offering an expert viewpoint on talent assessments.

This is not a recruiter position; it's about the science of talent and performance, raising awareness and insights across the business so that they are able to select the best talent available from our global talent pool.
We have a number of mid-senior level openings in our team seeking the following:

Passion and drive to embed scientific approaches that deliver impact on how an organisation selects talent.
Strong behavioural interviewing techniques (competency based and psychometric assessments).
Excellent analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns using SQL, statistical analysis or Python, BI tooling, etc.
An exceptional academic background including a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology based subject.
A high level of personal organisation to work remotely and be effective.

Location:
This is a remote position based in the EMEA region

What your day will look like

As a Talent Scientist you will:

Drive talent analytics to provide our business with real-time insight, partnering with the business to help them move through their hiring processes efficiently.
Conduct in-depth behavioural talent interviews providing considerable insights into motivations and behaviours.

Build key relationships with global stakeholders to ensure we deliver against our hiring agenda, closely monitoring hiring activities, driving results and ensuring that there is consistency in our operational processes.
Drive data driven insights, making sure our decision making process is robust and supportive to inform our decisions.
Consider our employer brand and how our interactions with a candidate impacts their experience.
Review and streamline hiring processes and tools to drive continuous improvement.
Work with external third parties and platforms to ensure we maximise our return on investment.

Bring a passion for diversity and inclusion, ensuring we remove unconscious bias from our hiring process and ensuring our sourcing strategy underpins this.
What we are looking for in you

An exceptional academic background from high school and university, with a Bachelors or Masters degree in a Psychology based subject.
Experience of hiring talent in the technology or consulting industry.
A highly data drive mindset with the ability to create measurable outcomes.

Passionate about how an organisation selects talent using scientific approaches with viewpoint on how to predict and measure hiring outcomes.
Strong analytical problem solving ability to identify trends and patterns using SQL, with Python and/or advanced statistical analysis preferable.
Exposure/appreciation of psychometric assessments, including interpretation.

Experience of conducting behavioural, competency based interviews with the ability to train stakeholders and advise on how to get the best out of an interview.
A high level of personal organisation and self drive to work remotely and be effective.
Willingness to travel to company events 2-4 times a year, for up to two weeks each.

Other Skills You May Bring

Experience in sourcing and headhunting with the ability to teach our senior leadership team how to hunt for industry leaders.
Experience in statistical significance testing and experience in Bayesian inference and/or predictive analytics and ML.

Exposure to the following tools:
LinkedIn Talent Insights, Greenhouse, DISC profiling, Superset.
Psychometric validity and reliability metrics.

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source.

As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis.
We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004.

Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Show more Show less

job_description:
## Full Description

Position: Chief Technology Officer (CTO) - AI, LLM & Automation

Ultimate Peaks is seeking a visionary Chief Technology Officer (CTO) for a pioneering AI-driven technology company specializing in Large Language Models (LLM) and automation solutions. The CTO will play a pivotal role in shaping the company's technical vision, scaling AI-powered products, and leading cutting-edge innovation in automation and enterprise AI solutions.

The ideal candidate is a proven technology leader with deep expertise in AI, machine learning, and automation, capable of driving R&D, product innovation, and scalable architecture.

Key Responsibilities

AI & Technology Strategy

ï Define and execute the company's AI and automation roadmap, ensuring alignment with business objectives.

ï Lead the development and optimization of Large Language Models (LLMs), NLP systems, and AI-driven automation tools.

ï Stay ahead of emerging AI trends, integrating the latest advancements in deep learning, reinforcement learning, and cloud AI technologies.

Product Development & Engineering Leadership

ï Oversee the end-to-end development lifecycle of AI-powered products and automation solutions.

ï Ensure scalability, security, and efficiency in AI model deployment and enterprise integrations.

ï Establish best practices for MLOps, Dev Ops, and AI model training at scale.

Team Leadership & Growth

ï Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing AI and engineering team.

ï Foster a culture of experimentation, innovation, and technical excellence.

ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI adoption across business applications.

Strategic Partnerships & Thought Leadership

ï Engage with industry leaders, AI researchers, and technology partners to position the company as a leader in AI automation.

ï Represent the company at tech conferences, AI summits, and global innovation forums.

ï Secure and manage relationships with cloud providers, AI research labs, and government AI initiatives.

Qualifications & Experience

ï 15+ years of experience in software engineering, AI, and automation, with at least 5 years in a CTO or senior leadership role.

ï Deep expertise in machine learning, LLMs (GPT, BERT, etc.), NLP, and AI-driven automation.

ï Strong background in scalable architecture, cloud AI platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and enterprise AI deployment.

ï Proven track record of leading AI-driven product development and innovation.

ï Experience in building and scaling AI engineering teams.

ï Strong stakeholder management skills with experience in AI commercialization and enterprise adoption.

Requirements

ï 10+ years of technology leadership experience in AI, machine learning, and automation.

ï Proven experience in designing and executing tech strategies for fast-paced, innovative environments.

ï Strong understanding of software engineering, cloud infrastructure, and data analytics.

ï Familiarity with current and emerging trends in AI and LLM technologies.

ï Exceptional leadership, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.

ï Strong track record of delivering successful technology solutions and driving change within organizations.

Benefits

Lead AI innovation in one of Saudi Arabia's fastest-growing high-tech companies.

ï Shape the future of LLM and automation technologies at scale.

ï Work with top-tier AI engineers and industry experts.

ï Competitive compensation, equity options, and leadership impact in a cutting-edge field.

Seniority level

Executive

Employment type

Full-time

Job function

Information Technology

Industries

IT Services and IT Consulting

job_description:
Job Overview:

Master Works is looking for a highly skilled LLM Engineer to join our AI Core Delivery team within the AI & Analytics CoE. In this role, you will develop, deploy, and optimize advanced language model capabilities, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and agentic AI systems. You will play a key role in scaling AI Core as the central enterprise AI platform by ensuring production-ready performance, robust observability, and seamless integration of LLMs with internal and external systems.

Key Responsibilities
ï Model Development & Optimization
ï Build and optimize RAG pipelines for efficient document processing, indexing, and retrieval.
ï Implement agentic AI logic for tool integration, task automation, and external data access.
ï Enhance query understanding, response ranking, and AI-generated output quality.
ï Develop evaluation benchmarks to measure LLM performance, accuracy, and relevance.
ï LLMOps & Deployment
ï Collaborate with API developers and backend engineers to deliver secure, observable LLM endpoints.
ï Deploy and manage LLMs in cloud-native or hybrid environments with support for scalability and multi-cloud readiness.
ï Implement CI/CD workflows for model updates, rollback mechanisms, and performance tuning.
ï Backend & Data Integration
ï Integrate LLM capabilities with enterprise data sources and knowledge bases.
ï Support multi-source retrieval and embedding strategies to improve AI responses.
ï Design pipelines that ensure low latency, high throughput, and fault tolerance.
ï Security & Compliance
ï Apply enterprise-grade authentication, access management, and encryption standards.
ï Ensure compliance with internal governance policies, data privacy, and audit requirements.
ï Continuous Improvement
ï Monitor system performance, debug issues, and fine-tune models based on real-world feedback.
ï Stay updated on advancements in LLM architectures, open-source tools, and evaluation frameworks.

Requirements
ï Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or related field.
ï Hands-on experience with LLM development and deployment (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, LLaMA, etc.).
ï Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), embeddings, and vector databases.
ï Experience with cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and infrastructure-as-code (IaC).
ï Proficiency with Python or similar languages for AI/ML pipeline development.
ï Familiarity with container orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD practices.
ï Knowledge of observability tools for monitoring AI performance in production environments.

Preferred Skills
ï Experience integrating agentic AI capabilities with external APIs and automation tools.
ï Strong grasp of prompt engineering, contextual memory systems, and LLM evaluation.
ï Exposure to enterprise AI security and compliance standards.

(React, Node.js, TypeScript, AI-Assisted Engineering)
Location

Riyadh, Saudi Arabia (Onsite)
Experience

Minimum 7 years of professional software development experience (mandatory)
Role Overview

We are seeking a Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer with a minimum of 7 years of hands-on industry experience to design, build, and scale modern web platforms using React, Next.js, TypeScript, and Node.js. This role requires strong technical ownership, architectural judgment, and the ability to deliver high-quality solutions in AI-assisted development environments.

As a senior engineer, you will contribute to system design, influence engineering standards, mentor junior developers, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable, scalable software in an onsite, collaborative engineering environment.
Key Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain end-to-end web applications using modern full-stack technologies
ï Lead the implementation of scalable frontend architectures using React.js and Next.js
ï Design and build backend services and APIs using Node.js (Express.js / NestJS)
ï Make informed architectural decisions around data models, APIs, state management, and system boundaries
ï Work effectively within monorepo architectures and shared platform codebases
ï Ensure data correctness and type safety through schema validation using Zod or Yup
ï Implement and maintain efficient state management and data-fetching strategies
ï Review code for quality, performance, security, and maintainability
ï Mentor junior and mid-level engineers through code reviews, technical guidance, and best practices
ï Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and production deployments using Docker and Kubernetes
ï Collaborate closely with product, design, QA, and DevOps teams in an onsite setting
ï Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies, estimation, and technical planning
ï Drive adoption of engineering best practices, testing strategies, and coding standards
AI-Assisted Development Responsibilities
ï Actively leverage AI-assisted development tools (e.g., Cursor, Claude Code, or equivalent) to accelerate delivery
ï Work with MCP servers (e.g., GitHub, Figma, Jira, Postman) to enhance context-aware development
ï Validate, refine, and productionize AI-generated code while maintaining engineering rigor
ï Ensure AI-assisted output aligns with architectural, security, and performance standards
Required Technical QualificationsFrontend
ï Strong expertise in React.js and Next.js
ï Advanced proficiency in TypeScript
ï Experience using Vite
ï Strong understanding of React Hook Form, Context API, Redux Toolkit, and TanStack Query
Backend
ï Strong experience with Node.js
ï Hands-on experience with Express.js and/or NestJS
ï Experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs
ï Strong experience with MongoDB and PostgreSQL
Architecture and Tooling
ï Schema validation using Zod or Yup
ï Experience working in monorepo environments
ï Strong understanding of microservices-based architectures
ï Consistent track record of writing clean, testable, and maintainable code
DevOps and Cloud
ï Experience with CI/CD pipelines
ï Containerization using Docker
ï Orchestration using Kubernetes
ï Experience working within the AWS ecosystem
Professional Skills
ï Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking
ï Excellent written and verbal communication skills
ï Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in an onsite environment
ï High level of ownership, accountability, and attention to detail
ï Ability to operate effectively in fast-paced, evolving environments
Preferred Qualifications
ï Experience with DynamoDB
ï Experience with testing frameworks (Jest, Vitest, Cypress, Playwright)
ï Experience working on large-scale or enterprise-grade systems
What We Offer
ï Opportunity to work onsite on high-impact, production-scale platforms
ï Strong engineering culture focused on quality, collaboration, and continuous improvement
ï Exposure to modern AI-assisted development workflows
ï Competitive compensation and benefits
ï Continuous learning and professional development opportunities

Rapiscan Systems is an industry leader in detection technology, providing cargo and vehicle inspection systems and services for ports, borders, military, high-threat facilities, and checkpoints to help customers combat terrorism, drug smuggling, illegal immigration, and trade fraud. We offer a broad array of scanning system configurations that leverage low-, medium-, and high-energy X-ray technologyóor multiple X-ray technologiesóto address each customerís unique security application requirements.
Role Overview As a Software & I. T Support Engineer you will reside in the KSA, based in Rapiscanís Riyadh offices. Rapiscan have a growing fleet of X-ray systems deployed throughout the Kingdom. The systems have complex software and IT systems that require expert troubleshooting, diagnostics, maintenance and patching. Working with UK and US teams you will work to diagnose and remediate I. T and software Issues, configure software & I. T. systems to integrate with customer networks solutions. The primary function of this position is to act as the main point of contact for all Cargo service Software and IT related queries within the Kingdom. The scope of this position includes hardware, network, software configuration, and documentation, , in support of the ongoing health and maintenance of all systems om country. The candidate will work alongside the Cargo service teams, Cargo Engineering Software Team, Cargo product support engineers and Cyber Security.
Role Responsibilities IT Systems Support:Troubleshoot and resolve IT and hardware issues. Support network connectivity in collaboration with customer IT teams. Provide 2nd/3rd line support for IT systems. Software Systems Support:Diagnose software issues, collect logs, and perform initial triage. Coordinate with software engineering teams to identify root causes. Install and validate new software releases. Capture and escalate customer feedback. Provide 2nd/3rd line support for software systems. Patch Management & System Upgrades:Validate and install patches across deployed systems. Support field service teams with patching and upgrades. Assist with configuration and deployment of system upgrades. General Responsibilities:Report status and updates to leadership as required. Uphold company values: Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, Teamwork. Follow Rapiscanís Code of Ethics. Report quality issues to management for corrective action.
Candidate Requirements5+ years of IT and software support experience. Strong experience with Windows OS (server & workstation) and Active Directory. Experience configuring and troubleshooting Active Directory. Knowledge of virtualization platforms (Hyper?V, VMware preferred). Strong networking knowledge: VLAN, VPN, Firewalls. Software troubleshooting and diagnostics at 2nd/3rd line. Experience working across global teams/time zones. Ability to live and work in KSA. Willingness to travel domestically; some international travel possible.

job_description:
Position Summary

The Data & Software Engineer is responsible not only for building scalable data pipelines and backend services but also for shaping the architectural direction of integrations, data flows, and internal applications. The role combines strong hands-on engineering with architectural leadership across data models, APIs, cloud components, and enterprise integration patterns. This engineer will meaningfully influence the design of new systems, modernization of legacy components, and the technical standards used across the technical team.

Major Responsibilities

Data Engineering & Integration
ï Design and implement robust, scalable ETL/ELT pipelines (Snowflake, DBT, Spark, Airflow).
ï Define data models, schemas, and mapping specifications for structured/unstructured datasets.
ï Architect and build integration solutions using REST/SOAP APIs, queues, or cloud- native services.
ï Establish best practices for data quality, lineage, monitoring, and observability.

Backend Software Engineering
ï Build backend services, automation tools, and microservices in Python, Java, C# or any other backend language.
ï Apply software design principles (SOLID, KISS).
ï Maintain and evolve existing services through CI/CD, testing, and refactoring for scalability.
ï Implement secure coding practices, API authentication, and integration security standards.

Architecture & Technical Strategy
ï Lead the design of system architectures for integrations and internal applications.
ï Produce architecture diagrams, data-flow maps, and interface specifications.
ï Evaluate and recommend tools, integration patterns, and cloud technologies.
ï Ensure alignment with organization-wide architectural standards.
ï Provide guidance on distributed systems, data modelling, storage patterns, and message flows.
ï Mentor engineers on design patterns, code structure, and architectural thinking.

Personal Requirements

Competencies
ï Architectural thinking: designs scalable, decoupled, maintainable systems.
ï Strong analytical skills and problem-solving under complexity.
ï Clear communication of technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.
ï Ownership mindset with strong attention to code quality and reliability.
ï Ability to mentor others and elevate engineering standards.

Qualifications & Experience
ï Bachelorís or Masterís in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
ï 7ñ10+ years of combined experience in software and/or data engineering.
ï Proficiency in Python, Java, and C#, with experience building APIs, backend services, and data pipelines.
ï Strong SQL skills and familiarity with modern CI/CD and Git-based workflows.
ï Ability to work with business stakeholders to translate requirements into technical solutions.
ï Strong communication skills and experience collaborating across teams.
ï Exposure to cloud technologies (AWS/Azure) and common integration patterns.
ï Experience with Higher-Ed systems (SIS, LMS) or CRM platforms is a big plus.
ï Familiarity with integration middleware or data governance is beneficial.

job_description:
Job Description

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.Canonical is looking for exceptional security-focused software engineers to be integrated across product teams. While they also contribute to the product as engineers, their primary focus is to challenge the entire team to think more deeply about security through state-of-the-art practices such as threat modeling, table-top exercises, architecture and design reviews, static analysis tools, and fuzzing, among others.These roles encompass all aspects of product security, including feature development, vulnerability response, proactive security, and open source community participation. Engineers in these roles collaborate closely with other Canonical teams, customers, and partners across the open source ecosystem.Each product engineering team at Canonical reserves one or two openings for security-oriented software engineers. We also develop a number of products driven entirely by security needs, such as our AppArmor kernel investments and the Ubuntu Security Guide (USG). As the publisher of Ubuntu, we also handle long-term security response for the entire operating system and open source ecosystem. Working with tens of thousands of upstreams means that we need to be fluent in every major programming language and design, build, and adopt sophisticated tools that enable us to work at scale and speed with confidence.Apply here if you are an exceptional security-focused software engineer, passionate about open source, and excited by Canonical's products and mission.This role requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through strong self-discipline and motivation. Rapiscan Systems is an industry leader in detection technology, providing cargo and vehicle inspection systems and services for ports, borders, military, high-threat facilities, and checkpoints to help customers combat terrorism, drug smuggling, illegal immigration, and trade fraud. We offer a broad array of scanning system configurations that leverage low-, medium-, and high-energy X-ray technologyóor multiple X-ray technologiesóto address each customerís unique security application requirements.

Role Overview

As a Software & I.T Support Engineer you will reside in the KSA, based in Rapiscanís Riyadh offices. Rapiscan have a growing fleet of X-ray systems deployed throughout the Kingdom. The systems have complex software and IT systems that require expert troubleshooting, diagnostics, maintenance and patching.

Working with UK and US teams you will work to diagnose and remediate I.T and software Issues, configure software & I.T. systems to integrate with customer networks solutions.

The primary function of this position is to act as the main point of contact for all Cargo service Software and IT related queries within the Kingdom.

The scope of this position includes hardware, network, software configuration, and documentation, , in support of the ongoing health and maintenance of all systems om country. The candidate will work alongside the Cargo service teams, Cargo Engineering Software Team, Cargo product support engineers and Cyber Security.

Role Responsibilities
ï IT Systems Support:
ï Troubleshoot and resolve IT and hardware issues.
ï Support network connectivity in collaboration with customer IT teams.
ï Provide 2nd/3rd line support for IT systems.
ï Software Systems Support:
ï Diagnose software issues, collect logs, and perform initial triage.
ï Coordinate with software engineering teams to identify root causes.
ï Install and validate new software releases.
ï Capture and escalate customer feedback.
ï Provide 2nd/3rd line support for software systems.
ï Patch Management & System Upgrades:
ï Validate and install patches across deployed systems.
ï Support field service teams with patching and upgrades.
ï Assist with configuration and deployment of system upgrades.
ï General Responsibilities:
ï Report status and updates to leadership as required.
ï Uphold company values: Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, Teamwork.
ï Follow Rapiscanís Code of Ethics.
ï Report quality issues to management for corrective action.

Candidate Requirements
ï 5+ years of IT and software support experience.
ï Strong experience with Windows OS (server & workstation) and Active Directory.
ï Experience configuring and troubleshooting Active Directory.
ï Knowledge of virtualization platforms (Hyper?V, VMware preferred).
ï Strong networking knowledge: VLAN, VPN, Firewalls.
ï Software troubleshooting and diagnostics at 2nd/3rd line.
ï Experience working across global teams/time zones.
ï Ability to live and work in KSA.
ï Willingness to travel domestically; some international travel possible.

job_description:
About Noon

Noon's mission is to radically change the way people learn, with a primary focus on the Middle East, where the company has its roots and where the need and urgency to improve education are highest.

We have taught over 12 million+ students successfully with our remote learning products. Our next big challenge is to build a network of schools, supported by top teachers and driven by technology and innovation, to positively impact even more lives.

Now weíre building the future of school at Noon Academy, and weíre aiming for an IPO, Join us to help us take to take Noon Academy to IPO.

Learn About us here: https://www.noon.edu.sa/
ï 10+ Years of Impact: Started with a simple ideaóaccess to the best teachers shouldnít be a luxury, and learning should energize, not drain you.
ï Market Leaders: 14 million students (and counting) use Noon across the Middle East, Egypt, and Pakistan to ace high-stakes exams like Qudurat & Tahsili.
ï Now: Weíre laser-focused on reinventing schools in Saudi Arabia. Weíre accelerating rapidly, well-funded, and profitable.
ï Office: Full-time, Riyadh-based. Weíve got a sweet office near the Boulevard, and weíd love to have you in it.

Why work at Noon?
ï The opportunity to have a real impact on millions of students.
ï A strong leadership and engineering team to learn from.
ï A solid runway: we recently closed our Series B and have substantial recurring revenue.

About the role

This is a mid/ senior backend eng Riyadh-based role. We are developing a product used by thousands of students every day. As a Software Engineer-Backend, you will be at the heart of the student journey, delivering innovation daily. Join our distributed, high-performing team.

Responsibilities:
ï Take full ownership of code, from design to delivery and observability.
ï Promote best practices, always striving for incremental improvements.
ï Participate in the teamís on-call rotation.
ï Reduce complexity and toil by identifying bottlenecks and improving system efficiency.
ï Be a team player.

Requirements:
ï Proficient in Java, Spring Boot or equivalent.
ï Experience with infrastructure and distributed systems.
ï Experience with containerisation and orchestration technologies (Kubernetes).

The interview process

Live coding interview -> System Design -> Behavioural interview.

About the Benefits

In addition to a competitive base salary, we offer
ï 21 days annual leave
ï Full premium Medical coverage including Family Dependent
ï Income Protection and Life Assurance to help you to protect your future

Why work at Noon?
ï Solving the Biggest Problem in Education: Weíre addressing the most important and challenging issue in the sectoróscaling star teachers and making learning fun.
ï Innovation at a Global Scale: Noon leads in edtech innovation; we are not a copycat. We pioneer new ways to deliver world-class education.
ï Solid Financial Footing: We have turned profitable and weíre well-funded.
ï International Exposure: Join a dynamic, internationally diverse team that encourages personal development.
ï Mission & Values Driven: We aim to provide equitable access to world-class education.

job_description:
Senior Software Engineer

Department: Engineering

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Riyadh

Description

Join us at Malaa, where we address challenges of national importance and drive transformative changes that impact millions of lives. Our mission is to harness cutting-edge technology to solve complex financial challenges, often establishing the foundation for advanced financial services and innovations. By developing systems from the ground up at an unprecedented scale, we're not just coding; we're revolutionizing the financial landscape. Through our work, we aim to enhance financial inclusion, stability, and efficiency, contributing to the economic growth and prosperity of communities nationwide.

Key Responsibilities

As a software engineer, your scope contains multiple complex solutions that impact at the domain level.
ï The main owner of multiple solutions that your team is developing.
ï You contribute completely autonomously and help others to perform at high standards.
ï You are an example of the ìconstant learnerî mentality and you know how to adopt new technologies and provide this knowledge to your domain to have a significant impact in the places where you observe non-optimal solutions.
ï You own architectural decisions, not only on the features that you are developing but also on how these features are impacting and interacting with other software components owned by your domain.
ï You fully understand the overall architecture of your tribe and understand the big picture of the full lifecycle of business workflow.
ï Your influence is not limited to your own work, but you are also responsible for the development of other members of the team and/or domain.
ï Participate in a DevOps / agile team ñ full lifecycle and full-stack ñ including design, development, testing, planning, backlog grooming, and support.
ï Design and Develop REST APIís for internal and external consumption.
ï You improve the developer experience within your domain.

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise
ï Minimum of +4 years of relevant experience, with at least 2 years at a comparable level.
ï 2+ years of experience in a high-traffic tech startup environment.
ï Solid experience in developing web services and APIs
ï Hands-on experience writing high-quality, testable code, with a strong understanding of software architectures.
ï Solid experience with working with SQL databaseís and itís fundamentals
ï Good understanding of event driven architecture and messaging services (Kafka, RMQ, etc..)
ï Understanding of CI/CD pipeline.
ï Proficient with versioning tools, preferably Git.
ï Knowledge of Agile Software Development Methodologies.
ï Proficient in solving horizontal strategic challenges.
ï Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire teams of multiple engineers, driving high-impact outcomes.
ï Expertise in prioritizing and executing strategic initiatives effectively.
ï Strong communication skills, adept at bridging the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
ï Ability to lead chapter meetings, prioritize strategic initiatives, and drive them to execution.

Benefits
ï Modern technology stack with exciting business challenges at a large scale
ï Top tier team with various backgrounds and experiences
ï Meaningful equity and perks

Youíll have the space to learn, grow, and take ownership of your work. We invest in your development, from training or workshops to free language lessons, and we encourage you to take on projects which both interest and challenge you.

Main Responsibilities:
ï Provide expert-level technical support for Automation and OSI PI software, including troubleshooting, problem analysis, and resolution.
ï Assist customers in optimizing the performance and functionality of OSI PI solutions within their automation environments.
ï Lead and mentor junior support engineers, providing guidance on complex technical issues and best practices.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to escalate and resolve critical issues, ensuring timely resolution.
ï Develop and deliver technical training to customers and internal teams on OSI PI software and automation systems.
ï Create and maintain technical documentation, including knowledge base articles, technical guides, and troubleshooting procedures.
ï Monitor and manage support cases to ensure SLAs are met and customer satisfaction is achieved.
ï Participate in the testing and validation of software updates, patches, and configurations.
ï Provide feedback to product development teams on recurring issues and feature Requests

Qualifications:
ï B.S. Computer Engineering, or any related field.
ï 4+ years of experience as a Technical Engineer or equivalent.
ï Proficiency in OSI PI, AVEVA System platform, InTouch, Historian, and database applications.
ï Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, and scripting is beneficial.
ï Must have worked in a large-scale System Platform implementation.
ï Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills
ï Ability to manage multiple projects and clients effectively.

If you want to make a mark, contribute to groundbreaking projects, and be a part of a team that's shaping the future, we want to hear from you. Send your CV to career@aitsmena.com

Join us, and let's co-create the future!

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are hiring a Software Engineer for our OpenStack Engineering team. This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and OpenStack. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

As a software engineer on the OpenStack Engineering team, you'll be building Charmed OpenStack and Ceph, a suite of open source Python based charms for deploying and managing OpenStack and Ceph. Your work will bring cloud platform technologies to a wide range of users and computing environments, from desktops to bare metal servers. This role requires a python software developer with a passion for automating infrastructure as code.

Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.

This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time.

What you'll do
ï Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
ï Write high quality code to create new features
ï Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
ï Review code produced by other engineers
ï Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
ï Ensure the success of OpenStack and Ceph on multiple architectures Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events

Who you are
ï You love technology and working with brilliant people
ï You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
ï You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
ï You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
ï You have experience with Python
ï You have interest and experience with two or more of the following:Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, AI/ML, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, scalable web services
ï You have experience with non-x86 architectures, including s390, arm64, power and others You have experience with OpenStack, OVN, Openvswitch and other related cloud technologies

What Canonical Offers
ï Learning and Development
ï Annual Compensation Review
ï Recognition Rewards
ï Annual Leave
ï Priority Pass for travel Flexible working option

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Master-Works is on the lookout for a skilled Back-End Software Engineer to enhance our development team.
As a Back-End Software Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the server-side logic, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end.
Working closely with other team members, you will implement robust business logic and web services and optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Key Responsibilities: Develop, test, and maintain high-performance backend applications using Node.
js and TypeScript.
Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate APIs and services with ReactJS applications.
Design and implement scalable backend architectures and RESTful APIs.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices.
Optimize applications for maximum performance and scalability.
Participate in code reviews and mentor junior developers.
Work with databases and manage data storage, ensuring secure and efficient data access.
Troubleshoot and debug issues to improve system performance.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in backend development and technologies.
Required Skills: Strong experience with Node.
js and TypeScript.
Proficiency in backend development with a focus on building RESTful APIs.
Solid understanding of ReactJS for frontend-backend integration.
Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL).
Strong knowledge of Git and version control best practices.
Familiarity with testing frameworks and practices (Jest, Mocha, etc.
). Ability to write scalable and secure code.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
Experience in working with cloud platforms and deployment (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.
). Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Preferred Skills: Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience in microservices architecture.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.
Understanding of Agile methodologies.
Education & Experience: Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
5+ years of experience in backend development.

Your Growth Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleaguesóat all levelsówill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you wonít find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:
ï Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
ï A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. Youíll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions, all while upholding our unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
ï Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firmís diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, youíll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
ï World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

Your ImpactAs a Senior Software Engineer with McKinsey Digital, you will work with clients across a wide range of sectors and industries, advising them on how to best leverage technology.

You will drive architectural design, make key technology decisions, and employ agile methodologies to build and deliver the next generation of products for our clients at scale.

You will also lead project workstreams, helping clients build their technical capabilities and foster a culture centered around engineering best practices, user-centricity, and Agile values.

As a core member of the team, you will take on responsibilities that include driving architectural design and making strategic technology decisions to shape next-generation products for various internal teams, ensuring that we remain at the forefront of technological innovation.

Additionally, you will be hands-on and co-creating solutions alongside our clients and their leadership, enabling you to grow into a recognized technology leader.

You will be part of the McKinsey Digital team in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This group brings together the best of McKinseyís digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.

McKinsey Digital is our tech delivery people unit. A global team of software, data and cloud engineers, passionate designers, technology architects, product owners, and leading technologists.

You will join a multidisciplinary community of developers, Agile coaches, designers, business strategists and experts. Together, we will design and create industry shaping products and tools for our clients.

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: JavaScript, TypeScript, React.js, Angular.js, Next.js, Vue.js, Python, Java, C#, NodeJS, SQL, MongoDB, AWS, Azure, GCP, and more!

Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. You will have the freedom to try new ideas and experiment in your role and will be guaranteed significant dedicated time to tinker, create, continuously learn and share cool new stuff. We also have a strong emphasis in our teams on mentoring others enabling them to grow and learn.

Changing the world requires us to sit with our clients at times, so some travel is expected in this role.

Your qualifications and skills
ï Undergraduate or masterís degree; or equivalent experience
ï 7+ years of experience in software development, with significant full-stack web application development experience strongly preferred
ï Demonstrated knowledge and hands-on experience across the full application stack with some of the following languages/frameworks: JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Angular, Vue, jQuery, Java, Sprint, C#, .NET, Node.js, SQL, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, cloud-native databases, AWS, Azure, GCP, Jenkins, Docker, Circle CI, Travis
ï Experience leading in Agile teams, including coaching and modeling Agile mindsets as part of sprint ceremonies, work definition and building developer capabilities
ï Experience working collaboratively with technical and non-technical team members and stakeholders including modeling and coaching others to use engineering best practices such as design patterns, customer-centric design, test-driven development, code refactoring, code review, and OWASP Top 10 security awareness

The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

Canonical is looking for exceptional security-focused software engineers to be integrated across product teams. While they also contribute to the product as engineers, their primary focus is to challenge the entire team to think more deeply about security through state-of-the-art practices such as threat modeling, table-top exercises, architecture and design reviews, static analysis tools, and fuzzing, among others.

These roles encompass all aspects of product security, including feature development, vulnerability response, proactive security, and open source community participation. Engineers in these roles collaborate closely with other Canonical teams, customers, and partners across the open source ecosystem.

Each product engineering team at Canonical reserves one or two openings for security-oriented software engineers. We also develop a number of products driven entirely by security needs, such as our AppArmor kernel investments and the Ubuntu Security Guide (USG). As the publisher of Ubuntu, we also handle long-term security response for the entire operating system and open source ecosystem. Working with tens of thousands of upstreams means that we need to be fluent in every major programming language and design, build, and adopt sophisticated tools that enable us to work at scale and speed with confidence.

Apply here if you are an exceptional security-focused software engineer, passionate about open source, and excited by Canonical's products and mission.

This role requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through strong self-discipline and motivation. It also involves mandatory international travel at least twice a year, typically for one week.

Location: Worldwide, this is a globally remote role

What you'll do

Security roles might tackle any of the following:
ï Define, implement, and document new security features
ï Lead security-focused initiatives within a product engineering team
ï Analyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in open source software
ï Contribute to Ubuntu and upstream open source projects to benefit the community
ï Audit and analyze source code for vulnerabilities
ï Integrate new tools into our security infrastructure, pipelines, and processes
ï Achieve and retain various security certifications
ï Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components to meet country-specific compliance requirements, such as FIPS and Common Criteria (CC) certifications
ï Work with external partners to develop Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmarks
ï Design and develop hardening automation for Ubuntu
ï Stay up to date with trends and developments in the security industry
ï Develop, test, and maintain new software capabilities
ï Provide guidance and support to other engineering teams on security best practices

What we are looking for in you
ï An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
ï Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
ï A track record of going above and beyond expectations
ï Thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and how to fix them
ï Knowledge of modern software engineering techniques
ï Familiarity with open source development tools and methodologies
ï Skill in one or more of C, C++, Python, Go, Rust, Java, Ruby, PHP, or JavaScript/Typescript
ï Experience as a security champion
ï Experience driving security within a wider SSDLC process
ï Professional written and spoken English
ï Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
ï Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
ï Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
ï Excellent communication and presentation skills
ï Results-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments

Optional skills we also value
ï Clear and effective communication with both the team and Ubuntu community members
ï Experience working with the Linux kernel
ï Experience with security certifications and knowledge of FIPS and/or Common Criteria (CC)
ï Experience with OVAL (Open Vulnerability Assessment Language)
ï Knowledge of cryptographic modules such as OpenSSL and Libgcrypt
ï Knowledge of low-level Linux cryptography APIs
ï Demonstrated ability to learn quickly
ï Performance engineering experience

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Employee Assistance Programme
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
ï Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_description:
About the opportunity

We are looking for a highly talented Software Engineer II - Backend to join our growing team in Riyadh. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on experience and create a direct impact, then this may be the place for you! The ideal candidate will collaborate with the Product Team in order to understand product requirements and provide technical expertise for all products as required, and to assist in analyzing, designing, testing, and structuring the required solutions to deliver a high-quality working software based on the business needs and standards.

You Will Be Working On

Software Development
ï Keep abreast of latest software development methodologies in order to be able to provide best-in-class software solutions
ï Analyze product requirements in order to understand engineering requirements, estimate efforts and provide the required solutions in collaboration with Product Team
ï Assist in building development components in order to transform the requirements into actual working software accurately
ï Document all coding steps in order to ensure comprehensibility and to facilitate future modifications and maintenance
ï Investigate and resolve issues and bugs
ï Collaborate with other colleagues in order to assist each other in code reviews and deliver code review reports accordingly
ï Perform functional and module testing in order to ensure functionality of delivered solutions
ï Assist in user trials and acceptance testing

Governance and Resilience
ï Follow all relevant policies, procedures, and processes in order for the daily work to be carried out in a controlled and consistent manner
ï Contribute to the identification of opportunities for continuous improvement of processes, practices, work processes, cost effectiveness, and productivity enhancement
ï Promote to other employees within the organization the implementation and adherence to policies, procedures, processes, and instructions

Daily Operations
ï Follow daily operations relating to the job to ensure work continuity
ï Contribute to preparing timely and accurate reports that concern the line of work to meet the requirements, objectives, and standards
ï Ensure the satisfaction of both internal and external customers by addressing their needs in a courteous and timely manner

What you need to be successful
ï 2- 4 years of experience in backend development using GoLang, Ruby on Rails (RoR), Java, or Python
ï Bachelor Degree in a relevant field is required
ï Masterís degree in a relevant field is preferred
ï Knowledge & understanding of software architecture, including Domain-Driven Design (DDD), microservices, Kubernetes, and containerization

Who we are

HungerStation is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the worldís pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experienceófast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.

What's in it for you
ï We offer relocation support globally to our permanent employees.
ï Exchange ideas and meet 2000+ colleagues from different teams within Delivery Hero in our active guilds and through our global tech and product community.
ï Develop your skills with your personal educational budget for conferences and external training.
ï Access our e-learning platform LinkedIn and participate in our various in-house training programs
ï And much moreÖ

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

The role

Our Workplace Engineering team are a highly performant group which specialises in web architecture and analytics specialists. Building new tools, dashboards and analytics that empower colleagues, managers and executives to make better decisions and deliver better work.

What you will do:
ï Design and deliver web-based systems and SAAS
ï Provide new insights into the Canonical workplace experience
ï Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
ï Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
ï Write high-quality code to create new features
ï Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
ï Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
ï Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
ï Estimate work, set goals and meet them
ï Write project specifications, and epics and understand the risks
ï Understand completion criteria and push work to completion
ï Coaching, mentoring and providing feedback to more junior members of the team, while always developing yourself
ï Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
ï Database design and architecture for connected systems
ï Developing new and improved working practices for the company
ï Providing tooling to support optimised processes Love what you do.

Who you are

To be successful in this team you must be an expert in two or more of the following:
ï Backend web service programming in Python and Node.JS
ï Solid understanding of web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
ï Data analytics and statistical analysis
ï Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning Data visualisation

The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow's tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the business and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of working at Canonical.

As a Senior Web Engineer at Canonical, you need an analytical, data-driven mind and a passion to connect and make sense of interesting data from APIs. We focus heavily on the collection of metrics, optimising processes, and ways of working across Canonical. You need to demonstrate leadership, excellence, and consistency and will mentor others in the team.

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Description

You will join a team of highly qualified team engineers to continue the innovation and development of our product which uses machine learning and big data technologies to analyze content from several data sources.

As a backend developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the backend systems of Lucidya's product. You will work with technologies such as Redis, Postgres, and Cassandra, and develop APIs using Python and Ruby on Rails.

You will work directly under the Engineering Manager in an agile yet demanding environment. We expect you to be a fast learner and quickly adapt to the technologies mentioned above.

Lucidya offers a result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment full of challenges. We are looking for talented candidates with strong programming skills.

Key tasks & responsibilities
ï Rapidly develop scalable, flexible, and high-performance backend systems.
ï Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software (backends and databases, in particular).
ï Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
ï Handle DevOps tasks.
ï Contribute to the growth of Lucidya through interviewing, onboarding, or other recruitment efforts.

Requirements
ï BA/BS or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent practical experience.
ï At least 3 years of experience in software development.
ï Strong knowledge of SQL and noSQL databases such as Redis, Postgres or Cassandra.
ï Fluency in Python or Ruby on Rails.
ï Knowledge of web servers and web application servers (e.g., Apache, Jetty, Tomcat, IIS).
ï Knowledge of code repositories like Git.
ï Ability to multitask and adapt to shifting priorities, demands, and tight timelines.
ï Database design skills.
ï Experience in building high-quality code.
ï Excellent organizational skills and proven analytical, planning, and problem-solving abilities.
ï Full-stack development with a background in ReactJS is a plus.

Summary: Enhance service quality and equipment reliability by applying Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) and TPM practices to optimize workflows and maintenance processes. This role bridges field operations with the maintenance department to minimize downtime, reduce failure rates, and boost overall equipment efficiency and productivity. It also focuses on planning, compliance, and data-driven improvements to sustain high availability and strong KPIs.

Summary: Weíre seeking a Senior React Native Developer to drive the modernization and scaling of our enterprise mobile apps, delivering high-performance features within a clean, scalable architecture. You will refactor legacy code, build reusable UI components aligned with design systems, and leverage AI tools to speed up development while maintaining quality. The role requires collaboration across backend, product, and design teams to deliver ERP mobile modules and ensure production readiness through testing and monitoring.

Summary: An opportunity for a Senior Angular Developer to shape the front-end of a large-scale, enterprise-grade ERP system and modernize legacy code with a focus on UI/UX excellence. In a monorepo, you will apply Tailwind CSS, Angular Material, and design systems to deliver modular, scalable features while leveraging AI tools to boost efficiency. Strong collaboration with cross-functional teams and proactive refactoring are expected to drive architectural improvements and high performance.

Summary: A senior backend engineer role in Jeddah involves designing scalable systems and APIs, ensuring best practices in coding, testing, and security. Expertise in system architecture, databases, Docker, and Python is required, with experience in performance optimization and observability tools. Strong problem-solving skills and collaboration across teams are essential for success.

Summary: Thales in Jeddah is seeking a Senior Solution Architect specializing in Physical Security Systems to design integrated security solutions for critical infrastructure and smart city projects. The role involves leading architecture development, integrating AI, IoT, and cloud services, and ensuring compliance with international standards. Candidates with 10-15 years of experience in security architecture, systems integration, and a strong strategic mindset will thrive in this dynamic environment. This position offers a chance to influence future security innovations in Saudi Arabia.

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the worldís most?innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they?provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are?the same.Your RoleWe are looking for an Embedded Software Engineer ñ AI-Powered Firmware for IoT Devices to join our team in Al Khobar, Saudi Arabia. You will be responsible for developing, installing, and maintaining AI-powered firmware for IoT devices, ensuring seamless integration and optimized performance. If you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment, this role is for you!Key ResponsibilitiesFirmware Development: Design, develop, and optimize AI-powered firmware for IoT devices.Integration & Testing: Integrate firmware with hardware and IoT platforms, conducting rigorous system testing.Real-Time Data Processing: Implement low-latency data processing and model compression techniques.Sensor & Actuator Integration: Ensure reliable, power-efficient sensor and actuator operation.AI Model Deployment: Develop and deploy AI models within embedded firmware for enhanced device intelligence.Your ProfileExperience: 5+ years in embedded software development, preferably in IoT.Technical Skills:Proficiency in C, C++, Python, and Rust.Strong knowledge of embedded systems, RTOS, and IoT communication protocols.Familiarity with IoT platforms (e.g., Azure IoT, AWS IoT).Soft Skills:Strong problem-solving, teamwork, and communication abilities.What Youíll Love About Working HereFlexible Work ArrangementsóWork remotely or adjust work hours for a balanced lifestyle.Career Growth OpportunitiesóAccess diverse roles and career development programs.Training & CertificationsóEquip yourself with valuable certifications in emerging technologies.Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

job_title: ServiceNow FSO Developer ñ SME / Lead
job_description:
The ServiceNow FSO Developer ñ SME is a senior technical expert responsible for architecting, developing, and optimizing enterprise-scale ServiceNow Field Service Management (FSM) solutions. This role acts as the go-to SME for FSM/FSO, leading complex implementations, mentoring developers, and partnering with business and architectural teams to drive operational excellence in field service delivery.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Act as FSM/FSO Subject Matter Expert across the ServiceNow platform.
ï Lead end-to-end FSM solution design for complex field service operations.
ï Architect and optimize work order lifecycle, dispatching, and scheduling.
ï Design and fine-tune auto-dispatch, capacity planning, and routing models.
ï Develop advanced server-side and client-side scripts (BRs, Script Includes, UI Actions).
ï Govern FSM data model, performance, and scalability.
ï Customize and extend Dispatcher Workspace and Mobile Agent.
ï Drive FSM integrations with ITSM, Asset, CMDB, Inventory, ERP systems.
ï Lead UAT, go-live, and hypercare activities.
ï Perform code reviews, best-practice enforcement, and upgrade readiness.
ï Mentor junior developers and provide technical leadership.
ï Collaborate with architects on platform strategy and roadmap

Required Skills & Experience:
ï 7ñ10+ years of ServiceNow development experience.
ï 4ñ5+ years of deep hands-on experience with FSM / FSO

Expert knowledge of:
ï FSM data model (Work Orders, Tasks, FSAs, Territories).
ï Auto-dispatch, scheduling, and optimization.
ï Flow Designer, Workflow, and Event Management.
ï Strong expertise in JavaScript (server & client side).
ï Proven experience with high-volume, enterprise FSM implementations.
ï Solid understanding of ITSM, CMDB, Asset, and Inventory Management.
ï Strong troubleshooting and performance-tuning skills.
ï Excellent stakeholder communication and leadership abilities

Preferred / Nice-to-Have:
ï ServiceNow FSM Implementation Specialist or CAD/CTA (FSM exposure).
ï Experience with IntegrationHub, REST/SOAP, MID Server.
ï Knowledge of Performance Analytics & reporting strategy.
ï Experience in regulated or asset-heavy industries:
ï Utilities, Telecom, Manufacturing, Oil & Gas.
ï Experience defining FSM governance and operating models

Tools & Technologies:

ServiceNow FSM / ITSM

Flow Designer, IntegrationHub

Dispatcher Workspace & Mobile Agent

JavaScript, REST APIs

job_description:
Job Description:
Job Summary
The Level 2 Support Engineer for Web Applications is responsible for troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving issues related to web-based software platforms. They serve as the escalation point for Level 1 support and work closely with development, QA, and infrastructure teams to ensure system stability and customer satisfaction.
Key Responsibilities
Issue Investigation & Resolution
Handle escalated tickets from Level 1 support (L1) involving functional or technical issues in web applications.
Reproduce issues in test/staging environments to identify bugs or misconfigurations.
Conduct detailed log analysis, SQL/database checks, and API validation.
Incident Management
Classify and prioritize incidents based on severity and business impact.
Escalate unresolved issues to Level 3 (development team) with proper documentation and root cause findings.
Collaborate with L1 and L3 teams during major incidents and post-incident reviews.
User Support & Communication
Communicate with business users or clients to gather additional information when needed.
Provide workarounds or solutions while permanent fixes are being developed.
Maintain knowledge base and support documentation.
Technical Tasks
Prepare scripts or SQL queries to validate data or resolve issues.
Perform basic configuration changes or updates in non-production environments.
Conduct release verification and smoke testing after deployments.
Continuous Improvement
Analyze recurring issues to suggest long-term fixes or enhancements.
Provide feedback to development/QA teams to improve application stability and usability.
Skills & Qualifications
Technical Skills:
Strong understanding of various technologies (Java, .net and visual basic)
Experience with web application architectures (e.g., client/server, REST APIs).
Familiarity with databases (MySQL, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and ability to write basic queries.
Exposure to version control (Git), CI/CD tools, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and documentation abilities.
Ability to work independently and under pressure.
Communication: Slack, Microsoft Teams, Email
Code/CI: Git, Jenkins, GitHub Actions

At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. Weíre committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here.
