Job Description

We are looking for a highly talented Software Engineer II - Android to join the team in Riyadh. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on experience and create a direct impact, then this may be the place for you! An ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor as well as a strong team player.

You Will Be Working On

Keep abreast of the latest software development methodologies in order to be able to provide best-in-class software solutions Analyze product requirements in order to understand engineering requirements, evaluate the technical feasibility, estimate efforts, and provide the required solutions in collaboration with the Product Team Assist in building development components and managing the programming of the different solution components in order to transform the requirements into actual working software accurately Document all coding steps in order to ensure comprehensibility and facilitate future modifications and maintenance Responsible for writing unit, integration, and UI / Snapshot testing. Investigate and resolve issues and bugs through patches and other means Collaborate with other colleagues in order to assist each other in code reviews and deliver code review reports accordingly Perform functional and module testing in order to ensure the functionality of delivered solutions Monitor evaluate and report on product development and recommend improvements where necessary Assist in user trials and acceptance testing

Qualifications

2-5 years of experience in developing software, with practical knowledge of design patterns and algorithms, ideally with Kotlin or Swift as a primary development language, but Java would suffice too. Experience with Flutter is preferred You are open-minded about technologies but particularly skilled in native Android development. Hands-on experience writing high-quality, testable code, also proficiency with modern mobile architectures. In-depth knowledge of mobile engineering lifecycle for fragments, activities, and practical experience with Agile methodologies (SCRUM or Kanban would do). Engineering excellence - a proven track record of substantially impacting the development of complex non-trivial systems. Open-source contributions and technical publications are very much welcome! Execution - ìgetting things doneî mentality. Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time, with high prioritization skills and experience with versioning tools (Git). You are experienced and on track with Modern Android Development approaches skillsets and practices. We are looking for practical knowledge of View Model, Live Data, Paging, Navigation, Safe Args, Retrofit2, RxJava2, Dagger2 (multi-module applications). Understanding of Modular App Architecture. Understanding of CI/CD pipeline.

Nice-to-Have Skills

Knowledge of Firebase, Google Maps API, Fastlane scripting, and Checkout.com SDK.

The ideal candidate should have a Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field. Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines.We are facing the interesting problem of fault-tolerant mission-critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.We have a number of openings ranging anywhere from junior to senior level. We will help you identify a suitable position depending on your experience and interests. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.Location: This role can be filled in European, Middle East and African time zones.What your day will look likeThe data platform team is responsible for the automation of data platform operations. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical. This role is focused on the creation and automation of features of data platforms, not analysing the data in them.Collaborate proactively with a distributed teamWrite high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new featuresDebug issues and interact with upstream communities publiclyWork with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fieldsDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external eventsWhat we are looking for in youProven hands-on experience in software development using PythonProven hands-on experience in distributed systems Have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degreeWillingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal eventsAdditional Skills That You Might Also BringYou might also bring a subset of experience from the following, which will determine the exact role and level we consider you for:Experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, OpenSearch, Kafka, Yugabyte, Trino, Superset, Atlas, Ranger, and RedisExperience with Linux systems administration, package management, and operationsExperience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStackExperience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data servicesWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal-opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

About Karage:

At Karage, we provide cutting-edge SaaS solutions designed to streamline operations, enhance customer experiences, and drive revenue growth for businesses in the automotive service industry. Our flagship product is a state-of-the-art Point of Sale (POS) system tailored specifically for auto repair shops, car dealerships, and related businesses. We are passionate about helping our clients optimize their business operations through technology and provide exceptional service.

Job Summary:

We are looking for a Senior Front-End Engineer to lead the development of our client-facing SaaS platforms. In this role, you will architect and build the user interfaces for our complex Point of Sale (POS) systems using Next.js. You will drive high performance and scalability while ensuring a seamless user experience for automotive service professionals. The ideal candidate will be a technical leader, mentoring junior engineers and driving best practices within the development lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable, high-performance web applications using Next.js and TypeScript, specifically for our POS and business management dashboards.
ï Write clean, efficient, and modular code (components/hooks) following modern React standards.
ï Optimize application speed and responsiveness (Core Web Vitals), ensuring our POS system performs reliably even in data-heavy environments.
ï Participate actively in all phases of the software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and UI design reviews to coding, testing, and deployment.
ï Conduct thorough code reviews to ensure adherence to architectural guidelines, accessibility standards, and best practices.
ï Mentor and guide junior front-end engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning, code quality, and technical growth.
ï Collaborate with product managers and UX/UI designers to translate complex workflows into intuitive, pixel-perfect interfaces.
ï Stay updated with emerging front-end technologies and evaluate their applicability to Karageís products.
ï Contribute to the continuous improvement of front-end development processes, build tools, and CI/CD pipelines.

Qualifications:
ï Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline.
ï Minimum of 5-7 years of progressive experience in software development, with a strong focus on Front-End Engineering.
ï Strong expertise in JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript.
ï Deep proficiency in React and the Next.js framework (SSR, SSG, routing).
ï Experience with state management (e.g., React Context).
ï Experience with front-end frameworks (e.g., React) is a must.
ï Solid understanding of database systems (SQL and NoSQL).
ï Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker).
ï Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
ï Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills.
ï Strong leadership, mentoring, and communication abilities.
ï Fluency in Arabic and English is preferred.

job_description:
Description

Do you want to love what you do at work? Do you want to make a difference, an impact, transform people's lives? Do you want to work with a team that believes in disrupting the normal, boring, and average?

If yes, then this is the job you're looking for. We are Saudi's number one event ticketing and experience booking platform in terms of technology, features, agility, and revenue, serving some of the largest mega events in the Kingdom surpassing over 2 billion sales.

Job summary

We're looking for a DevOps engineer to join a cutting-edge team that is working on some of the most exciting products being launched in the Middle East. Apply today and if you fit what we're looking for, we'll be in touch straight away. For this role, we're happy to consider candidates who are anywhere in the world and looking for a remote opportunity.

Key responsibilities
ï Create and execute test cases to identify problems in mobile and web applications
ï Analyze bugs and errors found during tests
ï Document results of tests for the software development team
ï Recommend improvements in software to enhance the user experience
ï Ability to communicate effectively with project managers about the issues and bugs found during testing
ï Work together with the software developers to enhance and improve applications as well as QA processes.
ï Maintain updated knowledge of industry trends and advancements
ï Suggest solutions to identified product problems
ï Collect quality data
ï Identify key KPIs for product quality
ï Prepare and present reports and metrics to senior management

Requirements
ï Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related IT degree
ï A minimum of 3 years of experience in the same position
ï Strong knowledge in automated testing frameworks and testing tools
ï Exceptional attention to detail.
ï Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
ï Experience in an Agile-SCRUM team environment
ï Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and Arabic

Senior software engineer I

Are you ready for the next step in your engineering career?

Would you enjoy working on our cutting-edge products?

About our Team

We are strengthening our software engineering team to modernise our existing application stack, powering one of LexisNexis IPís flagship products, PatentSight+. The team enhances the application with new features and functions to enrich the userís experience. This is an opportunity to work on modern, cloud native infrastructure and become part of building the new architecture.

About the Role

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will perform complex research, design, and software development assignments within a software product line. You will provide direct input to project plans, schedules, and methodology in the development of cross-functional software products. You will perform software design typically across multiple systems; mentors more-junior members of the team; and talks to users/customers and translates their requests into solutions.

Responsibilities
ï Interfacing with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.
ï Writing and reviewing portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.
ï Working closely with other development team members to understand complex product requirements and translate them into software designs.
ï Implementing development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews successfully.
ï Operating in a Scrum based development environment while collaborating with stakeholders.
ï Help entry-level software engineers, ensuring they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles.
ï Resolving complex bug issues and technical issues as necessary.
ï Designing and working with complex data models.

Requirements
ï 3 -5 years professional experience in a software engineering role.
ï Have BSC degree in engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
ï Experience with C#, SQL and the .Net Core Entity Framework, Windows.
ï Experience working with React or Angular. JavaScript, CSS, HTML, XML.
ï Experience with AWS or similar cloud providers, including knowledge on running cost effective serverless architecture is a plus.
ï Have advanced knowledge and experience of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile) along with AI tools e.g. GitHub CoPilot (nice-to-have).
ï Be proficient in data manipulation and optimization techniques.
ï Be able to analyze, debug, and resolve complex software issues.
ï Be able to work effectively with technical and non-technical team members and communicate requirements clearly.

Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.
ï Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

Working for you

We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:
ï Medical Aid
ï Retirement Plan inclusive of Risk Benefits (Disability, Critical Illness, Life Cover & Funeral Cover)
ï Modern family benefits, including adoption and surrogacy
ï Study Leave

About the Business

LexisNexis Legal & ProfessionalÆ provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its LexisÆ and NexisÆ services.

We know your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. We are delighted to offer country specific benefits. Click here to access benefits specific to your location.

Overview

Lucidya is an AI-native company transforming how brands understand and engage with their customers through cutting-edge technologies purpose-built for Customer Experience (CX). With AI at the core of our platform and operations, we are redefining how businesses drive growth, loyalty, and insight at scale.

We are looking for Backend Engineers to join our team. You will join a team of highly qualified engineers to continue the innovation and development of our product which uses Machine Learning & Big Data technologies to analyze content from several data sources.

As a developer, you will be working on the backend of our product Lucidya which is built using industryís latest technologies such as Redis, Postgres and Cassandra and developing APIs using Python and Ruby on Rails. The job also includes DevOps tasks from server setup to maintenance and recovery.

You will work directly under the Engineering Manager in an agile yet demanding environment. We expect you to be a fast learner to adapt those technologies mentioned above fast.

Lucidya offers a result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment full of challenges, We look for very talented candidates with strong programming skills.
Key Tasks & Responsibilities
ï Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.
ï Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software (backend and databases in particular)
ï Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
ï DevOps tasks
ï Contribute to the growth of Lucidya through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts
Qualifications
ï BA/BS or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent practical experience
ï +3 years of experience
ï Strong knowledge in SQL and noSQL databases such as (Redis, Postgress or Cassandra)
ï Fluency in Python and Ruby on Rails.
ï Knowledge in Web servers and Web application servers (e.g., Apache, Jetty, Tomcat, IIS)
ï Knowledge in code repository like Git
ï Ability to multi-task and adapt to shifting priorities, demands, and tight timelines
ï Database design skills
ï Perfect quality code
ï Excellent organizational skills and proven analytical, planning, problem solving skills
ï Full stack with background in ReactJS is a plus

job_title: Professional Services Engineer ñ Network & Security
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Resident Professional Services Engineer to work on-site with a customer, providing high-quality technical services across network and security environments. This role focuses on designing, deploying, optimizing, and operating security infrastructure while acting as a trusted technical advisor to the customer.

The successful candidate will collaborate closely with customer teams and internal stakeholders to ensure reliable, secure, and scalable solutions, while maintaining a strong focus on customer satisfaction and technical excellence.

Key Responsibilities
ï Support the customer during the design (Think) and implementation (Build) phases of projects
ï Design, deploy, test, verify, optimize, and operate network and security solutions
ï Develop and maintain technical project documentation, including:
ï High- and low-level designs
ï Methods of procedure (MoP)
ï Test plans
ï Configuration templates and scripts
ï Provision, customize, and verify security and network configurations based on approved designs and best practices
ï Perform solution testing and validate system behavior
ï Participate in interoperability and integration testing with third-party systems and devices
ï Recommend and implement industry best practices for network and security solutions
ï Troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate technical issues in a timely and structured manner
ï Deliver knowledge transfer and technical guidance to customer teams
ï Continuously enhance technical skills through training and on-the-job learning

Job Requirements
ï Minimum 3 years of experience with LAN/WAN and network security technologies
ï Strong experience in designing and implementing firewall and security gateway solutions (vendor-agnostic)
ï Solid knowledge of complex routing and WAN environments, including BGP and OSPF
ï Hands-on experience with MPLS networks, particularly Layer 3 VPNs
ï Exposure to managed service or MSSP environments, including multi-tenancy, monitoring, reporting, and support models
ï Experience with scripting and automation, such as zero-touch provisioning (ZTP) and integration with orchestrators, controllers, or dashboards
ï Hands-on experience with Web Application Firewalls (WAF)
ï Familiarity with sandboxing and advanced threat analysis solutions
ï Excellent communication skills and strong technical documentation capabilities
ï Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within cross-functional teams
ï Strong customer service mindset with excellent interpersonal and soft skills
ï Fluent Arabic speaker.

At Lucidya, we harness the power of Machine Learning and Big Data to empower businesses with actionable insights through social listening, customer experience, and data analytics platforms. This is a hands?on leadership role suited for someone passionate about driving architectural integrity and mentoring engineering teams.

ï Proficiency in Ruby on Rails or Python for production?grade applications.
ï Proven experience in technical leadership, architecture reviews, and mentoring.
ï Solid understanding of distributed systems, microservices, and event?driven architectures.
ï Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS preferred) and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
ï Familiarity with relational (e.g., Postgre

SQL) and non?relational (e.g., Redis, Elasticsearch) data stores.
ï Strong communication and collaboration skills.
ï Experience using GenAI tools (e.g., Copilot, ChatGPT) to boost coding efficiency, automate tasks, and improve code quality.

job_description:
Who Are We

HALA is a leading fintech player in the MENAP region that aims to redefine financial services and build the future bank of SMEs. HALA aims at empowering SMEs to start, run, and grow their businesses by providing them with cutting-edge financial and technological tools.

HALA currently holds multiple entities in UAE, Saudi Arabia and Egypt (including HALA Payments, HALA Cashier and HALA Logistics) and offers solutions that enable merchants to digitize their payments as well as manage their sales and operations.

Founded in 2017, HALA is currently duly licensed by the Saudi Arabian Central Bank as well as the Financials Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in Abu Dhabi Global Market.

Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain scalable, high-performance backend systems.
ï Architect and implement microservices-based applications using .NET Core.
ï Develop and optimize RESTful APIs for seamless integration with frontend and third-party services.
ï Work with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis) databases for efficient data storage and retrieval.
ï Implement authentication, authorization, and security best practices (OAuth, JWT, encryption, API security).
ï Collaborate with DevOps to manage CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and cloud deployments (AWS, Azure, GCP).
ï Ensure system scalability, reliability, and performance optimization.
ï Work with event-driven architectures using Kafka, RabbitMQ, or other message brokers.
ï Perform code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and enforce best coding practices.
ï Stay updated on emerging backend technologies, frameworks, and best practices.

Requirements
ï 5+ years of experience in backend development.
ï Proficiency in .NET Core.
ï Strong experience with microservices architecture and distributed systems.
ï Deep knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis).
ï Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
ï Hands-on experience with message brokers (Kafka, RabbitMQ) for event-driven systems.
ï Strong understanding of API security, authentication mechanisms, and performance tuning.
ï Knowledge of CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins.
ï Experience with scalability and high-availability architectures.
ï Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.
ï Strong communication and leadership skills to mentor junior developers.

What We Offer You

We believe you will love working at HALA!
ï We have an inclusive and diverse culture that encourages innovation and flexibility in remote, in-office, and hybrid work setups.
ï We offer highly competitive compensation packages, including the potential for shares.
ï We prioritize personal development and offer regular training and an annual learning stipend to tackle new challenges and grow your career in a hyper-growth environment.
ï Join a talented team of over 30 nationalities working in 7 countries and gain valuable experience in an exciting industry.
ï We offer autonomy, mentoring, and challenging goals that create incredible opportunities for both you and the company.
ï You will be given a lot of responsibility and trust. We believe that the best results come when the people responsible for a function are given the freedom to do what they think is best.

If you think you have what it takes to join a remarkable team #apply_now

Company Overview

Sitech builds impactful digital products, services, and experiences for enterprises and fast-growing startups. With a global talent pool, we specialize in product discovery, experience design, and custom software development, delivering scalable and high-quality solutions across multiple industries.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer with 10+ years of experience to lead the design, development, and delivery of complex software solutions, with a strong focus on Python (Django), Vue.js, and Open edX platforms.

This role combines hands-on technical leadership with architecture ownership, mentoring engineers, and collaborating closely with product, QA, and DevOps teams to deliver scalable, secure, and high-performing systems.

Key Responsibilities
ï Lead the end-to-end development of web-based platforms using Python (Django) and Vue.js.
ï Architect, customize, and extend Open edX platforms, including LMS/CMS, plugins, and integrations.
ï Define technical architecture, coding standards, and best practices across projects.
ï Provide technical leadership, code reviews, and mentorship to engineering teams.
ï Collaborate with product managers, UX designers, and QA to translate business requirements into robust technical solutions.
ï Oversee system integrations, APIs, and backend services.
ï Ensure platform scalability, performance, security, and reliability.
ï Drive CI/CD adoption and collaborate with DevOps on deployment strategies.
ï Troubleshoot complex technical issues and lead root-cause analysis.
ï Contribute to technical planning, estimations, and delivery timelines.

Qualifications & Requirements
ï 10+ years of professional software development experience.
ï Strong expertise in Python with Django (mandatory).
ï Proven experience with Vue.js and modern front-end architectures.
ï Hands-on experience with Open edX development, customization, and deployment.
ï Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, microservices, and system integration.
ï Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL/MySQL).
ï Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and cloud environments.
ï Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
ï Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments.
ï Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.

job_title: Lead Software Engineer - Riyadh - Saudi National
job_description:

ï Software architecture

Company Overview

The role has a strong hands-on focus, working primarily with Python (Django), Vue.js, and Open edX, and collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality products.

job_description:
Salla is seeking an experienced and strategic Software Engineering Manager to lead and oversee our Marketplace engineering team.

In this critical role, you will be responsible for shaping the technical vision and driving the successful execution of initiatives to enhance our marketplace platform, which connects sellers and buyers with efficiency and ease.

Your main responsibilities will include:
ï Lead and oversee multiple teams, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and fostering collaboration across engineering, product, QA, security, and UX/UI design.
ï Define and implement the technical vision and strategy for the Marketplace platform, ensuring scalability, performance, and innovation.
ï Drive technical excellence and enforce architecture standards, championing best practices in software development.
ï Mentor, manage, and grow engineering managers and their teams, fostering a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and high performance.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define and prioritize features that deliver value to users and the business.
ï Monitor and optimize system performance, proactively addressing issues and driving continuous improvements in reliability and scalability.
ï Ensure security and compliance standards are met across all projects and initiatives.
ï Develop and execute roadmaps, defining and tracking KPIs/OKRs to measure success and align team efforts with business objectives.
ï Hire, retain, and nurture top engineering talent, ensuring the team has the skills and diversity needed to succeed.

Experience:
ï 10+ years in software engineering, with at least 3 years in senior-level Engineering Management roles.
ï Proven track record of leading teams of 10+ members and collaborating with diverse stakeholders, including product managers, QA, security, and design teams.
ï Hands-on experience managing high-traffic platforms, preferably in e-commerce or marketplace environments.

Technical Skills:
ï Strong expertise in web technologies (e.g., PHP, JavaScript) and database systems (SQL and NoSQL).
ï Deep understanding of Agile methodologies and project management practices.
ï Expertise in setting up scalable architecture and maintaining technical standards.

Leadership Skills:
ï Exceptional strategic thinking and communication abilities.
ï Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
ï Experience developing and managing OKRs to ensure team and project success.

Other Requirements:
ï Spoken Arabic proficiency is required to communicate effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders.
ï Familiar with cloud services (AWS preferred) and microservices architecture.
ï Comprehensive Training & Development programs.
ï Performance-based Bonus incentives.
ï Flexible Work From Home options.

Haysí client is a leading enterprise file sync and share platform that specialize in providing industry leading compliance, data governance, data leak protection, data retention and digital rights management capabilities. They are a global company, currently growing a large team based in Riyadh. Our client are looking for a Senior Systems Software Engineer to join their team in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

Your new role
ï Design, implement, and maintain system-level components for desktop on Windows in modern C++ (C++17 and higher).
ï Implement and maintain gRPC services and clients (and JSON/REST-style APIs where applicable) that connect system components to higher-level layers (Electron/TypeScript UI, server-side services).
ï Develop and maintain unit tests (gtest) and integration tests (Python + pytest) to build and extend automated coverage.
ï Contribute to build and CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, WiX for installers, vcpkg for dependencies, PowerShell scripts where helpful).

What you'll need to succeed
ï Comfortable collaborating with UI (Electron/TypeScript/Vue), QA, and backend engineers.
ï Familiarity with networked applications (HTTP/HTTPS, TLS, proxies) from a developer perspective.
ï Background in cloud storage, sync clients, security/endpoint products, or distributed systems.
ï Strong commercial experience with modern C++ (C++17 and higher).
ï Solid knowledge of Windows internals: processes, C++ threading primitives (e.g. std::thread, std::mutex), synchronization, I/O, memory, security.

What you'll get in return
ï Competitive tax-free salary.
ï The opportunity to work with a reputable company and industry-leading security vendors.
ï A dynamic, professional environment with exposure to the latest product trends and product roadmaps.

What you'll need to do now

If you are interested in this role, please apply and answer the screening questions as best as you can. If your profile is a suitable match, a Hays consultant will reach out to you to discuss the opportunity in further detail.

Are you a Full-Stack Engineer who thrives on solving complex challenges and delivering high-impact features? Join our team to build innovative AI-powered products that transform how people learn and grow. Youíll focus on high-quality execution, ensuring our products are scalable, maintainable, and impactful.

Youíll work on products that are transforming learning:
ï TeachTap: Leverages AI to bring historical figures to life in a TikTok-like learning experience.
ï TeachTales: Engages students with personalized, magical storytelling that boosts comprehension.
ï TimeBack: Acts as a learning copilot that integrates with existing apps, proactively coaching students.
ï Athena: Uses AI-generated videos and tests to deliver measurable academic outcomes.

This role exists to deliver real-world impact through working software. Youíll use AI tools and cloud-native technologies to build full-stack systems that solve meaningful problems, not just tick off tickets. Youíll be expected to ship fast without cutting corners, choosing the simplest correct solution that balances short-term speed with long-term maintainability.

If youíre ready to solve complex technical challenges and deliver impactful features, weíd love to hear from you.

What you will be doing
ï Build and Ship Full-Stack Features: Take user stories from idea to impact; clarify requirements, design scalable solutions, write backend and frontend code, test thoroughly, and ship to production
ï Hunt Down and Fix Bugs: Investigate issues through root cause analysis, fix the real problems (not just symptoms), and guard against regressions with smart testing
ï Raise the Bar on Code Quality: Review plans and pull requests to ensure clarity, simplicity, and correctness, blocking tech debt before it starts

What you wonít be doing
ï Building pixel-perfect UIs or complex backends just for their own sake
ï Blindly implementing specs without understanding the problem
ï Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around
ï Just shipping features; youíll be responsible for solving actual problems

AI-Augmented Full-Stack Principal Engineer key responsibilities
ï Using AI to build software that solves real user problems, ships fast, and stays maintainable long-term

Basic Requirements
ï At least 4 years of experience writing production code for web applications' frontend and backend (any framework).
ï Strong ownership: Demonstrated experience owning complete modules, product features, or teams, not just contributing siloed tasks
ï Independent execution: The ability to unblock yourself, set your own pace, and find paths forward in ambiguous situations
ï Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work

About LearnWith.AI

LearnWith.AI is an edtech startup that leverages AI and subject matter experts to cultivate a new way of learning. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and AI-powered coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn more, learn faster, and learn better - and have fun while doing it. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.

job_title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
job_description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

The mission of the LXD team is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.

LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.

This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.

Location: This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.

What you will focus on
ï Design, implement and document system level Go code
ï Model data, design database schema and implement data storage in a dqlite (SQL) database
ï Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system tests
ï Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
ï Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external events

What we are looking for in you
ï You have experience programming in Go and C
ï You are knowledgeable in networking and storage technologies
ï You have experience with two or more of: cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community
ï You are curious, flexible, articulate and accountable
ï You value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivated You have a bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Employee Assistance Programme
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_description:
About the opportunity

We are looking for a highly talented Android Engineer to join the Fulfillment team in Riyadh. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on experience and create a direct impact, then this may be the place for you! An ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor as well as a strong team player.

You will be working on:
ï Keep abreast of the latest software development methodologies in order to be able to provide best-in-class software solutions
ï Analyze product requirements in order to understand engineering requirements, evaluate the technical feasibility, estimate efforts, and provide the required solutions in collaboration with the Product Team
ï Assist in building development components and managing the programming of the different solution components in order to transform the requirements into actual working software accurately
ï Document all coding steps in order to ensure comprehensibility and facilitate future modifications and maintenance
ï Responsible for writing unit, integration, and UI / Snapshot testing.
ï Investigate and resolve issues and bugs through patches and other means
ï Collaborate with other colleagues in order to assist each other in code reviews and deliver code review reports accordingly
ï Perform functional and module testing in order to ensure the functionality of delivered solutions
ï Monitor evaluate and report on product development and recommend improvements where necessary
ï Assist in user trials and acceptance testing

What you need to be successful
ï 3+ years of experience in developing software, with practical knowledge of design patterns and algorithms, ideally with Kotlin as a primary development language, but Java would suffice too.
ï You are open-minded about technologies but particularly skilled in native Android development.
ï Hands-on experience writing high-quality, testable code, also proficiency with modern mobile architectures.
ï In-depth knowledge of mobile engineering lifecycle for fragments, activities, and practical experience with Agile methodologies (SCRUM or Kanban would do).
ï Engineering excellence - a proven track record of substantially impacting the development of complex non-trivial systems. Open-source contributions and technical publications are very much welcome!
ï Execution - ìgetting things doneî mentality. Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time, with high prioritization skills and experience with versioning tools (Git).
ï You are experienced and on track with Modern Android Development approaches skillsets and practices. We are looking for practical knowledge of ViewModel, LiveData, Paging, Navigation, SafeArgs, Retrofit2, RxJava2, Dagger2 (multi-module applications).
ï Understanding of Modular App Architecture.
ï Understanding of CI/CD pipeline.
ï Ability to write new modules using maintainable architecture.

Nice-to-Have skills:
ï Knowledge of Firebase, Google Maps API, Fastlane scripting, and Checkout.com SDK.

Who we are

HungerStation is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the worldís pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experienceófast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.

What's in it for you

We offer:
ï We offer visa and relocation support globally and inside KSA to our employees.
ï Exchange ideas and meet 2000+ colleagues from different teams within Delivery Hero in our active guilds and through our global tech and product community.
ï Develop your skills with your personal educational budget for conferences and external training.
ï Access our e-learning platform LinkedIn and participate in our various in-house training programs
ï And much moreÖ

Company Overview

Sitech creates digital products, services, and experiences that deliver real impact. We partner with enterprises and fast-growing startups to design, build, and scale high-quality digital platforms across various industries.

Role Overview

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with 7+ years of experience to design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable software solutions. The role has a strong hands-on focus, working primarily with Python (Django), Vue.js, and Open edX, and collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality products.

Key Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain backend services using Python (Django).
ï Build and enhance front-end applications using Vue.js.
ï Customize, extend, and maintain Open edX platforms, including LMS/CMS features and integrations.
ï Develop and consume RESTful APIs and integrate third-party services.
ï Collaborate with product managers, UX designers, QA, and DevOps teams to deliver end-to-end solutions.
ï Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code following best practices.
ï Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical decision-making.
ï Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize system performance and reliability.
ï Ensure security, data protection, and platform stability.
ï Support deployments, releases, and ongoing platform improvements.

Qualifications & Requirements
ï 7+ years of professional software development experience.
ï Strong expertise in Python with Django.
ï Solid experience with Vue.js and modern front-end development.
ï Hands-on experience with Open edX development and customization.
ï Strong understanding of software design patterns, architecture, and best practices.
ï Experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL or MySQL.
ï Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and cloud environments.
ï Experience working in Agile/Scrum teams.
ï Strong problem-solving skills and effective communication abilities.

Nice to Have
ï Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
ï Exposure to microservices architecture.
ï Knowledge of EdTech platforms or LMS systems.
ï Experience working on enterprise or government-scale projects in KSA.

job_description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleaguesóat all levelsówill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you wonít find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:
ï Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
ï A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. Youíll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions, all while upholding our unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
ï Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firmís diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, youíll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
ï World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

Your Impact

As a Software Engineer with McKinsey Digital, you will work with clients across a wide range of sectors and industries, advising them on how to best leverage technology.

You will drive architectural design, make key technology decisions, and employ agile methodologies to build and deliver the next generation of products for our clients at scale.

You will also lead project workstreams, helping clients build their technical capabilities and foster a culture centered around engineering best practices, user-centricity, and Agile values.

As a core member of the team, you will take on responsibilities that include driving architectural design and making strategic technology decisions to shape next-generation products for various internal teams, ensuring that we remain at the forefront of technological innovation.

Additionally, you will be hands-on and co-creating solutions alongside our clients and their leadership, enabling you to grow into a recognized technology leader.

You will be part of the McKinsey Digital team in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This group brings together the best of McKinseyís digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.

McKinsey Digital is our tech delivery people unit. A global team of software, data and cloud engineers, passionate designers, technology architects, product owners, and leading technologists.

You will join a multidisciplinary community of developers, Agile coaches, designers, business strategists and experts. Together, we will design and create industry shaping products and tools for our clients.

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: JavaScript, TypeScript, React.js, Angular.js, Next.js, Vue.js, Python, Java, C#, NodeJS, SQL, MongoDB, AWS, Azure, GCP, and more!

Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. You will have the freedom to try new ideas and experiment in your role and will be guaranteed significant dedicated time to tinker, create, continuously learn and share cool new stuff. We also have a strong emphasis in our teams on mentoring others enabling them to grow and learn.

Changing the world requires us to sit with our clients at times, so some travel is expected in this role.

Your Qualifications and Skills
ï Undergraduate or masterís degree; or equivalent experience
ï 5+ years of experience in software development, with significant full-stack web application development experience strongly preferred
ï Demonstrated knowledge and hands-on experience across the full application stack with some of the following languages/frameworks: JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Angular, Vue, jQuery, Java, Sprint, C#, .NET, Node.js, SQL, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, cloud-native databases, AWS, Azure, GCP, Jenkins, Docker, Circle CI, Travis
ï Experience leading in Agile teams, including coaching and modeling Agile mindsets as part of sprint ceremonies, work definition and building developer capabilities
ï Experience working collaboratively with technical and non-technical team members and stakeholders including modeling and coaching others to use engineering best practices such as design patterns, customer-centric design, test-driven development, code refactoring, code review, and OWASP Top 10 security awareness

job_description:
A leading Talent Acquisition Company in Saudi Arabia, is excited to announce an opening for an Industrial Computer Engineer in Saudi Arabia. In this role, you will leverage your engineering expertise to design and implement advanced computing systems tailored for industrial applications across various sectors, including Oil & Energy. we pride ourselves on connecting skilled professionals with industry leaders. As an Industrial Computer Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work on impactful projects that push technological boundaries and drive innovation in the field.
Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain computer systems that improve industrial operations
ï Collaborate with internal teams to gather and analyze requirements for new projects
ï Develop and configure control systems and software relevant to industrial processes
ï Oversee system integration tasks and perform rigorous testing
ï Troubleshoot software and hardware issues effectively
ï Ensure systems comply with industry standards and quality assurance protocols
ï Provide ongoing technical support to clients and stakeholders
ï Keep abreast of new technologies and methodologies in the field of industrial computing

Has experience in IT system setup , integration and network operation . Provide commissioning, startup, and maintenance support of workshop networks and systems. Liaise with area Information Technology personnel to address interface between workshop, Corporate networks and third-party vendors. Address issues related to workshop's networks and control systems. Participate, if requested by Corporate Security Services, in investigating breaches within the plant operating facility. Serve as the find technical expert for plant or operating facility in the fields of workshop automation and control systems, networking and systems. Demonstrate good grasp of hardware interfacing and instrumentation techniques, -SAP Plant Connectivity, IOT platforms likes Thingworx, Building management systems, software scripting and/or security configuration. Solve and provide direction to solving complex technical problems. Specify hardware, software and application functionality. Manage workshop networks and systems including but not limited to routers, switches, firewalls, servers, operating systems, and other devices and components. Configure and maintain the OLE for Process Control (OPC) server. Develop software scripts for automating software installations. Install new process controls network system components. Configure and support patch management systems for the plant networks and systems. Perform hardware and software upgrades, backups, restore procedures and document disaster recoveries, perform software modifications, database and process historian administration. OTHER* MSCE Certification, other equivalent network administration certification, or successful demonstration of equivalent skills.
ï CompTIA Network+ Certification (or equivalent skills)
ï CompTIA Security+ Certification (or equivalent skills)
ï Excellent command of written and spoken English.
ï Familiarity with maintenance processes in a manufacturing workshop environment.

job_title: C, Golang Software Engineer working on dqlite, a Raft extension for SQLite
job_description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a software developer to focus on dqlite, our distributed SQLite database which uses our own Raft library for establishing consensus and replication. Dqlite is available as a pure C library or through a Go package that we also maintain, and we intend to provide bindings for Python and other languages.

You will design and implement enhancements to the libraft, dqlite and go-dqlite components which we consume in MicroK8s, LXD and other projects. Work includes development in those pieces of software as well as responding to issues and user inquiries.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern computing technologies. Canonical offers a fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development opportunities.

Location: This is a remote position available in EMEA

What you will focus on
ï Design and implement features across dqlite
ï Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
ï Improve Jepsen tests, traditional HA database automated testing and stress tests
ï Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural review Engage with the open source community and commercial partners

What we are looking for in you
ï Experience with distributed systems (preferably with Raft)
ï Good C programming experience
ï Solid understanding of asynchronous programming and concurrency patterns a plus
ï Capacity to learn quickly about new systems and techniques
ï Strong written and verbal communication skills Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Employee Assistance Programme
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Senior Software Engineer - Ruby on Rails (Remote)

Job Openings Senior Software Engineer - Ruby on Rails (Remote)
About the job Senior Software Engineer - Ruby on Rails (Remote)

At TalPod, we are a team of exceptional Software Engineers who thrive on solving complex software challenges. Our passion lies in building great software and nurturing the brightest talent to become world-class engineers.

We are looking to hire a mid-senior-level engineer for this role for a couple of our partners in Saudi, one is the most successful and large HR services and solutions provider, and another is the most successful on-demand service platform both backed by the largest VC firms on a rapid expansion.

What We Offer:
ï Exciting Opportunities: Collaborate with VC-backed, fast-growing tech companies. You'll work alongside some of the industry's hottest players, potentially shaping the next unicorn.
ï Agile Environment: Dive into an Agile and dynamic work setting. Surround yourself with brilliant minds, constantly learning and growing.
ï High-Quality Deliverables: Your work matters. Deliver excellence as you contribute to cutting-edge projects.
ï Remote Flexibility: Enjoy a full-time position compatible with the GCC time zone, allowing you to work remotely.
ï Join us at TalPod and be part of a team that thrives on excellence, innovation, and growth. Let's build awesome software together

Requirement & Responsibilities:
ï 4 - 10 years of experience in a related role.
ï Take a lead role in designing, developing, and maintaining web applications using Ruby on Rails.
ï Identify and address technical challenges and provide effective solutions to ensure project success.
ï Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality, and adherence to coding standards, and best practices.
ï Work closely with the development team, product managers, and stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
ï Collaborate with team members to ensure timely and successful project delivery according to specifications.
ï Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Ruby on Rails and web development to improve software quality and efficiency.
ï Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers, fostering their growth and development.
ï Collaborate with DevOps and QA teams to ensure smooth deployment and testing of applications.
ï Create and maintain technical documentation to support knowledge sharing and future maintenance.
ï Profound knowledge of Ruby on Rails, Ruby programming language, and related tools to develop and maintain web applications effectively.
ï Strong analytical skills and ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues efficiently.

job_description:
FileCloud is looking for a highly skilled Senior Systems Software Engineer to join our team in Riyadh, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. You will work on the core sync and OS integration layer of FileCloud Desktop. Your primary focus will be system-level development on Windows using modern C++ (C++17 and higher) and a strong understanding of Windows internals, filesystems, and OS integration. You will design and implement core sync and filesystem logic, integrate with Explorer, and collaborate closely with QA and UI teams. This role is fully office-based and will require working in our KSA office with other members of the remote FileCloud team.

About the Product & Company:

FileCloud is a hyper-secure EFSS (enterprise file sync and share) platform that provides industry leading compliance, data governance, data leak protection, data retention and digital rights management capabilities. FileCloud is a leader in content governance and collaboration for unstructured data, trusted and used worldwide across Global 1000 enterprises, educational institutions, government organizations, and service providers. In addition to its enterprise file sharing solution, FileCloudís product portfolio also includes Signority (acquired in May 2024), a Canadian-based e-signature and document workflow platform. We are currently expanding our team as we grow and improve FileCloud.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Design, implement, and maintain system-level components for FileCloud Desktop on Windows in modern C++ (C++17 and higher).
ï Work with Win32/WinRT, the Windows Cloud Files API (CFAPI), and our custom driver to handle filesystem events, placeholders, hydration/dehydration, and user actions.
ï Implement and maintain gRPC services and clients (and JSON/REST-style APIs where applicable) that connect system components to higher-level layers (Electron/TypeScript UI, server-side services).
ï If you have macOS experience, contribute to macOS system components in Swift using Apple File Provider and Endpoint Security/ESClient.
ï Develop and maintain unit tests (gtest) and integration tests (Python + pytest) to build and extend automated coverage.
ï Integrate with File Explorer for overlays, context menus, and other shell extensions, including COM where needed.
ï Use tools like Visual Studio, WinDbg, and Procmon to debug complex issues in production-like environments.
ï Contribute to build and CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, WiX for installers, vcpkg for dependencies, PowerShell scripts where helpful).
ï Strong commercial experience with modern C++ (C++17 and higher).
ï Solid knowledge of Windows internals: processes, C++ threading primitives (e.g. std::thread, std::mutex), synchronization, I/O, memory, security.
ï Hands-on experience with Win32 APIs and willingness to work with WinRT as needed.
ï Experience with multithreaded and asynchronous code.

Key Skills & Experience:

Modern C++ / Windows system programming
ï Strong commercial experience with modern C++ (C++17 and higher).
ï Solid knowledge of Windows internals: processes, C++ threading primitives (e.g. std::thread, std::mutex), synchronization, I/O, memory, security.
ï Hands-on experience with Win32 APIs and willingness to work with WinRT as needed.
ï Experience with multithreaded and asynchronous code.

Filesystems, sync & networking
ï Good understanding of filesystem behavior: notifications, caching, metadata, locking, renames, symlinks/junctions.
ï Experience in or strong interest in sync/backup clients, cloud storage, or related areas.
ï Familiarity with networked applications ( TLS, proxies) from a developer perspective.

APIs, testing & debugging
ï Experience with RPC / typed APIs (e.g. gRPC, JSON/REST, or similar) and willingness to work with gRPC daily.
ï Hands-on experience writing automated tests: unit tests in gtest and integration tests in Python + pytest.
ï Strong debugging skills on Windows using Visual Studio and system tools (WinDbg, Procmon, logs).

Collaboration & work style
ï Ability to work independently and take ownership of complex subsystems.
ï Comfortable collaborating with UI (Electron/TypeScript/Vue), QA, and backend engineers.
ï Good communication skills in English and prior experience in a remote or distributed team.

Nice-to-have / Learn-on-the-job
ï Experience with the Windows Cloud Files API (CFAPI) or other virtual filesystem/sync APIs.
ï Experience building installers with the WiX Toolset.
ï Familiarity with vcpkg for C++ dependency management.
ï Experience with COM APIs for shell integration.
ï macOS system development in Swift using Apple File Provider and Endpoint Security/ESClient.
ï Experience with Jenkins or similar CI systems.
ï Scripting skills in PowerShell (and/or basic shell scripting on macOS/Linux).
ï Background in cloud storage, sync clients, security/endpoint products, or distributed systems.
ï Awareness of security best practices when working at the OS and filesystem layer.

If you meet most of the core requirements but not everything on the ìnice-to-haveî list, we still encourage you to apply.

What We Offer
ï Be part of a team of passionate, committed individuals dedicated to building a world-class product
ï Dedicated time for training and education opportunities
ï A mentorship model wherein your mentor and team support your development
ï A competitive salary with an annual bonus
ï Onsite work with flexible hours that fall outside of the companywide core hours of 9am -12pm (US Eastern Standard Time
ï 20 days of paid time off which increases by a further 2 days after 3 years of service and 3 days after 5 years of service (in addition to 10 public holidays in your country)
ï Paid day off on your birthday or on an alternative day if your birthday falls outside a normal working day
ï Paid day off to volunteer with the charity of your choice
ï Paid monthly internet cost, as well as lunch and wellbeing stipend provided
ï Reimbursement of all hardware costs associated with the role

Please note that we conduct background security checks for everyone joining our team.

job_title: Distributed Systems Software Engineer, Python / Go
job_description:
We are seeking a software engineer with a passion for building and validating resilient distributed systems. At Canonical you can build a career and drive the success of those leveraging Canonical's Ubuntu and Juju to build multi-cloud deployable cloud applications.

We see quality engineering as a first class engineering practice and are looking for people who can bring deep engineering insights and a data driven approach to test automation, reporting and data analytics.

The Distributed Systems testing team at Canonical is responsible for ensuring the high quality of Canonical's Cloud solutions based on Juju, Terraform, OpenStack, Kubernetes when deployed under highly diverse conditions, from bare metal in customer data centers to public clouds like AWS, GCE, Azure.

As a software engineer you will have the opportunity to develop CI pipelines which power Canonical's cloud integration testing and reporting. Upcoming initiatives you will have the opportunity to contribute to include expanding deployment capabilities to new clouds and developing AI/ML pipelines for automatic analysis of test results. A successful candidate is interested in tackling these problems, as well as imagining and leading new initiatives within the team and across Canonical.

Location: this is a Globally remote role

What your day will look like
ï Create automated testing approaches and infrastructure for validating reliability, performance, and resilience of cloud orchestration tools and applications
ï Enable engineering teams across Canonical to develop software with confidence by making distributed system testing tooling available across the company
ï Enhance continuous integration pipelines for deploying and testing Canonical's cloud native products such as Kubeflow
ï Deploy, manage, and debug highly distributed systems
ï Monitor and report on automated testing efforts
ï Collaborate daily with a globally distributed team

What we are looking for in you
ï Solid background in modern test processes and strategies
ï Experience with Python or Go development
ï Strong object oriented development skills
ï Ability to develop and ship production grade modern web applications
ï Working knowledge of continuous integration tools such as Jenkins, CircleCI, GitHub CI
ï Knowledge of networking technologies and fundamentals
ï Solid understanding of Linux system architecture
ï A capacity for complex abstract thinking
ï Capability for 2-4 weeks of international travel travel per year

Additional skills that you might also bring
ï Collecting and analyzing large multidimensional datasets
ï Operating data platforms: key-value stores, relational or document databases, event buses
ï Work with cloud technologies such as OpenStack, Kubernetes, Terraform and AWS
ï Developing AI/ML pipelines

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Employee Assistance Programme
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
ï Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

As a Back-End Software Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the server-side logic, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. Working closely with other team members, you will implement robust business logic and web services and optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Key Responsibilities

Develop, test, and maintain high-performance backend applications using Node.js and TypeScript.
Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate APIs and services with ReactJS applications.
Design and implement scalable backend architectures and RESTful APIs.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices.
Optimize applications for maximum performance and scalability.
Participate in code reviews and mentor junior developers.
Work with databases and manage data storage, ensuring secure and efficient data access.
Troubleshoot and debug issues to improve system performance.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in backend development and technologies.

Required Skills

Proficiency in backend development with a focus on building RESTful APIs.

Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL).
Strong knowledge of Git and version control best practices.

Ability to write scalable and secure code.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
Experience in working with cloud platforms and deployment (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.).
Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Skills

Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience in microservices architecture.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.
Understanding of Agile methodologies.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
5+ years of experience in backend development.

Their role includes analyzing and modifying existing software as well as designing, constructing, and testing end-user applications that meet user needs ó all through software programming languages.

Write operational documentation with technical authors

job_description:
The Role:

Overview

The responsibilities of our Platform team include building and maintaining all backend services, including, but not limited to, payments, analytics, subscriptions, new products, text to speech, and external APIs.

This is a key role and ideal for someone who thinks strategically, enjoys fast-paced environments, is passionate about making product decisions, and has experience building great user experiences that delight users.

We are a flat organization that allows anyone to become a leader by showing excellent technical skills and delivering results consistently and fast. Work ethic, solid communication skills, and obsession with winning are paramount.

Our interview process involves several technical interviews and we aim to complete them within 1 week.

What Youíll Do

King Abdullah University of Science and Technology: Researcher Positions: Biological and Environmental Science and Engineering Division

Location

King Abdullah University of Science and Technology

Open Date

Sep 06, 2021

Description

The Software Engineer for Marine Sciences will be instrumental in overseeing the software and database systems for the Red Sea Research Center and the IOP Ocean Observing System. This effort includes telemetered data streams, workflows for various types of oceanographic instrumentation and sampling regimes, a database structure to organize the data flow and to archive oceanographic data, a web application to explore and share data, and connectivity with a GIS system. It is expected that a supporting staff will be hired who will facilitate the user interface. Thus, the software engineer will have some supervisory responsibility.
ï Develop and improve the groupís web application and database system for archiving historical, present and future data sets from marine and oceanographic research.
ï Develop workflows for data streams from oceanographic autonomous vehicles, remote sensor sites, and various other instrumentation into the database.
ï Develop interfaces to distribute scientific data sets to adjoining systems, i.e. ArcGIS Server & Red Sea model.
ï Coordinate developments with scientists, IT Operations, GIS and visualization specialists.
ï Responsible for entire software development life cycle from design to deployment. ëYou Build It, You Run Ití.
ï Work with scientists and engineers to develop new capabilities for data measurement, telemetry, assimilation into operational models and archiving.
ï Work with external collaborators to facilitate exchange between, or linkage with, external databases.

Qualifications
ï Bachelor Degree in computer science, engineering or related discipline.
ï Experience with building scalable software and meeting user requirements.
ï 2-5 years of experience in a related effort.

Application Process

This institution is using Interfolio's Faculty Search to conduct this search. Applicants to this position receive a free Dossier account and can send all application materials, including confidential letters of recommendation, free of charge.
