MOZN is a leading Enterprise AI company enabling organizations to make informed decisions in two critical domains: Financial Crime Prevention and Enterprise Knowledge Intelligence.
Weíre a diverse, collaborative team of innovators united by a shared purpose: to build AI that delivers tangible business value, builds trust, and empowers people and organizations with augmented intelligence. Our culture is built on the relentless pursuit of excellence and meaningful impact.
If youíre passionate about working alongside exceptional talent on world-class AI, and you want the autonomy and runway to do the best work of your career, join us in shaping the future of intelligent enterprises.

About the role

The Principal AI Engineer is a senior technical leader within the Cloud Engineering organization, responsible for shaping and standardizing the companyís approach to agentic AI systems and MLOps excellence. This role bridges AI innovation and platform engineering ó ensuring that all AI workloads (LLMs, agents, and ML models) follow unified, production-grade, and compliant standards for scalability, performance, and observability.

You will define the blueprints, frameworks, and reference architectures for AI workloads across all product lines, partnering closely with AI researchers, data scientists, and platform engineers to enable secure, efficient, and repeatable AI delivery.

What you'll do
ï Establishing and maintaining AI and agentic architecture blueprints (RAG, orchestration, fine-tuning, prompt pipelines, etc.) within Cloud Engineering
ï Standardizing AI deployment practices using containerized and serverless inference patterns
ï Leading the adoption of model lifecycle management across environments (Dev ? Stage ? Prod)
ï Partnering with FinOps and Cloud Security to optimize cost, compliance, and control across AI workloads
ï Owning the MLOps reference stack (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Ray, Vertex AI, or custom platform)
ï Defining CI/CD for AI models including versioning, artifact tracking, and retraining workflows
ï Building reusable SDKs, APIs, and templates for AI pipeline integration with Cloud Engineering systems
ï Driving model observability and monitoring standards for drift, latency, and data integrity
ï Leading the design and enablement of agentic AI systems (LLM-driven orchestrators, tool-using agents, multi-agent frameworks)
ï Creating reference implementations and governance frameworks for RAG, memory, and action-based AI workflows.
ï Collaborating with product and data teams to move prototypes into secure, production-grade environments
ï Embedding AI security, data protection, and PDPL/GDPR compliance into the MLOps lifecycle
ï Defining model validation and explainability standards, ensuring auditability and traceability
ï Working with Cloud Security and Data teams on responsible AI controls and AIOps monitoring
ï Mentoring AI and ML engineers on scalable design patterns and operational excellence
ï Contributing to internal AI guilds, tech councils, and engineering playbooks.
ï Representing Cloud Engineering in AI ecosystem evaluations and cross-functional initiatives

Qualifications
ï 10+ years in software, ML, or AI engineering; 5+ years leading AI or ML systems in production
ï Expert in Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, and MLOps frameworks (Kubeflow, MLflow, Airflow, etc.)
ï Proven experience with LLM and agentic architectures, including LangChain, vLLM, Ray, or similar
ï Experience with cloud-native AI stacks (Vertex AI, SageMaker, Azure AI, OCI Data Science)
ï Strong understanding of distributed systems, data pipelines, and cloud orchestration (Kubernetes, GKE, EKS, AKS)
ï Track record of defining AI infrastructure standards in large or multi-tenant SaaS environments
Preferred Skills
ï Hands-on with vector databases (Pinecone, FAISS, Weaviate) and RAG pipelines
ï Familiarity with AI cost optimization, GPU utilization metrics, and inference scaling
ï Knowledge of AI safety, fairness, and bias mitigation frameworks
ï Graduate degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related discipline
Key Traits
ï Thinks platform-first, ensuring every AI innovation can scale reliably and securely
ï Balances deep AI knowledge with engineering pragmatism and DevOps fluency
ï Influences across domains ó from MLOps to Cloud to Security ó to enable unified AI delivery
ï Obsessed with automation, repeatability, and cost-efficient AI operations

Benefits
ï You will be at the forefront of an exciting time for the Middle East, joining a high-growth rocket-ship in an exciting space
ï You will be given a lot of responsibility and trust. We believe that the best results come when the people responsible for a function are given the freedom to do what they think is best
ï The fundamentals will be taken care of: competitive compensation, top-tier health insurance, and an enabling culture so that you can focus on what you do best
ï You will enjoy a fun and dynamic workplace working alongside some of the greatest minds in Al
ï We believe strength lies in difference, embracing all for who they are and empowered to be the best version of themselves

job_title: Model Accuracy Development and Test Engineer (Datacentre AI Engineering) - Riyadh, KSA
job_description:
Company:

Qualcomm Middle East Information Technology Company LLC
Job Area:

Engineering Group > Software Test Engineering
General Summary:
About Us

Qualcomm is enabling a world where everyone and everything can be intelligently connected. You interact with products and technologies made possible by Qualcomm every day, including 5G-enabled smartphones that double as pro-level cameras and gaming devices, smarter vehicles and cities, and the technology behind the smart, connected factories that manufactured your latest purchase. Qualcomm 5G and AI innovations are the power behind the connected intelligent edge. Youíll find our technologies behind and inside the innovations that deliver significant value across multiple industries and to billions of people every day.
About the Role

We are seeking an Inference Accuracy engineer to design, develop, and validate model accuracy of deep learning models deployed at scale. The role focuses on deep accuracy analysis, debugging, accuracy evaluation, and recovery during inference on large data?centre hardware platforms. You will have strong problem?solving ability, excellent Python programming skills, and hands?on expertise with inference pipelines.
Key Responsibilities
ï Define and implement accuracy KPIs across precision modes
ï Develop scalable Python?based accuracy evaluation tools and automated pipelines.
ï Implement accuracy?preserving optimizations for inference frameworks (TensorRT, ONNX Runtime, AITemplate, Triton).
ï Build and maintain automated pipelines for accuracy evaluation across multiple frameworks (ONNX, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
ï Develop reusable plugins for pre?processing, post?processing, and metric evaluation.
ï Execute comprehensive accuracy tests for large?scale models (LLMs, vision, diffusion).
ï Validate accuracy under various quantization and precision settings (FP32, FP16, INT8).
ï Perform accuracy analysis with deep understanding of model architecture, including layers, attention mechanisms, and parameter configurations.
ï Identify architecture?driven accuracy degradation trends and propose optimization strategies.
ï Identify issues related to pre?processing drift, tokenization mismatches, operator fallback, and quantization effects.
ï Analyse accuracy differences across hardware targets, firmware versions, and runtime backends.
ï Perform slice?based accuracy analysis (batch size, concurrency, sequence length, domain shifts).
ï Design and run experiments to recover accuracy, including fine?tuning, calibration, and hyperparameter adjustments.
ï Debug accuracy failures by tracing root causes across data pre?processing, model layers, quantization steps, and deployment pipelines.
ï Compare results across different hardware/software stacks and generate actionable insights.
ï Document workflows, maintain dashboards, and publish accuracy results for stakeholders.
Required Skills & Experience
ï Strong background in AI/ML model evaluation and accuracy metrics.
ï Solid understanding of model architectures (transformers, CNNs, RNNs, MoE) and their impact on accuracy.
ï Experience with large language models (LLMs) and generative AI accuracy validation.
ï Expertise with inference runtimes (TensorRT, ONNX Runtime, Triton).
ï Understanding of quantization (INT8/FP8/INT4), calibration, QAT, and accuracy trade?offs.
ï Experience with model graph conversion (PyTorch ? ONNX ? backend engines).
ï Hands?on experience with accuracy pipeline development and automation frameworks. Understanding of video generation model accuracy and multi?modal evaluation benchmarking.
ï Proficiency in Python and familiarity with ML toolkits (ONNX Runtime, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
ï Expertise in accuracy analysis, including statistical methods and visualization tools.
ï Ability to design experiments for accuracy recovery and debug accuracy failures effectively.
ï Knowledge of quantization techniques and mixed?precision workflows.
ï Experience with data?centre accelerators (NVIDIA A100/H100/B200, AI100 Ultra, Gaudi, TPU).
ï Knowledge of LLM accuracy evaluation tools (lm?eval, HELM, synthetic benchmarks) is an advantage.
ï Strong problem?solving and analytical skills with the ability to isolate complex accuracy issues.
ï Familiarity with distributed deployment systems (Kubernetes, cloud inference services).
Required Qualifications
ï Bachelor's / Masters degree in Engineering, Machine learning/ AI, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
ï 4?10 yearsí of Software Engineering or related work experience.
ï 4?10 yearsí experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Python.
What's on Offer
ï Salary including housing & transport allowance
ï Stock (RSU's) and performance related bonus \ paid Maternity Leave
ï 6 weeks fully paid Paternity Leave
ï Employee stock purchase scheme
ï Child Education Allowance
ï if needed)
ï Life and Medical Insurance
ï Live+ Well Reimbursement for health and recreational membership fees
Minimum Qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
ï Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Software Engineering or related work experience.
ï PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
ï 2+ years of academic or work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.

References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.

Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail View email address on click.appcast.io or call Qualcomm's toll?free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).

Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

The platform integrates marketing automation tools such as Drip Marketing, Broadcast Campaigns, and Click-to-Whats App Ads to deliver personalized messages and enhance customer engagement. With its innovative solutions, OnDemand establishes itself as an essential partner for Saudi businesses seeking streamlined communication and growth.

You will work hands-on with LLMs, APIs, automation platforms, and cloud AI services to build intelligent, secure, and scalable solutions used by real customers.
? What Youíll Do
Build AI-Powered Products:Design and develop production-ready applications using Open AI API, Google Gemini API, and multimodal models, focusing on real-world business use cases.
API & Integrations:Lead integrations with third-party systems, internal services, messaging platforms, and data sources. Build robust, scalable API-based architectures.

AI Automation:Design intelligent workflows using n8n for document processing, customer interactions, notifications, and system orchestration using LLMs.
Infrastructure & Deployment:Deploy AI solutions on cloud environments (GCP / AWS / Azure) or on-premise GPU servers. Build and maintain secure, scalable MLOps / LLMOps pipelines.
Cost Optimization:Estimate, monitor, and optimize AI compute and inference costs. Propose cost-efficient architectures suitable for startup scale.
Research & Innovation:Stay up to date with the latest AI tools and frameworks, experiment rapidly, and translate research into production features.

Strong hands-on experience with Open AI API, Google Gemini API, and Vertex AI Platform
Proven experience building API-first systems and integrations
Proficiency with n8n for automation and orchestration
Experience deploying AI models and working with cloud platforms (GCP/AWS/Azure) and GPU infrastructure
Solid understanding of LLMs, finetuning, evaluation, and prompt engineering
Experience with AI cost modeling and optimization
Startup mindset: ownership, speed, and product-focused thinking
Nice to Have
Experience with Lang Chain or Llama Index
Background in MLOps / Dev Ops
Experience building B2B Saa S or AI platforms
Familiarity with data privacy and compliance best practices

ROLE OVERVIEW

We are seeking an AI Engineer to design and build applications leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques. The role involves prototyping finetuning and deploying AI powered solutions while ensuring performance scalability and alignment with business objectives.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
ï Develop integrate and optimize AI applications using LLM APIs (e.g. OpenAI Anthropic).
ï Implement RAG pipelines with vector databases and retrieval mechanisms.
ï Design test and refine prompts for effective model performance.
ï Integrate AI models with backend services and APIs.
ï Collaborate with developers and product teams to bring AI solutions into production.
ï Apply basic MLOps practices to ensure scalable deployment and monitoring.

QUALIFICATIONS
ï Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science AI Data Science or related field.
ï 4 years of software development experience including at least 2 years in AI/ML.
ï Proficiency in Python and familiarity with frameworks (LangChain LangGraph).
ï Experience with vector databases (Pinecone Weaviate FAISS).
ï Knowledge of RAG architectures embeddings and LLM optimization.
ï Strong problem-solving experimentation and debugging skills.

Preferred Skills
ï Experience with cloud AI platforms (Azure AWS GCP).
ï Exposure to MLOps tools (MLflow Kubeflow Docker).
ï Understanding of ethical AI bias mitigation and security practices.

Vertical

Technology

job_description:
The AI Innovation Engineer is a critical member of Master Worksí Innovation Department, responsible for driving the design and delivery of AI-powered PoCs and MVPs that solve real business challenges. This role requires a unique blend of engineering excellence, creativity, and applied research mindset to translate cutting-edge AI capabilities -especially those built on large language models (LLMs)-into functional and validated digital solutions. You will lead AI initiative execution across a variety of domains by leveraging pre-trained models, advanced orchestration techniques, and innovative workflows. Your primary development stack will be Python and modern AI libraries. You will also bridge innovation delivery by building lightweight APIs or frontends using Node.js and React when needed to complete a prototype or MVP.

Requirements
ï Design and deliver AI-driven PoCs and MVPs that directly support strategic innovation goals across Master Works and its subsidiaries.
ï Develop full-stack AI systems with Python at the coreóusing frameworks like FastAPI, Transformers, LangChain, Haystack, and PyTorchóto implement AI pipelines and intelligent service components.
ï Integrate and orchestrate LLMs using: - Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) - - - - Knowledge-Augmented Generation (KAG) Model Context Protocol (MCP) Multi-agent orchestration and A2A workflows Prompt engineering and fine-tuning where applicable
ï Interface with LLM providers (OpenAI, Claude, Groq, Cohere, open-source models) through APIs and SDKs, optimizing model utility and cost-efficiency.
ï Design and manage vector-based search architectures using tools like ChromaDB, Weaviate, Pinecone, or FAISS.
ï Prototype interaction layers, visual interfaces, and lightweight dashboards using Node.js and React, especially for showcasing PoC/MVP deliverables.
ï Collaborate with business stakeholders to shape and prioritize AI use cases, ensuring alignment with internal innovation streams and subsidiary needs.
ï Evaluate, benchmark, and refine AI models for accuracy, performance, and business relevance.
ï Create internal documentation, reusable components, and technical guidelines to support scaling and knowledge sharing.
ï Stay up to date with emerging AI trends and continuously integrate relevant new methods into practice.

Required Qualifications:
ï Bachelorís or Masterís degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Engineering, or a related technical field.
ï 5+ years of hands-on experience delivering AI-based systems with tangible outcomes.
ï Demonstrated mastery of Python for building AI workflows, services, and integrations using leading AI/ML frameworks. Proven experience in developing and integrating LLM-based applications using APIs, SDKs, and orchestration tools.
ï Solid knowledge of RAG, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt tuning techniques.
ï Familiarity with autonomous agent design patterns (e.g., A2A, task chaining, multi-agent flow control).
ï Working knowledge of Node.js and React for full-stack PoC/MVP assembly.
ï Strong experience with cloud-native development, containerization (e.g., Docker), and modern development practices.

Preferred Qualifications
ï Experience building Arabic-aware NLP solutions or localized AI models (e.g., Najdi dialect adaptation, intent classification in Arabic).
ï Background in deploying AI innovations in government, defense, or regulated sectors. Experience working in high-velocity innovation teams or R&D-style workstreams.
ï Familiarity with tools like MLflow, LangSmith, or Weights & Biases for experiment tracking.
ï Contributions to AI open-source initiatives, technical publications, or public demos is a plus.

Core Competencies:
ï Innovation-first mindset with ability to rapidly turn ideas into working prototypes.
ï Strong ownership, able to independently manage priorities and delivery.
ï Analytical thinker with the ability to simplify complex technical ideas.
ï Results-driven with a focus on experimentation and measurable outcomes.
ï Excellent communication skills, capable of articulating technical ideas to diverse stakeholders.
ï Ability to work in multi-disciplinary teams and dynamic business environments.
ï Passion for AI and continuous learning of emerging tools, models, and practices.

job_title: Senior AI Engineer - Data & Infrastructure for Multimodal Models (100  Remote)
job_description:
Overview

Senior AI Engineer - Data & Infrastructure for Multimodal Models (100% Remote)

Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance. At Tether, we're not just building products, we're pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businessesófrom exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMsóto seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether. Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world's most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services. Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities. Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing. Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, empowering individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity. Tether Evolution: Pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways. Why Join Us? Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you're passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.
About The Job

We're seeking experienced AI infrastructure Engineers to design and implement robust, scalable pipelines for massive data workloads. Join Tether's applied research team, where you'll contribute to high-impact projects that run across thousands of GPUs and drive cutting-edge video generation foundation development.
Responsibilities
ï Build and scale high-throughput data infrastructure optimized for video and multimodal content processing across large GPU clusters (e.g., H100/H200).
ï Design core preprocessing algorithms for video, audio, text, and image modalities, enabling efficient extraction, synchronization, and normalization of temporal data.
ï Build automated acquisition pipelines for sourcing large-scale video datasets, handling diverse formats, frame rates, annotations, and embedded audio.
ï Architect robust systems for scalable evaluation and annotation, including prompt-based scoring, perceptual metrics, caption generation, and retrieval-based diagnostics.
ï Collaborate with model researchers to co-design video model architectures (e.g. DiTs, VAEs, spatio-temporal transformers) and training schedules across pretraining and fine-tuning stages.
ï Optimize distributed data loading and pipeline throughput for training at scale, ensuring robustness across model variants and modality combinations.
ï Manage infrastructure to support experiment tracking, model versioning, and cross-team deployment workflows, integrating with production and research platforms.
ï Support backend engineering across research, product, and creative teams to ensure seamless integration of data and model workflows from prototyping to inference.
ï Proficient in Python with strong programming skills across backend, infrastructure, and data tooling domains.
ï Strong software engineering experience, including 2+ years working with petabyte-scale data pipelines and systems across thousands of GPUs.
ï Proven ability to architect and maintain large-scale distributed systems for data processing and delivery.
ï Deep expertise in orchestration frameworks such as Kubernetes and SLURM with hands-on experience deploying and managing high-throughput workloads.
Preferred Qualifications
ï Practical experience on building pipelines and infrastructure with visual and multimodal datasets, including image/video pipelines.
ï Experience in building video foundation infrastructure pipelines and workflows with collaboration of LLM and/or video foundation research and engineering teams is a strong advantage.
Important information for candidates
ï Recruitment scams have become increasingly common. To protect yourself, please keep the following in mind when applying for roles: Apply only through our official channels. We do not use third-party platforms or agencies for recruitment unless clearly stated. All open roles are listed on our official careers page: https://tether.recruitee.com/
ï Verify the recruiter's identity. All our recruiters have verified LinkedIn profiles. If you're unsure, you can confirm their identity by checking their profile or contacting us through our website.
ï Be cautious of unusual communication methods. We do not conduct interviews over WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS. All communication is done through official company emails and platforms.
ï Double-check email addresses. All communication from us will come from emails ending in @tether.to or @tether.io
ï We will never request payment or financial details. If someone asks for personal financial information or payment at any point during the hiring process, it is a scam. Please report it immediately.

When in doubt, feel free to reach out through our official website.

job_description:
Mirai, a Scopely company based in Riyadh, is building transformative AI solutions focused on enhancing productivity, automation, and data-driven decision-making within the companyís internal operations and enterprise platforms.

Mirai is a subsidiary of Scopely, a global interactive entertainment and mobile-first video game company, home to many top, award-winning experiences such as "MONOPOLY GO!," ìStar Trekô Fleet Command,î ìStumble Guys,î ìMARVEL Strike Force,î and ìYahtzeeÆ With Buddies,î among others. Recognized multiple times as one of Fast Companyís ìWorldís Most Innovative Companies,î Scopely is a multi-billion-dollar business due to its ability to create long-lasting interactive experiences that players enjoy for years. Scopely has global operations in more than a dozen markets across Asia, EMEA, and North America, and is home to many internal game development teams, referred to as Scopely Studios, with additional game studio partners across four continents.

Scopely was acquired by Savvy Games Group in July 2023 and is now an independent subsidiary of Savvy. Established in 2021 by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF), Savvy Games Group is a games and esports company formed with a mission to drive the long-term growth and development of the broader technology and innovation industry worldwide.

We are looking for a Lead Full Stack Engineer who will guide a talented team of engineers in our Gen AI team in Riyadh, in building end-to-end AI-powered products. You will play a key role in designing scalable systems, mentoring developers, and ensuring technical excellence across our AI and gaming platforms.

Leadership & Team Management
ï Lead, mentor, and grow a team of full-stack engineers working on GenAI products and internal platforms
ï Collaborate with product managers, designers, and AI engineers to define technical strategy and execution plans
ï Conduct regular code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and uphold engineering best practices
ï Guide the team in architectural decisions, ensuring scalability, performance, and maintainability
ï Drive sprint planning, task prioritization, and delivery of high-impact features

job_title: Senior AI Engineer, IgniteTech (Remote) ñ $100,000/year USD
job_description:
The software development industry is rapidly evolving, driven by the imperative to enhance development speed, reduce human error, and elevate code quality. These enhancements are crucial as they correlate directly with faster product time-to-market and heightened customer satisfaction. The average time for software deployment has historically lagged due to traditional coding practices, with an estimated 30% of projects exceeding their timeline due to inefficiencies and errors.

IgniteTech is leading the transformation, integrating advanced GenAI technologies to redefine software architecture and development. Unlike traditional roles that focus on incremental improvements, this position offers the thrilling opportunity to lead pivotal AI-driven initiatives. You will be at the forefront of integrating AI to not just enhance, but revolutionize software development processes and outcomes, significantly boosting efficiency and competitiveness on a strategic level.

This role is designed for those who are driven to be at the cutting edge of technology and innovation. It is not merely an operational or task-oriented position; it is a strategic role that involves extensive research and development, prototyping, and the application of AI in crafting next-generation software solutions. Ideal candidates are those who are not only proficient in AI and software architecture but are also visionary in their approach to leveraging technology for business innovation.

In this role, you will lead our team in shaping the architectural frameworks and strategies that integrate AI into our software solutions. This role is integral to our mission, and your work will directly influence the productivity and quality of our deliverables. We invite you to join us if you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and eager to make a tangible impact in the software industry.

We are seeking an experienced AI Engineer with hands-on expertise in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to design, build, and deploy AI solutions powered by Large Language Models (LLMs). The role focuses on integrating LLMs with enterprise data sources to deliver accurate, secure, and scalable AI applications. Key Responsibilities Design and implement RAG pipelines using structured and [Ö]

This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: EMEA

AI at Zapier

At Zapier, we build and use automation every day to make work more efficient, creative, and human. So if youíre using AI tools while applying here - thatís great! We just ask that you use them responsibly and transparently.

Check out our guidance on How to Collaborate with AI During Zapierís Hiring Process, including how to use AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, or others during our hiring process - and when not to.

Hi there!

Zapier is hiring for an Applied AI Engineer to help us build the future of automation with AI at its core. If you care about shipping real products, solving hard problems with large language models, and creating tools that help others build fasteróthis is your kind of role.

Weíre hiring acrossteams, each with their own flavor of AI work. Youíll work on things like shared libraries, evaluation systems, orchestration patterns, or user-facing featuresódepending on the team. What they all have in common: youíll ship to production, own meaningful problems, and make an impact across the company.

Even though our job description may seem like we're looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the person who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you meet these criteria:

About You
ï You have 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 3 of those years dedicated to building distributed, scalable cloud based web applications. You possess strong communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and a drive to deliver outstanding customer experiences for both external users and internal stakeholders.
ï You have at least 1 year of experience working with large language models (LLMs) to perform complex tasks in production environments. You experimented with build user facing leveraging agent architectures.
ï Youíre familiar with underlying technologies like transformer networks, attention mechanisms, and how they contribute to modelsí abilities to generate coherent responses, generate function calls, and perform other language tasks.
ï You have likely deployed evaluation frameworks for LLMs, with an understanding on performance, reliability, and bias assessment.
ï You likely have experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems and understand how to optimize knowledge retrieval for improved model accuracy and speed. You likely have experience with different indexing and chunking strategies based on the systemís data and goals, as well as semantic search and vector databases, and how they differ from traditional retrieval methods and databases.
ï You have experience of working through the full lifecycle of building, testing, deploying, and scaling LLM architectures.
ï You can identify and document trade-offs made during the development process. You also have experience building with cloud infrastructure technologies.
ï You love shipping to customers. Youíll be on a team focused on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from specifications into functional, production-ready code. You know how to balance speed versus quality to support the features we build for our customers.
ï You embody our values. At Zapier, our values are at the heart of how we work together and how we think about our customers. In our remote setting, they help develop trust and ensure we work and collaborate to democratize automation.

Things Youíll Do
ï You understand that AI-based applications thrive on data-driven feedback loops, which will be central to any system you develop. These loops will capture and instrument user data, synthesize core use cases, and implement/test strategies with LLMs to enhance performance.
ï You will be responsible for integrating LLMs into software products at Zapier, which will include setting up the necessary infrastructure to ensure performance, scalability, and reliability.
ï You will work mostly in Python or TypeScript. Experience isnít strictly required, but it is a big plus. Comfort with typed languages and modern backend practices is a must.
ï You will build tooling and infrastructure that enables teams to iterate on AI products faster, without sacrificing safety or reliability.
ï You will improve the state of cost observability across all teams, and work with individual teams to optimize spend for their products.
ï You will monitor the performance and health of AI systems, proactively detecting and addressing issues such as system failures and performance degradation.
ï You will collaborate with Data and cross-functional teams to refine and deploy LLM-based features.

If youíre interested in advancing your career at a fast-growing, profitable, impact-driven company, then read onÖ
ï Our Commitment to Applicants
ï Culture and Values at Zapier
ï Zapier Guide to Remote Work
ï Zapier Code of Conduct
ï Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

Difference between an Applied AI Engineer and an ML Engineer at Zapier:

How do we discern between other AI-forward engineering roles like ML Engineers and Applied AI Engineers? Both roles benefit from backend engineering skills and experience with LLMs.
ï ML engineers are expected to have more experience building data pipelines as well as experience utilizing other types of ML models beyond LLMs.
ï AI engineers are expected to have more full stack engineering experience, which would typically include frontend experience, and may only have experience working with LLMs.

How to Apply

At Zapier, we believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make us better, which is why we have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We're looking for the best fit for each of our roles, regardless of the type of companies in your background, so we encourage you to apply even if your skills and experiences donít exactly match the job description. All we ask is that you answer a few in-depth questions in our application that would typically be asked at the start of an interview process. This helps speed things up by letting us get to know you and your skillset a bit better right out of the gate. Please be sure to answer each question; the resume and CV fields are optional.

Education is not a requirement for our roles; however, if you receive an offer, you will need to include your most recent educational experience as part of our background check process.

After you apply, you are going to hear back from usóeven if we donít see an immediate fit with our team. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to never go more than seven days without letting you know the status of your application. We know weíll make mistakes from time to time, so if you ever have questions about where you stand or about the process, just ask your recruiter!

Zapier is an equal-opportunity employer and we're excited to work with talented and empathetic people of all identities. Zapier does not discriminate based on someone's identity in any aspect of hiring or employment as required by law and in line with our commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base. Zapier will consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

Zapier prioritizes the security of our customers' information and is dedicated to adhering to all applicable data privacy laws. You can review our privacy policy here.

Zapier is committed to inclusion. As part of this commitment, Zapier welcomes applications from individuals with disabilities and will work to provide reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.

Application Deadline:

The anticipated application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later, or if the position is filled.

Even though weíre an all-remote company, we still need to be thoughtful about where we have Zapiens working. Check out this resource for a list of countries where we currently cannot have Zapiens permanently working.

job_description:
About the role

The Principal AI Engineer is a senior technical leader within the Cloud Engineering organization, responsible for shaping and standardizing the company's approach to agentic AI systems and MLOps excellence. This role bridges AI innovation and platform engineering ó ensuring that all AI workloads (LLMs, agents, and ML models) follow unified, production-grade, and compliant standards for scalability, performance, and observability.

You will define the blueprints, frameworks, and reference architectures for AI workloads across all product lines, partnering closely with AI researchers, data scientists, and platform engineers to enable secure, efficient, and repeatable AI delivery.

What you'll do
ï Establishing and maintaining AI and agentic architecture blueprints (RAG, orchestration, fine-tuning, prompt pipelines, etc.) within Cloud Engineering
ï Standardizing AI deployment practices using containerized and serverless inference patterns
ï Leading the adoption of model lifecycle management across environments (Dev ? Stage ? Prod)
ï Partnering with FinOps and Cloud Security to optimize cost, compliance, and control across AI workloads
ï Owning the MLOps reference stack (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Ray, Vertex AI, or custom platform)
ï Defining CI/CD for AI models including versioning, artifact tracking, and retraining workflows
ï Building reusable SDKs, APIs, and templates for AI pipeline integration with Cloud Engineering systems
ï Driving model observability and monitoring standards for drift, latency, and data integrity
ï Leading the design and enablement of agentic AI systems (LLM-driven orchestrators, tool-using agents, multi-agent frameworks)
ï Creating reference implementations and governance frameworks for RAG, memory, and action-based AI workflows.
ï Collaborating with product and data teams to move prototypes into secure, production-grade environments
ï Embedding AI security, data protection, and PDPL/GDPR compliance into the MLOps lifecycle
ï Defining model validation and explainability standards, ensuring auditability and traceability
ï Working with Cloud Security and Data teams on responsible AI controls and AIOps monitoring
ï Mentoring AI and ML engineers on scalable design patterns and operational excellence
ï Contributing to internal AI guilds, tech councils, and engineering playbooks.
ï Representing Cloud Engineering in AI ecosystem evaluations and cross-functional initiatives

Qualifications
ï 10+ years in software, ML, or AI engineering; 5+ years leading AI or ML systems in production
ï Expert in Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, and MLOps frameworks (Kubeflow, MLflow, Airflow, etc.)
ï Proven experience with LLM and agentic architectures, including LangChain, vLLM, Ray, or similar
ï Experience with cloud-native AI stacks (Vertex AI, SageMaker, Azure AI, OCI Data Science)
ï Strong understanding of distributed systems, data pipelines, and cloud orchestration (Kubernetes, GKE, EKS, AKS)
ï Track record of defining AI infrastructure standards in large or multi-tenant SaaS environments
Preferred Skills
ï Hands-on with vector databases (Pinecone, FAISS, Weaviate) and RAG pipelines
ï Familiarity with AI cost optimization, GPU utilization metrics, and inference scaling
ï Knowledge of AI safety, fairness, and bias mitigation frameworks
ï Graduate degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related discipline
Key Traits
ï Thinks platform-first, ensuring every AI innovation can scale reliably and securely
ï Balances deep AI knowledge with engineering pragmatism and DevOps fluency
ï Influences across domains ó from MLOps to Cloud to Security ó to enable unified AI delivery
ï Obsessed with automation, repeatability, and cost-efficient AI operations

Benefits
ï You will be at the forefront of an exciting time for the Middle East, joining a high-growth rocket-ship in an exciting space
ï You will be given a lot of responsibility and trust. We believe that the best results come when the people responsible for a function are given the freedom to do what they think is best
ï The fundamentals will be taken care of: competitive compensation, top-tier health insurance, and an enabling culture so that you can focus on what you do best
ï You will enjoy a fun and dynamic workplace working alongside some of the greatest minds in Al
ï We believe strength lies in difference, embracing all for who they are and empowered to be the best version of themselves

About Polygon Labs

Polygon Labs is a software development company building and developing a network of aggregated blockchains via the Agglayer, secured by Ethereum. As public infrastructure, the Agglayer will bring together user bases and liquidity for any connected chain, and leverage Ethereum as a settlement layer. Polygon Labs has also contributed to the core development of several widely-adopted scaling protocols and tools for launching blockchains, including Agglayer CDK, Polygon PoS & Katana.

Your Role

Weíre looking for a staff-level, hands-on engineer at the intersection of Developer Productivity, DevEx, and AI to make our engineering organization more effective.

In this role, youíll identify bottlenecks across the developer lifecycle (planning ? coding ? review ? testing ? release ? incident response ? onboarding) and build internal tools and agentic workflows that measurably improve delivery speed and quality.

Youíll operate with an AI-first mindset: rapidly experiment with the latest coding agents and AI workflow patterns to see whatís possible today, forecast whatís likely to become viable in the next 3ñ6 months, and pragmatically fall back to conventional tooling when AI isnít the right fit. Youíll own discovery, roadmap, and backlog end-to-end, run short data-driven trials, and productionize what works.

Youíll work closely with the CTO, Engineering, DevOps/Infrastructure, Security, and Product to ensure everything integrates cleanly into existing workflows and raises the bar on quality, not just speed.

Your Responsibilities
ï Design and implement agentic workflows for requirements clarification, planning, PR generation, and refinement, with human-in-the-loop and safety gates by default.
ï Develop internal tools across IDEs, GitHub, Slack, and web apps to accelerate the SDLC and create consistent ìgolden paths.î
ï Build and maintain integrations with internal systems (CI, docs, metrics, task trackers) to enable context-rich agent behavior.
ï Automate high-leverage workflows like refactors, scaffolding, test generation, and documentation updates with LLM and AST-based tools.

What You'll Need

Mentorship, regular feedback, and peer learning sessions will empower you to sharpen your technical skills and contribute tangible value to live projects enjoyed by millions of players worldwide.
This internship is your opportunity to kick-start a career in game AI, collaborate with world-class talent, and support Miraiís mission to redefine games from Saudi Arabia for the global stage.

ï Contribute to the GenAI Suite: product description generation, email and blog content creation, landing page design, and brand-aware tone control
ï Lead experimentation on new LLM orchestration frameworks (LangGraph, semantic routers) and scalable deployment using Bedrock, SageMaker, or Vertex AI
ï Mentor junior data scientists and define best practices for versioning, prompt evaluation, and observability (e.g., LangFuse, MLflow, Grafana)

Who They Are:
ï This company is building the future of commerce AI in the Middle East, powering millions of merchants with intelligent assistants and Gen AI that understands Arabic and English fluently. As our Senior/Staff GenAI, you'll architect the brain behind our merchant and customer AI assistants, content generation suite, and conversational commerce platform. This isn't just another chatbot role, you'll design cutting-edge agentic AI systems that can reason about inventory, write compelling Arabic marketing copy, troubleshoot merchant issues, and generate insights from millions of transactions. Your work will directly impact how merchants across the region run their businesses.

ï 5+ years of experience in applied ML/NLP, including 2+ years building and deploying LLM-based systems in production
ï Proven impact: Delivered or scaled LLM products serving 100K+ users or handling 1M+ queries per day
ï Technical depth: Solid understanding of transformer architectures, RAG design and optimization, prompt engineering, and LLM evaluation techniques
ï Systems thinking: Experience with distributed systems, async workflows, vector search, and caching strategies for latency-sensitive workloads
ï Commerce awareness: Familiarity with e-commerce metrics, merchant pain points, and marketplace platform dynamics
ï Communication: Comfortable translating complex ML systems into actionable insights for non-technical and leadership stakeholders
ï Marketplace / SaaS platform experience

Benefits:

ï Competitive salary/package

About Q

Q is a large-scale
retail and e-commerce company
operating in the consumer market with a strong and growing customer base.

We serve a high-volume, real-world retail operation combined with a rapidly expanding digital platform, where technology is a core driver of customer experience, efficiency, and scale.

Our products are used daily by real customers, and our systems operate under real production pressure.

This environment demands AI systems that are reliable, practical, and deeply integrated into the product, not experimental or theoretical.

We are looking for a
Senior / Principal Applied AI Engineer
to lead the
design and hands-on implementation
of the core AI layer within the
Q
application.

AI at Q is
not an experiment, not a cosmetic feature, and not a side add-on
.

It is a fundamental part of the product and the customer experience. This role will have a direct impact on how users interact with the application and make their daily decisions faster and smarter.

This is a
hands on execution and technical planning role
.

It is
not
a managerial or supervisory position. We are looking for an engineer who builds systems, plans them, and takes full ownership of their success in production.

Role Core

You will be responsible for designing and building
end-to-end AI systems
that run in production inside the application, from initial concept to full-scale deployment.

The goal is not to build a superficial chatbot, but a real intelligent system that:
ï Understands the user and their intent.
ï Saves users time and effort.
ï Delivers what truly fits their needs within the Q experience.
ï Operates reliably at scale in a real-world production environment.

Scope of Responsibility
ï Design and build production-grade AI systems based on Large Language Models (LLMs).
ï Build and operate RAG systems and connect models to Q's data and systems via tools and APIs.
ï Own the full AI system lifecycle: design, development, evaluation, deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement.
ï Make informed technical decisions that directly impact experience quality, performance, and cost.
ï Work closely with product and engineering teams to understand user behavior and translate it into executable intelligent logic.
ï Drive long-term technical planning while remaining deeply involved in hands-on execution.

Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)
ï Proven experience building
AI systems that reached production
and are actively used by real users.
ï Experience working within product teams and companies,
not freelance projects or experimental prototypes
.
ï A clear track record of delivering end-to-end systems that handle daily production load.
ï Experience working on large-scale consumer products or platforms.

Knowledge and Capabilities
ï Deep understanding of how to apply Large Language Models within real products.
ï Strong experience designing and implementing RAG systems connected to live data.
ï Ability to choose technical solutions based on
customer value and business impact
, not technical novelty.
ï Strong proficiency in Python or a suitable language for building production AI systems.
ï Real understanding of user experience and how it translates into system logic and decision-making.
ï Ability to balance quality, performance, and cost.

What Sets the Ideal Candidate Apart
ï Has built systems that run in production, not demos or proofs of concept.
ï Thinks like both an engineer and a product builder.
ï Sees AI as a tool to serve users, not an end in itself.
ï Operates with full ownership and accountability for outcomes after launch.

Important Notes
ï This role is
not managerial
.
ï This role is
not research or academic
.
ï We are looking for an engineer who plans, builds, and executes systems the product truly depends on.

Why Join Q
ï You will work on a
real product with real users
, not internal tools or experimental labs.
ï Your work will have
direct, visible impact
on customer experience and business outcomes.
ï You will help build a core AI system from the ground up, not optimize a marginal feature.
ï You will operate with a high level of technical ownership and trust.
ï You will be part of a company that values clarity, execution, and long-term system thinking over hype.

If you are looking to build AI systems that matter, scale, and truly serve users Q is the place to do it.

Job Overview:
We are seeking a talented and motivated AI Engineer with expertise in Large Language Models (LLMs), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Speech-to-Text technologies. As part of our dynamic team, you will develop, implement, and optimize cutting-edge AI solutions to improve our products and services. Your work will focus on leveraging language models, building NLP systems, and integrating speech-to-text technologies for seamless communication and enhanced user experiences.

Experience: 8+ years

Location: Riyadh, KSA (5 Days work from office)

Working Days: Sunday to Thursday

Language requirement: Must be fluent in Arabic

Key Responsibilities:
ï LLM Development & Integration:
ï Fine-tune and deploy large language models for specific applications, such as chatbots, content generation, and customer support.
ï Evaluate and improve the performance of LLMs in real-world scenarios.
ï NLP System Design:
ï Design and implement NLP algorithms for tasks like text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
ï Work with large datasets to train and validate NLP models.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address language-based challenges.
ï Speech-to-Text Implementation:
ï Develop and optimize speech-to-text pipelines for various languages and dialects.
ï Integrate speech recognition systems with NLP and LLM solutions for end-to-end functionality.
ï Stay updated on the latest advancements in automatic speech recognition (ASR).
ï Performance Optimization:
ï Enhance AI model efficiency for scalability and real-time processing.
ï Address biases, improve accuracy, and ensure robustness in all models.
ï Research and Innovation:
ï Stay abreast of the latest research in LLM, NLP, and speech technologies.

job_title: Senior AI Engineer - Data & Infrastructure for Multimodal Models (100% Remote)
job_description:
Overview
Senior AI Engineer - Data & Infrastructure for Multimodal Models (100% Remote)
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance. At Tether, weíre not just building products, weíre pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businessesófrom exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMsóto seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.
Innovate with Tether. Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the worldís most trusted stablecoin,
USDT , relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services. Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities. Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like
KEET , our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing. Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, empowering individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity. Tether Evolution: Pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways. Why Join Us? Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If youíre passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards.
If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.
About The Job
Weíre seeking experienced AI infrastructure Engineers to design and implement robust, scalable pipelines for massive data workloads. Join Tetherís applied research team, where youíll contribute to high-impact projects that run across thousands of GPUs and drive cutting-edge video generation foundation development.
Responsibilities
Build and scale high-throughput data infrastructure optimized for video and multimodal content processing across large GPU clusters (e.g., H100/H200).
Design core preprocessing algorithms for video, audio, text, and image modalities, enabling efficient extraction, synchronization, and normalization of temporal data.
Build automated acquisition pipelines for sourcing large-scale video datasets, handling diverse formats, frame rates, annotations, and embedded audio.
Architect robust systems for scalable evaluation and annotation, including prompt-based scoring, perceptual metrics, caption generation, and retrieval-based diagnostics.
Collaborate with model researchers to co-design video model architectures (e.g. DiTs, VAEs, spatio-temporal transformers) and training schedules across pretraining and fine-tuning stages.
Optimize distributed data loading and pipeline throughput for training at scale, ensuring robustness across model variants and modality combinations.
Manage infrastructure to support experiment tracking, model versioning, and cross-team deployment workflows, integrating with production and research platforms.
Support backend engineering across research, product, and creative teams to ensure seamless integration of data and model workflows from prototyping to inference.
Proficient in Python with strong programming skills across backend, infrastructure, and data tooling domains.
Strong software engineering experience, including 2+ years working with petabyte-scale data pipelines and systems across thousands of GPUs.
Proven ability to architect and maintain large-scale distributed systems for data processing and delivery.
Deep expertise in orchestration frameworks such as Kubernetes and SLURM with hands-on experience deploying and managing high-throughput workloads.
Preferred Qualifications
Practical experience on building pipelines and infrastructure with visual and multimodal datasets, including image/video pipelines.
Experience in building video foundation infrastructure pipelines and workflows with collaboration of LLM and/or video foundation research and engineering teams is a strong advantage.
Important information for candidates
Recruitment scams have become increasingly common. To protect yourself, please keep the following in mind when applying for roles: Apply only through our official channels. We do not use third-party platforms or agencies for recruitment unless clearly stated. All open roles are listed on our official careers page: https://tether.recruitee.com/
Verify the recruiterís identity. All our recruiters have verified LinkedIn profiles. If youíre unsure, you can confirm their identity by checking their profile or contacting us through our website.
Be cautious of unusual communication methods. We do not conduct interviews over WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS. All communication is done through official company emails and platforms.
Double-check email addresses. All communication from us will come from emails ending in @tether.to or @tether.io
We will never request payment or financial details. If someone asks for personal financial information or payment at any point during the hiring process, it is a scam. Please report it immediately.
When in doubt, feel free to reach out through our official website.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

job_description:
M¸ller's Solutions is on the lookout for a Business Intelligence Engineer with expertise in Qlik and Qlik Sense. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing BI solutions that provide strategic insights across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and create reports, dashboards, and analytical applications that enable data-driven decision-making.
Responsibilities:
ï Design, develop, and maintain Qlik and Qlik Sense dashboards and reports that meet user requirements.
ï Work closely with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements for BI solutions.
ï Transform raw data into meaningful insights by extracting, cleaning, and organizing data from multiple sources.
ï Implement data models that support efficient querying and reporting.
ï Optimize performance of existing dashboards and reports, ensuring they are user-friendly and accessible.
ï Stay updated on best practices and advancements in BI technologies and Qlik tools.
ï Provide training and support to users to enhance their understanding of BI tools and data literacy.
ï Collaborate with IT to ensure data integrity, security, and proper governance protocols are maintained.

Requirements
ï Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
ï Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Engineer, specifically with Qlik and Qlik Sense.
ï Strong proficiency in data visualization and reporting using Qlik tools.
ï Experience with SQL and data extraction from relational databases.
ï Proficient in data modeling and ETL processes.
ï Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to translate complex data into actionable insights.
ï Strong communication skills to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
ï Ability to work collaboratively across teams and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
ï Understanding of data governance principles and best practices.
ï Familiarity with other BI tools and technologies is a plus.

Benefits

Why Join Us:

Opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Exciting projects and innovative work environment.

## Full Description
The purpose of an AI engineer position is to design, develop, and implement artificial intelligence solutions to address complex problems and enhance processes within an organization. This role aims to leverage advanced algorithms, machine learning, and deep learning techniques to create intelligent systems that can analyze data, make predictions, and automate tasks. Ultimately, the AI engineer contributes to technological innovation, improves efficiency, and helps the organization stay competitive by harnessing the power of artificial intelligence in various applications, such as data analysis, image recognition, natural language processing, and more.

Requirements

ï Design and optimize machine learning algorithms for specific applications.

ï Manage and preprocess large datasets to extract relevant features for training AI models.

ï Train machine learning models and evaluate their performance through testing.

ï Use programming languages (e.g., Python, Java) for AI development.

ï Apply expertise in deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch to build and implement neural networks.

ï Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts.

ï Analyze complex problems and propose innovative AI solutions to address business challenges.

ï Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and integrate new technologies into existing systems.

ï Ensure AI applications comply with ethical standards and legal regulations.

ï Prepare comprehensive documentation for algorithms, models, and processes.

ï Engage in ongoing learning to stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends.

ï Assist in deploying AI models into production environments, ensuring scalability and efficiency.

job_description:
An
AI Head of Retail
involves setting the vision for AI in retail, leading teams to develop and deploy AI solutions (like personalization, forecasting, automation) to boost sales, efficiency, and customer experience, while managing stakeholders, budgets, and ensuring ethical, compliant AI use across operations and strategy. This role blends traditional retail leadership with deep understanding of AI/ML, driving digital transformation from C-suite to store floor.

Key Responsibilities
ï Strategy & Vision
: Define the AI roadmap, align it with business goals, and identify high-impact AI use cases for retail business
ï Leadership & Team Management
: Lead data scientists, engineers, and retail teams, fostering collaboration and capability development in AI.
ï Deployment & Operations
: Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of AI models, from R&D to production deployment, ensuring smooth integration into daily operations.
ï Business Growth
: Drive revenue and profitability by leveraging AI to enhance sales, optimize store performance, and improve customer satisfaction.
ï Stakeholder Management
: Work cross-functionally with merchandising, marketing, IT, and legal; manage C-suite relationships and present to executives.
ï Governance & Compliance
: Ensure responsible, ethical, and compliant use of AI, adhering to regulations and data privacy.
ï Innovation
: Monitor industry trends (like GenAI) and champion pilot programs to demonstrate measurable business impact.

This is a senior role, often bridging technology and business, ensuring AI isn't just a tech project but a core driver of retail success, impacting everything from online personalization to in-store operations.

AI & Data | Data Science - Energy Resources Industries | Manager

About Deloitte:

When you work for us, you commit to a career at one of the largest and most prestigious professional services firms in the world.

We have received numerous awards over the last few years, including Best Employer in the Middle East, and Best Consulting Firm, and the Middle East Training & Development Excellence Award.
Our Purpose

Deloitte makes an impact that matters. Every day we challenge ourselves to do what matters mostófor clients, for our people, and for society. We serve clients distinctively, bringing innovative insights, solving complex challenges and unlocking sustainable growth.

We inspire our talented professionals to deliver outstanding value to clients, providing an exceptional career experience and an inclusive and collaborative culture.

We contribute to society, building confidence and trust in the markets, upholding the integrity of organizations and supporting our communities.
Our shared values guide the way we behave to make a positive, enduring impact:

Lead the way
Serve with integrity
Take care of each other
Foster inclusion
Collaborate for measurable impact

Technical Capabilities

on experience (10ñ15 years) in applied data science, advanced analytics and AI in the Oil and Gas Industry preferably in the Upstream sector.
series forecasting, anomaly detection, predictive analysis, optimization, and common ML algorithms (tree ensembles, gradient boosting, deep learning architectures).
augmented generation and prompt engineering.
driven models to support forecasting, optimization and decision support.
data frameworks (Spark, Databricks).

MLOps and production deployment experience:
containerisation (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes), CI/CD for models, model packaging (MLflow, Kubeflow, Seldon), automated monitoring and retraining pipelines.

Practical experience with cloud ML and data platforms: AWS (SageMaker, EMR), Azure (ML, Databricks), GCP (Vertex), and integration with enterprise data lakes and historian systems (OSIsoft/AVEVA PI).
Competence in model governance, explainability (SHAP, LIME), validation, performance monitoring and model risk management in regulated/operational environments.
end solution design.

Functional Capabilities

cases with clear business value (production uplift, downtime reduction, energy optimization, emissions reduction, predictive maintenance, process yield improvement).
value pilots, estimate effort and support pricing and commercial terms.

Client engagement & account handling:
lead technical client workshops, present to executive audiences, translate technical outputs into actionable recommendations and ROI narratives.

Business development:
lead proposals development, technically and commercially, along with quality and risk management journey internally.
quality artefacts (analysis reports, dashboards, model documentation) and ensure solutions are operationalized and adopted.
technical stakeholders using dashboards and executive summaries.

Leadership Capabilities

market activities.
in and drive change adoption.
suite and technical leadership.

Required Qualifications

10ñ15 years' practical experience in data science, analytics or AI roles with significant, demonstrable exposure to the oil & gas industry (upstream mainly).
end delivery from requirements and PoC to deployment and monitoring.

oriented environment and flexible work hours.

ï processing

clustering).

ï Familiarity with common AI/ML frameworks and libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, and

basic exposure to TensorFlow or PyTorch.

job_description:
Company
Qualcomm Middle East Information Technology Company LLC

Job Area
Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Test Engineering

General Summary
About Us
Qualcomm is enabling a world where everyone and everything can be intelligently connected. You interact with products and technologies made possible by Qualcomm every day, including 5G-enabled smartphones that double as pro-level cameras and gaming devices, smarter vehicles and cities, and the technology behind the smart, connected factories that manufactured your latest purchase. Qualcomm 5G and AI innovations are the power behind the connected intelligent edge. You'll find our technologies behind and inside the innovations that deliver significant value across multiple industries and to billions of people every day.

About The Role
We are recruiting for a Site Reliability Engineer ñ Datacentre AI Engineering at Qualcomm Technologies, Inc., located in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This role centres on designing, maintaining, and scaling large-scale AI inference systems in a datacentre environment. You will support critical AI use cases, ensuring that Qualcomm's infrastructure is robust, reliable, and scalable for advanced machine learning workloads.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
AI Infrastructure
ï Design and maintain large-scale AI Inference systems supporting critical AI use cases.
ï Ensure reliability, operability, and scalability of the Qualcomm data-centre cluster
ï Build software tools and ecosystems around AI software stacks.

AI & ML Engineering
ï Analyse software requirements and consult with architecture and hardware engineers.
ï Hands-on experience in building Agentic AI solutions, LLM orchestration and agentic AI libraries.
ï Collaborate with model, systems & software teams to improve model performance on AI100 deployments
ï Identify features that optimize workloads for multi-SoC and multi-card systems

Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
ï Implement SRE fundamentals: incident management, monitoring, performance optimization
ï Hands-on experience with MLOps tools and practices, ensuring seamless integration of ML models into production
ï Establish operational maturity frameworks and sustainable incident response protocols.

Observability & Tooling
ï Build tools and frameworks to improve observability and define reliability metrics.
ï Monitor system health using Prometheus, Grafana, Cloudwatch, and custom telemetry.
ï Create and maintain documentation and knowledge base articles.

Automation & CI/CD
ï Design automation tools to reduce manual processes and operational overhead.
ï Ensure CI/CD reliability for agent deployment cycles.
ï Apply Infrastructure as Code practices using tools like Terraform CDK.

Required Skillset Includes
AI & Deep Learning
ï Experience with LLMs, NLP, Vision, Audio, and Recommendation systems.
ï Proficiency with LLM inference concepts: token streaming, batching, KV cache.
ï Proficiency in PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, and Ray.
ï Familiar with GPU / TPU compute, ML frameworks, checkpointing and distributed inferencing

AI Agent Operations
ï Experience supporting GenAI or agentic AI applications in production.
ï Familiarity with LLM orchestration, prompt reliability, and RAG systems.
ï Exposure to LangChain, AutoGen, and similar agent orchestration frameworks.

Programming & Software Design
ï Strong programming skills in Python with experience in PyTorch
ï Scripting (Python, Bash), configuration management (Ansible/Terraform), orchestration

Systems & Infrastructure
ï Strong Linux fundamentals: shell, systemd, containers, networking (TLS, DNS, HTTP/2, gRPC).
ï Expertise in Slurm (configuration, scheduling, plugins/extensions) or equivalent
ï Good knowledge of networking (RDMA, InfiniBand, RoCE, high-throughput, low-latency networks)
ï Experience operating and scaling distributed systems with high availability.

Observability & Monitoring
ï Hands-on experience with Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Loki, Datadog, SIP, Homer.
ï Exposure to hardware health monitoring and system reliability.

DevOps & SRE Practices
ï Deep understanding of SDLC, release management, and system reliability.
ï Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitLab) and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform CDK).

Qualifications & Experience
ï Bachelor's / Masters degree in Engineering, Machine learning/ AI, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
ï 4-5 years' of Software Engineering or related work experience.

What's On Offer
Apart from working with great people, we offer the below:
ï Salary including housing & transport allowance
ï Stock (RSU's) and performance related bonus
ï 16 weeks fully paid Maternity Leave
ï 6 weeks fully paid Paternity Leave
ï Employee stock purchase scheme
ï Child Education Allowance
ï Relocation and immigration support (if needed)
ï Life and Medical Insurance
ï Live+ Well Reimbursement for health and recreational membership fees

Minimum Qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.

OR

Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.

OR

PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
ï 2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.
ï References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.

We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).

: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm.
