job_title: ML Production Engineer: Build & Scale AI Models
job_description:
A leading technology firm is seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to design, build, deploy, and scale machine learning models powering data-driven products. You will work at the intersection of data science, software engineering, and MLOps. The ideal candidate has 3-7+ years of experience, strong programming skills in Python, and hands-on experience with deploying ML models. This role involves optimizing models for performance, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and applying responsible AI principles.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

Company

Qualcomm Middle East Information Technology Company LLC

Job Area

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering

General Summary

About Us

Qualcomm is enabling a world where everyone and everything can be intelligently connected.

You interact with products and technologies made possible by Qualcomm every day, including 5G-enabled smartphones that double as pro-level cameras and gaming devices, smarter vehicles and cities, and the technology behind the smart, connected factories that manufactured your latest purchase.
Qualcomm 5G and AI innovations are the power behind the connected intelligent edge.

You'll find our technologies behind and inside the innovations that deliver significant value across multiple industries and to billions of people every day.
About The Role

Qualcomm is leveraging its expertise in hardware-accelerated AI to bring powerful, energy-efficient generative AI and computer vision workloads to the Edge.

The Qualcomm Compute AISW team is developing several key technologies including a comprehensive hardware and software stack for deep learning inference acceleration.

We are seeking highly skilled and experienced AI/ML Engineer to enable latest SOTA models on Qualcomm Edge platforms to join our team in Saudi Arabia.

In this role, you'll serve as a trusted technical advisor and customer advocate, helping partners and clients unlock the full potential of advanced computing platforms, including CPUs, GPUs, NPUs, AI accelerators, and heterogeneous systems.

You will have a pre-and post-sales focus and will work with channel partners and their respective technical sales/delivery teams to drive adoption of Qualcomm's platform across the B2B market.
You will partner with OEM and Channel sales teams on strategic and regionally appropriate engagements.
You will be the voice of the customer back to Qualcomm product, engineering and marketing teams on feature enhancements.

Responsibilities Will Include

Assisting with the Execution of Qualcomm's Go-To-Market strategy across MEA region.
Supporting the Sales team through deep technical engagement with reseller & customer implementers and assisting with device evaluations, pilots and proof-of-concepts
Assisting with the technical sales enablement commercial channel sales teams.
Assisting with Windows on Snapdragon related issues and bugs that you and/or your enterprise customers identify

Act as a technical interface between Qualcomm and customers to capture, articulate, and translate product requirements for various mobile and compute SKUs into actionable engineering specifications.

Collaborate with OEMs/ODMs, ISVs, and ecosystem partners to ensure successful integration of Snapdragon compute platforms across hardware, firmware, and software layers.
Drive end-to-end product development, from early architecture definition and bring-up to final system validation and commercial launch.

Analyse system performance and power efficiency; identify optimization opportunities to achieve the full potential of Snapdragon-powered laptops including compatibility, app performance, connectivity, and feature enablement.
Support customers in resolving complex hardware/software integration issues and provide technical guidance on reference designs, SDKs, and BSPs.
Guide customers through the evaluation and integration of platforms such as SoCs, AI/ML accelerators, and server-grade CPUs/GPUs/NPUs.
Represent Qualcomm in technical discussions and reviews with partners, demonstrating deep technical understanding and effective communication.
Lead product demos, technical workshops, and training sessions to showcase compute technologies and best practices.
Coordinate with Qualcomm global teams (engineering, product management, and customer engineering) to align roadmap priorities and technical support plans.
Collect and share customer feedback to help shape product roadmaps and drive continuous improvement.
Create and maintain technical documentation, application notes, and reference designs.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in high-performance computing, AI/ML, and edge/cloud architectures.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field or 5+ years of Computer Science or related work experience.
Very strong in C/C++/Python programming and algorithm development.
Experience with at least one AIML framework like TensorFlow, ONNX, Pytorch, etc.
Windows development experience. Experience with embedded systems development or equivalent.
Understanding of software development and debugging in embedded environments.
Understanding of AI/ML workloads
Strong problem-solving and diagnostic abilities
Ability to work in high-pressure environments and respond to incidents quickly
Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality and reliability
Willingness to work shifts, on-call rotations and sometimes in physically demanding conditions
Familiarity with Windows, Linux, bare-metal and virtualization platforms
Commitment to ongoing learning and professional development
Software design/debugging techniques, problem solving, and documentation skills.

Strong understanding of Qualcomm Snapdragon platforms and compute architectures including CPU, GPU, NPU and supporting software stacks (drivers, libraries, frameworks).
Proven ability to work directly with OEMs/ODMs and ISVs to deliver complex, multi-component systems.
Excellent skills in system debugging, performance profiling tools, benchmarking methodologies and cross-functional coordination.
Strong communication skills with a customer-first mindset; able to translate complex technical details into business-oriented discussions and customer-facing insights.
Willingness to travel for customer meetings and industry events.

Preferred Qualifications & Experience

Technical sales management expertise, the ability to manage change and the desire to operate effectively across organizations and customers
Experience building complex solutions and driving new device adoption with resellers & distributors.
Experience in support of launching new technologies/products
Ability to communicate, educate and evangelize both internally & externally
Prior experience in a customer engineering, field application, or technical program management role.
Understanding of cloud-to-edge AI enablement, on-device inference, or performance tuning on Snapdragon platforms.
Experience with system integration tools, BSP customization, and cross-platform testing.
Understanding about Processor architecture, system design fundamentals
Ability to collaborate across a globally diverse team and multiple interests
Batchelors or Masters degree with AI/ML as part of the course is a plus

Why Join Qualcomm

At Qualcomm, you'll be part of a global team that's defining the future of connected computing.

You will engage directly with world-leading OEMs and ecosystem partners to shape the next generation of AI-ready laptops and mobile devices ó enabling users to experience the full power of Snapdragon technology.
What's On Offer

Salary including housing & transport allowance
Stock (RSU's) and performance related bonus
16 weeks fully paid Maternity Leave
6 weeks fully paid Paternity Leave
Employee stock purchase scheme

Relocation and immigration support (if needed)
Life and Medical Insurance
Live+ Well Reimbursement for health and recreational membership fees

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
OR

Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
OR

PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.

job_description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated AI Engineer (Technical Lead) with deep expertise in Large Language Models (LLMs), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Speech-to-Text technologies. In this role, you will play a key part in building and optimizing advanced AI solutions to enhance our products and services. You will lead the development and integration of intelligent systems that enable seamless human-computer interaction and drive innovation across teams.
Key Responsibilities:

LLM Development & Integration:
ï Fine-tune and deploy large language models for applications such as chatbots, content generation, and customer support.
ï Continuously evaluate and enhance the performance of LLMs in real-world environments.

NLP System Design:
ï Design and implement NLP solutions for tasks including text classification, entity recognition, summarization, and sentiment analysis.
ï Work with large datasets to train, validate, and optimize NLP models.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve language processing challenges.

Speech-to-Text Implementation:
ï Build and refine speech-to-text systems for diverse languages and dialects.
ï Integrate ASR (automatic speech recognition) systems with LLM and NLP pipelines for seamless end-to-end solutions.
ï Stay current with the latest developments in speech recognition technology.

Performance Optimization:
ï Optimize model performance for scalability and low-latency applications.
ï Address model bias, improve accuracy, and ensure robustness in production environments.

Research & Innovation:
ï Monitor emerging trends and advancements in LLMs, NLP, and speech technologies.
ï Experiment with and implement cutting-edge research in practical use cases.

Documentation & Collaboration:
ï Maintain clear technical documentation for all AI systems, models, and workflows.
ï Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI solutions with business objectives.
Required Qualifications:
ï Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.
ï Proven experience in LLM development using platforms like OpenAI (GPT) or similar.
ï Strong understanding of NLP techniques and hands-on experience with libraries such as spaCy, NLTK, or Hugging Face.
ï Solid experience with speech recognition technologies (e.g., Google Speech API, Whisper, or similar tools).
ï Proficiency in Python, along with experience in TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks.
ï Excellent problem-solving skills, collaborative approach, and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
ï Fluent in Arabic ñ This role requires Arabic language skills.

job_description:
Job Overview:

Master Works is looking for a highly skilled LLM Engineer to join our AI Core Delivery team within the AI & Analytics CoE. In this role, you will develop, deploy, and optimize advanced language model capabilities, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and agentic AI systems. You will play a key role in scaling AI Core as the central enterprise AI platform by ensuring production-ready performance, robust observability, and seamless integration of LLMs with internal and external systems.

Key Responsibilities
ï Model Development & Optimization
ï Build and optimize RAG pipelines for efficient document processing, indexing, and retrieval.
ï Implement agentic AI logic for tool integration, task automation, and external data access.
ï Enhance query understanding, response ranking, and AI-generated output quality.
ï Develop evaluation benchmarks to measure LLM performance, accuracy, and relevance.
ï LLMOps & Deployment
ï Collaborate with API developers and backend engineers to deliver secure, observable LLM endpoints.
ï Deploy and manage LLMs in cloud-native or hybrid environments with support for scalability and multi-cloud readiness.
ï Implement CI/CD workflows for model updates, rollback mechanisms, and performance tuning.
ï Backend & Data Integration
ï Integrate LLM capabilities with enterprise data sources and knowledge bases.
ï Support multi-source retrieval and embedding strategies to improve AI responses.
ï Design pipelines that ensure low latency, high throughput, and fault tolerance.
ï Security & Compliance
ï Apply enterprise-grade authentication, access management, and encryption standards.
ï Ensure compliance with internal governance policies, data privacy, and audit requirements.
ï Continuous Improvement
ï Monitor system performance, debug issues, and fine-tune models based on real-world feedback.
ï Stay updated on advancements in LLM architectures, open-source tools, and evaluation frameworks.

Requirements
ï Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or related field.
ï Hands-on experience with LLM development and deployment (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, LLaMA, etc.).
ï Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), embeddings, and vector databases.
ï Experience with cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and infrastructure-as-code (IaC).
ï Proficiency with Python or similar languages for AI/ML pipeline development.
ï Familiarity with container orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD practices.
ï Knowledge of observability tools for monitoring AI performance in production environments.

Preferred Skills
ï Experience integrating agentic AI capabilities with external APIs and automation tools.
ï Strong grasp of prompt engineering, contextual memory systems, and LLM evaluation.
ï Exposure to enterprise AI security and compliance standards.

job_title: Dedicated Cloud Support Engineer, Saudi Arabia
job_description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a Cloud Support Engineer to deliver an outstanding technical support experience on the full cloud technical stack at Canonical. Combine your Linux support and software engineering skills, passion for technology, and your general knowledge of the full stack, from hardware to application, networking, Linux and open source, to help customers get the most from their solution from Canonical. Our team provides exceptional technical support and engineering solutions to help customers with everything open source from Ubuntu Server and Desktop to OpenStack and Kubernetes. This is an exceptional opportunity for an open source technologist who enjoys solving problems under pressure. If you have a passion for the latest open source technologies, technical support, cloud-native development, data-center technologies such as OpenStack, Kubernetes and networking, you will love the Cloud Support Engineer role at Canonical.

Location: This role is office-based in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Candidates must be based there or have the ability to relocate.

The role entails
ï Apply your knowledge of Linux virtualisation using Libvirt/KVM, containers and Kubernetes along with your knowledge of TCP/IP networking to support customised solutions for our customers.
ï Be the technical authority and demonstrate your experience with popular open source software such as PostgreSQL, Corosync/Pacemaker, MongoDB, MySQL and Apache.
ï Provide advice on deployed architecture, implementing solutions for complex problems and guiding customers to successful data-center infrastructure operations
ï Communicate regularly with the customer team about ongoing issues

What we are looking for in you
ï Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
ï Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
ï Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
ï Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
ï Hands-on and extensive working experience in:
ï * Virtualization / Cloud - primarily using KVM or OpenStack.
ï Containers - especially with Docker, LXD/LXC, or Kubernetes.
ï Storage technologies - block, object and network.
ï Cloud computing expertise in provisioning, monitoring, orchestration, etc.
ï Professional experience with OpenStack and/or Ceph is a strong plus
ï Open source development or scripting experience
ï Extensive Customer support experience is key:
ï * Customer needs are top priority.
ï Communicate professionally, emphatically, clearly and set the right expectations.
ï Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long.

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Employee Assistance Programme
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
ï Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#LI-remote

Company Description

C-9INE accelerates companies' journeys to market with its cutting-edge, AI-driven C9 software stack. Offering pre-built foundational blocks for Front End, Web, Backend, Quality Assurance, and Cloud Platform Engineering, C-9INE provides startups and organisations with tools to streamline development while enhancing delivery through DevOps, Agile practices, and organisational design playbooks. The turnkey solution integrates top-tier technologies for application security, compliance, observability, CI/CD, and DevSecOps to support seamless project execution. Leveraging AI as a helper tool, C-9INE prioritises automating repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and outcomes.

Role Description

This is a full-time role based in Riyadh. As a Senior Principal Google Cloud Engineer, you will design, implement, and maintain GCP cloud infrastructure and solutions to meet organisational needs. Responsibilities include managing cloud-based services, optimising cloud performance, ensuring system security, provisioning resources, and supporting cloud-native application deployment and migrations from others private/public clouds and DC's. The role also involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, reliable, resilient solutions aligned with company objectives.

Qualifications
ï Expert-level skills in building, designing, and deploying GCP/AWS/OCI/based workloads
ï High proficiency in GCP Infrastructure and GKE Computing, including provisioning and managing scalable GCP cloud environments through automation Infrastructure as code and Ansible. This is a must!
ï Expert-level hands-on experience of Datacentre to GCP migration or Other public cloud to GCP migration using frameworks like 6R's
ï Physical data centre experience with DHCP, TFTP, AUTOINSTALL, KICKSTART, PXE, NETWORKING, SUBNETS, ROUTING etc.
ï 5+ years of client-facing experience to guide/help/onboard clients on use of GCP services.
ï Expert-level knowledge in Linux/Windows system administration and management
ï Hands-on experience of managing Databases (PostgreSQL/Mysql/Mongo/MSSQL) and their integration within cloud platforms
ï Expert-level hands-on experience working with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Landing Zone, VPC's, HA VPN, Big Query, GCE, App Engine, CloudSQL, Cloud LB's, IAM, Monitoring and Logging, Native firewalls + Palo Alto, Fortinet.
ï Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, preferably from a Software Engineering background.
ï Professional certifications in cloud computing or Google Cloud technologies are an advantage; however, hands-on experience is a MUST.
ï Someone who prefers to Automate and manage infra with code rather than manually doing things!
ï Efficient communicator with depth of perception and strategic thinking.
ï Arabic language is a huge PLUS.

C-9INE offers a fast-paced, high-expectation environment where youíll be challenged to grow, perform at your best, and consistently exceed goals. We invest heavily in training and development so you can build deep, multi-disciplinary expertise and become highly skilled across multiple areas of cloud and platform engineering.

Location: Riyadh, KSA

Start date: Immediate (March/April)

Salary: Negotiable.

Key Responsibilities?Health Check: Platform health check, daily maintenance (capacity check, alert, system stability) End Customer Support: Provide support to end customer onboarding, billing, environment support, functional clarification, and product working clarification. Collaboration: Co-ordinate with L2/ Apsara & L3 R&D team directly any issue which not able to fixed. Regular Report: Weekly/Monthly internal Report publish Change Support: Help to raise change requests and collaborate with all team on execution, raise a ticket in case needed for Apsara Daily & Platform issue fixing: Perform the daily technical troubleshooting, patch deployment, fixing the platform core issue, and deployment of the new upgrade version. Core platform syncs with the global strategy (product upgrade, incident management). Network & Hardware: Configure the network device, interlink, troubleshoot all switches, and ensure the stability of the platform, failure of hardware/cluster, and adjust the existing network based on the new deployment & requirement. Version Upgrade: Perform the platform upgrade and align with the R&D team of the different product teams. Integration: Implement and process the integration with the API, core system linking configuration, certificate, and troubleshoot. Technical Alignment: troubleshoot and execute the issue with the L3 Development team of each product category, prepare end-to-end deployment
Qualifications1?Bachelorís degree or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology or related disciplines, with solid IT fundamentals and cloud computing knowledge.2?Alibaba Cloud certifications are highly preferred (e.g. ACA / ACP / ACE); familiarity with the Apsara cloud ecosystem and hands-on experience in Alibaba Cloud platform operations or cloud services is an advantage.3?Strong experience in platform operations, including system health checks, capacity management, alert handling, patch deployment, version upgrades, and troubleshooting; experience with end-to-end deployment and API/system integration is a plus.4?Solid knowledge of networking and hardware, including network configuration, link debugging, switch and hardware/cluster troubleshooting; strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with L2 / Apsara / L3 R&D teams.5?At least 2 years of experience in cloud platform operations or related roles; experience in platform upgrades, system integration or large-scale operations is preferred; strong cross-team collaboration skills, including working with overseas technical teams.6?Good proficiency in English for reading, writing and communication, capable of handling technical documentation and collaborating with overseas teams; strong compliance awareness, professionalism, execution capability and ability to work under pressure, with strict adherence to data security and confidentiality requirements.7, Arabic or Chinese language is an advantage.

Title : Software Engineer- Cloud Solutions

Location : Morrisville, NC, US

Requisition ID : 132638

Job Summary

As a Software Engineer you will work as part of a team responsible for participating in the development, testing and debugging of operating systems and file systems that run NetApp storage applications. In this specific job, you will be a member of the Performance Engineering product development team. As part of the Research and Development function, the overall focus of the group is on competitive market and customer requirements, technology advances, product quality, product cost and time-to-market Software engineers focus on enhancements to existing products as well as new product development. The Performance Engineering product development team develops new innovations in the core 1 / 0 path explicitly targeted at improving ONTAP's performance when deployed into various cloud environments including FSXn, GCNV, CVO and OCI

Job Responsibilities
ï Develop a strong technical understanding of NetAppís existing data management and storage solutions in the Cloud, their interdependencies, and limitations.
ï Participate in all phases of the product development cycle including product design and development, test automation, debugging and support, and supporting resolution of impactful customer issues.
ï Continuously monitor, analyze, and measure system health, availability, and latency using Google native tooling. Develop and implement steps to improve system and application performance, availability, and reliability.
ï Stay up to date with security trends and proactively identify, diagnose, and resolve complex security issues.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features and deliver performance requirements
ï Engage in incident management processes and resolve issues within agreed SLAs / SLOs and expected to be on Call rotations.
ï Handle unstructured tasks and conducting research to convert vague / undefined requirements into clearly articulated ones.
ï Operate under limited supervision and direction, as this individual can operate, drive results and set priorities independently.

Job Requirements
ï Bachelorís degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field.
ï 5+ years of hands-on experience in software development and cloud engineering.
ï Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as C / C++, Python and focused primarily on the OS and Filesystems, Kernel levels deeper insights
ï Strong hands-on operational knowledge in at least one major cloud platform (AWS, GCP, or OCI).
ï Strong knowledge of cloud architecture, services, and best practices.
ï Familiarity with CI / CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
ï Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
ï Strong verbal and written communication skills, and collaboration skills are a must.
ï Ability to work with limited supervision and operate and drive results independently.

Education

IC - Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience.Mgr & Exec - Typically requires a minimum of 3 years of related experience.

Compensation :

The target salary range for this position is 130,900 - 194,700 USD. The salary offered will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education and may be outside of this range. The range is based on 'On Target Earningsí (OTE) representing the total potential earnings, which is the sum of the base salary and potential commission earned when performance targets are achieved. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off, various Leave options, employee stock purchase plan, and / or restricted stocks (RSUís). These offerings are subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. We will provide detailed information about the specific benefits for your region during the recruitment process.

job_description:
We are looking for a Senior Windows Infrastructure Engineer to design, build, and manage enterprise Microsoft environments across Windows Server, Active Directory, Office 365, and Azure.

The role focuses on ensuring secure, scalable, and highly available infrastructure while supporting application hosting and automation initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Active Directory (AD) Management: Maintain, troubleshoot, and optimize Active Directory, including user accounts, permissions, and Group Policy.
ï Office 365 and Exchange Online Administration: Administer and support the full range of Office 365 services (e.g., Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams).
ï Windows Server Administration: Install, configure, and manage Windows servers to ensure availability, security, and performance.
ï MSSQL Administration: Manage and administer Microsoft SQL Server, including performance optimization, backup management, and troubleshooting.
ï Application Hosting Environment: Collaborate with developers and DevOps to provision and configure Windows environments for application hosting.
ï Automation: Develop and implement automation scripts (e.g., PowerShell, Ansible) to streamline day-to-day administrative tasks.
ï Azure Cloud Services: Utilize and manage Microsoft Azure services to support and integrate with the Windows infrastructure.
ï Server Performance Monitoring: Monitor the health and performance of Windows servers and MSSQL databases, ensuring issues are proactively addressed.
ï Patch Management: Perform security patching and updates on Windows servers and MSSQL databases, keeping systems compliant and secure.
ï Security and Compliance: Ensure secure configurations of servers, Office 365 environments, and databases, following best practices for system hardening and security.
ï Office 365 Security Features: Configure and manage security-related features in Office 365 E5, including DLP, MDM, Microsoft Defender, and other relevant security solutions.
ï Audit Preparation: Collect and document evidence for internal and external security audits, particularly focusing on NCA compliance.
ï Collaboration: Work closely with other Infra team members and development teams to ensure seamless integration of Windows systems, databases, and Office 365 in the overall IT infrastructure.
ï Incident Response: Troubleshoot and resolve incidents related to Windows systems, MSSQL databases, and Office 365 security configurations, minimizing downtime.
ï Backup and Disaster Recovery: Ensure backup systems are properly configured for both Windows servers and MSSQL databases, and that disaster recovery plans are up to date.

Qualifications:
ï Bachelorís degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field
ï 5+ years of experience as as a Windows System Administrator or Engineer
ï Strong experience in Active Directory, Office 365, Exchange Online, and Windows Server
ï Experience with Azure cloud services
ï Strong experience administering Microsoft SQL Server
ï Experience in automation using PowerShell
ï Strong understanding of infrastructure security and compliance frameworks
ï Relevant certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator, Microsoft Certified: Windows Server, MCSA, MCSE, or similar)

Preferred:
ï Experience with DevOps methodologies.
ï Familiarity with virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V).
ï Knowledge of backup and disaster recovery best practices.

job_description:
.

About the Role

We are looking for a highly skilled Cloud Engineer with strong expertise in multi-cloud environments, specifically Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS). The role involves designing, deploying, and maintaining secure, scalable, and cost-optimized cloud solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in automation, security, and cloud cost management, with the ability to collaborate across teams to deliver reliable and compliant cloud services.

Key Responsibilities

Cloud Infrastructure & Operations
ï Design, deploy, and maintain workloads on GCP and AWS (e.g., Compute, Storage, VPC, IAM, RDS/Cloud SQL, Kubernetes/GKE/EKS).
ï Configure hybrid connectivity solutions (VPN, Interconnect, Direct Connect, Cloud Router, BGP).
ï Implement high availability, disaster recovery (DR), and backup strategies.
ï Continuously monitor and improve performance, reliability, and scalability of cloud environments.

Billing & Cost Optimization
ï Manage and optimize cloud billing and consumption across accounts and projects.
ï Define and implement budgets, alerts, and cost optimization strategies.
ï Partner with stakeholders to apply FinOps practices and ensure cost efficiency.

Automation & DevOps
ï Develop Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, CloudFormation, or Deployment Manager.
ï Automate provisioning, deployments, and operational tasks.
ï Support CI/CD pipelines using Cloud Build, CodePipeline, Jenkins, or GitHub Actions.

Security & Compliance
ï Apply security best practices for IAM, encryption, firewall policies, and network segmentation.
ï Utilize Google Cloud Security Command Center (SCC) and AWS Security Hub for risk detection and compliance monitoring.
ï Ensure adherence to standards such as ISO, GDPR, PDPL, and other relevant regulations.
ï Integrate cloud environments with SIEM and centralized monitoring solutions.

Collaboration & Support
ï Partner with architects and application teams to migrate and modernize workloads.
ï Produce technical documentation, runbooks, and best practice guidelines.
ï Provide L2/L3 support for cloud services, ensuring SLAs are met.

Qualifications

Required
ï Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field.
ï 3+ years of experience as a Cloud Engineer with hands-on expertise in GCP and/or AWS.
ï Proficiency in cloud services (Compute, Networking, Storage, IAM, Kubernetes).
ï Strong skills in Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible.
ï Proficiency in scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell).
ï Experience with containers and orchestration (Docker, GKE, EKS, Kubernetes).
ï Familiarity with CI/CD tools and DevOps practices.

Certification (Mandatory)
ï Google Associate Cloud Engineer or Google Professional Cloud Architect.
ï AWS certification (Solutions Architect Associate or higher) is a strong plus.

Preferred
ï Experience working in multi-cloud or hybrid cloud setups.
ï Knowledge of FinOps tools and cost governance frameworks.
ï Familiarity with ITIL or ITSM processes.
ï Exposure to cloud-native data services (BigQuery, Redshift, RDS, Cloud SQL).

Core Competencies
ï Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
ï Excellent collaboration and communication abilities.
ï Focused on security, automation, and cost optimization
ï Ability to work in a fast-paced, regulated enterprise environment.

ï Lead cloud migration initiatives for core banking systems, ensuring minimal disruption and high availability.
ï Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to ensure robust, scalable, and secure cloud solutions.
ï Implement cloud governance, monitoring, and cost-optimization strategies aligned with banking regulations.
ï Deploy and manage IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS solutions on major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for banking workloads.
ï Automate provisioning, configuration, and deployment processes using CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools.
ï Monitor system performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement improvements to meet SLAs.
ï Ensure compliance with banking industry regulations, security standards, and best practices in cloud environments.
ï Evaluate, recommend, and implement new cloud technologies, tools, and frameworks suitable for the banking sector.
ï Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into scalable cloud solutions.
ï Mentor junior cloud engineers and provide technical guidance on architecture and best practices.
ï Conduct disaster recovery planning, backup strategies, and high-availability setups for critical banking systems.
ï Participate in architecture reviews, risk assessments, and incident management for cloud environments.
ï Ensure proper documentation of cloud infrastructure, policies, and processes for audits and compliance.
ï Strong experience in cloud architecture, deployment, and management, specifically in the banking domain.
ï Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP services and cloud-native solutions.
ï Expertise in automation tools and frameworks (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, Kubernetes, Docker).
ï Knowledge of security, encryption, and regulatory compliance standards in banking (e.g., PCI DSS, ISO 27001).
ï Experience with hybrid cloud, multi-cloud, or private cloud setups.
ï Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, PowerShell) for automation and orchestration.
ï Deep understanding of core banking systems, financial transactions, and banking operations.

To create and manage a GKE (Google Kubernetes Engine) environment and the overall Anthos environment.
Focus on setting up your Google Cloud project, enabling the necessary APIs, creating and configuring GKE clusters, registering them with Anthos, and then utilizing Anthos's capabilities for multi-cluster management, configuration, and policy management.
1. Setting up your Google Cloud Project and Enabling APIs: Create or select a Google Cloud project: This project will house your GKE clusters and Anthos environment.
Enable necessary APIs: Specifically, enable the GKE, Fleet (GKE Hub), and Anthos Service Mesh APIs.
2. Creating and Configuring GKE Clusters: Configure cluster settings: Define node locations, machine types, network settings, and other parameters according to your workload needs.
3. Registering GKE Clusters with Anthos: Register clusters to a fleet: Connect your GKE clusters to a fleet to enable multi-cluster management features.
Use the Connect Agent: This agent establishes a secure connection between your clusters and Google Cloud, enabling management from the console and CLI.
4. Managing the Anthos Environment: Multi-cluster Management: Fleets: Organize and manage your clusters as a single logical unit.
Anthos Config Management: Use GitOps-based configuration management to enforce policies and ensure consistency across your clusters.
Cloud Deploy: Configure targets for deploying applications to your Anthos clusters, including GKE Enterprise clusters.
Service Mesh: Utilize Anthos Service Mesh to manage, monitor, and secure your services across clusters.
Policy Management: Policy Controller: Define and enforce policies to ensure compliance and security across your clusters.
Constraint Templates: Customize policies to meet specific security and compliance requirements.
Observability: Leverage Anthos's observability features to monitor cluster health, resource utilization, and application performance.
Team Management: Use team-scoped views to manage access and permissions for your development teams.
5. Key Considerations: Networking: Plan your networking strategy for communication between clusters and external resources.
Security: Implement robust security measures, including network policies, access controls, and encryption.
Scalability: Design your clusters with scalability in mind to handle fluctuating workloads.
Cost Optimization: Monitor resource utilization and optimize your cluster configurations to minimize costs.
Class A Medical Insurnace Min 3 + Years of experience in the required field

Company Description
C-9INE accelerates companies' journeys to market with its cutting-edge, AI-driven C9 software stack.

Offering pre-built foundational blocks for Front End, Web, Backend, Quality Assurance, and Cloud Platform Engineering, C-9INE provides startups and organisations with tools to streamline development while enhancing delivery through DevOps, Agile practices, and organisational design playbooks.
The turnkey solution integrates top-tier technologies for application security, compliance, observability, CI/CD, and DevSecOps to support seamless project execution. Leveraging AI as a helper tool, C-9INE prioritises automating repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and outcomes.

Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role based in Riyadh, with flexibility for some remote work. As a Google Cloud Engineer, you will design, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure and solutions to meet organisational needs. Responsibilities include managing cloud-based services, optimising cloud performance, ensuring system security, provisioning resources, and supporting cloud-native application deployment. The role also involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, reliable solutions aligned with company objectives.

Qualifications
Skills in building, designing, and deploying GCP-based workloads
Expertise in GCP Infrastructure and GKE Computing, including provisioning and managing scalable GCP cloud environments
Extensive experience in Datacentre to GCP migration or Other public cloud to GCP migration using frameworks like 6R's
Multi-year client-facing experience to guide/help/onboard clients on use of GCP services.
Proficiency in Linux system administration and management
Knowledge of Databases and their integration within cloud platforms
Experience working with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or similar cloud service providers
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Professional certifications in cloud computing or Google Cloud technologies are an advantage
Efficient communicator with depth of perception and strategic thinking.

C-9INE offers a fast-paced, high-expectation environment where you'll be challenged to grow, perform at your best, and consistently exceed goals.

We invest heavily in training and development so you can build deep, multi-disciplinary expertise and become highly skilled across multiple areas of cloud and platform engineering.

Location:
Riyadh, KSA

Start date:
Immediate (March/April)

Salary: 25k-35k Saudi Riyal (depending on experience).

Employment Type: Full-Time (1-Year Renewable Contract with transition support if awarded to another MSP)
We are seeking an experienced System & Cloud Engineer to take ownership of physical and virtual infrastructure servers, storage, virtualization platforms, backup/recovery processes, and hybrid cloud resources. This is a hands-on, mission-critical role ensuring system stability, security compliance, and DR readiness while supporting NCA ECC and ISO 27001 requirements.
Youíll work with HPE ProLiant, NetApp, VMware vSphere/ESXi, Veeam, Commvault, and Azure/AWS while collaborating with cross-functional teams, participating in CAB-approved changes, and supporting audits and lifecycle upgrades.
?? Key Responsibilities
?? Server & Virtualization: Administer & patch HPE servers and VMware clusters, tune OS performance, monitor CPU/memory/I/O utilization, maintain logs & configuration baselines.
?? Storage: Provision and monitor NetApp LUNs, volumes, snapshots; support replication and DR site readiness.
?? Backup & Recovery: Configure and monitor Veeam/Commvault jobs, test restorations, document retention policies, and participate in DR drills.
?? Preventive Maintenance: Regular diagnostics, firmware upgrades, log reviews, cleanup of obsolete files, security hardening baselines.
?? Cloud Operations: Administer Azure/AWS resources (IAM, security groups), maintain secure hybrid connectivity, assist with migration and cost optimization.
?? Monitoring & Incident Response: Use SolarWinds/ManageEngine for infrastructure health checks, triage alerts, perform RCA, and escalate per SLA.
?? Documentation & Compliance: Maintain version-controlled SOPs, runbooks, system diagrams, and provide evidence for audits.
?? Collaboration & Vendor Support: Work with vendors (HPE, NetApp, VMware) for TAC/RMA cases, coordinate lifecycle refreshes, and participate in service reviews.
Contribute to technology evaluations and process automation opportunities.
?? Qualifications
?? Bachelorís degree in IT or related field
? 5ñ7 years experience in systems administration, virtualization, and cloud operations
?? Preferred Certifications: MCSA/MCSE, VMware VCP-DCV, NetApp NCDA, Veeam VMCE, AZ-104, AWS SAA, ITIL v4
?? Technical Skills
Windows Server (AD, DNS, DHCP, GPO), Linux (RHEL/Ubuntu), VMware vSphere/ESXi & vCenter, NetApp provisioning/replication, Veeam/Commvault backup suites, WSUS/SCCM patching, Azure/AWS security & identity controls, SolarWinds/ManageEngine monitoring tools, security hardening & compliance alignment.
?? Why Join Us?
You will play a key role in business continuity and cybersecurity compliance, influence infrastructure roadmaps, and support hybrid cloud transformation in a high-visibility environment.

job_description:
Job description:

Role Overview

We are seeking a Senior Cloud Engineer with 8+ years of experience and a strong financial services background to define, own, and execute our hybrid cloud strategy. This is a hands-on senior role requiring deep expertise across on-premise, hybrid, and cloud environments, with proven experience delivering secure, compliant on-prem to cloud migrations in regulated, audit-driven environments.

The ideal candidate will be a technical authority who can design, implement, and optimize resilient cloud platforms while ensuring security, compliance, performance, and cost efficiency.

Key Responsibilities
ï Architect, manage, and optimize hybrid environments (on-prem + cloud)
ï Lead and execute on-premise to cloud migrations with minimal business risk
ï Design secure cloud landing zones, networking, and identity integrations
ï Ensure high availability, resilience, performance, and security
ï Optimize cloud cost, reliability, and operational efficiency
ï Lead lifecycle management, capacity planning, patching, and upgrades
ï Act as a senior technical authority for infrastructure and cloud decisions
ï Drive Infrastructure as Code (IaC) adoption and automation
ï Support CI/CD pipelines and modern application delivery practices
ï Work closely with security, compliance, and audit teams in regulated environments

Technical Skills & Expertise
ï VMware virtualization platforms
ï Enterprise networking and security
ï Google Cloud Platform (GCP) ñ senior-level expertise required
ï Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
ï CI/CD tools and automation
ï Scripting: PowerShell, Bash, Python
ï Monitoring and logging platforms

Required Experience & Qualifications
ï Minimum 8 years of IT Infrastructure and Cloud Engineering experience
ï Mandatory experience in the financial services industry
ï Proven ownership of on-prem to cloud migrations
ï Strong expertise in VMware and enterprise networking
ï Hands-on, senior-level experience with GCP
ï Experience working in regulated, audit-driven environments
ï Strong problem-solving and stakeholder communication skills

Job Type: Full-time

ï What is your level of hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)? (Junior / Intermediate / Senior)

job_description:
Job Summary

The Senior Cloud Operations Engineer (GCP) is responsible for operating, maintaining, and optimizing enterprise workloads running on Google Cloud Platform. The role ensures high availability, performance, security, and reliability of GCP services across production and non-production environments.

The engineer will work closely with Cloud Architecture, Cloud Security, Platform Engineering, and DevOps teams to support GCP infrastructure, enforce governance, and enable cloud-native operations aligned with best practices.

Key Responsibilities
ï GCP Cloud Operations
ï Operate and support day-to-day activities on GCP workloads across Compute Engine, GKE, Cloud SQL, Storage, and Load Balancing
ï Manage production environments, resolve incidents, and ensure uptime through SLO/SLA alignment
ï Implement OS-Login, IAP, VPC-SC, and secure connectivity for internal and external users
ï Monitor system health using Cloud Logging, Cloud Monitoring, and Error Reporting
ï GCP Infrastructure Management
ï Manage Compute Engine instances, instance templates, MIGs, custom images, and snapshots
ï Administer GKE clusters, node pools, autoscaling, Ingress/LB configurations, and GCR/Artifact Registry
ï Configure Cloud Load Balancers (External/Internal HTTP(S), TCP/UDP, SSL proxy)
ï Implement VPC design, subnets, Cloud NAT, firewall policies, routing, Private Service Connect, and hybrid connectivity
ï Automation, IaC & CI/CD
ï Develop, maintain, and version cloud resources using Terraform and Google's Deployment Manager
ï Automate provisioning, patching, scaling, and maintenance tasks
ï Contribute to GitLab/Cloud Build pipelines for GCP deployments
ï Create runbooks, automation scripts (Bash/Python), and SOPs for repeated processes
ï Cloud Security & Compliance (GCP Focused)
ï Enforce least privilege using IAM, service accounts, workload identity, and custom roles
ï Support Cloud Security Command Center (SCC) findings remediation
ï Implement Binary Authorization, Shielded VMs, CMEK/CMK, network segmentation, and policy enforcement via Organization Policies
ï Support compliance activities aligned with NCA, CIS GCP Benchmarks, and ISO standards
ï Incident & Problem Management
ï Lead incident troubleshooting using GCP logging, LB logs, VPC Flow Logs, packet mirroring
ï Conduct root-cause analysis for GKE, network, IAM, and service-level issues
ï Improve observability through dashboards, alerts, and SLO-based monitoring
ï Participate in on-call rotations and perform emergency recovery operations
ï Cost Optimization & Governance
ï Utilize GCP Cost tools: Billing dashboards, Cost Insights, Quotas, and Budgets
ï Optimize resources via committed use discounts, instance rightsizing, autoscaling, and idle resource cleanup
ï Ensure adherence to cloud governance frameworks and tagging/labeling standards

Requirements

Education
ï Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field

Experience
ï 5-8+ years of hands-on experience in cloud operations with at least 3 years dedicated to GCP
ï Strong background in Linux/Windows VM operations in GCP
ï Experience operating GKE-based applications or microservices

Technical Requirements (GCP-Specialized)

Google Compute & VM Operations
ï Expertise in Compute Engine, MIGs, instance templates, OS-Login, IAP-enabled access
ï Understanding of disk types, snapshots, custom images, and maintenance policies

Networking
ï Strong hands-on experience with VPC design, peering, Shared VPC, firewall rules, Cloud NAT, and Private Service Connect
ï Deep understanding of Google Load Balancers (External HTTP(S), Internal HTTP(S), SSL Proxy, TCP/UDP)

GKE & Container Services
ï Experience managing GKE clusters, node pools, autoscaling, monitoring, and troubleshooting pods/service meshes
ï Familiarity with Anthos (optional)

Storage & Databases
ï Strong knowledge of Cloud Storage, object lifecycle management, Cloud SQL, Memorystore, and related services

Security (GCP Focused)
ï Experience with:
ï IAM design
ï SCC findings
ï VPC SC
ï Binary Authorization
ï Workload Identity
ï KMS/CMEK
ï Shielded VMs
ï Security posture hardening (CIS, NCA, ISO)

Automation & DevOps
ï Strong experience with Terraform (required)
ï Experience with GitLab CI, Cloud Build, or Jenkins for GCP workloads
ï Strong scripting in Bash/Python

Observability
ï Proficiency with:
ï Cloud Monitoring
ï Cloud Logging
ï Error Reporting
ï VPC Flow Logs
ï LB logs

Soft Skills
ï Strong ownership and accountability mindset
ï Ability to diagnose complex cloud/network/security issues
ï Excellent communication and documentation skills
ï Ability to work in fast-paced, highly collaborative environments
ï Leadership in incident management

Preferred Certifications
ï Google Cloud Professional Cloud Engineer (required or in-progress)
ï Google Professional DevOps Engineer
ï CKA/CKAD (for GKE experience)
ï HashiCorp Terraform Associate
ï ITIL Foundation and ISO awareness

Responsibilities

Bachelorís degree in computer science or related field or equivalent. System Microsoft Administration experience to include but not limited to (Azure, MS Exchange, Windows administration, DHCP). Drives the planning, design, implementation, organization, and operation of the Cloud environment. Certified on MCSA, MCSE or equivalent. Certified Azure AZ-104 or equivalent. Experience with Power Shell and automation tools. Familiarity with monitoring tools like Azure Monitor and Azure Log Analytics. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Extensive experience in managing and administering Kubernetes Service. Proficient in designing, deploying, and managing Kubernetes clusters on Azure with a focus on performance, security, and scalability. Advanced knowledge of containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes orchestration. Deep understanding of Kubernetes architecture, including master node, worker nodes, and control plane components. Proficient in CI/CD pipeline integration with Kubernetes using tools like Azure Dev Ops, Jenkins.
Experience:+5

Job Purpose:

We are seeking a highly skilled Private Cloud Operations Engineer with expertise in VMware and VMware Cloud Director (VCD) stack to design, implement, and support private cloud solutions for our managed services clients. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of private cloud infrastructure, virtualization technologies, and managed service operations. This role demands technical proficiency, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent communication skills to deliver innovative cloud solutions and seamless service delivery.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Cloud Infrastructure Design & Implementation
ï Architect and deploy VMware-based private cloud solutions, including vSphere, vSAN, NSX, NSX-T and VMware Cloud Director (VCD).
ï Integrate VMware products with existing IT environments to ensure scalability and reliability.
ï Service Operations & Management
ï Manage day-to-day operations of private cloud environments, ensuring optimal performance and uptime.
ï Monitor and maintain the VCD stack, including upgrades, patches, and troubleshooting.
ï Create and maintain detailed documentation for architecture, processes, and configurations.
ï Implement and manage backup and recovery solutions to ensure data protection and availability.
ï Establish and manage monitoring systems to proactively identify and resolve performance and operational issues.
ï Oversee patching and upgrading of private cloud infrastructure to maintain compliance, security, and optimal performance.
ï Client Engagement & Solution Delivery
ï Work closely with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
ï Provide expertise in private cloud migrations and workload optimizations.
ï Serve as a point of escalation for critical issues, ensuring timely resolution and communication.
ï Automation & Optimization
ï Develop automation scripts and workflows using VMware tools like vRealize Orchestrator and PowerCLI.
ï Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
ï Collaboration & Training
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including storage, networking, and security experts, to deliver integrated solutions.
ï Provide training and mentorship to junior team members and clientsí technical teams.

Required Skills & Qualifications:
ï Education:
ï Bachelorís degree in computer science or engineering.
ï Technical Expertise:
ï Extensive experience with VMware vSphere, vSAN, and VMware Cloud Director (VCD).
ï Proficiency in VMware automation tools (e.g., Aria Suite, PowerCLI).
ï Strong understanding of networking (e.g., NSX, NSX-T, VLANs, routing, firewalls) and storage solutions (SAN/NAS).
ï Hands-on experience with hybrid and multi-cloud environments is a plus.
ï Certifications:
ï VMware certifications such as VCP-DCV, VCAP-DCV, or VMware Cloud Management certifications are highly preferred.
ï Soft Skills:
ï Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
ï Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
ï Ability to manage multiple priorities and work under pressure in a client-facing role.
ï Experience:
ï Preferred banking experience
ï 9+ years of experience in private cloud environments with a focus on VMware technologies.
ï Prior experience in managed services or consulting environments is an advantage.

Preferred Qualifications:
ï Familiarity with cloud-native technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, Tanzu).
ï Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Ansible).
ï Experience with IaC tools (Terraform, Cloud Formation, CI/CD Pipeline).
ï Knowledge of ITIL frameworks and service management best practices.

job_description:
Company Description

https://tamkeentech.sa/

Job Description

Responsibilities:
ï Cloud Architecture Design: Designing scalable, resilient, and secure cloud architectures based on business requirements and best practices of the chosen cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.).
ï Cloud Infrastructure Provisioning: Deploying and managing cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, or ARM templates to ensure consistency and efficiency.
ï Deployment Automation: Implementing automated deployment pipelines (CI/CD) to enable rapid and reliable deployment of applications and services in the cloud environment.
ï Monitoring and Optimization: Setting up monitoring, alerting, and logging solutions to ensure the performance, availability, and cost efficiency of cloud resources. Continuously optimizing cloud infrastructure and costs.
ï Security Management: Implementing security best practices and configuring identity and access management (IAM) policies, encryption, network security, and compliance controls in the cloud environment.
ï Troubleshooting and Incident Response: Responding to and resolving incidents and outages related to cloud infrastructure, applications, and services. Conducting root cause analysis and implementing preventive measures.
ï Backup and Disaster Recovery: Setting up and maintaining backup and disaster recovery solutions to ensure data integrity and business continuity in the event of failures or disasters.
ï Collaboration and Communication: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, operations, and security teams, to ensure alignment and collaboration on cloud projects and initiatives.
ï Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Documenting cloud architectures, configurations, procedures, and best practices. Sharing knowledge and providing guidance to other team members and stakeholders.
ï Continuous Learning and Innovation: Staying updated with cloud technology trends, new features, and best practices. Evaluating and recommending new tools and technologies to improve cloud infrastructure and processes.
ï Compliance and Governance: Ensuring cloud environments comply with regulatory requirements and internal policies. Implementing governance frameworks and controls to maintain security and compliance.
ï Vendor Management: Managing relationships with cloud service providers (CSPs) and third-party vendors. Evaluating services, negotiating contracts, and optimizing costs.

Skills:
ï Cloud Platforms: Proficiency in working with major cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or others.
ï Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Experience with tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, or Azure Resource Manager for provisioning and managing cloud infrastructure.
ï Containerization: Knowledge of container orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes for deploying, managing, and scaling containerized applications.
ï Networking: Understanding of cloud networking concepts including VPCs, subnets, DNS, load balancing, and VPNs.
ï Security: Familiarity with cloud security best practices, identity and access management (IAM), encryption methods, and compliance standards.
ï Monitoring and Logging: Ability to set up and utilize monitoring tools like CloudWatch, Azure Monitor, or Stackdriver, and logging solutions such as ELK stack or Cloud Logging.
ï Scripting and Automation: Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, PowerShell, or Bash for automating tasks and workflows in the cloud environment.
ï Database Management: Knowledge of cloud database technologies like Amazon RDS, Azure SQL Database, or Google Cloud SQL, including configuration, backup, and scalability.
ï DevOps Practices: Understanding of DevOps principles and practices, including continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and version control systems like Git.
ï Troubleshooting and Problem Solving: Ability to diagnose and resolve issues related to cloud infrastructure, applications, and services.
ï Collaboration and Communication: Effective communication skills for collaborating with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and clients, and for documenting processes and procedures.
ï Continuous Learning: Given the rapid evolution of cloud technologies, a willingness to stay updated with industry trends, new tools, and best practices.

Qualifications
ï Bachelor degree in Computer Science or a similar field.
ï AWS certificate

job_title: Outcome Customer Engineer, Cloud Platform; English, Arabic
job_description:
Position: Outcome Customer Engineer, Google Cloud Platform (English, Arabic)

About The Job

Applicants to this role must have work authorization in Saudi Arabia as this role is not eligible for work visa sponsorship.

As a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Outcome Customer Engineer (OCE), you will drive initial and ongoing business generation ramp for our customers, clearing blockers and ensuring they get the maximum benefit from their investment faster. You will manage and execute the deployment plan, transitioning scoped workloads into production by providing technical leadership to customers and partners. You will have a direct impact on the velocity and incremental consumption of customer workloads, leading to accelerated value realization, higher adoption, and future expansion opportunities.

You will blend sales expertise, market knowledge, direct technical engagement, and technical project management to prove the value of the Google Cloud portfolio.

Google Cloud accelerates every organizationís ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Googleís cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
ï Develop and orchestrate a structured, end-to-end deployment plan across customer and partner teams, onboarding the implementation team, clearing blockers, managing timelines and progress, and ensuring readiness (e.g., capacity, training).
ï Leverage skills such as coding, debugging, or systems design to resolve technical blockers and accelerate deployment.
ï Drive and track progress of the initial and ongoing ramp of workloads, moving customers from agreement to consumption as quickly as possible.
ï Identify expansion opportunities for new workloads within the account during project execution.
ï Drive sustainable product usage to help customers realize value on an ongoing basis and secure future agreements renewals.
Minimum qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
ï 6 years of experience with cloud native architecture in a customer-facing or support role.
ï Experience in one or more core areas:
Infrastructure Modernization, Cloud Runtimes (GKE/Cloud Run), Databases, or Networking and Security.
ï Experience with cloud infrastructure or application modernization in a delivery role.
ï Experience in deployment planning, orchestration, or change management, as well as in programming languages, debugging, or systems design.
ï Ability to communicate in English and Arabic fluently to work in this client facing role.
Preferred qualifications
ï Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform) and CI/CD pipelines, and in programming languages (Python, Go) for automation.
ï Experience with SRE principles, incident response protocols, lean/agile methodologies to manage delivery flow and eliminate waste.
ï Experience guiding Global Systems Integrators (GSIs) or partners through technical implementations and enforcing quality standards.
ï Familiarity with Google Cloud Foundation Toolkit (CFT) or similar standardized deployment libraries.
ï Ability to act as a player-coach, upskilling customer teams through code walkthroughs and technical workshops.
ï Ability to navigate ambiguity, facilitate technical workshops, and guide customers through the organizational change to adopt a new cloud-powered business process.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Cloud Support Engineer in Saudi Arabia.

We are looking for a talented Cloud Support Engineer to provide expert-level technical support for cloud and Linux-based environments at global scale. In this role, you will work directly with customers to diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex infrastructure and operating system issues. You will handle challenging problems across cloud platforms, containers, networking, and storage, while maintaining a strong focus on customer satisfaction and service quality. Operating in a fully remote, distributed environment, you will collaborate with highly skilled engineers worldwide and continuously expand your technical expertise. This position offers exposure to cutting-edge open-source technologies and the opportunity to build a long-term career in cloud support and systems engineering.

Accountabilities

Investigate, troubleshoot, and resolve complex customer issues related to cloud environments, Linux systems, and open-source technologies. Own support cases end to end, ensuring timely resolution in line with service level agreements and customer expectations. Engage directly with customers via ticketing systems, calls, and remote sessions to deliver clear, professional support. Perform root cause analysis on system failures, crashes, and configuration issues, escalating when necessary. Contribute to and maintain technical documentation and knowledge base articles to support shared learning. Participate in an on-call or weekend rotation as part of a global support team. Collaborate with engineering and product teams to communicate issue impact, timelines, and fixes effectively.

Requirements

Strong professional written and spoken English communication skills. Hands-on experience supporting Linux systems in production environments. Practical expertise in at least three of the following areas: cloud and virtualization, containers, storage technologies, networking, or orchestration tools. Advanced troubleshooting skills, including log analysis, stack trace interpretation, and OS-level debugging. Understanding of application and operating system bugs, with the ability to escalate effectively. Programming fundamentals in any language. Proven customer support mindset with the ability to communicate clearly, empathetically, and professionally. Willingness to work remotely and travel internationally up to twice per year for company events.

Benefits

Fully remote, globally distributed work environment. Competitive compensation with annual reviews and performance-based bonuses. Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year. Annual paid leave, parental leave, and employee assistance programs. Recognition and reward programs for outstanding performance. Opportunities to travel internationally and collaborate in person with global teams. Long-term career growth within a profitable and fast-growing technology organization.

The final decision and next steps (interviews, assessments) are managed by their internal team.

job_title: Senior Cloud Operations Engineer (Google Cloud Platform)
job_description:
Job Summary The Senior Cloud Operations Engineer (GCP) is responsible for operating, maintaining, and optimizing enterprise workloads running on Google Cloud Platform.
The role ensures high availability, performance, security, and reliability of GCP services across production and non-production environments.
The engineer will work closely with Cloud Architecture, Cloud Security, Platform Engineering, and DevOps teams to support GCP infrastructure, enforce governance, and enable cloud-native operations aligned with best practices.
Key Responsibilities 1.
GCP Cloud Operations Operate and support day-to-day activities on GCP workloads across Compute Engine, GKE, Cloud SQL, Storage, and Load Balancing.
Manage production environments, resolve incidents, and ensure uptime through SLO/SLA alignment.
Implement OS-Login, IAP, VPC-SC, and secure connectivity for internal and external users.
Monitor system health using Cloud Logging, Cloud Monitoring, and Error Reporting.
2. GCP Infrastructure Management Manage Compute Engine instances, instance templates, MIGs, custom images, and snapshots.
Administer GKE clusters, node pools, autoscaling, Ingress/LB configurations, and GCR/Artifact Registry.
Configure Cloud Load Balancers (External/Internal HTTP(S), TCP/UDP, SSL proxy).
Implement VPC design, subnets, Cloud NAT, firewall policies, routing, Private Service Connect, and hybrid connectivity.
3. Automation, IaC & CI/CD Develop, maintain, and version cloud resources using Terraform and Googleís Deployment Manager.
Automate provisioning, patching, scaling, and maintenance tasks.
Contribute to GitLab/Cloud Build pipelines for GCP deployments.
Create runbooks, automation scripts (Bash/Python), and SOPs for repeated processes.
4. Cloud Security & Compliance (GCP Focused) Enforce least privilege using IAM, service accounts, workload identity, and custom roles.
Support Cloud Security Command Center (SCC) findings remediation.
Implement Binary Authorization, Shielded VMs, CMEK/CMK, network segmentation, and policy enforcement via Organization Policies.
Support compliance activities aligned with NCA, CIS GCP Benchmarks, and ISO standards.
5. Incident & Problem Management Lead incident troubleshooting using GCP logging, LB logs, VPC Flow Logs, packet mirroring.
Conduct root-cause analysis for GKE, network, IAM, and service-level issues.
Improve observability through dashboards, alerts, and SLO-based monitoring.
Participate in on-call rotations and perform emergency recovery operations.
6. Cost Optimization & Governance Utilize GCP Cost tools: Billing dashboards, Cost Insights, Quotas, and Budgets.
Optimize resources via committed use discounts, instance rightsizing, autoscaling, and idle resource cleanup.
Ensure adherence to cloud governance frameworks and tagging/labeling standards.
Education Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field.
Experience 5ñ8+ years of hands-on experience in cloud operations with at least 3 years dedicated to GCP .
Strong background in Linux/Windows VM operations in GCP.
Experience operating GKE-based applications or microservices.
Technical Requirements (GCP-Specialized) Google Compute & VM Operations Expertise in Compute Engine, MIGs, instance templates, OS-Login, IAP-enabled access.
Understanding of disk types, snapshots, custom images, and maintenance policies.
Networking Strong hands-on experience with VPC design, peering, Shared VPC, firewall rules, Cloud NAT, and Private Service Connect.
Deep understanding of Google Load Balancers (External HTTP(S), Internal HTTP(S), SSL Proxy, TCP/UDP).
GKE & Container Services Experience managing GKE clusters, node pools, autoscaling, monitoring, and troubleshooting pods/service meshes.
Familiarity with Anthos (optional).
Storage & Databases Strong knowledge of Cloud Storage, object lifecycle management, Cloud SQL, Memorystore, and related services.
Security (GCP Focused) Experience with: IAM design SCC findings VPC SC Binary Authorization Workload Identity KMS/CMEK Shielded VMs Security posture hardening (CIS, NCA, ISO) Automation & DevOps Strong experience with Terraform (required).
Experience with GitLab CI, Cloud Build, or Jenkins for GCP workloads.
Strong scripting in Bash/Python.
Observability Proficiency with: Cloud Monitoring Cloud Logging Error Reporting VPC Flow Logs LB logs Soft Skills Strong ownership and accountability mindset.
Ability to diagnose complex cloud/network/security issues.
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Ability to work in fast-paced, highly collaborative environments.
Leadership in incident management.
Preferred Certifications Google Cloud Professional Cloud Engineer (required or in-progress).
Google Professional DevOps Engineer .
CKA/CKAD (for GKE experience) .
HashiCorp Terraform Associate .
ITIL Foundation and ISO awareness.

job_title: Software Engineer, Backend Developer, Cloud Engineer - Software
job_description:
Who Are We

HALA is a leading fintech player in the MENAP region that aims to redefine financial services and build the future bank of SMEs. HALA aims at empowering SMEs to start, run, and grow their businesses by providing them with cutting-edge financial and technological tools.

HALA currently holds multiple entities in UAE, Saudi Arabia and Egypt (including HALA Payments, HALA Cashier and HALA Logistics) and offers solutions that enable merchants to digitize their payments as well as manage their sales and operations.

Founded in 2017, HALA is currently duly licensed by the Saudi Arabian Central Bank as well as the Financials Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in Abu Dhabi Global Market.
Job Summary

Design, develop, and maintain backend services and APIs that power Hala services web and mobile platforms. Build and optimize scalable, secure, and high-performance systems to support growing user and data demands.
Key Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain backend services and APIs that power Hala services web and mobile platforms.

Hybrid Cloud Architecture & Strategy

On-Prem to Cloud Migration
Lead end-to-end on-prem to cloud migrations in regulated environments.

Reliability, Security & Compliance
Ensure high availability, resilience, performance, and security of infrastructure platforms.
Operate within financial services regulatory and audit requirements.
Lead capacity planning, lifecycle management, patching, and upgrades.
Automation & Modern Delivery

Support CI/CD pipelines and modern application delivery.
Automate provisioning, monitoring, and operational processes.
Technical Leadership
Act as senior technical authority for infrastructure and cloud decisions.
Provide guidance and mentorship to engineering teams.

Required Experience & Qualifications
8+ years of IT infrastructure and cloud engineering experience.
Mandatory experience in financial services (banking, insurance, fintech, capital markets).
Proven ownership of on-prem to cloud migrations in regulated environments.
Strong hands-on expertise with VMware virtualization platforms.
Solid experience in enterprise networking and security.
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Experience working in audit-driven, compliance-heavy environments.
Strong scripting skills (PowerShell, Bash, Python).

The Job in a Nutshell

We are seeking a Staff Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our high-impact engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the scalability, performance, and reliability of Foodicsí cloud-native platforms and services. You will design, implement, and evolve infrastructure solutions and operational processes that support millions of transactions daily, while championing best practices in observability, incident management, and resilience engineering. Your expertise will help us maintain world-class uptime and seamless customer experiences as we continue to grow at scale.

What Will You Do?
ï Design and maintain scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems across multiple cloud providers (AWS, OCI).

ï Implement robust observability frameworks (metrics, tracing, logging) to proactively detect and address performance issues.
ï Collaborate with development teams to embed reliability into every stage of the software lifecycle.
ï Optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining service quality.

What Are We Looking For?

Weíre looking for a reliability-focused engineer with strong technical depth, who thrives in solving complex operational challenges at scale. You must be hands-on with distributed systems, cloud-native platforms, and automation tools.

ï Experience with Kubernetes, container orchestration, and service mesh technologies.
ï Proven expertise in infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible, Crossplane is optional) and automation scripting (Bash, Python, Go).
ï Deep understanding of monitoring and alerting systems (Prometheus/Grafana, ELK, Loki, Datadog, AWS CloudWatch).
ï Skilled in cloud networking, load balancing, API gateway management (NGINX, Kong, AWS API GW).
ï Solid experience with relational and NoSQL databases in production (MySQL/PostgreSQL, MongoDB, DocumentDB, Redis).
ï Familiarity with distributed tracing (Jaeger, OpenTelemetry) and chaos testing frameworks.

Who Will Excel?
