ï Candidates that demonstrate strong collaboration and communication skills across engineering, product, and business teams.
ï Candidates who bring a data-driven approach to performance tuning and capacity planning. Candidates that thrive in fast-paced, high-growth SaaS environments and embraces continuous improvement.

We believe you will love working at Foodics!

job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Platform Engineer to join our Infrastructure team and lead the design and automation of resilient, scalable, and secure infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in Kubernetes, ArgoCD, Terraform, Ansible, CI/CD, and experience across public cloud platforms such as Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Amazon Web Services (AWS).

Key Responsibilities:
ï Design, implement, and manage Kubernetes-based platforms across public cloud environments (OCI, GCP, AWS).
ï Drive GitOps adoption using ArgoCD for consistent and automated deployments.
ï Build and maintain infrastructure using Terraform and ensure compliance with IaC best practices.
ï Automate configuration and operational tasks using Ansible.
ï Develop and manage robust CI/CD pipelines to support fast, secure, and reliable software delivery.
ï Collaborate with development, security, and infrastructure teams to align platform solutions with business goals.
ï Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize infrastructure and deployment processes across cloud platforms.
ï Enforce cloud security standards and governance policies within Kubernetes and related cloud services.
ï Maintain thorough documentation of infrastructure design, processes, and procedures.

Job Requirements:
ï Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
ï 6+ years in Platform Engineering, DevOps, or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) roles.
ï Strong hands-on experience with Kubernetes (deployment, networking, security, Helm).
ï Proficiency in ArgoCD or similar GitOps tools (e.g., FluxCD).
ï Expertise in Terraform for infrastructure provisioning on cloud platforms.
ï Solid experience with Ansible for automation and configuration management.
ï Experience with CI/CD tools (GitLab CI, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.).
ï Proven track record working with public cloud platforms, particularly:
ï Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) ñ compute, networking, load balancing, block/object storage, IAM.
ï Google Cloud Platform (GCP) ñ GKE, Cloud Build, IAM, VPC.
ï Amazon Web Services (AWS) ñ EKS, EC2, S3, IAM, VPC.
ï Proficient in Git and scripting languages (Bash, Python).
ï Knowledge of security best practices in cloud and Kubernetes environments.

Preferred Qualifications:
ï Experience implementing multi-cloud or hybrid-cloud architectures.
ï Familiarity with service mesh technologies (Istio, Linkerd).
ï Experience with monitoring, logging, and alerting tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Loki, etc.).
ï Certifications: CKA, CKAD, Terraform Associate, AWS/GCP/OCI certifications.

Application closing date: Thursday, 16 January 2026
ï 11:59pm, Canberra time

Estimated start date: Monday, 02 March 2026

Location of work: SA

Working arrangements: Working from home arrangements will be considered in the provision of these services following an initial requirement of the contractor being in the office for the first 2 weeks of the engagement before a flexible working arrangement will be considered. WFH arrangements will be negotiated upon commencement and aligned to the work and assignment. Note: Candidates may be required to be in the office a min of 3 days per week, based upon team dynamics.

Length of contract: Up to 12 Months depending on the start date

Contract extensions: Up to a maximum of 24 months

Security clearance: Must have a current Negative Vetting Level 1 clearance

Rates: $130 - $160 per hour (inc. super)

Services Australia is at the frontline of government service delivery, supporting millions of Australians, and is front and centre of a vision to be a world leader in government service delivery. It's using cutting-edge technology to build world class platforms and capabilities to help Australians get on with their lives.

Services Australia is seeking a Senior Cloud Engineer with 5+ years' experience in Azure/AWS, specialising in greenfield/brownfield setups, IaC, and secure-by-design principles. They muset be skilled in networking, governance, and security (RBAC/IAM, guardrails), hybrid connectivity, and DevOps (CI/CD, scripting). They must have strong knowledge of Australian government cloud compliance, data sovereignty, and privacy laws and have a proven ability to deliver scalable, secure solutions aligned with regulatory requirements.

Position description for the Senior Cloud Engineer:
ï Technology Architects at the EL2 equivalent level are also called Senior Cloud Engineer (Senior Technical Engineering Expert).
ï Technology Architects/ Senior Cloud Engineer determine the appropriate technologies to be used in the service development and delivery environment. They monitor emerging technologies and plan technology exploration, implementation and retirement.
ï Services Australia is seeking to procure a Senior Cloud Engineer (expert) to play a pivotal role in delivering complex application development projects on public cloud platforms across the Technology and Digital Program (TDP) Group that align with the agency's strategic objectives. The position requires a seasoned professional with extensive experience and expertise in Public Cloud Services.
ï As a Senior Cloud Engineer, you will specialise in either Azure or AWS public cloud platforms, with the capability to design, implement, and optimise environments from new (greenfield) implementations as well as enhance existing setups (brownfield). This role is focused on building secure-by-design architectures, incorporating reusable patterns and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to deliver scalable, compliant cloud solutions in line with APS frameworks and regulations.
ï Senior Cloud Engineer will collaborate with Architecture, Cyber Security, and Core Infrastructure teams in the group to establish foundational infrastructure, enforce governance, and apply best practices across networking and resource management in your primary platform, while demonstrating skills in both Azure and AWS.
ï The Senior Cloud Engineer is expected to operate with a significant degree of independence with a high level of autonomy, while also maintaining close working relationships with key stakeholders and strict adherence to agency processes and procedures.
ï In performing the role, the candidate will be required to identify and drive innovation, manage and lead change, and has an active role in contributing to and implementing the agency's strategic direction with decision-making and advice to others highly dependent on their own judgement.
ï The Senior Cloud Engineer is vital in ensuring that Services Australia effectively leverages technology to enhance service delivery and meet the needs of the community.
ï Develop, describe present and influence outcomes and/or findings across various forums.
ï Excellent problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills in a collaborative environment

Technical experience for the Senior Cloud Engineer:
ï 5+ years of hands-on experience as a Cloud Engineer, with expertise in building greenfield and brownfield setups in either Azure OR AWS public clouds, including IaC implementations and secure-by-design principles.
ï Proven track record with foundational elements in Azure (Landing Zones, Management Groups, Resource Groups, Key Vault, Blob Storage, Virtual Machines) OR AWS equivalents (Landing Zone, Organizations, VPCs, Secrets Manager, S3, EC2).
ï Strong knowledge of networking in either or both platforms: Azure (VNets, peering, NSGs, routing) and/or AWS (VPCs, subnets, security groups, NAT gateways), including hybrid connectivity.
ï Experience in governance and security: Implementing policies, guardrails, RBAC/IAM, and tools like Azure Security Center or AWS Security Hub.
ï Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Azure DevOps, AWS CodePipeline), and scripting (PowerShell, Python, Bash).
ï Understanding of Australian government cloud requirements, including data sovereignty, security classifications, and regulatory compliance.
ï Proficiency in relevant technologies, frameworks, and tools, as well as the ability to translate complex technical requirements into scalable and sustainable solutions is imperative.
ï Data governance, privacy laws, and other pertinent policies that impact solution delivery within Services Australia.

Knowledge and Qualifications for the Senior Cloud Engineer::
ï Certifications such as AZ-104/AZ-305 (Azure) or AWS SysOps/CloudOps highly desirable.
ï Strong communication and negotiation skills
ï Professional presentation skills

The key position responsibilities for the Senior Cloud Engineer are:
ï Design and deploy greenfield and brownfield cloud platforms in either Azure or AWS, including foundational structures like Azure Landing Zones/Management Groups or AWS Landing Zone/Organizations/Control Tower, to support organisational scalability and hierarchy.
ï Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, ARM/Bicep (Azure), or CloudFormation (AWS) for reusable, automated, and secure deployments.
ï Configure and manage core services, such as Azure Key Vault/Blob Storage/Virtual Machines or AWS Secrets Manager/S3/EC2, ensuring secure-by-design principles like least privilege, encryption at rest/transit, and threat modelling.
ï Establish robust networking components, including Azure VNets/Subnets/NSGs/Firewall or AWS VPCs/Subnets/Security Groups/Transit Gateway, with focus on secure connectivity (e.g., VPN/ExpressRoute in Azure or Direct Connect in AWS).
ï Develop and enforce governance frameworks, including policies and guardrails via Azure Policy/RBAC or AWS Control Tower/IAM, to align with Australian government standards (e.g., ISM, PSPF), incorporating security assessments, cost optimisation, and compliance monitoring.
ï Integrate secure-by-design practices throughout the lifecycle, such as zero-trust models, automated vulnerability scanning, and identity federation.
ï Provide technical guidance, documentation, and training to teams on best practices for both Azure and AWS environments.
ï Document, present and discuss the end-to-end implementation options, recommendations and implications, to facilitate and support the decision-making process.
ï Ensure work aligns with business processes and overall delivery outcomes.
ï Drive innovation, continuous improvement and manage and lead change.
ï Proactively share knowledge and expertise as the subject matter expert.
ï Oversee and prepare a range of documentation and reports.
ï Collaborate with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders to achieve outcomes and key deliverables.
ï Resolve very complex, sensitive and/or escalated technical issues.
ï Develop and present outcomes confidently to a range of stakeholders across multiple forums.

Essential criteria
ï Emerging technology monitoring: Level 6 (SFIA):
- Plans and leads the identification and assessment of emerging technologies and the evaluation of potential impacts, threats and opportunities.
- Creates technology roadmaps that align organisational plans with emerging technology solutions. Engages with, and influences, relevant stakeholders to obtain organisational commitment to technology roadmaps.
- Develops organisational guidelines for monitoring emerging technologies. Collaborates with internal and external parties to facilitate intelligence gathering.
ï Information security: Level 3 (SFIA):
- Applies and maintains specific security controls as required by organisational policy and local risk assessments.
- Communicates security risks and issues to business managers and others. Performs basic risk assessments for small information systems.
- Contributes to the identification of risks that arise from potential technical solution architectures.
- Suggests alternate solutions or countermeasures to mitigate risks. Defines secure systems configurations in compliance with intended architectures. Supports investigation of suspected attacks and security breaches.
ï Innovation: Level 5 (SFIA):
- Manages the innovation pipeline and executes innovation processes.
- Develops and adapts innovation tools, processes and infrastructures to drive the process of innovation.
- Identifies resources and capabilities needed to support innovation.
- Encourages and motivates innovation communities, teams and individuals to share creative ideas and learn from failures.
- Manages and facilitates the communication and open flow of creative ideas between interested parties and the set-up of innovation networks and communities.
ï Solution architecture: Level 4 (SFIA):
- Contributes to the development of solution architectures in specific business, infrastructure or functional areas.
- Identifies and evaluates alternative architectures and the trade-offs in cost, performance and scalability.
- Determines and documents architecturally significant decisions.
- Produces specifications of cloud-based or on-premises components, tiers and interfaces, for translation into detailed designs using selected services and products.
- Supports projects or change initiatives through the preparation of technical plans and application of design principles.
- Aligns solutions with enterprise and solution architecture standards (including security).
ï Specialist advice: Level 5 (SFIA):
- Provides definitive and expert advice in their specialist area.
- Actively maintains recognised expert level knowledge in one or more identifiable specialisms.
- Oversees the provision of specialist advice by others.
- Consolidates expertise from multiple sources, including third-party experts, to provide coherent advice to further organisational objectives.
- Supports and promotes the development and sharing of specialist knowledge within the organisation.
ï Systems design: Level 5 (SFIA)
- Designs large or complex systems and undertakes impact analysis on major design options and trade-offs.
- Ensures that the system design balances functional and non-functional requirements.
- Reviews systems designs and ensures that appropriate methods, tools and techniques are applied effectively.
- Makes recommendations and assesses and manages associated risks.
- Adopts and adapts system design methods, tools and techniques.
- Contributes to development of system design policies, standards and selection of architecture components.

Desirable criteria
ï Consultancy: Level 6 (SFIA):
- Manages the provision of consultancy services and/or a team of consultants. In own areas of expertise, provides advice and guidance to consultants and/or the client when delivering consultancy services.
- Engages with clients and maintains client relationships.
- Establishes consultancy agreements/contracts and manages completion and disengagement.
ï Enterprise and business architecture: Level 5 (SFIA):
- Develops models and plans to drive the execution of the business strategy, taking advantage of opportunities to improve business performance.
- Contributes to creating and reviewing a systems capability strategy which meets the business's strategic requirements.
- Determines requirements and specifies effective business processes, through improvements in technology, information or data practices, organisation, roles, procedures and equipment.
ï Information assurance: Level 5 (SFIA):
- Interprets information assurance and security policies and applies these to manage risks.
- Provides advice and guidance to ensure adoption of and adherence to information assurance architectures, strategies, policies, standards and guidelines.
- Plans, organises and conducts information assurance and accreditation of complex domains areas, cross-functional areas, and across the supply chain. Contributes to the development of policies, standards and guidelines.
ï Network design: Level 6 (SFIA):
- Takes responsibility for major aspects of network specification, standards, technologies and overall network design models within the organisation.
- Produces network design policies, principles and criteria covering connectivity, capacity, interfacing, security, resilience, recovery and access.
ï Requirements definition and management: Level 4 (SFIA):
- Defines and manages scoping, requirements definition and prioritisation activities for initiatives of medium size and complexity.
- Contributes to selecting the requirements approach. Facilitates input from stakeholders, provides constructive challenge and enables effective prioritisation of requirements.
- Establishes requirements base-lines, obtains formal agreement to requirements, and ensures traceability to source.

HOW TO APPLY

Please provide an updated CV (a maximum of 3-5 pages) to reflect your suitability to the role based on the job description. You will also need to complete a summary which is no more than 5000 characters in total in response to the requirements for the role and the essential and desirable criteria. Your application will be reviewed based on ability to demonstrate, or potential to develop, the capabilities required.

job_description:
Applicants to this role must have work authorization in Saudi Arabia as this role is not eligible for work visa sponsorship

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience with cloud native architecture in a customer-facing or support role.
Experience in one or more core areas: Infrastructure Modernization, Cloud Runtimes (GKE/Cloud Run), Databases, or Networking and Security.
Experience with cloud infrastructure or application modernization in a delivery role.
Experience in deployment planning, orchestration, or change management, as well as in programming languages, debugging, or systems design.
Ability to communicate in English and Arabic fluently to work in this client facing role.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform) and CI/CD pipelines, and in programming languages (Python, Go) for automation.
Experience with SRE principles, incident response protocols, lean/agile methodologies to manage delivery flow and eliminate waste.
Experience guiding Global Systems Integrators (GSIs) or partners through technical implementations and enforcing quality standards.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Foundation Toolkit (CFT) or similar standardized deployment libraries.
Ability to act as a player-coach, upskilling customer teams through code walkthroughs and technical workshops.

Ability to navigate ambiguity, facilitate technical workshops, and guide customers through the organizational change to adopt a new cloud-powered business process.
About The Job

As a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Outcome Customer Engineer (OCE), you will drive initial and ongoing business generation ramp for our customers, clearing blockers and ensuring they get the maximum benefit from their investment faster.

You will manage and execute the deployment plan, transitioning scoped workloads into production by providing technical leadership to customers and partners.

You will have a direct impact on the velocity and incremental consumption of customer workloads, leading to accelerated value realization, higher adoption, and future expansion opportunities.

You will blend sales expertise, market knowledge, direct technical engagement, and technical project management to prove the value of the Google Cloud portfolio.
Google Cloud accelerates every organization's ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably.

Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities

Develop and orchestrate a structured, end-to-end deployment plan across customer and partner teams, onboarding the implementation team, clearing blockers, managing timelines and progress, and ensuring readiness (e.g., capacity, training).
Leverage skills such as coding, debugging, or systems design to resolve technical blockers and accelerate deployment.

Drive and track progress of the initial and ongoing ramp of workloads, moving customers from agreement to consumption as quickly as possible.
Identify expansion opportunities for new workloads within the account during project execution.
Drive sustainable product usage to help customers realize value on an ongoing basis and secure future agreements renewals.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more Show less

With a focus on strategic IT transformation, the company aligns closely with client objectives, providing invaluable support in effective planning, seamless implementation, and proficient management of IT infrastructure./p>

The client is looking for a Senior Service Engineer VAS/CLOUD to work in The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

Overall Purpose:

The Senior Service Engineer ensures the quality of service, performance monitoring, and operational excellence of VAS/Cloud services, while managing day-to-day activities within Managed Services.

Responsibilities:

The Senior Service Engineer is responsible for:
ï Ensuring overall Quality of Service, performance data, SLA, and KPIs in the Operations Centre.

ï Real-time monitoring of service and network quality and capacity; analyzing and reporting on performance.
ï Initiating service and network improvements and optimization activities.
ï Performing temporary service and network reconfigurations if performance is not satisfactory.

ï Analyzing failure trends and identifying chronic failures.
ï Providing performance data and determining the impact of service issues on performance.

Main Activities:
ï Set up performance measurements and quality thresholds using available tools.

Interface With:

ï Customer Interfaces

ï Ability to work independently and in a team.

ï Methodical and thorough in approach.
ï Strong analytical and investigative abilities.
ï Focused on service and network performance.
ï Able to work under tight deadlines.

Technical Competence:
ï Hands-on experience with Cloud solutions, NFVi, SDI, SDN, and orchestrators.
ï Hands-on experience or strong knowledge of WRMS.
ï Knowledge of VAS systems, including standards and protocols such as SMS and Bulk Messaging.
ï Strong understanding of IP networks.

ï Experience with cloud systems and environments such as OpenStack Cloud and Kubernetes.
ï Knowledge of Grafana, Shell scripting, and automation tools.

Required Education and Experience:
ï Bachelorís degree in Electrical Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent.
ï Minimum 8 years of experience in Operations and Maintenance.
ï Experience as a Technical Lead.
ï Experience within Datacom and Telecom networks.

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

This is a general selection process for software engineers focused on virtualisation and container technology - from the kernel through userspace. Apply here if you are an exceptional Go, Rust, or C/C++ software engineer and want to work on next-generation open source VMM or container technology, or related open source networking and storage.

Container, virtualisation and cloud infrastructure have become essentials of modern software deployments. We invest in open source related to application isolation, workload orchestration, system or OCI containers, micro service architecture or cloud infrastructure.

Here are some examples of projects under way at Canonical.

RustVMM has great potential as a new hypervisor for Linux. We are building a team to work on this, with an emphasis on performance, security and operability. Work in Rust and bring your expert knowledge of VMM and related kernel networking and storage capabilities.

Docker images are easy to make and publish on Docker Hub and other registries, but the quality, consistency and security maintenance of those images is broadly very poor. Canonical is in a good position to publish a portfolio of outstanding Docker images. Our Rockcraft team is designing and implementing an elevated Docker image experience for the open source community.

LXD is a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD engineering spans the entire software stack from low-level kernel work on namespaces, confinement, security, filesystems, VMMs and networking, to the high level management REST API and CLI.

Members of the Kubernetes product team build MicroK8s for on-rails K8s, and Charmed Kubernetes for more sophisticated integration. We work on K8s itself and on the operations tooling around it.

The OpenStack team deliver Charmed OpenStack, OVN / OVS and Ceph. This work brings cloud platform technologies to large-scale computing environments.

These teams hire system level C/C++, Golang, Rust and Python developers to work on security-critical, performance-critical and mission-critical code, focused on software delivery, containers, security, sandboxing, application orchestration and management. Our teams are motivated to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies.

Location: we have remote container and virt engineering roles in every time zone.

What you will focus on
ï Design and specify new features, building consensus on approach
ï Engage with upstream communities in your area of expertise

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

To create and manage a GKE (Google Kubernetes Engine) environment and the overall Anthos environment. ï Configure cluster settings:

Define node locations, machine types, network settings, and other parameters according to your workload needs.

3. Registering GKE Clusters with Anthos:
ï Register clusters to a fleet:

Connect your GKE clusters to a fleet to enable multi-cluster management features.
ï Use the Connect Agent:

This agent establishes a secure connection between your clusters and Google Cloud, enabling management from the console and CLI.

4. Managing the Anthos Environment:

ï Fleets: Organize and manage your clusters as a single logical unit.
ï Anthos Config Management: Use GitOps-based configuration management to enforce policies and ensure consistency across your clusters.

Utilize Anthos Service Mesh to manage, monitor, and secure your services across clusters.

Leverage Anthos's observability features to monitor cluster health, resource utilization, and application performance.
ï Team Management:

Use team-scoped views to manage access and permissions for your development teams.

5. Key Considerations:
ï Networking:

Plan your networking strategy for communication between clusters and external resources.
ï Security:

Implement robust security measures, including network policies, access controls, and encryption.

Design your clusters with scalability in mind to handle fluctuating workloads.

Monitor resource utilization and optimize your cluster configurations to minimize costs.

Our passionate experts combine the power of proactive, always-on service and expertise with best-in-class tools and automation to deliver technology when and how our customers need it.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Services Platform Engineer to join our Professional Services Team, focusing on designing, implementing, and managing our cloud data services platform. This role is critical to ensuring reliable, scalable, and high-performance data services across private cloud environments. The ideal candidate will have expertise in container-native storage solutions, Kubernetes, and database management at scale, with the ability to work across multiple data technologies and platforms.

Discover your inner Racker - click here

Responsibilities
ï Design, build, and manage enterprise data services platforms and infrastructure, preferably Portworx Data Services (PDS)
ï Monitor platform health, performance metrics, and capacity planning across multiple data technologies
ï Implement and maintain backup, disaster recovery, and high availability strategies
ï Troubleshoot complex platform issues and coordinate resolution efforts
ï Ensure high uptime and meet established SLA requirements for data services
ï Provision and manage various data services including databases, caching layers, and message queues
ï Implement data security best practices, access controls, and compliance requirements
ï Optimize data service performance, storage utilization, and resource allocation
ï Manage data service lifecycle including upgrades, patches, and migrations
ï Support multiple data technologies (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Kafka, etc.)
ï Design and implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or Helm
ï Develop automation scripts (e.g. Python, Bash/Shell, PowerShell, etc.) for routine operations, deployments, and maintenance tasks
ï Integrate data services platform with CI/CD pipelines and development workflows
ï Implement monitoring and alerting solutions using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or similar
ï Manage Kubernetes clusters and container orchestration for data workloads
ï Provide technical guidance and best practices for data service usage to cloud tenants/users
ï Participate in on-call rotation for critical platform support
ï Document processes, procedures, and architectural decisions
ï Collaborate with security and compliance teams to ensure regulatory adherence

Requirements
ï Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field
ï 5+ years of experience in platform engineering, DevOps, or data infrastructure administration
ï 3+ years of experience with container-native storage solutions (Portworx preferred)
ï Experience managing production data services environments at scale
ï Solid experience with Linux-based Operating Systems (e.g. Debian/Ubuntu, Redhat, etc.) and Windows Server administration
ï Proven track record of implementing high-availability and disaster recovery solutions
ï Experience with agile development methodologies and collaborative team environments
ï Strong expertise in Kubernetes administration and container orchestration
ï Proficiency with data service administration across multiple technologies (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Kafka, etc.)
ï Solid understanding of networking, storage, and security principles in containerized environments
ï Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Bash, etc.) for automation
ï Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, Ansible, Helm)
ï Knowledge of monitoring and observability tools

Additional Skills (Good To Have)
ï Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) or similar certifications
ï Experience with Portworx or other container-native storage platforms
ï Experience with service mesh technologies (Istio, Linkerd)
ï Knowledge of data service performance tuning and optimization techniques
ï Experience with data pipeline tools and ETL processes
ï Familiarity with compliance frameworks (SOC2, GDPR, HIPAA)
ï Experience with GitOps workflows and tools like ArgoCD or Flux

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

job_title: Backend Developer / Full Stack Developer (Java Spring Boot)
job_description:
We are looking for skilled Saudi Backend Developers or Full Stack Developers with strong expertise in Java and Spring Boot. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable backend services and APIs, and, for full stack profiles, contributing to frontend development as well. This role is ideal for a hands-on developer who enjoys building robust systems, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and working in agile environments.

Key Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, test, and maintain backend services using Java and Spring Boot
ï Build and maintain RESTful APIs and microservices
ï Collaborate with frontend developers, product owners, and QA teams to deliver end-to-end solutions
ï Optimize application performance, scalability, and security
ï Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices
ï Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical improvements
ï Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve production issues
ï For Full Stack profiles: contribute to frontend development and integration with backend services
ï Work within an Agile/Scrum development environment

Requirements
ï Minimum 3 years of professional experience in software development
ï Strong experience with Java and Spring Boot
ï Solid understanding of REST APIs, HTTP protocols, and microservices architecture
ï Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle)
ï Familiarity with Git and version control workflows
ï Understanding of software development best practices, design patterns, and clean code
ï Experience working in Agile environments
ï Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail
ï Strong communication skills in a collaborative team environment

Description

Role : Senior Back-End .NET Developer

Location : Saudi Arabia (Onsite)

Exp : 6+ years

Key Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain backend services and web APIs using .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, C#, MVC, and Web API.
ï Develop and optimize database structures and queries using SQL Server or other RDBMS.
ï Integrate intelligent services such as Azure Cognitive Services or ML.NET to enable AI-driven features.
ï Collaborate with frontend developers and UI/UX designers to deliver seamless full-stack solutions.
ï Ensure application performance, scalability, and security through clean architecture and code

best practices.
ï Build and maintain integrations with external systems like Microsoft Dynamics CRM,

SharePoint, and others using RESTful and SOAP services.
ï Deploy applications using IIS, Docker, or Azure App Services, and manage CI/CD pipelines

with Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.
ï Conduct code reviews and provide mentorship to junior developers.
ï Write and maintain unit and integration tests using xUnit, NUnit, or similar frameworks.
ï Participate in Agile ceremonies (Scrum/Kanban), contributing to sprint planning, task

estimation, and delivery.
ï Maintain clear technical documentation for APIs, system architecture, and deployment

workflows.
ï Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot issues and deliver solutions in a timely manner.

Required Skills & Qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
ï 5+ years of professional experience in .NET backend development.
ï Strong proficiency in .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, MVC, Web API, and C#.
ï Solid experience with SQL Server and writing optimized SQL queries.
ï Familiarity with AI and ML integration tools such as Azure AI services or ML.NET is a strong

plus.
ï Experience with modern frontend technologies like Angular, React, or Next.js is a plus.
ï Proficiency in using Visual Studio (20192022), SQL Server Management Studio, NSwag Studio, Stoplight, Mockoon, and IIS is plus.
ï Experience with version control systems like Git and tools like TFS.
ï Good understanding of design patterns, OOP, and clean code principles.
ï Experience with cloud platforms (especially Azure) and DevOps practices.
ï Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
ï Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

(ref:hirist.tech)

Role Purpose.
The Backend Developer is responsible for delivering high quality technology capabilities supporting smart sustainable developments.

Key Responsibilities.
ï Design implement and support solutions aligned with organizational strategy.
ï Engage stakeholders to translate requirements into effective outcomes.
ï Ensure reliability security and performance of platforms and systems.
ï Support operations deployment and continuous improvement initiatives.
ï Maintain documentation standards and compliance requirements.

ï Bachelor degree in engineering information technology or related discipline.
ï Proven experience in a similar role within complex environments.
ï Strong communication analytical and problem solving skills.
ï Ability to work collaboratively across multidisciplinary teams.
ï Experience with sustainable smart digital programs is an advantage.

We are looking for a skilled Backend Developer to join our dynamic team at Master-Works.
As a Backend Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining server-side applications, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end.
You will collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements using server-side logic.
Location: Hyderabad (5 Days work from office) Working Days: Sunday to Thursday Timings: 10 AM to 6 PM Key Responsibilities: Develop high-quality, reusable, and maintainable back-end components for web applications.
Design and implement RESTful APIs to support front-end functionalities.
Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements using server-side logic.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.

Monitor and improve server-side performance.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues across the application stack.
Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends.

2+ years of experience in back-end development.
Proficiency in one or more back-end programming languages (e.
g., Python, Java, Node.
js). Experience with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
Familiarity with RESTful API development and integration.
Understanding of security best practices when dealing with back-end technologies.
Knowledge of version control systems, preferably Git.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.

job_description:
Who Are We

HALA is a leading fintech player in the MENAP region that aims to redefine financial services and build the future bank of SMEs. HALA aims at empowering SMEs to start, run, and grow their businesses by providing them with cutting-edge financial and technological tools.

HALA currently holds multiple entities in UAE, Saudi Arabia and Egypt (including HALA Payments, HALA Cashier and HALA Logistics) and offers solutions that enable merchants to digitize their payments as well as manage their sales and operations.

Founded in 2017, HALA is currently duly licensed by the Saudi Arabian Central Bank as well as the Financials Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in Abu Dhabi Global Market.

Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain scalable, high-performance backend systems.
ï Architect and implement microservices-based applications using .NET Core.
ï Develop and optimize RESTful APIs for seamless integration with frontend and third-party services.
ï Work with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis) databases for efficient data storage and retrieval.
ï Implement authentication, authorization, and security best practices (OAuth, JWT, encryption, API security).
ï Collaborate with DevOps to manage CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and cloud deployments (AWS, Azure, GCP).
ï Ensure system scalability, reliability, and performance optimization.
ï Work with event-driven architectures using Kafka, RabbitMQ, or other message brokers.
ï Perform code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and enforce best coding practices.
ï Stay updated on emerging backend technologies, frameworks, and best practices.

Requirements
ï 5+ years of experience in backend development.
ï Proficiency in .NET Core.
ï Strong experience with microservices architecture and distributed systems.
ï Deep knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis).
ï Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
ï Hands-on experience with message brokers (Kafka, RabbitMQ) for event-driven systems.
ï Strong understanding of API security, authentication mechanisms, and performance tuning.
ï Knowledge of CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins.
ï Experience with scalability and high-availability architectures.
ï Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.
ï Strong communication and leadership skills to mentor junior developers.

What We Offer You

We believe you will love working at HALA!
ï We have an inclusive and diverse culture that encourages innovation and flexibility in remote, in-office, and hybrid work setups.
ï We offer highly competitive compensation packages, including the potential for shares.
ï We prioritize personal development and offer regular training and an annual learning stipend to tackle new challenges and grow your career in a hyper-growth environment.
ï Join a talented team of over 30 nationalities working in 7 countries and gain valuable experience in an exciting industry.
ï We offer autonomy, mentoring, and challenging goals that create incredible opportunities for both you and the company.
ï You will be given a lot of responsibility and trust. We believe that the best results come when the people responsible for a function are given the freedom to do what they think is best.

If you think you have what it takes to join a remarkable team #apply_now

job_description:
Job summary

We are looking for a skilled back-end developer to design, develop, and maintain server-side applications and APIs that power scalable, secure, and high-performance systems. The role involves close collaboration with front-end developers, database specialists, business analysts, and DevOps teams to deliver reliable business solutions.

Key responsibilities
ï Application development

Design, develop, and maintain server-side logic and APIs.

Build reusable, efficient, and scalable back-end components.

Integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
ï Database & data management

Design and manage databases (SQL and/or NoSQL).

Write optimized queries and ensure data integrity.

Work with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.
ï API & integration

Develop and maintain RESTful / GraphQL APIs.

Integrate third-party services and external systems.

Ensure API security, performance, and versioning.
ï Performance & security

Optimize applications for speed, scalability, and reliability.

Implement authentication, authorization, and data security best practices.

Identify and fix performance bottlenecks and bugs.
ï Collaboration & agile practices

Work in Agile/Scrum teams with product owners, business analysts, and Scrum Masters.

Participate in sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.

Contribute to code reviews and technical discussions.

Requirements

Required skills & qualifications

Technical skills:
ï Strong experience in one or more back-end languages: Java, Python, Node.js, C#, or similar.
ï Experience with back-end frameworks: Spring Boot, Django, Express.js, .NET, etc.
ï Solid understanding of REST APIs, microservices architecture, and object-oriented programming.

Databases & tools:
ï Experience with SQL and/or NoSQL databases.
ï Familiarity with version control tools (Git).
ï Experience with CI/CD pipelines.

Experience & education
ï Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent experience).
ï 4ñ6 years of experience in back-end development.

Job description

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Machine Learning and AI are increasingly powering applications across organizations like financial institutions, healthcare, government etc. In order for AI to be successful and help improve our lives, it must be trustworthy by providing transparency and be explainable. Organizations are recognizing the importance of a holistic approach to governed data and AI technology in order to manger risk and regulations and to safeguard their brand reputations.

At IBM we are helping people and organizations adopt AI responsibly. Watsonx Governance is an enterprise-grade toolkit to accelerate responsible, transparent and explainable AI workflows. We enable organizations to comply with regulations, demonstrate strong model governance and mitigate business risk using an integrated and transparent approach.

Who you are:

Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Your Role and Responsibilities

What you'll do:

At IBM, you will be part of the Watsonx Governance team and will build capabilities that enable organizations to deploy and scale AI applications that are compliant with regulations and are trustworthy.

You will work in an innovation driven, collaborative environment to understand requirements, architect, design and implement trusted AI solutions.
You will develop cloud native micro services that will be deployed to hybrid cloud environments
You will work with customers to help them succeed in their AI journey by adopting Watson Studio Trusted AI solutions.
You will work in a agile development environment
You will actively contribute to all phases of software development including development and testing.

SASW_24

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
ï Excellent analytical and problem solving skills and the zeal to learn quickly and adapt to changing requirements
ï Programming skills in Java, Python
ï Understanding of data structures, algorithms and programming
ï Ability to collaborate and work independently when required.
ï Ability to learn and apply new technologies quickly

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
ï Exposure to development and scripting technologies like React, Node, HTML, CSS, Java Script etc
ï Exposure to software development practices and methodologies

job_description:
Company Description

We are one of the largest travel and transportation companies in the region and currently are in the middle of a massive digital transformation within the organization.

Job Description

We are looking for a strong Principal Software Engineer. If you are well versed in Microservices, Solution Architecture, including network, data, application, system, and integration architecture - then we are looking for you!

Responsibiities:
ï Design Technical/Integration Architectures, including development, runtime, and operations architectures
ï Define scalable solutions using Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) patterns, and microservices automating business process models and cloud-based services.
ï Design message and event-driven architectures.
ï Lead implementation of large, complex solutions from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
ï Provide Technical design across multiple projects and clients
ï Provide Technology Consulting services covering areas such as Architectural Strategy, Architectural review/audit and Architecture road-map.
ï Manages the risks, issues, and dependencies of the scoped solution
ï Responsible for roadmaps for integration technologies (current and future).
ï Introducing Agile processes to the existing team

Qualifications
ï 5+ years of intensive Java backend development and solution architecture. (Java, Spring Boot, API Security, Redis, Sql and NoSql databases, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS).
ï Strong experience in hands-on platform delivery and architecture design.
ï Full understanding of Cloud service, AWS and DevOps tools and CI/CD process.
ï Strong experience with the full life cycle of Agile software development processes, approaches, delivery and methods with scaling to the Enterprise and release management processes.
ï Thought leadership and Technical knowledge combined with delivery experience in some of these areas:
ï Legacy platform migration
ï RESTful APIs and API gateways
ï Microservices based Architecture
ï Cloud deployment (AWS mainly)
ï Ability to influence and guide senior stakeholders on technical solutions
ï Excellent documentation, presentation and communication skills.
ï Should have good experience with NodeJs

InnovationTeam is a dynamic technology company dedicated to delivering cutting-edge solutions to diverse markets.
We're on the lookout for skilled SR Backend Developers with a strong focus on Microservices architecture to become part of our talented development team.
At InnovationTeam, we believe in fostering innovation, teamwork, and professional growth.
As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment that encourages creativity and technical excellence.
As a SR Backend Developer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing robust microservices that drive our applications.
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable solutions while ensuring best practices in software development.
Private Health Insurance Work From Home Training & Development Competitive Salary Annual Vacation Requirements: Minimum 5 years of experience in software development with a focus on backend technologies.
Strong knowledge of Microservices architecture and design patterns.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or Node.
js. Experience with RESTful APIs and developing scalable web services.
Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Solid understanding of database technologies, both SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra).
Experience with message brokers (RabbitMQ, Kafka) and event-driven architecture.
Knowledge of CI/CD processes and tools such as Jenkins or GitLab CI.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
Nice to have: Experience in cloud services such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Contributions to open-source projects or technical blogs.
Must Hold solid Microservices experience (At least two projects delivered).
Must have developed and successfully deployed to production at least three products built on a microservices architecture (containerized, CI/CD-enabled, observability in place).
Expectations: Participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment.
Work closely with frontend developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
Conduct code reviews and mentor junior developers to improve their skills.
Continuously improve existing applications by refactoring code and optimizing performance.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies.

Position: Junior Backend Engineer: AI-Driven, Hybrid, Growth
A tech-driven company in the Riyadh Region is seeking a passionate Junior Software Engineer to assist in the design and development of innovative backend systems. The ideal candidate should have a degree in Computer Science, Business, or Telecommunications and a proactive attitude. This position offers competitive salary, flexible hours, and a hybrid work environment with opportunities for growth and mentorship in a fast-moving sector.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

Company Description

Weíre a remote-first, distributed software company with team members spread across the globe. We help startups and scaling companies build products and grow their engineering teams.

Why do people join Clearview? To make an impact. To grow as people and professionals. To enjoy schedule flexibility unlike anything theyíve ever experienced in a workplace. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

We bring Clearview teammates on as full-time contractors, but our list of benefits looks nothing like traditional contract freelancing. We offer all our teammates:
ï Unparalleled flexibility of working hours --which means operationalized family-first, soul-first values
ï Paid skill expansion (so you can keep growing as you work with us).
ï Coworking (or home office optimization) budget
ï A local meet-up budget for our co-located teammates to hang out outside of work
ï Annual summits , for company-wide face time

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path to success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will often work independently, but when youíre working on a team it will be a small, feature-based, cross-functional team. One thing you can be certain of: You will be empowered to take ownership.

Job Description

Are you an exceptionally strong, mid-to-senior Backend Developer with an independent mindset? Do you want to work remotely on challenging projects within a great community? Sounds like youíll be a great fit for Clearview.

We are currently seeking a mid-to-senior-career engineer with ironclad coding skills and the proven ability to work effectively, proactively and independently but within the context of a small, self-directed engineering team.

Qualifications

Youíll need to be:
ï Fluent in the English language, both spoken and written (however: we donít mind which version of the English language it is)
ï Comfortable working effectively, proactively and independently within the context of a small, self-directed team of developers.
ï A fully proactive and self-directed time-management expert, very capable and happy working independently while communicating very regularly with your intercontinental teammates.

What we expect of you:
ï Several years of professional experience in software development
ï Youíll write lots of Node.js code, incorporating best practices, design patterns and frameworks that will last for years to come.
ï Strong experience and understand the ins and outs of JavaScript and Node.js.
ï Extensive experience with Git, GitHub and GitLab
ï Implement automated unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
ï Create pull requests (While youíre at it, review your teammatesí pull requests too, mentoring the more junior members of our development team.)
ï Youíll participate in design sessions with your team members, coming up with the optimum technical solution: one that not only meets business requirements, but does so with performance, scalability and maintainability in mind.
ï Youíll innovate. Thereís always something we can improve upon, whether it be process or tools or technology choices. If you can dream it, youíll likely get to build it.
ï You have a strong understanding of SQL databases (Postgres, MySQL..), Redis and Elasticsearch

It would be awesome if:
ï You have some experience working remotely (but if youíre a clear communicator with rock-solid reliability and youíre curious about making the leap to remote, weíll guide you through it)
ï You understand the AWS / GCP / Docker / K8s services and ecosystem.
ï You understand CI tools and implement CD (Delivery/Deployment)

Summary

Senior Full?Stack .NET Developer to design, build, and maintain high?performance backend services and APIs, collaborate closely with front?end teams, and drive architectural decisions in a fast?paced, Agile environment.

Description
ï Architect, develop, and deploy RESTful APIs using ASP.NET Core MVC and .NET 6/7
ï Lead code reviews and enforce clean?code standards across the team
ï Integrate front?end frameworks such as Angular or React with backend services
ï Develop backend services and APIs using .NET MVC / .NET Core.
ï Build frontend interfaces with Angular, React, or Razor views.
ï Work with databases (SQL Server, Entity Framework, ..etc) for data access.
ï Ensure clean, scalable, and secure code across frontend and backend.
ï Collaborate with teams to deliver end-to-end web solutions.

Required Skills:
ï .NET Core / .NET MVC and C#
ï Angular or React / Razor Views
ï SQL Server & Entity Framework
ï RESTful APIs
ï Clean, secure, scalable coding
ï Git & Agile basics
ï Problem-solving and teamwork

Job Requirements
ï Minimum 5 years professional experience in full?stack .NET development
ï Strong proficiency in C#, ASP.NET Core MVC, Web API, and Entity Framework Core
ï Hands?on experience with front?end technologies such as Angular 12+, React, or Vue.js
ï Deep understanding of relational databases, SQL Server, and performance tuning
ï Proven track record with Azure cloud services (App Service, Functions, Storage) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
ï Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or similar tools
ï Bachelorís degree in Computer Science or equivalent, or demonstrable equivalent experience

job_description:
Overview:

We are seeking a highly experienced Senior PHP Backend Developer to lead the design and development of robust, scalable, and high-performance backend systems. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of building enterprise-grade applications, mentoring team members, and driving technical excellence throughout the software development lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Lead backend architecture and development efforts, ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability of PHP-based systems.

2. Collaborate cross-functionally with front-end engineers, product managers, and DevOps teams to define technical solutions aligned with business objectives.

3. Design and optimize databases, crafting efficient data models, writing high-performance SQL queries, and managing complex data migrations.

4. Integrate external APIs and internal microservices, ensuring seamless interoperability and secure data exchange.

5. Implement robust security practices, including authentication, authorization, input validation, and data protection mechanisms.

6. Drive performance optimization, identifying bottlenecks, implementing caching layers, and improving backend efficiency.

7. Oversee code quality through regular code reviews, enforcing best practices, and guiding junior developers in clean coding principles.

8. Stay ahead of technology trends, continuously evaluating and adopting new PHP frameworks, tools, and architectural patterns.

9. Contribute to DevOps and CI/CD initiatives, ensuring smooth deployment pipelines and automated testing processes.

10. Provide technical mentorship, support production systems, and ensure high availability and reliability in live environments.

1. 7+ years of professional experience in backend development, with deep expertise in PHP and frameworks such as Laravel, Symfony, or CodeIgniter.

2. Strong understanding of software architecture, design patterns (e.g., SOLID principles, MVC), and scalable system design.

3. Hands-on experience with RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and third-party API integrations.

4. Advanced knowledge of MySQL (or other relational databases), including query optimization and schema design.

5. Proficiency in version control systems (Git) and experience with collaborative workflows (branching, pull requests, code reviews).

6. Solid understanding of server environments, deployment automation, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or similar).

7. Familiarity with frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and their integration with backend systems.

8. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex production issues.

9. Excellent communication and leadership skills, with a proactive approach to mentoring and collaboration.

10. A passion for engineering excellence, continuous learning, and contributing to a culture of innovation and quality.

Job Title:

Factory, Singleton

We are looking for an experienced Senior Back-End .NET Developer to join our team.

If you're passionate about designing scalable backend systems, integrating with modern cloud services, and working in a collaborative Agile environment, this role is for you.
You'll lead the development of robust web APIs and services that power intelligent, secure, and efficient enterprise applications.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain high-performance back-end services and RESTful APIs using .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, C#, MVC, and Web API.
Architect and optimize database solutions using SQL Server or other relational databases.
Integrate Azure Cognitive Services, ML.NET, or other intelligent features into applications.
Collaborate closely with front-end developers, UI/UX designers, and QA engineers to deliver full-stack features.
Apply clean architecture, SOLID principles, and industry best practices to ensure code quality, scalability, and security.
Build and maintain integrations with external systems like Microsoft Dynamics CRM, SharePoint, and others using RESTful/SOAP APIs.
Deploy and manage applications using IIS, Docker, or Azure App Services.
Manage CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.
Conduct thorough code reviews and provide technical guidance to junior developers.
Write and maintain unit and integration tests using xUnit, NUnit, or similar frameworks.

Participate in Agile/Scrum activities:
sprint planning, estimations, retrospectives.
Document system architecture, APIs, and deployment processes.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of experience in .NET backend development.
Expert in .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, C#, MVC, and Web API.
Strong experience in SQL Server, query optimization, and relational database design.
Good understanding of OOP, design patterns, and clean coding practices.
Familiarity with Azure AI services or ML.NET is a strong plus.
Experience integrating with Microsoft Dynamics, SharePoint, or similar systems.
Proficiency in tools such as Visual Studio, SQL Server Management Studio, NSwag Studio, Stoplight, and Mockoon.
Skilled in Git, TFS, and modern version control practices.
Experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, CI/CD, and DevOps practices.

Nice to Have
Exposure to modern frontend frameworks like Angular, React, or
Experience with infrastructure as code and cloud-native development.
Ability to contribute to architectural decisions and mentor peers.

Soft Skills
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork.
Proactive, self-driven, and detail-oriented mindset.
Ability to work both independently and within a collaborative Agile team.
Show more Show less

Summary
We are seeking a Senior Backend Developer responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining server-side applications, databases, and APIs.

The role involves enhancing existing systems, building new backend services, and working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable and scalable solutions using modern technologies.
Description
Design, develop, and maintain serverside logic, database integration, and API connectivity for our software applications
Collaborate with crossfunctional teams to identify and prioritize project requiremets
Develop highquality, efficient, and welldocumented code that meets the requirements of our applications
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, and optimize application performance
Participate in code reviews and contribute to the improvement of the overall quality of our codebase
Stay uptodate with the latest trends and technologies in the industry, and apply this knowledge to improve our applications and services
Mentor and guide junior developers, and contribute to the growth and development of our team
Develop and maintain technical documentation, and ensure that all applications are properly documented
Collaborate with our DevOps team to ensure the smooth deployment of our applications
Participate in agile development methodologies, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes

Key Responsibilities
At least 3 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on serverside logic, database integration, and API connectivity
Strong proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Python, or C#
Experience with database management systems, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB
Knowledge of API design principles, and experience with API development frameworks such as REST or GraphQL
Familiarity with agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban
Strong understanding of software design patterns, and experience with object-oriented programming
Excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related field

Required Skills
Strong experience in backend development and server-side architecture
Proficiency in Java, Python, or C#
Experience designing and developing RESTful or GraphQL APIs
Solid understanding of database design and integration (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Knowledge of object-oriented programming and software design patterns
Experience with version control systems (Git)
Ability to troubleshoot, debug, and optimize application performance
Familiarity with agile development methodologies (Scrum or Kanban)
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Ability to write clear and maintainable technical documentation
Show more Show less

job_title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Python & AI Focus) ñ Onsite Dammam, KSA
job_description:
Job Overview

We are looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer with strong Python and Generative AI expertise to join our team onsite in Dammam, Saudi Arabia. You will lead the front-end integration of multiple custom AI/LLM models into production-grade applications, while progressively contributing to backend and infrastructure layers in a full-stack capacity.

This is a heavily AI-driven role that demands hands-on experience in deploying and consuming Generative AI models (LLMs, RAG pipelines, data extraction, etc.), API development in Python (FastAPI), on-premise server management, containerization, OpenShift orchestration, and robust CI/CD practices.

Key Responsibilities
ï Build responsive, high-performance front-end applications using React.js + Redux, Tailwind CSS, and custom CSS for real-time API/event handling.
ï Integrate multiple custom Generative AI models (LLMs, RAG, embeddings, data-extraction pipelines) into the front-end via REST/gRPC/WebSocket APIs.
ï Design and develop production APIs in Python (FastAPI + Swagger/OpenAPI) to expose AI models hosted on on-prem servers and local machines.
ï Consume and integrate OpenAI APIs, third-party LLMs, and custom fine-tuned models securely and efficiently.
ï Containerize applications and AI inference services using Docker; deploy and manage on Red Hat OpenShiftclusters.
ï Perform Linux system administration tasks related to Docker, OpenShift, networking, storage, and security in on-prem environments.
ï Build, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins (including GitOps practices).
ï Manage backend services using Node.js/Express and/or FastAPI; Next.js experience is a strong plus.
ï Optimize front-end performance when streaming or rendering AI-generated content (text, images, structured data).
ï Troubleshoot full-stack and infrastructure issues across development, staging, and production environments.
ï Participate in architecture and deployment strategy discussions for on-prem AI platforms.

Required Qualifications & Skills
ï 5ñ8 years of professional full-stack development experience.
ï Expert-level React.js + Redux and Tailwind CSS.
ï Strong Python proficiency with deep knowledge of:
ï Generative AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), RAG architectures, prompt-to-output pipelines, data extraction, and vector stores.
ï Building production APIs using FastAPI + Swagger/OpenAPI.
ï Integrating OpenAI APIs and self-hosted/custom LLMs.
ï Solid backend experience with Node.js/Express (Next.js is a big plus) and FastAPI.
ï Proven experience integrating and deploying AI models in production (on-prem or local environments).
ï Advanced Linux administration skills (running Docker/OpenShift commands, troubleshooting containers, networking, security hardening).
ï Hands-on expertise in:
ï Docker (multi-stage builds, Docker Compose, image optimization).
ï Red Hat OpenShift (or Kubernetes) ñ deployments, operators, routes, persistent storage.
ï Jenkins CI/CD pipeline creation and management.
ï Strong grasp of infrastructure-as-code, configuration management, and automated deployment strategies.
ï Fluent in Arabic (mandatory ñ daily communication with client teams in Dammam).
ï Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

Preferred (Nice-to-Have) Skills
ï Next.js (SSR/SSG) and full-stack React frameworks.
ï Kubernetes core concepts and migration from OpenShift.
ï Monitoring stack: Prometheus, Grafana, EFK/ELK.
ï AI model fine-tuning or quantization techniques.
ï Security best practices for containerized AI workloads (secrets management, RBAC, network policies).
ï Cloud exposure (AWS/GCP/Azure) for hybrid scenarios (not mandatory).

Additional Information
ï 8-month full-time onsite contract in Dammam, Saudi Arabia.
ï Immediate or short-notice joining preferred.
ï Compensation & benefits will be competitive and discussed during interviews.
ï Must already have (or be able to obtain quickly) the right to work in Saudi Arabia.

If you live and breathe React + Python + Generative AI + OpenShift/Docker + Linux, and youíre ready to deliver production AI applications onsite in Dammam, we want to hear from you today!

Skills

5ñ8 years of full-stack development experience

Expert in React.js + Redux, Tailwind CSS, and modern front-end architecture

Strong Python with deep expertise in Generative AI, LLMs, RAG pipelines, embeddings, data extraction, and vector stores

Production experience building and documenting APIs using FastAPI + Swagger/OpenAPI

Hands-on integration of OpenAI APIs and custom/self-hosted LLMs

Backend development with Node.js/Express and/or FastAPI (Next.js is a big plus)

Advanced Linux system administration (Docker commands, OpenShift CLI, networking, security, troubleshooting)

Expert in Docker containerization (multi-stage builds, Compose, optimization)

Strong Red Hat OpenShift experience (deployments, routes, operators, persistent storage)

Proven ability to design and maintain complex Jenkins CI/CD pipelines (including GitOps)

On-premise and local-machine AI model deployment & inference optimization

Arabic language fluency (mandatory)

Immediate or short-notice availability for onsite work in Dammam, Saudi Arabia

As Development Director, you'll be responsible for: Leading the full development life-cycle including from feasibility, design, approvals, procurement, and delivery Drive development strategy, business planning, and financial modelling for new and existing projects Manage consultants, architects, contractors, and internal stakeholders to ensure timely and cost-effective delivery Oversee project budgets, schedules, and risk management Work closely with senior leadership on investment decisions and portfolio optimisation Ensure developments meet market demand, brand standards, and regulatory requirements Proven experience in a senior development role within residential, commercial, and/or hospitality real estate having delivered minimum 3-4 projects through the projects entire full lifecyle Strong understanding of the Saudi Arabian real estate market and regulatory environment Demonstrated ability to lead complex, large-scale developments Excellent financial, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills Arabic speaking is advantageous but not essential Degree in Real Estate, Engineering, Architecture, or a related field
