job_description: Experience ñ 5+ years, Location ñ Riyadh Residence (Iqama) + Medical Responsibilities:Design, develop, and maintain scalable and secure backend services and APIs.Optimize application performance and ensure high availability.Collaborate with frontend developers, product managers, and QA teams.Implement database schemas, queries, and data models (SQL/NoSQL).Integrate third-party services and APIs.Ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and security guidelines.Debug, troubleshoot, and upgrade existing applications.Requirements:Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.Strong expertise in backend frameworks (Node.js, Java, Python, or .NET).Hands-on experience with RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and microservices.Experience in ìBankingî Mobile Applications is a must.Proficiency in database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.).Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).Strong knowledge of version control (Git) and CI/CD pipelines.

Company Overview

Sitech builds impactful digital products, services, and experiences for enterprises and fast-growing startups. With a global talent pool, we specialize in product discovery, experience design, and custom software development, delivering scalable and high-quality solutions across multiple industries.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer with 10+ years of experience to lead the design, development, and delivery of complex software solutions, with a strong focus on Python (Django), Vue.js, and Open edX platforms.

This role combines hands-on technical leadership with architecture ownership, mentoring engineers, and collaborating closely with product, QA, and DevOps teams to deliver scalable, secure, and high-performing systems.

Key Responsibilities
ï Lead the end-to-end development of web-based platforms using Python (Django) and Vue.js.
ï Architect, customize, and extend Open edX platforms, including LMS/CMS, plugins, and integrations.
ï Define technical architecture, coding standards, and best practices across projects.
ï Provide technical leadership, code reviews, and mentorship to engineering teams.
ï Collaborate with product managers, UX designers, and QA to translate business requirements into robust technical solutions.
ï Oversee system integrations, APIs, and backend services.
ï Ensure platform scalability, performance, security, and reliability.
ï Drive CI/CD adoption and collaborate with DevOps on deployment strategies.
ï Troubleshoot complex technical issues and lead root-cause analysis.
ï Contribute to technical planning, estimations, and delivery timelines.

Qualifications & Requirements
ï 10+ years of professional software development experience.
ï Strong expertise in Python with Django (mandatory).
ï Proven experience with Vue.js and modern front-end architectures.
ï Hands-on experience with Open edX development, customization, and deployment.
ï Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, microservices, and system integration.
ï Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL/MySQL).
ï Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and cloud environments.
ï Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
ï Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments.
ï Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.

Lucidya is an AI-native company transforming how brands understand and engage with their customers through cutting-edge technologies purpose-built for Customer Experience (CX). With AI at the core of our platform and operations, we are redefining how businesses drive growth, loyalty, and insight at scale.

We are looking for Sr Backend Engineers to join our team. You will join a team of highly qualified team engineers to continue the innovation and development of our product which uses Machine Learning & Big Data technologies to analyze content from several data sources.

As a developer, you will be working on the backend of our product Lucidya which is built using industryís latest technologies such as Redis, Postgres and Cassandra and developing APIs using Python and Ruby on Rails. The job also includes DevOps tasks from server setup to maintenance and recovery.

You will work directly under the Engineering Manager in an agile yet demanding environment. We expect you to be a fast learner to adapt those technologies mentioned above fast.

Lucidya offers a result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment full of challenges, We look for very talented candidates with strong programming skills.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities
ï Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.
ï Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software (backend and databases in particular)
ï Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
ï DevOps tasks
ï Contribute to the growth of Lucidya through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts
ï BA/BS or or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent practical experience
ï +6 years of experience
ï Strong knowledge in SQL and noSQL databases such as (Redis , Postgress or Cassandra)
ï Fluency in Python and Ruby on Rails.
ï Knowledge in Web servers and Web application servers (e.g., Apache, Jetty, Tomcat, IIS)
ï Knowledge in code repository like Git
ï Ability to multi-task and adapt to shifting priorities, demands, and tight timelines
ï Database design skills
ï Perfect quality code
ï Excellent organizational skills and proven analytical, planning, problem solving skills
ï Full stack with background in ReactJS is a plus

job_description:
MUST HAVE skills in :
ï Full Stack .NET Developer with strong experience in .NET development, Angular-based front-end development, and back-end services.

(general development skills and knowledge including but not limited to):
ï Microsoft .NET Platform: .NET / C# / MVC / .NET Core
ï Front-End Technologies: HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, Bootstrap, jQuery, JavaScript

ï Design Tools: Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Flash, Dreamweaver
ï Databases: Microsoft SQL Server

ï Low-Code Platforms: such as Outsystems
ï Mobile Technologies: Native, hybrid, and cross-platform development for Android and iOS

Master-Works is on the lookout for a skilled Back-End Software Engineer to enhance our development team. As a Back-End Software Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the server-side logic, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. Working closely with other team members, you will implement robust business logic and web services and optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Key Responsibilities

Develop, test, and maintain high-performance backend applications using Node.js and TypeScript.
Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate APIs and services with ReactJS applications.
Design and implement scalable backend architectures and RESTful APIs.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices.
Optimize applications for maximum performance and scalability.
Participate in code reviews and mentor junior developers.
Work with databases and manage data storage, ensuring secure and efficient data access.
Troubleshoot and debug issues to improve system performance.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in backend development and technologies.

Required Skills

Strong experience with Node.js and TypeScript.
Proficiency in backend development with a focus on building RESTful APIs.
Solid understanding of ReactJS for frontend-backend integration.
Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL).
Strong knowledge of Git and version control best practices.
Familiarity with testing frameworks and practices (Jest, Mocha, etc.).
Ability to write scalable and secure code.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
Experience in working with cloud platforms and deployment (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.).
Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Skills

Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience in microservices architecture.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.
Understanding of Agile methodologies.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
5+ years of experience in backend development.

ï Data normalization

ï Ensure structured outputs using Pydantic / schema validation
ï Handle async processing, queues, and background tasks
ï Work with DynamoDB / PostgreSQL / Redis
ï Implement authentication (JWT/OAuth2) and security best practices
ï Monitor AI usage, latency, and costs

ï Strong Python development
ï FastAPI framework

ï Git & CI/CD

AI & LLM

ï Building RAG systems with vector databases
ï Handling hallucination, retries, and guardrails

Cloud & Data

Good to Have

ï Observability for LLM calls

ï Knowledge of microservices architecture

What We Expect

ï Ability to combine deterministic backend logic with AI reasoning

Contract Terms

Full-time contractor (30-40 hours per week)

Fully Remote, GMT -5

About the Role

This is a 1099 contractor position for 6-12 months with potential for ongoing renewal. This role is perfect for a developer who enjoys solving complex problems, working with financial data, and has a passion for building robust, high-performance applications.

Responsibilities
ï Design, develop, and maintain financial calculation engines and reporting systems
ï Refactor and modernize legacy monolith code into well-architected domain-driven services
ï Transform and analyze large financial datasets using Laravel Collections: map/reduce, filter, etc.
ï Create and optimize data visualization features using Chart.js
ï Update and maintain SPAs using Vue.js
ï Deploy and maintain Laravel applications with modern authentication (JWT/OAuth)
ï Root out older PHP 7.2 code and migrate to 8.3

Technical Requirements
ï 3-5+ years of PHP/Laravel development experience
ï Strong experience with data mapping, some experience with financial calculations
ï Familiarity with typing JSON structures, DTOs
ï Experience with Filament and/or Livewire
ï Experience with VueJS and Pinia
ï Experience with JIRA and Agile development methodologies

Nice-to-Have
ï Experience in the US financial services or wealth management industry
ï Familiarity with PHPStan, PHPinsights, and other quality tools
ï Knowledge of domain-driven design principles
ï Familiarity with containerization and cloud platforms
ï Familiarity with Rust for performance-critical components is a plus

What We Offer
ï Opportunity to work on complex financial systems
ï Greenfield development projects alongside legacy system modernization
ï Mostly self-starter environment
ï Competitive compensation

About IncomeConductor LLC

Investors are familiar with the challenges around accumulating, saving, and focusing on asset growth during their working years. However, when it comes time to begin planning for their retirement years, they face a whole new set of complexities. We designed our flagship fintech system IncomeConductor to help financial advisors make the complexities of retirement clear to their clients.

Through the delivery of an easy to use web-based solution, IncomeConductor gives advisors a compelling distribution strategy, a powerful toolset, and a repeatable, highly efficient business process for winning and servicing clients seeking income planning advice.

IncomeConductor LLCís founders have brought together decades of industry experience from financial advice delivery, investment management, and technology development to create the premier retirement income solution. With IncomeConductor, advisors are supported in their marketing efforts to pre-retirees with clear and concise educational content for prospects.

Welcome to where every role drives real change. At Rime, we don't just offer jobs, we offer the chance to shape industries and transform communities. Join professionals who wake up knowing their work matters, solving challenges that impact millions. Whether leading breakthrough initiatives or starting your journey, you'll work on projects that leave a lasting legacy. Every decision, every idea here creates ripple effects that matter. Ready to do work that matters? Explore our roles and join those making a real difference.
Description
The Role

We are seeking an experienced Edge AI/CV Orchestration Engineer to enhance and scale our core engine that manages AI workloads on resource-constrained edge devices.

Your primary mission is to improve the "brain" of our system: the orchestration engine that decides which AI tasks run, when they run, and how they perform on hardware like the NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano.

You will be the bridge between our backend infrastructure and our deployed physical hardware, ensuring our edge devices operate efficiently, reliably, and at scale.
Requirements
Required Qualifications (Must-Haves)

Proven Experience: 3-5+ years of experience in backend development, systems programming, or DevOps, with a focus on distributed or embedded systems.

Expert Python:
Strong proficiency in Python, especially for building backend services, asynchronous programming (e.g., asyncio), and system-level scripting.

NVIDIA Jetson Expertise:
Demonstrable, hands-on experience working with the NVIDIA Jetson platform (e.g., Orin Nano, Xavier NX, AGX). You should be comfortable with the JetPack SDK and its tools.

Deep Linux Knowledge:
Strong command of the Linux operating system. You must understand system administration, process management, shell scripting, networking, and performance tuning (e.g., using top, htop, perf).

Backend Systems:
Solid experience designing, building, and maintaining APIs and microservices.

Preferred Qualifications (Nice-to-Haves)

Containerization:
Experience with Docker, containerd, and/or edge-focused Kubernetes (K3s, MicroK8s).

NVIDIA Stack:
Direct experience with the NVIDIA stack is a major plus, especially NVIDIA DeepStream, TensorRT, or Triton Inference Server.

AI/CV Exposure:
A good understanding of the challenges in deploying computer vision or machine learning models.

Other Languages:
Experience with C++ or Go for performance-critical components.

Fleet Management:
Experience with IoT fleet management tools (e.g., AWS IoT Greengrass, Azure IoT Edge, or Balena).

Roles And Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities

Engine Enhancement:
Design, develop, and optimize new features for our Python-based backend orchestration engine.

System Management:

Implement robust solutions for resource allocation (CPU, GPU, memory), task scheduling, and priority management across a fleet of edge devices.

Performance Optimization:

Profile and fine-tune the performance of AI/CV pipelines on the Jetson platform, diving deep into the Linux environment to resolve bottlenecks.

Backend & API Development:

Build and maintain scalable backend services and APIs (e.g., REST, gRPC) that allow for remote deployment, monitoring, and updating of tasks.

Deployment & CI/CD:
Improve automated deployment pipelines for pushing new AI models and orchestration logic to devices in the field.

Troubleshooting:

Act as the key troubleshooter for complex system-level issues that span AI models, our orchestration code, and the underlying Linux OS on the Jetson hardware.
Show more Show less

Immediate joiners or candidates with a notice period not exceeding 30 days
Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled Dot Net Developer with extensive experience in full-stack development, modern frameworks, and enterprise-grade application design. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and a collaborative approach.
Key Responsibilities
Front-End Development
ï UI/UX: Experience in responsive design using Bootstrap, Tailwind CSS, or Material UI
ï Design Collaboration: Familiar with tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch
ï State Management: Proficient with Redux
ï Testing: Skilled in unit testing
Back-End Development
ï Languages & Frameworks: Expertise in .NET Core and .NET Framework
ï API Development: Strong understanding of RESTful APIs and GraphQL
ï Architecture: Experience in microservices, event-driven, and serverless architectures
ï Security: Knowledge of JWT, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, and best security practices (XSS, CSRF, SQL Injection prevention)
Database & Persistence
ï Databases: Experience with MSSQL, Oracle, MongoDB, and Redis
ï ORMs: Proficient in Entity Framework and LINQ
ï Data Management: Strong ability to write complex queries, stored procedures, and manage transactions
DevOps & CI/CD
ï Version Control: Skilled in Git (GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket)
ï CI/CD Tools: Experience with Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or GitHub Actions
ï Containerization & Orchestration: Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
ï Monitoring & Logging: Familiar with Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK Stack
Testing & Quality Assurance
ï Testing Frameworks: Hands-on experience with Selenium and Postman for API testing
Soft Skills
ï Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset
ï Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
ï Proven ability to mentor junior developers
ï Adaptable to fast-paced and dynamic environments
Documentation

Proficient in maintaining clear technical documentation using:

In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining back-end systems that power our applications. You will work collaboratively with front-end developers, product owners, and other stakeholders to build robust and scalable services that meet user needs and enhance overall system performance.

Key Responsibilities:
ï Design and implement scalable and high-performance server-side applications using Java and related technologies.
ï Develop RESTful APIs and microservices to facilitate interaction with front-end components.
ï Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design solutions that meet business goals.
ï Write clean, well-organized, and maintainable code, following best practices and coding standards.
ï Participate in code reviews, offering constructive feedback and sharing knowledge with peers.
ï Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues and bugs in production systems.
ï Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends and apply them as necessary.

Requirements

Requirements:

ï Proven experience as a Java Back-End Developer, with extensive knowledge of Java, Spring Framework, and Hibernate.
ï Banking experience.
ï Strong understanding of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
ï Experience with relational databases (SQL Server, MySQL, or PostgreSQL) and writing complex queries.
ï Familiarity with cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure) and containerization technologies (like Docker).

ï Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Additional Qualifications:

Soft Skills:

Benefits

Why Join Us:

Opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Exciting projects and innovative work environment.

job_description:
About Noon Academy:

Noon's mission is to radically change the way people learn, with a primary focus on the Middle East, where the company has its roots and where the need and urgency to improve education are highest.

We have taught over 12 million+ students successfully with our remote learning products. Our next big challenge is to build a network of schools, supported by top teachers and driven by technology and innovation, to positively impact even more lives.

We recently pivoted towards a hybrid model. Hybrid brings digital star teachers directly into school buildings, and amplifies the experience through peer to peer learning and AI. We ran this model for a year with two schools and the results were so overwhelming that we expanded to 18 private and 10 public schools in our second year of operations.
The verdict is clear: students don't just tolerate hybrid, they love it.

Learn About us here:
ï 10+ Years of Impact: Started with a simple ideaóaccess to the best teachers shouldn't be a luxury, and learning should energize, not drain you.
ï Market Leaders: 14 million students (and counting) use Noon across the Middle East, Egypt, and Pakistan to ace high-stakes exams like Qudurat & Tahsili.
ï Now: We're laser-focused on reinventing schools in Saudi Arabia. We're accelerating rapidly, well-funded, and profitable.
ï Office: Full-time, Riyadh-based. We've got a sweet office near the Boulevard, and we'd love to have you in it.

Why work at Noon?
ï The opportunity to have a real impact on millions of students.
ï A strong leadership and engineering team to learn from.
ï A solid runway: we recently closed our Series B and have substantial recurring revenue.

About the role

This is a mid/ senior backend eng Riyadh-based role. We are developing a product used by thousands of students every day. As a Software Engineer-Backend, you will be at the heart of the student journey, delivering innovation daily. Join our distributed, high-performing team.

Responsibilities:
ï Take full ownership of code, from design to delivery and observability.
ï Promote best practices, always striving for incremental improvements.
ï Participate in the team's on-call rotation.
ï Reduce complexity and toil by identifying bottlenecks and improving system efficiency.
ï Be a team player.

Requirements:
ï Proficient in Java, Spring Boot or equivalent.
ï Experience with infrastructure and distributed systems.
ï Experience with containerisation and orchestration technologies (Kubernetes).

The interview process

Live coding interview -> System Design -> Behavioural interview.

About the Benefits

In addition to a competitive base salary, we offer
ï 21 days annual leave
ï Full premium Medical coverage including Family Dependent
ï Income Protection and Life Assurance to help you to protect your future

Why work at Noon?
ï Solving the Biggest Problem in Education: We're addressing the most important and challenging issue in the sectoróscaling star teachers and making learning fun.
ï Innovation at a Global Scale: Noon leads in edtech innovation; we are not a copycat. We pioneer new ways to deliver world-class education.
ï Solid Financial Footing: We have turned profitable and we're well-funded.
ï International Exposure: Join a dynamic, internationally diverse team that encourages personal development.
ï Mission & Values Driven: We aim to provide equitable access to world-class education.

Apply through the job link.
We look forward to reviewing your application and exploring how you can contribute to Noon's mission

job_description:
We're Growing Join Rommaana
At Rommaana Technologies we put our users first. We are looking for colleagues who
remain learners throughout their careers and whose curiosity and motivation in
understanding machine learning and insurtech will provide "game-changing" insurtech
software and algorithms.

Job Overview:
We are seeking a passionate and talented Junior Software Engineer to join
our dynamic team. In this role, you will assist in the design, development, and deployment of
innovative software solutions.

You will work closely with senior engineers and cross-functional teams to gain valuable experience and contribute to the success of our projects.

Location:
[Remote / Hybrid / Office ó Riyadh]

Type:
Full-time

Team:
Engineering

Experience Level:
Junior (1ñ3 years)

About the Role
We're looking for a Junior Backend Engineer to join our engineering team and help build
reliable, scalable backend systems. You'll work primarily with Python, Google Cloud Platform
(GCP), Cloud Run, and PostgreSQL, and collaborate closely with senior engineers to design,
build, and maintain production services.

We make heavy use of Claude Code and AI-assisted development workflows, so you'll be
expected to work effectively with AI coding tools to accelerate delivery while maintaining
high engineering standards.
This is a great opportunity for someone early in their career who wants to learn modern
cloud-native backend development in a fast-moving environment.

What You'll Do
ï Develop and maintain backend services using Python
ï Build and deploy containerized applications on GCP Cloud Run
ï Design and interact with PostgreSQL databases (queries, migrations, schema updates)
ï Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code
ï Collaborate with senior engineers on architecture and implementation decisions
ï Use Claude Code and AI-assisted tools to speed up development, debugging, and
refactoring
ï Monitor application performance, troubleshoot issues, and fix bugs
ï Contribute to code reviews and engineering best practices
ï Learn and improve continuously through mentorship and real production work
What We're Looking For
ï Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Computer Science,
Telecommunications, or related fields from a top university.
ï Skills: A proactive, self-starting attitude with exceptional organizational and time-management skills.
ï Experience: Prior experience in insurance or education in insurance is required.
ï Passion: Eagerness to work in a startup environment and a genuine interest in
technology.
ï Languages:
? Advanced English (our primary working language).

What's in It for You?
ï Competitive salary: Get rewarded for your hard work.
ï Flexibility: Enjoy flexible working hours and a hybrid work environment.
ï Ownership: All full-time employees receive an ESOP share package, giving you a
stake in Rommaana's success (just like in Silicon Valley).
ï Growth Opportunities: Learn from industry leaders and take on impactful projects.
ï Team Events: Join us in Riyadh for our annual summer corporate retreat
Show more Show less

JOB OBJECTIVE :

Python Backend engineer will in collaboration with Data team be responsible for the execution of the data initiatives. This role will play a crucial role in the development and maintenance of our backend applications. Managing the entire application lifecycle, from concept to deployment, ensuring high performance, and responsiveness to requests from the front end. Collaborate with our development team to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic, implement security and data protection, and design and launch new features to meet our business needs

Key Role Responsibilities:
ï Design and implement scalable and robust backend applications using Python.
ï Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications by writing clean, reusable, and efficient code.
ï Ensure the implementation of secure authentication systems, user role management, and privileges.
ï Integrate multiple data sources and databases into one system and manage the interchange of data between the server and users.
ï Collaborate with front-end developers on the integration of elements.
ï Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant applications.
ï Implement security and data protection solutions.
ï Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior developers.

Minimum Qualifications:
ï Graduate or Post-graduate with a Computer Science or Mathematics background (or related field), preferred

Minimum Experience:
ï 4-7 years of relevant python backend engineering experience with 3 years in similar role

management skills.

technology.

Seen is a payments infrastructure platform for variable income in a cashless world, starting with digitizing tipping. We help service staff receive tips instantly and transparently through simple QR-based flows, while enabling businesses to manage tips at scale with compliant, structured payouts. Seen operates at the intersection of payments, hospitality, and workforce income, solving a real leakage problem as economies move away from cash. We are hiring a Senior Backend Engineer with the ability to work full stack when needed. This is a full time, remote role targeting candidates within MENA time zones.

What you'll do

You will lead the design, implementation, and operation of the backend microservices that power our MVP and its evolution: authentication, onboarding, tips and payments, payouts, reporting, and internationalization (English and Arabic). While the focus is backend, you are comfortable contributing to web and mobile frontends to ship end-to-end customer journeys.

Backend (primary)

∑ Design, build, and maintain Golang microservices for auth, user onboarding (KYC/KYB), payment creation, payment initiation, transaction management, payouts (including split payouts), notifications, and reporting.

∑ Integrate and harden payment flows with gateways and banking partners: hosted payment pages, API/SDK flows, wallet payments, and signature?verified webhooks/callbacks.

∑ Implement internationalization at the backend layer (EN/AR), including language?aware APIs, templates, and config.

∑ Define and maintain C4?style designs (Context, Container, Component, Code) for services and major epics in Confluence.

∑ Ensure production?grade quality: testing (unit/integration), idempotency, retries, observability, and performance.

Full?stack (as needed)

∑ Collaborate with web ) and mobile (React Native) to shape API contracts and deliver end?to?end flows (onboarding, payment experiences).

∑ Contribute pragmatic fixes or features on the frontend to unblock delivery while maintaining code quality and i18n/RTL considerations.

Operations & reliabilityProduct lifecycle & documentation

∑ Contribute across the full product lifecycle: from discovery and design through implementation, testing, deployment, and iteration.

∑ Ensure key decisions are captured: keep code, architecture (C4 diagrams), and technical decisions documented for future reference.

∑ Own CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions), container builds, and Kubernetes Helm?based deployments on AWS.

∑ Instrument services using Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Jaeger, and OpenTelemetry; define SLOs/alerts for payment and payout health.

∑ Drive incident analysis, root cause remediation, and continuous improvement.

Technology vision and architecture

We build working software with excellent architecture, iterate quickly from MVP to production, and keep documentation accurate yet lean. We use microservices with clear boundaries and C4 diagrams to communicate intent. Internationalization for English and Arabic is a core capability, not an afterthought.

Our stack

∑ Languages & frameworks: Golang (backend), TypeScript with and React Native (frontends).

∑ Architecture: Microservices; C4 model documentation; contract?first APIs.

∑ Identity & security: Keycloak (OAuth2/OIDC), token management, signature verification for callbacks, secure secret handling.

∑ Payments & fintech: Hosted payment pages, wallets, API/SDK integrations, payouts, reconciliation, status mapping and error handling.

∑ Infrastructure: AWS (Docker images in ECR), Kubernetes with Helm, GitHub Actions CI/CD, GitOps?style workflows.

∑ Observability: Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Jaeger, OpenTelemetry.

What we're looking forMust?have

∑ Senior?level experience building production Golang services and RESTful microservices.

∑ Strong background with third?party API integrations, webhooks/callbacks, and asynchronous workflows with idempotency and retries.

∑ Hands?on with AWS (or similar), containers, CI/CD, and familiarity with Kubernetes and Helm.

∑ Security?minded: authN/authZ, token handling, secret management, signature verification for payment events.

∑ Testing discipline: unit and integration tests; monitoring, logging, and tracing in production.

∑ Experience building modern web applications and ideally mobile apps (React Native) as part of full-stack delivery, with the willingness to jump into the frontend when needed to deliver end-to-end value.

∑ Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and clear written and verbal communication; comfortable working in a small, fast-moving, founder-led team.

Nice?to?have

∑ Keycloak or similar identity providers; deep OAuth2/OIDC experience.

∑ Payment gateways and payouts in MENA; reconciliation and settlement expertise.

∑ Internationalization/i18n for English/Arabic and RTL considerations.

How we work

∑ Architecture?first: invest in C4 diagrams and design reviews before large changes.

∑ Iterative delivery: ship small, safe increments with strong automation and observability.

∑ Lean but clear documentation: keep Confluence up to date with designs, APIs, runbooks, and key technical decisions.

∑ Close collaboration: work directly with founders, product, and design to scope features, refine requirements, and ship impactful improvements quickly.

About PulseMediaNL

PulseMediaNL is a fast-growing digital marketing agency delivering high-impact, data-driven marketing solutions for businesses in the healthcare, medical, and wellness sectors. We combine strategy, creativity, and performance to help our clients achieve sustainable growth through modern digital experiences.

As we continue expanding our global footprint, we are seeking a Junior Front-End Developer based in the MENA region to join our fully remote team. This role is perfect for an enthusiastic developer eager to build engaging user interfaces, collaborate across teams, and grow their skills in a dynamic, healthcare-focused environment.

If youíre passionate about front-end development, modern web technologies, and crafting high-quality digital experiences, weíd love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

Front-End Development

Convert UI/UX designs into clean, scalable, and reusable front-end code.

Assist in building landing pages, websites, and digital assets that support marketing campaigns.

Collaboration

Support SEO, CRO, and performance-focused initiatives through front-end improvements.

Performance & Optimization

Optimize websites for speed, performance, and cross-browser compatibility.

Ensure consistent, responsive experiences across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

Apply best practices for usability and accessibility.

CMS & Content Management

Assist with maintaining and updating websites built on CMS platforms such as WordPress.

Implement content updates, layouts, and page templates based on client and internal requirements.

Quality Assurance

Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve front-end bugs and UI issues.

Test features across multiple browsers and devices to ensure reliability.

Learning & Growth

Stay up to date with modern front-end tools, frameworks, and best practices.

Learn from senior developers and actively participate in code reviews and feedback sessions.

Experience

Required Qualifications

0ñ2 years of front-end development experience (internships, freelance work, or personal projects included).

Hands-on experience with real-world websites or web applications is a plus.

Education

Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, Web Development, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES6+).

Understanding of responsive and mobile-first design principles.

Basic familiarity with front-end frameworks or libraries (React, Vue, or similar is a plus).

Experience With WordPress Or Other CMS Platforms Preferred.

Basic understanding of SEO-friendly front-end practices.

Tools & Technologies

Experience using Git-based version control systems.

Familiarity with design handoff tools such as Figma or Adobe XD.

Basic knowledge of performance optimization and cross-browser testing.

Soft Skills

Strong attention to detail and problem-solving mindset.

Good communication skills and ability to work effectively in a remote team.

Willingness to learn, accept feedback, and continuously improve.

Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, or similar CSS frameworks.

Basic understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG).

Exposure to healthcare, medical, or regulated industries is a bonus.

Familiarity with JavaScript build tools or workflows.

English proficiency required; Arabic is a strong plus.

Why Join PulseMediaNL?

Competitive Compensation

Attractive salary package based on experience and skills.

Paid time off and holidays (based on country of residence).

Professional Growth

Hands-on mentorship from experienced developers and designers.

Clear growth path toward mid-level front-end or full-stack roles.

Exposure to real-world projects in global healthcare markets.

Fully Remote Work

Work from anywhere within the MENA region.

Flexible working hours with a strong work-life balance.

Remote-first culture with collaborative tools and workflows.

Supportive & Innovative Culture

Join a creative, forward-thinking team that values quality and innovation.

Supportive environment focused on learning and continuous improvement.

Meaningful Impact

Build digital solutions that positively impact healthcare and wellness industries worldwide.

How to Apply

If youíre a motivated Junior Front-End Developer | Web Development professional based in the MENA region and excited to grow your career in a healthcare-focused digital agency, weíd love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and portfolio (if available).

PulseMediaNL is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage diverse perspectives to apply.

job_description:
A leading tech company in Riyadh is looking for an experienced frontend developer to enhance its product team. In this role, you'll transform customer needs into interactive web applications, ensuring optimal user experiences across various devices. Applicants should have a solid grasp of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks, along with strong communication skills. The position emphasizes collaboration with design and product management for creating impressive and responsive interfaces.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Senior Frontend Developer (Angular) to join our growing engineering team. The role is on-site in Riyadh and is for Saudi Nationals. In this role, you will lead the development of scalable, secure, and high-performance single-page applications (SPAs) using Angular, TypeScript, and RxJS. The ideal candidate will have 4+ years of frontend development experience, with deep expertise in Angular and reactive programming, as well as a strong understanding of OAuth2/OpenID Connect, state management, and accessibility standards. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable and user-centric web applications used at scale.

Job Responsibilities
ï Design, build, and maintain enterprise-grade SPAs using Angular, TypeScript, and RxJS.
ï Integrate frontend applications with RESTful APIs using secure OAuth2/OpenID Connect flows (PKCE, token handling).
ï Implement scalable state management solutions using NgRx or Redux.
ï Convert UX/UI specifications into responsive, accessible components that follow WCAG standards.
ï Optimize performance through code splitting, lazy loading, and efficient change detection.
ï Ensure frontend code quality through unit and E2E testing, CI pipelines, and code reviews.
ï Collaborate with designers, product managers, and backend teams to deliver seamless user experiences. Contribute to and evolve the company's design system and component library.

Job Requirements
ï Saudi National
ï 4+ years of experience in frontend development, with at least 3 years using Angular on large-scale projects.
ï Strong proficiency in TypeScript and RxJS, including observables, operators, and advanced error handling.
ï Solid knowledge of NgRx/Redux for state management in complex applications.
ï Experience integrating OAuth2/OpenID Connect in SPAs, including guards, interceptors, and token storage.
ï Expertise in HTML, CSS, and responsive layouts with a focus on accessibility (WCAG).
ï Familiarity with modern frontend tooling (Webpack, NPM, CI/CD).
ï Experience working with design systems, theming, and UI component libraries is a plus.
ï Knowledge of SSR, micro-frontends, or performance tuning (Core Web Vitals) is a bonus.

The Frontend Developer is responsible for delivering high quality technology capabilities supporting smart sustainable developments.
Key Responsibilities.
ï Design implement and support solutions aligned with organizational strategy.
ï Engage stakeholders to translate requirements into effective outcomes.
ï Ensure reliability security and performance of platforms and systems.
ï Support operations deployment and continuous improvement initiatives.
ï Maintain documentation standards and compliance requirements.

ï Bachelor degree in engineering information technology or related discipline.
ï Proven experience in a similar role within complex environments.
ï Strong communication analytical and problem solving skills.
ï Ability to work collaboratively across multidisciplinary teams.
ï Experience with sustainable smart digital programs is an advantage.

About Karage:

At Karage, we provide cutting-edge SaaS solutions designed to streamline operations, enhance customer experiences, and drive revenue growth for businesses in the automotive service industry. Our flagship product is a state-of-the-art Point of Sale (POS) system tailored specifically for auto repair shops, car dealerships, and related businesses. We are passionate about helping our clients optimize their business operations through technology and provide exceptional service.

Job Summary:

We are looking for a Senior Front-End Engineer to lead the development of our client-facing SaaS platforms. In this role, you will architect and build the user interfaces for our complex Point of Sale (POS) systems using Next.js. You will drive high performance and scalability while ensuring a seamless user experience for automotive service professionals. The ideal candidate will be a technical leader, mentoring junior engineers and driving best practices within the development lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:

Qualifications:

job_title: Web Frontend Engineer - JS, CSS, React, Flutter
job_description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of globally distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a Web/UI Engineer to develop a data-rich and reliable user experience. These frontends are constructed using JS, CSS, React, and Flutter, and serve as Canonical's enterprise products that act as the company's face to our users.

In order to create consistency across our products and sites, we have a central team that builds an open-source React toolkit and presentation layer, the Vanilla Framework. We are excited to develop this further and see if we can help more open-source projects build performant and accessible interfaces that respond well to diverse layouts. We use REST APIs for communication, and we consider API design an important part of the process.

Flutter is a new front-end technology that has the potential to unify our desktop and web development. We are growing the team's exposure to Flutter and have roles on both web and Ubuntu engineering for this specialism.

We hire developers with outstanding academic results and a passion for open-source software, innovation, and cutting-edge web technologies. In these roles, you will have the opportunity to make significant contributions through high-quality, front-end and back-end code while exhibiting technical leadership, exceptional design, and intuitive user experience.

Additionally, we encourage colleagues to engage with the broader open-source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and ensure seamless software operations at scale.

Location: This is a Globally remote role.

The role entails
ï Design and implement well-tested and documented software in Web technologies or Flutter.
ï Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
ï Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
ï Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
ï Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
ï Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
ï Deploy and operate services developed by the team Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy

What we are looking for in you
ï An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
ï Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
ï Drive and a track record of going above and beyond expectations
ï Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
ï Professional manner in interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
ï Experience designing and writing high-quality Web technologies
ï Experience with and passion for Typescript, React or Flutter
ï An eye for accessibility and performance
ï Professional written and spoken English
ï Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
ï Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
ï Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
ï Excellent communication and presentation skills
ï Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitmentsAbility to travel twice a year, for company events for up to two weeks each

Nice-to-have skills
ï Experience with container tech such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
ï Attention to detail concerning user-centric UI development
ï REST API design, development and governance Performance engineering and security experience

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
ï Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
ï Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
ï Annual compensation review
ï Recognition rewards
ï Annual holiday leave
ï Maternity and paternity leave
ï Employee Assistance Programme
ï Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_description:
A growing tech studio in Saudi Arabia is seeking a Senior Frontend Developer for a full-time on-site role. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming designs into functional websites and ensuring optimal user experiences. Responsibilities include coding with HTML, CSS, and JS, optimizations for usability, and addressing performance issues. This role requires proven experience in web development, strong communication skills, and a BSc/BA in a relevant field.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

About PulseMediaNL

PulseMediaNL is a forward-thinking digital marketing agency delivering innovative, data-driven solutions for healthcare, medical, and wellness brands. We help our clients achieve sustainable growth through high-performance campaigns, strategic insights, and creative digital experiences.

As we continue to expand globally, we are seeking a Junior Front-End Developer (Remote) based in the MENA region to join our growing remote team.

This role is ideal for a motivated developer eager to build modern user interfaces, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and grow technically in a fast-paced, healthcare-focused environment.

If you're passionate about front-end development, modern web technologies, and crafting engaging digital experiences, we'd love to hear from you.
Key Responsibilities

Front-End Development

Develop and maintain responsive, user-friendly interfaces for healthcare and medical clients
Convert UI/UX designs into clean, reusable, and high-quality front-end code
Support the creation of landing pages, websites, and marketing assets for digital campaigns

Collaboration

Work closely with designers, marketers, and project managers to ensure accurate and seamless implementation
Support SEO, CRO, and performance-focused front-end updates

Performance & Optimization

Optimize websites for speed, performance, and cross-browser compatibility
Ensure consistent responsiveness across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
Follow best practices for accessibility and usability

CMS & Content Management

Assist with maintaining and updating CMS-based websites (primarily WordPress)
Implement content updates, page layouts, and templates as needed

Quality Assurance

Identify and resolve front-end bugs and UI inconsistencies
Test features across browsers and devices to ensure reliability

Continuous Learning

Stay current with modern front-end technologies and best practices
Participate in code reviews and learn from senior developers

Experience

Required Qualifications

0ñ2 years of front-end development experience (including internships, freelance, or personal projects)
Hands-on experience with live websites or applications is a plus

Education

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, Software Engineering, or equivalent practical experience

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
Understanding of responsive and mobile-first design
Familiarity with front-end frameworks (React, Vue, or similar) is a plus
Experience with WordPress or other CMS platforms preferred
Basic understanding of SEO-friendly front-end practices

Tools

Experience with Git or other version control systems
Familiarity with Figma, Adobe XD, or similar design tools
Basic knowledge of performance optimization and cross-browser testing

Soft Skills

Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
Clear communication skills and comfort working remotely
Willingness to learn, accept feedback, and grow
Good time management and ability to meet deadlines

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, or similar frameworks
Basic knowledge of WCAG accessibility standards
Exposure to healthcare, medical, or regulated industries
Familiarity with JavaScript build tools or workflows
Fluent in English; Arabic is a strong advantage

Why Join PulseMediaNL?

Compensation & Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience and skills
Paid time off and holidays (based on country of residence)

Professional Growth

Mentorship from experienced developers and designers
Clear growth path toward mid-level front-end or full-stack roles
Exposure to real-world healthcare projects and global clients

Remote-First Culture

Fully remote role within the MENA region
Flexible working hours and strong work-life balance
Collaborative, remote-friendly workflows

Culture & Impact

Innovative, supportive, and quality-driven team
Learning-focused environment that encourages growth
Opportunity to contribute to meaningful healthcare and wellness solutions

How to Apply

If you're a motivated Junior Front-End Developer (Remote) based in the MENA region and excited to grow your career in a healthcare-focused digital agency, we'd love to hear from you.
Please submit your resume and portfolio (if available).

PulseMediaNL is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and value diverse perspectives.

About Us

Gulf Associates is a management advisory firm supporting senior leaders and boards at critical decision points, providing independent judgment, structured analysis, and hands-on partnership to help organizations move forward with confidence.

Job type:
Internship | Location: Remote ñ Middle East |

Gulf Associates offers a fully paid frontend development internship designed for candidates who want to build real, production-facing web interfaces in a professional advisory environment.
This role is not a simulated learning program. Interns contribute directly to internal platforms and client-facing materials used in active consulting work.

This internship is intended for candidates seeking substantive frontend development experience and exposure to professional standards, responsibility, and real outcomes.

com is Saudiís #1 event ticketing and experience booking platform in terms of technology, features, agility, revenue serving some of the largest mega events in the Kingdom surpassing over 2 billion in sales.

Job description

Summary

As a FrontEnd Developer youll play a pivotal role in crafting the user experience of our projects. ï Competitive salary.
ï Continuous learning and development opportunities.
ï The chance to make a real impact on the success of our company.

Kanz is an AI Recruiter Copilot revolutionizing recruiting.

We make hiring in Saudi Arabia as simple as ordering an Uber. Tell us who you want to hire and when you want to meet them, our AI does the rest - job posting, sourcing, assessing, and scheduling, all within a week. We're helping 300 companies hire top Saudi talent.

With 1M users on our platform, we're revolutionizing recruiting in the Middle East.

You will join a senior development team responsible for architecting and delivering Kanzís core user-facing products: the cross-platform mobile application and the web application. You are expected to deliver a lightning-fast experience, optimizing for speed and clarity over features. A critical focus will be the initial

90-second job posting flow and ensuring the mobile experience is prioritized. Key responsibilities include:
ï Leadthe development and architecture of the mobile application using React Native.
ï Implementthe 90-second job posting flow, AI matching engine, and interview scheduling.
ï Integratethe front-end with our fully API-based backend, which utilizes GCP and PostgreSQL.
ï Enforce high performance standards, including a page load of less than 2 seconds and API response.
ï Workwith the design system to ensure the application is aesthetically consistent.
ï Implementmobile-specific features like Swipe Actions, Voice Notes for candidate feedback, and Commute Mode (audio summaries of new applicants).
ï Ensurethe application is accessible and compliant, particularly with WCAG 2.1 AA and full RTL support for Arabic.
ï Experience and Skills:
ï 5+ years of professional experience in front-end development, with a strong background in architecting and shipping production-ready applications using React Native.
ï Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and experience with modern state management patterns.
ï Expertise in mobile performance optimization, network latency handling, and caching strategies.
ï Demonstrated ability to integrate complex applications with robust, API-based backends.

ï Direct experience implementing and maintaining full RTL (Right-to-Left) support for languages like Arabic.
ï Experience working closely with design systems, component libraries, and translating high-fidelity design specifications (e.g., Figma) into performant code.

Specialist - Quality Assurance Frontend Engineer
Overview

About the company: At Almosafer (part of Seera Group), weíre not just part of the travel industry, weíre helping shape its future. As Saudi Arabiaís leading travel company, we serve millions across every segment of the travel and tourism ecosystem. Rooted in our name ìAlmosafer,î meaning the traveler, we strive to make every journey seamless, personal, and purposeful. Our diverse platforms and services are built to deliver enriching experiences that reflect the spirit of Saudi Arabia and the wider region. Weíre united by a bold vision: To be the undisputed leader in travel services, fostering lasting connections and setting new benchmarks for excellence in the Kingdom and beyond. Our team across Saudi Arabia and the wider region blends deep cultural understanding with forward-thinking innovation, shaping a new standard for travel in the region.
About the Job

We are looking for a Senior QA Frontend Engineer to join our dynamic team.
Responsibilities
ï Understand complex business domain, define an effective test scope, and actively contribute to requirements analysis and feedback discussions
ï Collaborate with developers, product managers, and business stakeholders to ensure quality throughout the SDLC
ï Design, develop, and execute functional tests across the frontend and integration tests with APIs, and backend systems
ï Leverage AI tools to generate test cases, analyze UI/API failures, and streamline bug reporting workflows
ï Use prompt engineering techniques with AI tools to enhance exploratory testing, increase test coverage, and generate test data
ï Build & maintain robust automated tests using modern automation tools like Cypress
ï Actively participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and technical discussions, offering input that strengthens product quality
ï Clearly communicate testing progress, risks, and status to relevant stakeholders
ï Contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes and standards within team
Profile Requirements
ï 5+ years experience in software testing, ideally with a web and API testing background
ï Ability to understand complex business domain, and identify business and test use cases
ï Experience working in Agile environments with different cross-functional teams
ï Familiarity with API testing tools (e.g., Postman) and backend validation techniques
ï Exposure to AI-assisted testing tools (e.g., Cursor AI, GitHub Copilot) and understanding of their role in modern QA workflows is a plus
ï Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and approach challenges methodically
ï Proactive communicator who actively engages in team discussions, shares ideas, and collaborates effectively with distributed teams
Benefits

At Almosafer, our teams work with purpose, clarity, and a shared commitment to doing things the right way. Whether you're building platforms, supporting travelers, or shaping strategy, your work connects to something bigger. Across functions and locations, we value accountability, trust, and collaboration - and we create the structure and space for you to contribute meaningfully from day one.

Here, you will find:

job_title: Front-End Developer Expertise for AI Training
job_description:
## Full Description

Front-End Developer Expertise for AI Training

Join to apply for the Front-End Developer Expertise for AI Training role at Outlier .

Outlier helps the worldís most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you a world-class front-end developer or web designer who wants to help shape the future of AI?

We collaborate with leading AI organizations to train largelanguage modelsóteaching them how to design and code like the best front-end engineers and designers in the world. Our projects focus on helping generative AI improve its understanding of front-end technologies, UI/UX principles, and modern web standards.

This is a rare opportunity to put your coding and design skills to work in training cutting-edge AI systemsóno prior experience with AI is required.

About The Opportunity

ï Outlier is looking for exceptional front-end developers and designers to help train generative AI models.

ï This freelance role is fully remote and offers flexible hoursóyou can work whenever works best for you.

You may contribute your expertise byÖ

ï Creating and answering questions about front-end development and web design to help train AI models

ï Reviewing and evaluating code generated by AI in JavaScript, React, and other modern front-end frameworks

ï Assessing UI/UX quality, accessibility, and design choices made by AI-generated code

ï Offering expert-level feedback on what makes a user interface intuitive, functional, and beautiful

Weíre looking for people withÖ

ï Strong technical skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React, Next.js, Vue, or similar

ï An eye for world-class designódeep understanding of UI/UX principles, responsive design, and interaction patterns

ï Experience building polished, accessible, and production-ready web interfaces

ï A background in computer science, web development, or digital design (degree not required if experience is exceptional)

ï Outstanding attention to detail and ability to communicate clearly about visual and code quality

Payment

ï Currently, pay rates for core project work are up to USD $50 per hour.

ï Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Seniority level

ï Associate

Employment type

ï Contract

Industries

ï Technology, Information and Internet

Referrals increase your chances of interviewing at Outlier by 2x.

job_title: Freelance Front-End Web Developer for Islamic Organization
job_description:
Role Overview
Dar-us-Salaam is seeking a Freelance Front-End Web Developer to support ongoing website needs across multiple projects.

This role focuses on implementing front-end updates, improving user experience, maintaining consistency, and ensuring that designs and content are accurately and cleanly executed.

The Front-End Web Developer will work closely with the Director of Strategic Communications and collaborate with designers, videographers, and other technical partners as needed.
Key Responsibilities
Implement front-end updates and layout changes across Dar-us-Salaam web properties
Translate designs, layouts, or written requirements into clean, functional front-end implementations
Ensure websites are responsive, accessible, and visually consistent
Update pages for campaigns, events, fundraising initiatives, and organizational projects
Support basic troubleshooting of front-end display or functionality issues
Optimize pages for performance, clarity, and usability
Types of Work Involved
Landing pages for campaigns and fundraising
Updates to existing website pages and layouts
Front-end support for donor and program pages
Collaboration with designers on visual execution
Minor enhancements to user experience and navigation
Technical Requirements
Strong working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience working with CMS platforms (we primarily use WordPress)
Comfort implementing designs without heavy hand-holding
Ability to work within existing systems and structures
Documentation & Organization Expectations
Dar-us-Salaam values clarity and continuity.

The Front-End Web Developer should be comfortable:
Following existing documentation
Clearly communicating what was changed and where
Flagging areas that may need backend or technical escalation
Working Style & Collaboration
Works directly with the Director of Strategic Communications
Communicates clearly and proactively
Comfortable receiving feedback and making revisions
Reliable with timelines and follow-through
Desired Candidate Profile

Required Qualifications
Portfolio or examples of front-end web work
Experience supporting live websites with real users
Ability to work independently while staying aligned with direction
Strong command of the English language, including clear writing, proper grammar, and the ability to communicate ideas effectively within an English-speaking professional context
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with nonprofits or mission-driven organizations
Familiarity with website performance and accessibility best practices
Experience collaborating with designers and content teams
Compensation
Compensation will be discussed based on scope, availability, and experience
How to Apply

Please include:
A brief introduction
Links to websites or projects you have worked on
A short explanation of your front-end workflow
Your availability and typical turnaround time

job_title: Senior Full Stack Java Developer (Banking & Payments)
job_description:
Job Title: Senior Full Stack Java Developer (Banking & Payments)

Job Type: Permanent

Job Location: Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

Experience: 5 - 8 Years

Domain : Banking
Role Overview:

We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Full Stack Java Developer with strong experience in Banking & Payment systems. The ideal candidate should have over 5 to 8 years of experience in designing and developing enterprise-grade solutions, including IPS, GCC-RTGS, B2B, MACUG, Bulk Payments, and other financial transaction systems. The role requires deep expertise in Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, React.js, REST APIs, and hands-on experience working in complex, high-availability payment environments.

The candidate should be capable of leading teams, delivering scalable solutions, integrating mission?critical systems, and collaborating effectively with cross?functional stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:
ï End?to?end design and development of enterprise payment modules such as:
ï B2B/SADAD payments
ï MOI payments
ï MACUG
ï Bulk payroll (Fransiglobal, B2B, Macug)
ï Instant Payment Platform (IPP ñ Saudi payments)
ï GCC RTGS (Real?Time Gross Settlement)
ï Standing Payment Instructions (SPPM)
ï Build and enhance payment engines capable of scalable, high?throughput transaction processing.
ï Develop and maintain real?time transaction processing solutions aligned with IPS and GCC?RTGS standards.
ï Implement and support orchestration systems for batch and real-time payments.
ï Integrate payment modules with TCS BaNCS Core Banking System.
ï Configure and maintain Swift, IBAN mapping, and other financial message processing setups.
ï Ensure adherence to secure coding practices, high availability, performance, and SLAs.
ï Collaborate with business and operations teams to translate functional requirements into technical solutions.
ï Mentor junior developers, perform code reviews, and drive engineering best practices.

Technical Skills:

Backend
ï Java 17+, Spring Boot 3.x
ï Spring MVC, Spring Data JPA, Hibernate
ï RESTful Web Services, SOAP Services

Microservices & Architecture
ï Spring Cloud Gateway (API Gateway), Eureka, Config Server
ï Feign, Circuit Breaker (Resilience4j)
ï Redis Caching
ï Asynchronous messaging with Kafka

Core Java
ï Multithreading: ExecutorService, ForkJoinPool, CompletableFuture
ï Design patterns: Factory, Singleton

We are seeking a highly skilled Full-Stack Developer to join our team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both the front-end and back-end components of our applications. This role requires a balance of technical expertise, problem-solving ability, and collaboration with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable and high-quality software solutions.

Responsibilities
ï Develop, test, and maintain web applications across the full stack (front-end, back-end, databases, and cloud infrastructure).
ï Build responsive and user-friendly front-end interfaces using modern frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue).
ï Design and implement RESTful APIs or GraphQL endpoints.
ï Work with databases (SQL and NoSQL) to design schemas, write queries, and optimize performance.
ï Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to deliver features end-to-end.
ï Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices.
ï Ensure application security, performance, and scalability.
ï Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing applications.
ï Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and agile ceremonies.
ï By applying to this position, weíll create your Simera Professional Key (SPK) ó a unique key that helps you connect with employers, stand out, and secure the right match.

job_description:
Are you a Full-Stack Engineer who thrives on solving complex challenges and delivering high-impact features? Join our team to build innovative AI-powered products that transform how people learn and grow. Youíll focus on high-quality execution, ensuring our products are scalable, maintainable, and impactful.

Youíll work on products that are transforming learning:
ï TeachTap: Leverages AI to bring historical figures to life in a TikTok-like learning experience.
ï TeachTales: Engages students with personalized, magical storytelling that boosts comprehension.
ï TimeBack: Acts as a learning copilot that integrates with existing apps, proactively coaching students.
ï Athena: Uses AI-generated videos and tests to deliver measurable academic outcomes.

This role exists to deliver real-world impact through working software. Youíll use AI tools and cloud-native technologies to build full-stack systems that solve meaningful problems, not just tick off tickets. Youíll be expected to ship fast without cutting corners, choosing the simplest correct solution that balances short-term speed with long-term maintainability.

If youíre ready to solve complex technical challenges and deliver impactful features, weíd love to hear from you.

What you will be doing
ï Build and Ship Full-Stack Features: Take user stories from idea to impact; clarify requirements, design scalable solutions, write backend and frontend code, test thoroughly, and ship to production
ï Hunt Down and Fix Bugs: Investigate issues through root cause analysis, fix the real problems (not just symptoms), and guard against regressions with smart testing
ï Raise the Bar on Code Quality: Review plans and pull requests to ensure clarity, simplicity, and correctness, blocking tech debt before it starts

What you wonít be doing
ï Building pixel-perfect UIs or complex backends just for their own sake
ï Blindly implementing specs without understanding the problem
ï Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around
ï Just shipping features; youíll be responsible for solving actual problems

AI-Augmented Full-Stack Principal Engineer key responsibilities
ï Using AI to build software that solves real user problems, ships fast, and stays maintainable long-term

Basic Requirements
ï At least 4 years of experience writing production code for web applications' frontend and backend (any framework).
ï Strong ownership: Demonstrated experience owning complete modules, product features, or teams, not just contributing siloed tasks
ï Independent execution: The ability to unblock yourself, set your own pace, and find paths forward in ambiguous situations
ï Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work

About LearnWith.AI

LearnWith.AI is an edtech startup that leverages AI and subject matter experts to cultivate a new way of learning. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and AI-powered coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn more, learn faster, and learn better - and have fun while doing it. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.

job_title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Python & AI Focus) ñ Onsite Dammam, KSA
job_description:
Job Overview

We are looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer with strong Python and Generative AI expertise to join our team onsite in Dammam, Saudi Arabia. You will lead the front-end integration of multiple custom AI/LLM models into production-grade applications, while progressively contributing to backend and infrastructure layers in a full-stack capacity.

This is a heavily AI-driven role that demands hands-on experience in deploying and consuming Generative AI models (LLMs, RAG pipelines, data extraction, etc.), API development in Python (FastAPI), on-premise server management, containerization, OpenShift orchestration, and robust CI/CD practices.

Key Responsibilities
ï Build responsive, high-performance front-end applications using React.js + Redux, Tailwind CSS, and custom CSS for real-time API/event handling.
ï Integrate multiple custom Generative AI models (LLMs, RAG, embeddings, data-extraction pipelines) into the front-end via REST/gRPC/WebSocket APIs.
ï Design and develop production APIs in Python (FastAPI + Swagger/OpenAPI) to expose AI models hosted on on-prem servers and local machines.
ï Consume and integrate OpenAI APIs, third-party LLMs, and custom fine-tuned models securely and efficiently.
ï Containerize applications and AI inference services using Docker; deploy and manage on Red Hat OpenShiftclusters.
ï Perform Linux system administration tasks related to Docker, OpenShift, networking, storage, and security in on-prem environments.
ï Build, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins (including GitOps practices).
ï Manage backend services using Node.js/Express and/or FastAPI; Next.js experience is a strong plus.
ï Optimize front-end performance when streaming or rendering AI-generated content (text, images, structured data).
ï Troubleshoot full-stack and infrastructure issues across development, staging, and production environments.
ï Participate in architecture and deployment strategy discussions for on-prem AI platforms.

Required Qualifications & Skills
ï 5ñ8 years of professional full-stack development experience.
ï Expert-level React.js + Redux and Tailwind CSS.
ï Strong Python proficiency with deep knowledge of:
ï Generative AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), RAG architectures, prompt-to-output pipelines, data extraction, and vector stores.
ï Building production APIs using FastAPI + Swagger/OpenAPI.
ï Integrating OpenAI APIs and self-hosted/custom LLMs.
ï Solid backend experience with Node.js/Express (Next.js is a big plus) and FastAPI.
ï Proven experience integrating and deploying AI models in production (on-prem or local environments).
ï Advanced Linux administration skills (running Docker/OpenShift commands, troubleshooting containers, networking, security hardening).
ï Hands-on expertise in:
ï Docker (multi-stage builds, Docker Compose, image optimization).
ï Red Hat OpenShift (or Kubernetes) ñ deployments, operators, routes, persistent storage.
ï Jenkins CI/CD pipeline creation and management.
ï Strong grasp of infrastructure-as-code, configuration management, and automated deployment strategies.
ï Fluent in Arabic (mandatory ñ daily communication with client teams in Dammam).
ï Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

Preferred (Nice-to-Have) Skills
ï Next.js (SSR/SSG) and full-stack React frameworks.
ï Kubernetes core concepts and migration from OpenShift.
ï Monitoring stack: Prometheus, Grafana, EFK/ELK.
ï AI model fine-tuning or quantization techniques.
ï Security best practices for containerized AI workloads (secrets management, RBAC, network policies).
ï Cloud exposure (AWS/GCP/Azure) for hybrid scenarios (not mandatory).

Additional Information
ï 8-month full-time onsite contract in Dammam, Saudi Arabia.
ï Immediate or short-notice joining preferred.
ï Compensation & benefits will be competitive and discussed during interviews.
ï Must already have (or be able to obtain quickly) the right to work in Saudi Arabia.

If you live and breathe React + Python + Generative AI + OpenShift/Docker + Linux, and youíre ready to deliver production AI applications onsite in Dammam, we want to hear from you today!

Skills

5ñ8 years of full-stack development experience

Expert in React.js + Redux, Tailwind CSS, and modern front-end architecture

Strong Python with deep expertise in Generative AI, LLMs, RAG pipelines, embeddings, data extraction, and vector stores

Production experience building and documenting APIs using FastAPI + Swagger/OpenAPI

Hands-on integration of OpenAI APIs and custom/self-hosted LLMs

Backend development with Node.js/Express and/or FastAPI (Next.js is a big plus)

Advanced Linux system administration (Docker commands, OpenShift CLI, networking, security, troubleshooting)

Expert in Docker containerization (multi-stage builds, Compose, optimization)

Strong Red Hat OpenShift experience (deployments, routes, operators, persistent storage)

Proven ability to design and maintain complex Jenkins CI/CD pipelines (including GitOps)

On-premise and local-machine AI model deployment & inference optimization

Arabic language fluency (mandatory)

Immediate or short-notice availability for onsite work in Dammam, Saudi Arabia

You will play a pivotal role in the design, development, and implementation of innovative software solutions that drive our business forward. Senior Full?Stack .NET Developer to design, build, and maintain high?performance backend services and APIs, collaborate closely with front?end teams, and drive architectural decisions in a fast?paced, Agile environment.

The position involves developing dynamic front-end interfaces using React and robust back-end APIs using Node.js/NestJS, ensuring seamless integration, security, and scalability across the stack.

ï Design, develop, and deploy scalable web applications using React, Node.js, and NestJS.
