Description

Role Main Purpose:

The Data Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data infrastructure, pipelines, and integrations that support enterprise-wide data analytics, reporting, and business intelligence. The role focuses on ensuring data availability, quality, and security to enable effective decision-making across the organization. The Data Engineer will work closely with IT, data analysts, business intelligence teams, and corporate stakeholders to build scalable, automated, and cloud-optimized data solutions that integrate with various business applications, ERP systems, CRM platforms, and data warehouses.

Responsibilities:
ï Data Pipeline Development & ETL (Extract, Transform, Load)
ï Design, develop, and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for data extraction, transformation, and loading from multiple internal and external sources.
ï Ensure data is clean, normalized, and optimized for reporting and analytics.
ï Automate data workflows and batch processes to improve operational efficiency.
ï Use Python, SQL, Apache Airflow to manage data transformations.
ï Gathering, wrangling, and verifying data from various sources.
ï Data Infrastructure & Engineering
ï Design, develop, and maintain scalable, real-time data pipelines for data ingestion, transformation, and storage.
ï Ensure seamless data integration from various sources
ï Implement big data frameworks and cloud-based architecture (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) tailored for sports analytics
ï Database Management & Optimization
ï Manage structured and unstructured data across relational (SQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Snowflake).
ï Optimize database performance to support large-scale data analytics.
ï Implement data partitioning, indexing, and caching strategies to enhance query performance.
ï Business Intelligence & Reporting Support
ï Enable data-driven decision-making by supporting BI teams with data models and analytical datasets.
ï Work with Power BI, Tableau, or other visualization tools to optimize reporting performance.
ï Implement self-service analytics frameworks to empower business users with easy access to data
ï Data Integration & Business Application Connectivity
ï Integrate data from multiple systems to create a centralized data repository.
ï Develop and manage APIs and middleware solutions for seamless data flow between corporate applications.
ï Work with third-party data providers and external APIs to enrich business data.
ï AI & Machine Learning Data Enablement
ï Assist in developing predictive analytics, forecasting models, and anomaly detection use cases.
ï Ensure efficient feature engineering and data preparation for machine learning initiatives.
ï Data Security & Compliance
ï Security Measures: work with the Data Protection and Cybersecurity to Implement the data protection and cybersecurity measures to protect the application stack from threats.
ï Access Control: Managing who can access the application and what they can do.
ï Conduct regular data integrity checks and audits to maintain accuracy and reliability.
ï Maintaining data integrity:
ï Data Error Checking: Regularly verifying data to identify and correct errors.
ï Validation Procedures: Ensuring data meets specific criteria before it's used.
ï Application Integration
ï Integrate sports data platforms with ERP, CRM, ticketing, and broadcasting systems to ensure seamless data flow.
ï Maintain API lifecycle management for data-sharing across internal and external stakeholders.
ï Data Lifecycle Management & Archiving
ï Data Migration: Ensuring data is securely transferred to new systems.
ï Assess Impact: Evaluate the impact of retiring these applications on business operations and data integrity.
ï Data Extraction and Transformation: Thoroughly examine and extract all necessary data from the application.
ï Data Archiving: Coherent and accessible data archive, ensuring it includes necessary metadata for future reference.
ï Maintain Data: Establish retention policies to manage the archived data according to business and regulatory requirements.

Best Practice:
ï Standardization: Implement best practices for data modelling, metadata management, and data architecture.
ï Automation: Use CI/CD pipelines for data engineering workflows to enhance agility.
ï Data Quality Management: Enforce data validation, anomaly detection, and reconciliation processes.
ï Security & Compliance: Regularly audit and ensure compliance with corporate data governance policies.
ï Collaboration: Work closely with business, IT, and analytics teams to align data solutions with enterprise needs.

Education & Experience:
ï 5+ years of experience in Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or Big Data Processing.
ï Proven expertise in building ETL pipelines, data warehouse management, and cloud-based data platforms.
ï Experience working with structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
ï Bachelorís or Masterís degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
ï Certifications in AWS Data Engineering, Azure Data Fundamentals, or Google Data Engineer (Preferred).

Knowledge & Skills:
ï Low ego - Go-getter & Can-do attitude
ï Ability to build relationships based on transparency
ï Adopt, Apply and promote the SPL culture and values (Performance - Ambition - Governance ñ Professionalism)
ï Ability to transfer confidence to team members
ï Ability to transfer knowledge and experience to team members
ï Promote Openness and clarity
ï Ability to manage and develop people
ï Ability to delegate
ï Problem-solving skills
ï Decision making
ï Effective and clear communication

Technical Skills:
ï Programming: Strong expertise in SQL, Python, Java, or Scala for data processing.
ï Databases: Experience with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server) and NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB) databases.
ï Data Warehousing: Hands-on experience with Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or Azure Synapse.
ï Big Data Frameworks: Knowledge of Apache Spark, Hadoop, Databricks, or Kafka for large-scale data processing.
ï Cloud Platforms: Proficiency in AWS (Glue, Lambda, S3), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse), or GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow).
ï Workflow Automation: Familiarity with Apache Airflow, or Prefect for data pipeline orchestration.
ï APIs & Integrations: Ability to develop and manage RESTful APIs, JSON, XML for data exchange.

job_title: Data Center Operation Technician (IT Engineer), TPE - DCO
job_description:
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, weíre the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain ó and weíre looking for talented people who want to help.

Youíll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. Youíll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And youíll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
Key job responsibilities
ï 7x24 roster duty in data center operations
ï Incident first responder and onsite hands on support
ï Break-fix and troubleshooting according to process guideline
ï Maintain proper media handling operations according to process guideline
ï Capacity landing and decommissioning according to process guideline
ï Site management and maintain tidiness in operation areas
ï Innovate and contribute from day-to-day operation experiences to improve operation efficiency
About the team

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasnít followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, donít let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the worldís most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ó thatís why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, itís in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship & Career Growth

Weíre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earthís Best Employer. Thatís why youíll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, thereís nothing we canít achieve in the cloud.
Basic Qualifications

- Bachelor or equivalent qualifications in Information Technology / Computer Science / Engineering or related disciplines.
- 1 year experience in server / network hardware and operation systems maintenance / troubleshooting.
- Basic knowledge of network cabling (fiber optic) and operation support experience.
Preferred Qualifications

- Knowledge of data center infrastructure design, operations, or delivery
- Knowledge of cloud computing technologies
- Knowledge of process improvement, ideally including Lean, Kaizen and Six Sigma
- Industry experience in Data Center Operations.
- Understanding of data center safety and security environment.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit for more information. If the country/region youíre applying in isnít listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist / Senior ML Engineer
job_description:
Who Are We?
We Are Foodics! a leading restaurant management ecosystem and payment tech provider. Founded in 2014 with headquarter in Riyadh and offices across 5 countries, including UAE, Egypt, Jordan and Kuwait. We are currently serving customers and partners in over 35 different countries worldwide. Our innovative products have successfully processed over 6 billion (yes, billion with a B) orders so far! making Foodics one of the most rapidly evolving SaaS companies to ever emerge from the MENA region. Also Foodics has achieved three rounds of funding, with the latest raising $170 million in the largest SaaS funding round in MENA, boosting its innovation capabilities to better serve business owners.

The Job in a Nutshell??

You will lead the design, development, and deployment of ML/AI/GenAI models that power core Foodics products (e.g., pricing, personalization, fraud detection). Youíll collaborate with Data Engineers, Product Managers, and Platform teams to deliver production-grade models with real impact.

What Will You Do?
ï * Own end-to-end ML model lifecycle: problem framing, data exploration, training, deployment, monitoring.
ï Design and develop scalable solutions using classical ML and GenAI techniques.
ï Implement MLOps best practices: versioning, reproducibility, monitoring, CI/CD for models.
ï Collaborate with squads and platform teams to ensure reusability and adherence to standards.
ï Mentor junior ML engineers and contribute to the internal ML knowledge base.
ï Integrate models with APIs and backend services as needed.
ï Embrace and enforce a "you build it, you run it" approach, owning the full lifecycle of ML models from development through monitoring and continuous improvement.

What Are We Looking For?
ï * 5+ yearsí experience in applied ML, AI, or data science.

What We Offer You?

Consensys is the leading blockchain and web3 software company founded by Joe Lubin, CEO of Consensys and Co-Founder of Ethereum. Since 2014, Consensys has been at the forefront of innovation, pioneering technological developments within the web3 ecosystem.

Through our product suite, including the MetaMask platform, Infura, Linea, Diligence, and our NFT toolkit Phosphor, we have become the trusted collaborator for users, creators, and developers on their path to build and belong in the world they want to see.

Whether building a dapp, an NFT collection, a portfolio, or a better future, the instinct to build is universal. Consensys inspires and champions the builder instinct in everyone by making web3 universally easy to use and develop on.

Our mission is to unlock the collaborative power of communities by making the decentralized web universally easy to access, use, and build on.

Youíll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to onboard one billion participants and 5 million developers. Youíll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects ó challenging you to stay at the top of your game. Youíll join a network of builders that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. Consensys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies.
About the Data Team

The Data team sits within the Office of the COO and builds the infrastructure that powers analysis across the organisation. We design, run, and optimise pipelines that bring together product, marketing, and financial data at scale. Our role is to ensure data is reliable, accessible, and ready for useóhelping Consensys move fast while maintaining quality and trust.
What youíll do
ï Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines that integrate sources across the business.
ï Collaborate closely with analysts, business stakeholders, and other engineering teams to gather requirements, align timelines, discuss architecture, and ensure successful delivery.
ï Document data pipelines, best practices, and processes to support onboarding and knowledge sharing within the team.
ï Develop and optimize data models to deliver trusted, structured, and business-ready data.
ï Ensure data quality, security, and governance are embedded in all pipelines and systems.
ï Orchestrate and monitor pipeline execution to ensure reliability and scalability.
ï Deploy and manage infrastructure as code.
ï Build and tune big data pipelines using SQL, Python, and distributed processing frameworks.
ï Work with cloud data warehouses to enable insights and analytics.
ï Maintain and update reporting solutions and user dashboards.
ï Automate workflows and improve CI/CD pipelines to reduce manual processes.
Would be great if you brought this to the role
ï Over 6 years of experience as a Data Engineer
ï Use Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) to securely process sensitive user data, ensuring it remains protected and only aggregated insights are released.
ï Strong SQL skills and experience with cloud warehouses (e.g.: Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
ï Hands-on experience with transformation and orchestration tools (e.g.: dbt, Airflow, Dagster).
ï Comfort with Python or other scripting languages for ETL and automation.
ï Familiarity with data governance and metadata management (e.g.: DataHub).
ï Experience deploying and managing infrastructure as code (e.g.: Terraform, Pulumi).
ï Exposure to data integration and ingestion tools (e.g.: Airbyte, Segment).
ï Experience with big data and distributed processing (e.g.: Apache Spark, AWS EMR, S3).
ï Exposure to open source projects
ï Experience maintaining and improving reporting solutions and dashboards (e.g.: Preset/Superset, Cube.dev).
ï Familiarity with CI/CD practices and automation (e.g.: GitHub Actions).
ï A collaborative mindset and eagerness to work with both technical and non-technical colleagues.

Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. Weíre passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environmentóapply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.

Aramco energizes the world economy.

Aramco occupies a special position in the global energy industry. We are one of the worldís largest producers of hydrocarbon energy and chemicals, with among the lowest Upstream carbon intensities of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramcoís value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generationsí spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdomís vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.

Overview

We are seeking a Data Engineering Specialist to join Downstream Global Optimizer (GO) team.

The Downstream Global Optimizer team drives commercial optimization across Saudi Aramcoís integrated downstream value chain, including domestic and international refining assets. The GO team identifies and captures optimization opportunities to enhance system netback and deliver shareholder value. By building robust data infrastructure, automating pipelines, and enabling real-time analytics, the team supports agile decision-making in dynamic market conditions.

Your primary role is to design, develop, and maintain scalable data platforms that power the iGO (intelligent Global Optimizer) ecosystem. Your work will ensure seamless integration of structured/unstructured data, enable high-performance analytics, and provide reliable foundations for optimization models, machine learning pipelines, and enterprise reporting. You will focus on building and maintaining the data infrastructure that supports our data scientists. This role will involve designing and implementing scalable data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and managing data storage solutions. The specialist will work closely with data scientists and other teams to provide the necessary data infrastructure for advanced analytics and machine learning models.

Key Responsibilities

As the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:
ï Design and implement data architectures and efficient ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to move and transform data from various sources into a format suitable for analysis.
ï Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data by implementing data validation and cleansing processes.
ï Architect and manage data storage solutions, including data lakes and warehouses, to meet the needs of the organization.
ï Work with data scientists and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide appropriate data solutions.
ï Optimize data pipelines and architectures for scalability and performance, ensuring they can handle large volumes of data efficiently.
ï Maintain thorough documentation of data systems, pipelines, and processes for clarity and continuity.
ï Proficiency in languages such as Python, SQL, and Java or Scala.
ï Experience with big data technologies like Apache Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, and Airflow.
ï Knowledge of cloud services such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, including their data storage and processing services.
ï Understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience with tools like Databricks, Microsoft data fabric and Cloudera.
ï Familiarity with ETL tools and processes for data transformation and migration.
ï Experience with CI/CD pipelines and version control systems like Git.

Minimum Requirements
ï You will hold a Bachelorís degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, or a related field from a recognized institution. A Masterís or advanced degree is preferred.
ï You will have at least 10 years of experience in data engineering, data architecture, or enterprise data platform development, including 5+ years in designing and managing enterprise-grade data pipelines.
ï Strong technical expertise in programming languages: Python, SQL, Scala, and experience with data engineering frameworks (Apache Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Flink).
ï Proven experience building data lakes, data warehouses, and ETL/ELT pipelines for large-scale, heterogeneous datasets.
ï In-depth knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and distributed data processing tools (e.g., Databricks, Cloudera, Snowflake).
ï Hands-on experience with data governance, metadata management, and data quality frameworks.
ï Ability to work in complex, cross-functional environments, translating business needs into scalable data architectures.
ï Strong communication skills to articulate technical designs to stakeholders and mentor junior engineers.
ï Familiarity with industrial/energy sector data ecosystems (e.g., OT/IT systems, SCADA, ERP, market data) is preferred.
ï Certifications in cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure), data engineering (e.g., Google Professional Data Engineer, AWS Big Data Specialty) are a plus.

Work Location and Work Schedule

Work Location: Within Saudi Arabia ñ To be specified in Job offer

Work Schedule: Full Time - To be specified in Job offer

Job Post Duration

Job posting start date: 2/5/2026

Job posting end date: 12/30/2026

Working environment

Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the worldís biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.

We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs ñ one of the largest in the world.

Senior Data Engineer ( IDMC) with Governance Consultant (KSA Experience Required)

Job Summary: We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer ( IDMC) with strong Governance experience in enterprise data sourcing and data management projects, and have deep expertise in implementing Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) capabilitiesóespecially in Data Governance, Cataloging, and Data Qualityóand a solid understanding of local regulatory frameworks such as PDPL,SDAIA,(NDMO, NDI).

The ideal candidate will work on designing, developing of data governance, quality, privacy and optimizing data pipelines that support data integration, transformation across hybrid environments (on-premises and cloud).

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the design and implementation of enterprise Data Governance frameworks tailored to KSA business and regulatory environments.

Identify and prioritize business use cases by engaging with stakeholders across banking, governmental, telecom and enterprise sectors.

Implement data governance policies, controls, and privacy rules in alignment with KSA's Personal Data Protection Law (PDPL).

Utilize Informatica IDMC (CDGC, DQ, EDC, Axon) to manage metadata, data lineage, and data quality processes.

Work closely with data stewards, architects, and business teams to ensure data is discoverable, trusted, and secure.

Troubleshoot and optimize workflows and orchestrations for performance and operational efficiency.

Develop documentation for data assets, data flows, governance processes, and transformation logic.

Support change management and training activities to promote a data governance culture.

Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to support data quality initiatives.

Familiarity with hybrid data environments (on-prem + cloud) with familiarity in Azure, AWS, or GCP.

Deep understanding of data privacy regulations (PDPL, GDPR, etc.) and their implementation in large organizations.

Additional Expertise (Good to Have):

Design and implement data ingestion, transformation, integration, and MDM workflows using Informatica IDMC and MDM tools.

Develop and maintain scalable, efficient data pipelines that ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity.

Solid understanding of data warehousing, data lakes, and data modeling concepts. Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational and non-relational databases.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

4+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering or ETL development using Informatica.

Strong working knowledge of Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC), particularly- 1. Cloud Data Governance & Catalog (CDGC)
ï Metadata Management
ï Data Quality & Profiling
ï Governance and Privacy Controls
ï Data integration and transformation
ï Data pipeline orchestration Preferred Skills & Experience: Exposure to Informatica IDMC, Axon, EDC, PowerCenter.

Experience in banking, governmental, telecom or regulated sectors within Saudi Arabia.

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and DevOps practices.

Strong techno functional skills to work across business and technical teams.

At Aajil (formerly Buildnow), we're powering smarter decisions for B2B commerce through data-driven credit solutions. As a
Senior Data Engineer
( Remote ), you'll build and scale the data infrastructure that fuels our underwriting models, analytics dashboards, and real-time decision engines. If you have serious technical chops, love designing robust systems at scale, and thrive in collaborative environments, this is your opportunity to do some of the most challenging data engineering work in fintech.
What You'll Do
Building and scaling data infrastructure
that processes millions in transaction volume and powers real-time credit decisions.
Designing and implementing data pipelines
across data lakehouses, OLAP systems, and event-driven architectures using GCP or AWS.
Optimizing ETL/ELT workflows
with tools like dbt, Airflow, Spark, and Kafka to ensure data reliability and performance at scale.
Implementing real-time data processing
and streaming analytics that support instant underwriting decisions.
Productionizing ML models
in collaboration with data scientists, ensuring models run efficiently in production.
Contributing to technical strategy
for data architecture, tooling decisions, and infrastructure improvements.
Collaborating closely
with engineering leadership, Risk, Product, and Analytics teams to solve complex data challenges.
Writing production-grade code
with strong Python fundamentals, clean architecture, and robust testing.
Ensuring data quality, governance, and security
across all systems and pipelines.
What We're Looking For
5+ years of experience in data engineering
with a proven track record of building and scaling production data systems in high-growth environments.
Deep expertise in cloud platforms
(GCP/AWS) and modern data tools (dbt, Airflow, Spark, Kafka, BigQuery/Redshift).
Strong programming fundamentals in Python , with solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering best practices.
Hands-on experience with diverse data architectures , including data lakehouses (Delta Lake, Iceberg), OLAP systems, and event-driven pipelines.
Proven ability to design and optimize for scale , tackling performance, cost, and reliability challenges in high-throughput environments.
Experience productionizing ML models
and working closely with data science teams.
Strong problem-solving skills
and ability to troubleshoot complex issues across distributed systems.
Excellent collaboration skills
and ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Track record of shipping complex projects
from design to production.
Nice-to-Have
Experience in fintech, lending, or credit risk environments.
Familiarity with data governance and compliance frameworks.
Contributions to open-source data tools or active involvement in the data engineering community.
Experience with real-time fraud detection or underwriting systems.
Why Aajil?
Hard Problems : Tackle challenging data engineering problems in credit risk, fraud detection, and real-time underwriting.
Cutting-Edge Stack : Work with modern tools like Kafka, Airflow, dbt, Delta Lake, and cloud-native architectures.
Collaborative Team : Work alongside experienced engineers solving complex problems together.

Builder Culture : No bureaucracy, just meaningful technical work that moves the business forward.

Integration Tools:

This is a remote opportunity from Greece or Morocco and internal role starting February 2026, if you live outside of Greece or locations of our delivery hubs, the application will be automatically rejected, thank you for your understanding

About Us
Local Expertise supported by Global Talent
At Agoya, we are a data and digital agency helping businesses innovate and grow.

Our expertise covers talent solutions, product development, and advisory services, empowering clients with the right people, tools, and strategies to succeed.

Through long-term partnerships and our global hubs (e.g., Agoya Morocco & Greece), we connect businesses with top-tier talent and deliver tailored solutions in data, cloud, and digital transformation.
Whether through expert consultants, custom digital products, or strategic guidance, we help organizations turn challenges into opportunities.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our growing team and support a transformative internal project in Belgium.

You will play a key role in building scalable data pipelines, integrating cloud solutions, and designing maintainable architectures that empower data-driven decision-making.

This role offers the chance to blend strong technical expertise with practical implementation, ensuring that solutions remain robust, efficient, and easily maintainable.
Your Responsabilities
Design, develop, and implement scalable data pipelines and ELT/ETL workflows using modern tools and cloud platforms.

Work with Azure (Data Factory, Data Lake, SQL, Service Bus, API Management, Container Services) to build and maintain production-ready data environments.
Leverage SQL, Python, and dbt for data transformation, modeling, and automation.
Apply software engineering best practices (version control, CI/CD, documentation, logging, and monitoring) to ensure long-term maintainability.
Collaborate closely with client stakeholders and Agoya's Head of Data Intelligence to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Build and optimize APIs (using FastAPI or similar frameworks) for seamless system integrations.
Develop data models and contribute to metadata management (using tools such as OpenMetadata, if applicable).
Support or integrate with analytics layers, including Power BI, to ensure data readiness for business insights.
Identify and propose improvements to data workflows, infrastructure, and automation processes.

Your Profile
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (required).
3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer (required).
Strong skills in SQL, Python, and dbt (required).
Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud (Data Factory, Data Lake, SQL) (required).
Solid understanding of ETL/ELT patterns and data modeling principles (required).
Proficiency in software engineering best practices: CI/CD, version control (Git), documentation, logging, and monitoring (required).
Experience with Airflow or Dagster (highly desirable).
Exposure to Power BI and FastAPI (highly desirable).
Familiarity with Azure Service Bus, Container Services, Azure API Management, OpenMetadata, or Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform) (nice-to-have).
Analytical, collaborative, proactive, and detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality, maintainable solutions.
Fluency in English.

Our Benefits
Work remotely from Greece with a supportive team and international environment.
Autonomy to manage your work, with trust as a cornerstone.
Market-aligned compensation that recognizes your expertise.
Work with a multicultural team in the exciting event management sector.
Access to professional development resources and support for certifications.
Be part of projects that revolutionize how data is leveraged in event management.

Click "Apply" to submit your CV. We'll review your profile and reach out if you are a close match. Looking forward to working with you

Are you looking to kick-start your career within an international software product company? Then our Data Engineer role for fresh graduates will be a fantastic opportunity for you.

Denodo is a fantastic place to begin your career. We are the leader in Data Virtualization and we are embracing a culture that puts people first, where everyone has the opportunity to own their career and make a contribution towards the modern change, and is given the space to grow personally and professionally.

At Denodo we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who are committed to doing their best and deliver on their promises. We are looking for people who value different perspectives, who build sustainable relationships and who dare to shape the future and want to make a difference.

Your career with us will combine cutting edge technology, exposure to worldwide clients across all industries (Financial Services, Automotive, Insurance, Pharma, etc.), exciting growth paths and direct mentorship.

Your mission will be to help and assist our clients and partners to realize their full potential through accelerated adoption and productive use of Denodo's Data Virtualization capability to provide modern solutions for agile data delivery to empower people.

Required Skills
ï Desired Skills & Experience*

Non-mandatory Skills ( Nice To Have)

job_title: Senior PMM: Data & AI Platform Growth
job_description:
A leading technology firm seeks an experienced Product Marketing Manager to drive marketing strategy and content creation for its data and AI platform solutions. The successful candidate will develop go-to-market strategies, create compelling technical content, and conduct market research to inform product roadmap decisions. A strong background in product marketing within B2B technology is required, along with technical writing skills.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

About PostHog

We're shipping every product that companies need from their first day, to the day they IPO, and beyond. The operating system for folks who build products.

We started with open-source product analytics, launched out of Y Combinator's W20 cohort. We've since shipped more than a dozen products, including:
ï A built-in data warehouse, so users can query product and customer data together using custom SQL insights.
ï A customer data platform, so they can send their data wherever they need with ease.
ï PostHog AI, an AI-powered analyst that answers product questions, helps users find useful session recordings, and writes custom SQL queries.

Next on the roadmap are CRM, Workflow, revenue analytics, and support products. When we say every product, we really mean it

We are:
ï Product-led. More than 100,000 companies have installed PostHog, mostly driven by word-of-mouth. We have intensely strong product-market fit.
ï Well-funded. We've raised more than $100m from some of the world's top investors. We're set up for a long, ambitious journey.
ï Default alive. Revenue is growing 10% MoM on average, and we're very efficient. We raise money to push ambition and grow faster, not to keep the lights on.

We're focused on building an awesome product for end users, hiring exceptional teammates, shipping fast, and being as weird as possible.
What you'll be doing

As a Software Engineer on the Warehouse Pipeline team in the Data Stack group, you'll build and iterate on our data import system.

Our import workers are built in python and we pull in data from APIs and databases in batches, process the data using Apache Arrow in memory, and move the data into object storage in open table formats.

You'll build and maintain our source library, as we're looking for creative ways to make our library manageable at scale. You'll revamp our schema management strategy, and build resilient systems (e.g logging, observability, testing)

You'll debug stateful data workflows by digging into k8s pod metrics, and schedule jobs using As you can see, there's a huge breadth of challenges and opportunities to tackle, and nothing is off-limits.

The PostHog Data Stack group provides both a core product for our users and a foundational platform for our internal teams. Data is a first-class product at PostHog, not an afterthought.

You will have the chance to push the boundaries of what our Data Stack team can do while ensuring we remain stable and production-ready.

You now know what you'll be doing, but what about what you'll need to bring along?
You'll fit right in if:
ï You're a builder. You bring strong skills in building resilient systems, with experience in Kubernetes, Docker, and S3 at scale. We build in python. Async-python and skills are welcome.
ï You have hands-on experience with batch processing and modern data formats. We use Arrow to stream data. Experience with Iceberg and/or Delta is welcome, we don't expect you to have experience with all three (although that would be great)
ï You're more than a connector of things. Building pipelines is more than configuring tools to make them work together, it's about actually building the tooling used in data warehousing pipelines. We need you to have experience with building tools versus using off-the-shelf tools
ï You bring experience with creating and maintaining data pipelines. You are comfortable with debugging stateful, async data workflows by digging into k8s pod metrics.
ï You bring a mix of skills. It's not just about the Data Pipeline work. You'll need strong backend skills as we run a complex system.
ï You love getting things done. Engineers at PostHog have an incredible amount of autonomy to decide what to work on, so you'll need to be proactive and just git it done.
ï You're ready to do the best work of your career. We have incredible distribution, a big financial cushion and an amazing team. There's probably no better place to see how far you can go.

If this sounds like you, we should talk.

We are committed to ensuring a fair and accessible interview process. If you need any accommodations or adjustments, please let us know
What's in it for you?

Now that we've told you what you'll be building with us, let's talk about what we'll be building for you.

About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel.

Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [

NASDAQ:

BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe.

Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you're ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally.

Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration.
We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team

Fintech is a rapidly expanding industry with endless opportunities for growth and innovation.

At Agoda, we are proud to be at the forefront of this exciting field, working closely with our finance business team and product owners to reduce risk, increase efficiency, and seize new market opportunities.
Our fintech projects are diverse and varied, ranging from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer-facing solutions.

Whether using big data technologies for reconciliation, expanding and enhancing payment options for our customers, or developing lightning-fast tax calculation systems, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible in fintech.

With a talented team of data and backend engineers, we are well-equipped to tackle any challenge that comes our way.

Agoda is the perfect place for you if you're passionate about fintech and looking to make a real impact in this dynamic industry.
The Opportunity

We are seeking highly skilled engineers with a range of experience in fintech to join our team. Whether you are a seasoned expert or just starting out in the field, we welcome your application.

We are looking for intelligent and agile engineers with strong attention to detail and the ability to work on both back-end and data engineering tasks.

If you have a passion for fintech technology and are excited about the opportunity to build and innovate, we would love to hear from you.
We value a wide range of experience and backgrounds and encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

In this Role, you will get to

Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

Strong experience building finance stack applications including ledgers, revenue recognition, monetary transfers and reconciliations, financial accounting platforms etc.
Experience handling financial data risk management and data governance projects.
Experience supporting internal and external financial audits
Experience with data profiling, data lineage, data cataloging to enhance data governance and documentation
Experience in leading projects, initiatives and/or teams, with full ownership of the systems involved
Experience with building data pipelines to integrate 3rd parties is plus.

job_title: Senior PMM: Data & AI Platform Growth
job_description:
A leading technology firm seeks an experienced Product Marketing Manager to drive marketing strategy and content creation for its data and AI platform solutions. The successful candidate will develop go-to-market strategies, create compelling technical content, and conduct market research to inform product roadmap decisions. A strong background in product marketing within B2B technology is required, along with technical writing skills.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

About Mozn
Mozn is a rapidly growing technology firm revolutionising the field of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science headquartered in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia and it's working to realise Vision 2030 with a proven track record of excellence in supporting and growing the tech ecosystem in Saudi Arabia and the GCC region. Mozn is the trusted AI technology partner for some of the largest government organizations, as well as many large corporations and startups.

We are in an exciting stage of scaling the company to provide AI-powered products and solutions both locally and globally that ensure the growth and prosperity of our digital humanity. It is an exciting time to work in the field of AI to create a long-lasting impact.

About The Role
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Pre-Sales Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be the technical expert supporting the sales process, working closely with the sales team to identify customer needs, deliver compelling product demonstrations, and provide tailored solutions that meet client requirements. You will act as a bridge between our technical offerings and customer business challenges.

What You'll Do
ï Assist in the pre-sales process by managing the technical assessment of Focal to ensure effective promotion of our product.
ï Identify, understand and define client requirements and translate them into effective solutions.
ï Conduct product demonstrations and proof-of-concept exercises to showcase the capabilities and benefits of our solutions.
ï Provide accurate and timely responses to client inquiries, RFPs, and RFIs, addressing technical and business-related questions.
ï Working closely with clients to solve business problems in areas such as compliance and financial crimes.
ï Effectively communicate technical information to non-technical to our clients, articulating complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
ï Prepare and deliver compelling presentations, demonstrations, and workshops tailored to client needs, highlighting the unique value proposition of our products or services.
ï Become a subject matter expert in one or more of our solution areas

Qualifications
ï Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
ï 4 years proven experience as a Pre-Sales Executive or in a similar customer-facing technical role
ï 4 years of experience in Anti-Money Laundering
ï Excellent bilingual verbal and written communication skills.
ï Outstanding multitasking abilities.
ï Eager to learn.
ï Strong understanding and knowledge of Anti-Money Laundering is a must.
ï Previous experience in Technology background is a plus
ï Self-motivated and results-oriented, with the ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
ï Arabic language is a plus but not a must.

Benefits
ï You will be at the forefront of an exciting time for the Middle East, joining a high-growth rocket-ship in an exciting space.
ï You will be given a lot of responsibility and trust. We believe that the best results come when the people responsible for a function are given the freedom to do what they think is best.
ï The fundamentals will be taken care of: competitive compensation, top-tier health insurance, and an enabling culture so that you can focus on what you do best
ï You will enjoy a fun and dynamic workplace working alongside some of the greatest minds in AI.
ï We believe strength lies in difference, embracing all for who they are and empowered to be the best version of themselves.

A leading cloud provider is offering an Electrical & Mechanical Engineering Operations Traineeship in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. This full-time program will last 6 months and aims to develop skills for a future full-time role. Key responsibilities include maintaining mechanical and electrical equipment, assisting with troubleshooting, and performing system operations. Candidates must be UAE Nationals with a relevant degree or technical training. This opportunity provides exposure to data center operations and a chance to potentially secure a permanent position.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

ï About Agoda*
At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you're ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
ï About Agoda*
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team
Fintech is a rapidly expanding industry with endless opportunities for growth and innovation. At Agoda, we are proud to be at the forefront of this exciting field, working closely with our finance business team and product owners to reduce risk, increase efficiency, and seize new market opportunities. Our fintech projects are diverse and varied, ranging from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer-facing solutions. Whether using big data technologies for reconciliation, expanding and enhancing payment options for our customers, or developing lightning-fast tax calculation systems, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible in fintech. With a talented team of data and backend engineers, we are well-equipped to tackle any challenge that comes our way. Agoda is the perfect place for you if you're passionate about fintech and looking to make a real impact in this dynamic industry.

The Opportunity
We are seeking highly skilled engineers with a range of experience in fintech to join our team. Whether you are a seasoned expert or just starting out in the field, we welcome your application. We are looking for intelligent and agile engineers with strong attention to detail and the ability to work on both back-end and data engineering tasks. If you have a passion for fintech technology and are excited about the opportunity to build and innovate, we would love to hear from you. We value a wide range of experience and backgrounds and encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

ï Experience with data tooling: Spark, Kafka, Workflow Orchestration Tools
ï Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
ï Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets. In depth knowledge of Model and Design of DB schemas for read and write performance.
ï Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
ï Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
ï Experience supporting and working with Scrum in Agile Cross-functional teams.
ï Excellent verbal and written English communication skills

It's great if you have
ï Deep experience with spark based distributed data pipelines. Able to deep dive and solve challenges in spark query plans and optimize code. Experience in Spark streaming is a plus
ï Strong experience building finance stack applications including ledgers, revenue recognition, monetary transfers and reconciliations, financial accounting platforms etc.

job_description:
<\/p>
We're building next -gen, location -aware solutionsóand we're looking for a Senior GIS Data Engineer who lives and breathes maps, spatial data, and geotechnical storytelling. You'll be at the core of our geospatial stackótransforming raw location data into actionable insights, clean maps, and smart spatial infrastructure. If you're experienced in GIS analysis, satellite <\/span>imagery, and<\/span> have a passion for building scalable, <\/span>spatially -aware<\/span> systems, you'll thrive here.<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/div>

<\/div><\/div>

Job Responsibilities:<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/p>
ï Design, build, and maintain data pipelines for spatial datasets, integrating sources like satellite imagery, AutoCAD drawings, and map servers.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/li>
ï Lead end -to -end GIS workflowsófrom raw data processing to interactive maps and spatial dashboards.<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/li>
ï Work with tools like ArcGIS, QGIS, ArcGIS Online, and WMS to analyze and visualize land use, infrastructure, and environmental data.<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/li>
ï Conduct spatial data cleaning, transformation, and validation using Python (<\/span>GeoPandas<\/span>, Pandas) and ArcGIS tools.<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/li>
ï Maintain and update geodatabases, shapefiles, feature classes, and manage attribute schemas for ongoing projects.<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/li>
ï Handle georeferencing, digitization, utility network analysis, and format conversions (e.g., AutoCAD GIS, KMZ Shapefile).<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/li>
ï Stay <\/span>up -to -date<\/span> with GIS trends such as remote sensing, spatial modeling, and data standards.<\/span><\/span> <\/span>
<\/li><\/ul>

<\/p><\/div>

<\/div><\/span>

Requirements<\/h3>
ï Degree in Geography, Geomatics, Civil Engineering, GIS,
Environmental Science, or a related field.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï 10 years in GIS roles, ideally involving urban planning,
infrastructure, hydrology, or environmental management.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Deep experience with ArcGIS suite, QGIS, and other
geospatial tools.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Solid scripting skills in Python for automating geospatial
workflows (ArcPy, GeoPandas).<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Strong command of spatial databases SQL, shapefile
management, schema/domain creation, and data validation is a must<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Skilled in digitizing, georeferencing, cartography, and
thematic mapping.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Solid knowledge of DEM/DTM analysis, catchment area
planning, and land classification.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Experience with AutoCAD <\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span> GIS workflows, spatial data conversions, and integrating
diverse geospatial formats.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Familiarity with coordinate system transformations
(Lat/Long <\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span> UTM,
local grid systems).<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Proficient in using ArcGIS Toolboxes and setting
symbology/style rules for feature classes.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span><\/span><\/li>
ï Able to produce high -quality maps, GIS reports, and
maintain geospatial documentation.<\/span><\/span> <\/span><\/span>
<\/span> <\/span><\/span><\/span><\/li><\/ul>
